channel.title: Obsidian
channel.generator: Webpage HTML Export plugin for Obsidian

item.title: anchoring-paint
item.description: For creatures who dislike pesky mages, plants that drain mana can be mixed with paint in order to create a liquid that can be spread over surfaces. Typically the paint comes with instructions on how you draw the magic circles required to activate its potential.A single can is enough to cover a 20 ft radius in a magic circles. Creatures cannot teleport to any surface that is warded by anchoring paint, or the air above it.After the paint has stopped an instance of teleportation, it rapidly begins to evaporate over the course of an hour.

item.title: barbarian-chew
item.description: These plants are rare occurrences in mountainous regions, but stand out due to their red leaves year round. With a little bit of alchemical alteration, they inspire fury in those that chew (and often consume) them.For the rest of the day, you cannot use [concentration] effects. The next time you rage today you gain 10 additional speed. When this enhanced rage ends, you cannot rage again until you rest.

item.title: embalming-fluid
item.description: A slightly less extreme version of flash freeze, adapted for a specific purpose. Often used by morticians to make funeral rites more pleasant.Application of this ointment on a corpse prevents its decomposition and negates its stench for 1 week. With 2 doses the embalming lasts a month. With 3 doses, and a creature trained in the medicine skill, it can last many years.

item.title: flare
item.description: By mixing fuel with an oxidizer, all you need to make light is a spark.A flare provides a source of light that doesn't rely on fire, making it an ideal short term light source, or wet adventures. With a quick twist (swift action) to activate the chemical reaction, flares gives off light like a torch (20 ft radius bright) for 30 minutes. Flares are more resilient than torches in that they can be tossed around, even in water, without worry of the light going out.With such a simple triggering mechanism, flares can easily be attached to trip wires, or have some kind of specific firing mechanism similar to a firearm to activate it while launching it high in the sky, or both (just as examples).

item.title: flash-freeze
item.description: Creating flash freeze requires the scale of a frost dragon to create, but the scale is a reusable component. Only small quantities of this substance can be created and contained at once.When poured over water, the oil pools on the surface and takes 1 round to spread out from the point of origin in a 20-foot radius. At the start of your next turn, the oil flash-freezes the surface of the water, creating an ice sheet over the affected area. Any 5-foot square of this ice can support ~500 pounds of weight. Weight in excess of this amount causes the entire sheet to crack and quickly break up. This ice sheet becomes unstable and breaks up on its own after 1 hour, or faster in a hot climate. This item has no significant effect when used against creatures.

item.title: perfume
item.description: Perfumes are powerful mixtures of chemicals with distinct and long-lasting scents, made out of a wide variety of substances. Whether or not they are appealing is up to taste however. You can apply a dose of perfume to yourself as a standard action, and it lasts for a few hours, provided you are not drenched in other liquids or other powerful smelling substances.The first time you roll a persuasion check or deception check to lie against someone, roll serendipity. If you roll 17 or higher, the creature likes the smell, giving you a reroll against them for such checks. Creature's with the scent special quality tend to find most perfumes garish and unpleasant, increasing the DC to 20. Creatures without a sense of spell are unaffected by perfume.You can only benefit from a specific type of perfume's benefit once per creature, requiring you to spice things up during your next interaction if you want the reroll again.By succeeding on a monster lore check against a creature, or just asking people who may know such things, you can figure out a type of perfume they enjoy, bypassing the serendipity check entirely.Can also be flavor texted as a breath spray or something similar.

item.title: salve-of-slipperiness
item.description: Oils and secretions of all kinds can be used to make these salves. They are the most effective lubricant on the market, preventing friction in all kinds of scenarios. Applying it to a creature takes 3 rounds and a thorough rub down. It temporarily gives them DR 10 vs grapples and the compression quality for 10 minutes.

item.title: smelling-salt
item.description: A form of mineral too delicate for ore processing that requires an alchemist's touch to unlock its true potential.These crystals snap people awake in a hazy stupor when inhaled. Replaces the defeated condition with the time out condition until they restore hp, they take damage or 10 minutes pass.

item.title: super-goo-solvent
agility-potion
item.description: Rabbit's feet are a key component in creating agility potions. Other creatures known for swiftness are sometimes used as well.Gives a +10 bonus to speed and a +4 bonus to acrobatics checks for 1 minute, after which, the creature is fatigued. This effect is a [buff].

item.title: allnight
item.description: Allnight is made from crushed nocturnal insects. The stimulant is similar to caffeine, but cranked up to 11. it is very easy to tell when someone is under the effects of all night due to their constant twitching/jittering and inability to remain focused.Lasts 8 hours. You suppress the negative effects of fatigue and cannot fall asleep or be put to sleep, but take a -2 penalty to all skill checks and cannot do anything with the [concentration] tag. You also do not gain the benefits of rest while under the effects of allnight.

item.title: antitoxin
item.description: Anti toxin is a liquid that can be drank or directly applied to wounds as a standard action, depending on the type of poison. When administered it halts the progression of poison for 1 hour. Using multiple antitoxins on the same creature in the same 24 hour period has no effect.

item.title: bloodblock
item.description: Bloodblock requires extracting toxins from creatures like mosquitoes and removing the itchiness. Many alchemists do this by crushing large quantities of common mosquitoes and using chemical separation processes.Can be used to substitute for a med kit when treating bleeding creatures. Gives a +4 bonus said checks.

item.title: gillweed
item.description: Gillweed is a plant commonly found in swamps at the waters edge.This potion must be inhaled instead of drank. Doing so is very uncomfortable and staggers the creature for 1 round. The potion allows a creature to breathe underwater as well as air for 8 hours.

item.title: healing-potion
item.description: The jizzle when it is not acclimated to a particular creature consumes a vast amount of resources from the creatures body to immediately speed up recovery.Immediately restores 5 hp.By increasing the DC by 4, you can double the price and increase its healing by 5. This doubling in price/+4 DC is cumulative (DC 22 for 700g, DC 26 1400g, DC 30 for 2800g etc)T3 and above potions are considered rare items due to their high craft DC.

item.title: mana-potion
item.description: By melting down mana crystals, they can be converted into a tasty sweet potion that can be addictive.Immediately restores 1 mana, but you mana burn 1, reducing your maximum mana. Normally mana burn also reduces current mana, but to keep the math simple, increase current mana by 1 and reduce max by 1.By increasing the DC by 4, you can double the price and increase its restorative effects and mana burn by 1. This doubling in price/+4 DC is cumulative (DC 22 for 700g, DC 26 1400g, DC 30 for 2800g etc)T3 and above potions are considered rare items due to their high craft DC.

item.title: README
item.description: Potions are small flasks that can be downed in one gulp and usually provide some type of positive benefit to the consumer. Some potions inflict potion sickness.Potion Sickness - A creature with potion sickness cannot drink any other potions. Makes it so you can't drink in consecutive turns unless stated otherwise. (cycle goes as follows: drink, sick, drink etc...)

item.title: tongues-potion
item.description: Tongues potions are made using the saliva of particularly chatty or loud creatures. When consumed, the potion allows you to sound like any creature. However, this drought is missing one final ingredient: The tongue of the creature you wish to sound like. Without this key ingredient, the potion is useless.Most tongues potions are sold without the final key ingredient, but alchemy stores tend to have a few preserved tongues lying around.Potions that already sound like a specific creature are incredibly rare and exorbitantly, but more general things like "orc" or "imp" might be available for sale. Depending on the rarity of the tongue in question, price could increase by 10% for something common like orc, or increase by 1,000% with the tongue of a prince.Roundabout numbers, decide as appropriate for situation. Big rare=big price.

item.title: trollblood-potion
item.description: By scraping off the natural excretions of a troll's skin, trollblood potions can be made.When consumed, the creature gains regeneration 1 for 1 minute. This effect is suppressed for 1 turn if the creature takes fire/poison damage.Trollblood gives you potion sickness.

item.title: alchemist-fire
item.description: Alchemist fire is one of the first things taught to alchemists and only requires a handful of common chemicals.When exposed to open air, this combination of chemicals ignites. Creatures within 5 ft are set ablaze (DC 14 reflex negates).

item.title: bottled-lightning
item.description: Typically alchemists create bottled lightning on stormy days, with some type of lightning rod to attract the lightning. They treat the interior of a bottle with a thin layer of a rubbery insulator and extract the stored electrical power into it.When destroyed, the lightning lashes out at nearby creatures. Creatures within 5 ft take 2d6 (7) zap damage (DC 14 reflex negates).

item.title: chloroform
item.description: Chloroform is mostly a product of a handful of mushrooms and seaweeds, its properties make it useful in a variety of alchemical creations, but the most well known use is its ability to knock creatures out. A handful of spells and plant creatures have adopted use of this "sleep powder" to incapacitate creatures temporarily. Alchemists have figured out how to manufacture chemicals that mimic this, but are significantly less powerful.Carefully sealed in glass jars, chloroform is used as a projectile weapon. Make a thrown attack against a creature or a melee attack to smash it against them. The creature must make a DC 20 fortitude save or become drowsy and a bit numb. This gives them blurred vision and 5 temp hp. If you critically strike the creature, it lands in their face and the has disadvantage on its save.By smashing a second glass jar against an already drowsy creature, they are forced to make an additional save. If they fail, they are put to sleep for 1 round.

item.title: flash-powder
item.description: When thrown with enough force, a bag of flash powder reacts violently with a flash of light. Thrown at a creature's feet, it blinds for 1 round (DC 14 reflex reduces to blurred vision).When consumed it makes the user feel very fast for no mechanical benefit.

item.title: README
item.description: Thrown concoctions are alchemical items that can be used as thrown weapons in combat.Some thrown concoctions explode on impact, requiring a saving throw instead of an attack.

item.title: siphoning-salt
item.description: Mineral deposits containing salt exposed to powerful magic can sometimes cause the salt to take a blue hue, giving it anti-magic properties. Mages are hesitant to mass produce it for obvious reasons.When thrown on a spell with a persistent effect, it acts as dispel magic at CL 3.

item.title: stink-oil
item.description: Like alchemist fire, stink oil only requires common chemicals. It also requires a little bit of dead organic matter. Most alchemists use their own dead skin flakes to save time.Throw this vial in the space of a creature to cause it to be sickened 2 for one minute (DC 14 fort negates). Creatures with blindsense (scent) take a -2 penalty to their save. Regardless if the creature saves, survival attempts using scent get a +2 bonus until the creature washes up.

item.title: divorce-potion
item.description: It's so easy to fall in love, but much harder to climb out of it. The divorce potion negates the effects of the love potion. It uses many of the same ingredients but requires organic matter harvested from the creature who the creature is in love with.The effects of the potion are instant. The creature is fully aware of everything they did while under the effects of the love potion, but views it as they would have from the day just before they drank it. Divorce potions are most commonly administered to fix accidental love potion consumption. Due to the higher DC, they are much less common.

item.title: README
item.description: By extracting the juices of a dead love bug, the complex process of creating a love potion can begin. The name is what everybody calls it, but its function is more in line with a toxin than a potion.Care must be exercised when using love potions, for love is not an exact science. When a creature consumes a love potion, they become charmed and deeply romantically interested in the first person they see for 8 hours. At the end of this duration, the creature loses the charmed condition. It then makes a will save (DC 20 negates) to resist the effects of the potion or the romantic feelings become permanent.In the event where the creature first seen is not romantically compatible, it instead forms a close platonic bond.

item.title: README
item.description: Toxins are harmful substances that usually require getting into the body of your target, either through injury or ingestion. Most of them inflict some type of debilitating status.An injury toxin can be applied to your weapon as a standard action, and typically evaporated within a few minutes. Applies its effect on-hit.

item.title: styx-serum
item.description: Using a sample of water from the river Styx and some brain matter, you can create a concoction that can wipe a creature's memories of the recent past. It looks a bit foggier than water and tastes like stagnant water.The Styx serum is incredibly powerful when ingested. It wipes out the memories of the last 24 hours, including drinking the serum.Particularly important events, such as a first kiss, a loved one dying or an unexpected betrayal cannot be erased completely from the spirit by the Styx serum. Such events are instead interpreted as gut feelings, fated connections, love at first sight or deja vu,

item.title: README
item.description: Come in several different categories based on their typical use case.The format includes the items name, the DC to craft it and its cost to purchase.I put alchemical items into different price brackets. One for relatively minor and commonplace items another for powerful items, and the last for things requiring incredibly rare reagents. Item DC refers to craft DC, which determines the price. The save DC is typically a base amount (or the class DC of the Alchemist class). If you want to purchase items with a higher DC, adjust the price accordingly.Cheap - DC^2-80. Then rounded up to nearest 10.Common - 100+(DC+5)^2. Then rounded up to nearest 100Expensive - 1000+(DC+10)^2. Then round up to nearest 100

item.title: businessman
item.description: You are one of owners of a large business, or the primary owner of a small business. Choose a specific profession, craft or performance skill that you are proficient in, or that could be reasonably related. You have access to a location that you can perform all of the necessary tasks of your trade. This location counts as masterwork tools for whatever it is. In addition, you make 10% more money when you work here.You have to return to this business for at least twice each month for upkeep. If you have a method of long distance communication good enough to have lengthy back and forths, such as a good postal system or magic, you can also upkeep as long as you send such messages 1/week. If you don't you are replaced or the business begins to decline.

item.title: family-man
item.description: You are the co-owner of a house somewhere in the world, usually at least on the tangent of civilization. You lived with either your immediate family, like parents and siblings, or you made a family of your own with a spouse and children.You own a meager house in a specific place, and a handful of family members to come home to after an adventure. Your house is always considered a suitable place to rest in order to cure general afflictions.Your family generally understands you won't always be back home for dinner, but going more than a month without contact will usually cause them unease, and may eventually cause them to move.

item.title: noble
item.description: You come from an upper ring of society. Your name might not carry the same weight everywhere you go, but your gold pouch certainly does.You get a bonus 1,000 starting gold that you can spend as you wish. Your family also gives you an allowance every month of 500g. For campaigns with a faster or slower pace, such as if there are frequent time skips, consider changing how often the allowance comes in.If you are far from home, it can take up to a week for your allowance to arrive. They can only ever be picked up from settlements.

item.title: README
item.description: Background helps to determine what your character was doing before they got sucked up into an adventure, other than acquiring the skills necessary to go out into the dangerous world of course.Backgrounds typically give assets with a specific focus.

item.title: tradesman
item.description: You worked in a job that required a specialized form of training, such as an alchemist, a doctor or a blacksmith. Over the years of your work you have accumulated a few tools of the trade. Select one of the following presets, or make one that's similar. Doctor - You start off with a masterwork medicine kit, a dose of troll oil and 3 doses of bloodblock.Alchemist - Start off with a masterwork alchemist kit. You start off with a love potion and an alchemist fire.Craftsman (weapons/armor) - Start off with a set of combat ready equipment. You can start off with... -Heavy armor and a weapon -Medium armor, 3 melee weapons, a ranged weapon and a shield -Light armor, 6 light melee weapons, 2 ranged weapons and a shieldYou also have masterwork tools for crafting weapons/armor.

item.title: wanderer
item.description: You go wherever the road takes you. You might have had a home once, but for one reason or another you had to or wanted to leave.You start play with a standard rock. More information can be found in the bestiary. Very basically, rocks are autonomous, mass produces transportation and shipping vehicles. Most significant places in civilization will have service stations and parking available.

item.title: mana-donation
item.description: By going to specialized facilities, or by going to churches with gilded altars, a creature can donate mana. When you donate, you [mana burn] an equal amount. A creature can safely donate an amount of mana equal to their (max-1). There are usually safeguards against donating your max mana, but less savory individuals don't mind. Mana burning your max mana gives you a T3 affliction: Mana Starvation. This means that most common people are only able to donate 1 mana each day. Children typically do not possess enough mana to safely donate.Specialized facilities and gilded altars are incredibly expensive, typically costing 100s of thousands of gold to craft. This makes it so facilities for mana donation tend to be rather sparse, only located in sizable settlements with magical and religious influence.When mana is extracted, it is turned into a mana crystal. Mana crystals are versatile and can change between states of matter, becoming either liquid or solid for ease of storage. Each point of mana can earn 4g in a mana extraction facility. In a church, it earns 5 GBP and food/lodging for the day.Most religious services happen in the evening after work, so that way people may spend their mana as they wish during the day, and donate it at night if they wish. With large generous populations this can mean that you can amass large quantities of mana rather quickly. Because most people can only donate 1 mana, you can almost 1:1 translate a population of donors to daily mana generation. Not everybody who donates has commoner tier mana, but at the same time, not everybody can always donate! So the 1:1 ratio is generally the go-to method of determining mana generation over time.Again, not all places have the correct facilities, so this is often available in villages.

item.title: populations
item.description: Settlements receive classifications based on population. More populous settlements tend to condense more wealth, have more facilities and are more cosmopolitan. Certain types of services can be expected in larger settlements, but are unheard of in smaller ones.The settlements of Nack are generally less populous than those in our world, with even the biggest of cities having only hundreds of thousands of people.Hamlet - <1,000 peopleVillage - 1,000+ peopleCity - 10,000+ peopleMetropolis - 100k+ peopleSome general assumptions about the population... About 10% of the population is assumed to be over level 0, with a skew towards early levels. Most regions have a dominant religion, with at around half the population favoring them. Metropolises break this mold by having more variety, while hamlets tend to have a much higher skew of 1 religion.

item.title: README
item.description: This section is dedicated to determining income, typically through the use of a skill, like profession, perform or alchemy.All income is based around a formula which calculates a yearly salary (y) based on your skill bonus (x).Salary assumes you you work for 5 days a week, for 50 weeks a year. Divide this value by 250 to figure our your daily income. Most jobs tend to have weekly payouts. The chart below does this formula for you for most expected values. Anything lower than a +0 bonus to the task at hand makes a 5k salary, 20g daily and 100g a week.This formula assumes a prosperous nation with a lot of economic opportunity and a population with thousands of people per city. In poorer and less populous regions, consider using the following multiplier for all goods and services (if you don't mind sacrificing convenience for realism, since multiplying the value every time you buy/sell can get tedious).Developing - Multiply all values by .75 Poor - Multiply all values by .5It also assumes the work provides value. If you are a butcher in a society of vegans, you will struggle to find work. Apply a multiplier in such circumstances.Service/Goods is Almost Useless - Multiply all values by .1 High Supply/Low Demand- Multiply all values by .5 Low Supply/High Demand, Novel Service- Multiply all values by 1.2

item.title: prices-weight-of-common-equipment
item.description: Characters start off with 1k gold.

item.title: README
item.description: Armor does not decrease your speed. Gain poise equal to the armor bonus the armor gives. Heavy armor imposes a -2 penalty to stealth checks. Dex column decides how much dex you get to add to AC. If it has no value, your dex doesn’t add or subtract from your AC.If you do not meet the armor's strength requirement, your speed is reduced by 30 (minimum 5).ShieldsShields do not passively give AC. Instead they give you poise and additional combat options. If you un-equip a shield, you immediately subtract the bonus poise it grants (min 1). ALL ShieldsShields Up (Immediate) - Raise your shield. You gain resistance to any damage originating from a ranged attack roll until the start of your turn. Can be used on attacks targeting allies within reach instead, but ends if they leave your reach. Block (Immediate) - Decrease the bonus to an incoming attack by 2. If it grazes, it instead misses completely. Can be used on attacks targeting allies within reach. Multiple creatures can block the same attack.Tank Up (15 ft of movement) - Plant your shield to gain total cover from one particular direction. Essentially defends you from all attacks originating from a cone in that direction. A creature within 5 feet of you behind your shield gains cover, but only from a direct line. On subsequent turns reduce your movement by 15 to maintain this. You can choose to attack from behind the shield, but it gives cover instead of total cover. Using other shield abilities ends tank up. You can only use tank up once per turn, forcing you to stick to a particular direction. You cannot tank up in the same turn you charge. Blast Shield (Immediate) - When you fail a reflex save, gain resistance to the damage taken.

item.title: the-buckler
item.description: Buckler doesn't count as a shield and doesn't provide any passive defensive bonuses. Instead you get access to the parry ability. You can still interact with objects with a buckler on hand, but bucklers cannot be used if the hand is occupied.Parry (standard) - Prepare yourself for an incoming attack. When you are attacked, you can choose whether or not to parry it. If you do, roll an attack as an instant action. If your attack roll is higher, the attack is negated. You can decide to parry an attack after the result of the roll is revealed.

item.title: README
item.description: It's not a boulder, it's a rock! Rocks are the premier transportation and shipping vehicles in the world of Nack. They are incredibly fast, cheap and can plop down anywhere and look natural because they're rocks.Rocks are construct creatures that have their programming optimized for navigation and high speed transportation. More details in the stats subsection.A standard rock costs 1,500g.If you would only like to rent one, you are typically limited to predesignated paths, such as state roads. It costs 10g for short trips within 600 miles, 30g for something between 2-6 days and 80g+ for anything longer.Prices for augments are included below. Using augmented rocks multiplies adds 50g to the price to rent them, with particularly expensive ones being even more expensive or unavailable for most customers.If the rock is lost, destroyed or damaged, the owner/company that provided the service expects compensation for replacements/repairs.All prices listed are in addition to the base 1,500g price.Offroad - 2,000g Capable of traversing a specific type of terrain, such as forest regions, snow etc. Each sold separately.Climbing/Swimming - 1,000g Rock is capable of using its full speed while climbing or swimming. Each sold separately.Armored Plating - 10,000g Adds +5 ac, +5 to all saving throws, +10 poise and +20 hp.Flight - 60,000g Rock is capable of using its full speed while flying.

item.title: rock-stats
item.description: Level 0 Construct (+0 init)AC 10 HP 20 Poise 15 Fort +0, Refl +0, Will +0NoneVehicle - Standard rocks are streamlined to be useful as transportation and shipping vehicles, but leave a lot to be desired in terms of their combat capabilities. If attacked, a rock is helpless to stop its attacker aside from running away. As such, rocks must be kept away from danger.Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +0, Lucc +0, Int -, Wis +0, Cha +0Speed - 100 land, increases to 45mph out of combat. In ideal conditions, such as well-maintained roads, a rock can travel about 1000 miles a day, assuming it travels through the night, or 600 assuming it doesn't. These speeds are halved when moving through areas without well maintained roads, and reduced to 1/4 if you are traveling through wilderness with unwieldy terrain, such as snowy, sandy, mountainous or forested biomes. Some rocks come with specific terrains in mind and ignore such penalties.Camouflage - Wherever rocks are common (most places), it requires a DC 25 perception check to notice a rock is abnormal when it is not in use. A rock can hide any kinds of custom augmentations while camouflaged, including decorative additions like paint jobs.Autonomous - A rock is programmed to move towards specific well known destinations, in cardinal directions, or to move the path of least resistance towards a set of coordinates. If the rider wishes, there is also a driver's seat that allows them to more finely control the rock's movement. The autonomous driving controls leave a lot to be desired for sleeping passengers. You can get some sleep, but you do not gain the benefits of rest unless you stop to sleep.Seating/Storage - Rocks have compartments that can be easily hidden when not in use, both for seating and for storage. Standard rocks have seating to comfortably accommodate for 20 medium creatures. Such seating is protected from the elements via a weak magical barrier, capable of stopping small insects, wind and rain, but not arrows and swords. They can carry up to 5000 lbs in a compartment that is 8x8x8ft.

item.title: README
item.description: In order to adventure, you need to eat, sleep and relax after a hard day of getting munched on by wolves. These things are going to steadily eat into your wallet. This section is dedicated to quantifying these basic necessities.That being said, not all restaurants and inns are created equal. Some more expensive ones may have access to special types of services, or provide you with connections to a specific type of clientele for an enormous price hike.Food/WaterIt costs 25g a week to keep yourself fed. Certain features, like proficiency in the survival skill or the Hellion's dirt consumption can significantly decrease or eliminate this cost.25 gold a week translates to ~110g a month or about ~1,300g a year.LodgingIt costs 100g a week to keep a roof over your head, provided you don't already have a house and need to acquire rooms at inns or pay farmers to sleep in barns. Sleeping out in the wilderness costs nothing, but can bring dangers like weather, monsters, thieves and the like.If you already own a house, this cost is decreased to 50g a week. This represents upkeep for your house in the wilderness or upkeep, taxes or loan repayments for your house in a city.100 gold a week translates to ~440g a month or about ~5,200g a year. 50 gold a week translates to ~220g a month or about ~2,600g a year.SuppliesAdventuring/travel requires a lot of miscellaneous things, amounting to 25g a week. Adventuring requires many things. You need to keep your swords sharp, your fires lit, your tents and bedrolls without holes etc. You're also gonna need a lot of rope.What counts as "adventuring" doesn't necessarily require you be out in the wilderness and could just as easily involve you snooping around towns gathering info, harassing farmers and exploring haunted houses.As a benefit for paying for supplies, you need not write down many miscellaneous items on your character sheet as you or a party member are assumed to have such things. This usually means something like a hammer, rope, flint and steel etc.25 gold a week translates to ~110g a month or about ~1,300g a year.Recovering from AfflictionsA night at the tavern is usually enough to wash away your woes, getting rid of all T1 afflictions. This usually involves you blowing a good amount of money all at once, costing 100g. General recovery can refer to visiting amusement parks or eating out at a nice restaurant.Such activities must always be performed at some type of "for leisure" location. It doesn't necessarily need to be in a settlement, so it could also include remote locations like hot springs in a mountain. Higher tiers of afflictions will likely require a specialist and a large degree of time. The cost for these services is tied to how long it takes to heal, using the economics chart to determine cost. Some afflictions require very specific treatment that might not be generally available.TransportationSpeed is usually the name of the game, but might not always be available. Because of the variety in transportation, it is its own subsection.A creature with 30 speed traveling on foot can travel 30 miles a day on a road, 24 miles a day in wilderness or 15 miles a day in dense/difficult terrain like snow, mountains and jungle. Judge overall travel speed based on the weakest link.

item.title: teleportation
item.description: A teleportation circle is an undertaking that requires a great deal of upkeep to maintain, with skillful mages on call for when things go wrong. Only the most rich and powerful nations have access to a teleportation circle, and only in their capital. The number of teleportation circles in a world typically does no exceed a dozen.That being said, the process of teleportation between circles is usually an easy, painless and routine task. Teleportation between these circles costs 100g and typically only takes a few minutes of waiting in line.Certain restrictions may be in place during times of war and strife preventing teleportation while they last.

item.title: bandage
item.description: This badge is meant to resemble bandages, but when the wearer is afflicted with a bleed effect, it automatically negates it.This has a 1 minute cooldown.

item.title: bull-goat
item.description: This tiny ram icon can be affixed to any piece of medium or heavy armor, increasing your poise by 5.

item.title: bullseye
item.description: This badge literally puts a target on you. Any ranged attacks directed at allies within 5 ft of you are instead directed at you.

item.title: peace
item.description: This badge is a symbol of peace. If you perform no action on your turn in combat, you are affected as per sanctuary until the start of your next turn.This has a 1 minute cooldown.

item.title: README
item.description: Baubles are little badges, icons, talismans and whatnot that you affix to your person, providing you with a passive bonus. You can only have one bauble.

item.title: README
item.description: This piece of enchanted wood is infused with mana from those adept at magic casting, allowing you to channel their experience through it.While wielding a wand, you can increase the CL of a spell you cast by 1 as a swift action.A wand comes with a cantrip that you can innately cast while you wield it.

item.title: wand-enhanced
item.description: This piece of enchanted wood is infused with mana from those adept at magic casting, allowing you to channel their experience through it.While wielding a wand, you can increase the CL of a spell you cast by 1 as a swift action.An enhanced wand, in additional to casting a cantrip, allows you to innately cast a tier 1 technique 1/day.

item.title: banner-of-doom
item.description: This flag is inscribed with symbols of fiends, prominent criminal organizations or evil mages. Those that exist within 30 ft of the banner while it is planted (a standard action) hear whispers from it, causing them to become shaken 1, unless they are allied with the group the banner's iconography showcases.This has no effect on creatures that are already shaken. If the creature was not already shaken when it entered the area and it leaves the area, the shaken the banner inflicts immediately dissipates as the whispers vanish.A creature can roll a DC 15 athletics check to push the banner over.

item.title: seal-standard
item.description: A seal is a vague title given to an item of significance to channel magic power through. For more information see seals.Seals are typically attuned to a specific type of magic, such as Brazzeria or Pyromancy, allowing you to cast spells of that tree with +1 CL.

item.title: summoning-contract
item.description: Summoning contracts are written in order for a creature to provide aid to another without following them around all the time. There are always 2 parties involved in a contract: the summoner and the summoned. Typically it is up to the summoner to convince the summoned to sign the contract, as the magic does not work with unwilling creatures. It is possible to find summoning contracts with a signature from a summoned creature, but not a summoner. Contracts are often temporary, being lifted after a certain number of summons, or after a specific task is complete.When the summoned creature signs the contract in blood, so to must the summoner. The summoned creature takes up a [companion] slot while summoned. 1/day as a FRA, you can summon the contracted creature. Creatures summoned in this way always have a pseudo-ethereal translucent quality to them that is easily identifiable (DC 10 arcana). A summon typically only lasts a minute, but can last up to an hour if the summoned creature accepts summoning sickness. The creature also gains summoning sickness if it drops to 0 hp while summoned.Summoning Sickness - A specific type of ailment that occurs as a result of a summoned creature pushing themselves too hard while summoned from a summoning contract, usually by sticking around for too long or being defeated. The creature is drained 2 and cannot be summoned for two weeks, even if the drain is removed.In most aspects, a summoned creature functions exactly as they would if you were fighting by their side in their actual body, with a few key differences. As a magical effect, they can be dispelled (DC 12+summoned creatures lvl). They have all of their gear and any resources that they expend (such as potions) while summoned are still expended when they return to their body. Summoned creatures only have 50% of their max hp.To the summoned creature, when you attempt to summon them, they receive a mental message from their summoner no longer than 2 sentences. They can choose to deny being summoned if they pass a will save (your class DC). If they succeed, they can send 2 sentences back. Otherwise, they enter a trance like state and their spirit leaves their body and appears next to you. If their body takes damage, or is otherwise harmed, then their spirit immediately winks out of existence.A summoned creature can dismiss itself as a standard action. A creature can only be summoned once per day.The more powerful a creature is, the more expensive it is to bind them to a summoning contract. If the contract has a limit on uses, adjust price as below.If the contract has stipulations that limit when the creature can be summoned, halve the cost again. (only summon vs fiends) Ex. Level 1 creature, limited use cases, 3 times. 1,000g.

item.title: tracking-device
item.description: This tiny device is about the size of a peanut and resonates with psionic energy. You can attune to it by concentrating on it while in contact with it for 1 minute, provided you don't have negative intelligence.More importantly, it can fit inside of a creature's body. With engineering or medicine proficiency, you can implant this device into a creature. The process is painful and obvious, so it can usually only be done on knocked out creatures. While implanted, you can know the general direction and distance of any tracking device you have attuned to. Each tracking device has a slightly different signal, allowing you to tell which one is which, provided you have the mental capacity to do so. You can be attuned to (1+int) tracking devices at once.If the creature ever receives medical examination, a DC 20 medicine check also reveals a strange bump, or an unusual ache that indicates where the tracking device is, and it can be removed.

item.title: amplifying-staff
item.description: Favored by bards, this light staff shimmers in the light. If you hold it up to your mouth, it doubles the volume of any vocalizations. By spending a swift action to increase the mana cost of any ability with the [healing] tag by 1 (or adding a mana cost of 1), you can increase its range by 10 feet, or its radius by 5 ft.Manathirst 12 The range/radius extension can be done as a free action.Manathirst 22 The range/radius extension no longer requires mana.It is a 1h crush weapon. Also comes in a battle staff and light variant, like most staves.

item.title: anal-probe
item.description: This baton looks unimpressive until you press a button on its side to coat it in a strange liquid and electrify it as a swift action. It can remain electrified for 1 minute before it must recharge for 5. When you thrust it, it seems to magnetize to the target's orifices.It is a 1h light club.When electrified it instead deals 2d6 zap dmg. It also gains a special attack.Special Attack: Terrestrial Exploration Shove the probe in whatever hole the creature is most uncomfortable with. They are clumsy 2 on-hit.

item.title: benevolent-blade
item.description: This silver sword has a hilt that shines a radiant gold. This weapon is used to non-lethally dispatch creatures when defeating them since it has no chance of potentially killing them.Special Attack: Lifesteal [healing] On hit heal (2+lvl).Manathirst 7 Special Attack: Benevolence [healing] Strike at an ally as the blade transforms into a warming radiance. It grants the attacks damage as temp hp and has no harmful on hit effects.The sword is a 1h slash or pierce weapon with the one and done property.

item.title: boring-blade
item.description: This mundane sword shows its true power only when the user does not use any fancy shmancy techniques with it. If fact, the sword appears to "activate" glowing with power for a minute when using a technique, but counter intuitively, this is how the sword appears when it deactivates.As long as you have not used a technique in the last minute, it is treated as though it has every special weapon property seen in the weapon rules page, with the exception of reach and ranged weapon properties. It has conceal, bleed, etc. You can use every special attack that doesn't have a specific weapon requirement.Boring blade has 3 enchantment slots.The sword is a light pierce weapon with the chink magnet and the attached property.

item.title: demons-grasp
item.description: This green metallic gauntlet has its fingers honed at the tip like claws. Imprinted on the back of its "hand" is inscribed a slur written in infernal against fiends. It is exceptionally good at capturing the attention of fiends. When attacking with fiendish allies, they are all taunted by the target of your attack on-hit. Fiends you grapple are automatically taunted by you.Manathirst 12 When fighting a fiend, every attack with this weapon taunts on-hit for 1 round (will negates). Allied fiends get a +2 bonus to attack against any creature you attack with Demons Grasp for 1 turn.The gauntlet is a light slash weapon with the attached and CM (grapple) qualities.

item.title: elemental-staff
item.description: This staff has a mana crystal affixed to its end, shimmering with a color that indicates the type of element it favors. All spells with the elemental tag shared by the staff get +1 CL. 1/day it can reduce the mana cost of such a spell by 1.Manathirst 12 1/day you can spend 1 mana to change the elemental damage type of the spell to the stave's elemental affinity.The standard staff is a 1h crush weapon. Also comes in a battle staff and light variant, like most staves.

item.title: fiery-war-axe
item.description: Favored by veteran fighters, this axe is the color of obsidian, with a blade that looks white hot. When pointing the weapon at any creature that is considered a minion to you, it ignites in flames. Against any such foe, the axe deals an additional d10 fire damage.The axe is a 1h slash weapon with the one and done property.

item.title: garish-gavel
item.description: This hammer is bejeweled all along its head and has a finish to its wooden handle that makes it sparkle. When you strike it against a solid surface, it is exceptionally loud, even with only a light tap. Everyone can't help but look upon he who slams the gavel.Special Attack: ORDER - Must be directed at a solid object instead of a creature. Taunt all creatures within 30 ft for 1 round.The hammer is a 1h crush weapon the one and done and dueling properties.

item.title: heavy-metal
item.description: This oversized guitar is made almost entirely out of iron with chrome plating. It weighs 50 lbs and is hilariously impractical as an instrument. In order to even properly play the guitar, the wielder must possess at least +1 Str. It has the following special attack.Instrumental Destruction - Whack someone with Heavy Metal so hard it breaks and becomes unusable, dealing an additional 2d6 (7) sonic damage. The mana cost of the next technique you use this turn is decreased by your strength score. You must [mana burn] 1 as a FRA to repair it so it can be played/wielded again.The guitar functions as a large hammer-esque 2h crush weapon with the meteor swing special attack and the CM (sunder) quality.

item.title: hunters-rifle
item.description: This gun has a barrel that grows to comically large size at its tip. You get a +4 bonus on survival checks to track any creature you have hit or grazed with this weapon in the last week.Special Attack: My Brand - On hit apply a brand to a creature, physically marking them. You and your companion creatures attacks do an additional d6 damage until the end of your next turn.The gun functions 2h rifle (see exotic weapons).

item.title: icebreaker
item.description: This mace is a cool blue color and, when wielded, the air around is visibly chilled as though it was exhaling on a cold day. It excels at crushing ice, and can easily smash through any type of icey barrier less than 1ft thick. Anything thicker becomes something of a mining operation. If a creature is frosty, or otherwise mostly made of ice, the mace does an additional 5 damage and makes it clumsy 1 on-hit. It has the following special attack...Rime Time - Make a swipe at the air and target a 30 ft cone. All creatures in the area take 2d6+lvl (7+lvl) cold damage and are made frosty (reflex halves and negates frosty).The mace is a 1h crush weapon with the CM (Sunder) and one and done properties.

item.title: likkem
item.description: This staff has a smug frog carved into the tip of it. Its eyeballs are wheels with numbers inscribed on them from 0 to 9. Whenever you defeat a creature with a melee attack using this staff, or a spell cast using this staff, the staffs eyes start spinning, stopping when they reach how much damage you overkilled the target. If you did exactly enough damage to defeat the creature and the eyes stop on zero, it plays a frog croaking sound and you gain a luck dice.By spending a luck dice, you can innately cast Lucky StarThe standard staff is a 1h crush weapon.

item.title: nosey-knife
item.description: This knife makes the wielder feel uneasy, like it knows what its thinking. Whenever you crit a DD creature, the knife randomly chooses a technique the creature knows to memorize, up to your highest tier technique known. While you wield the knife, you also have that technique memorized.The knife has a will of its own, and will memorize new techniques if you keep critting whether you want it to or not.The knife is a light pierce weapon with the conceal and chink magnet property.

item.title: ogre-club
item.description: This club has metal plates at its end, each face inscribed with magic sigils to enhance this heavy weapons power. Unfortunately, ogres' propensity for randomness creates a different definition of power than most. While the you are threatening multiple enemies, you get a +2 bonus to attack, but you decide which enemy you attack randomly among all creatures you threaten.The club is a 2h crush weapon with bewildering blow special attack and the easily repaired quality.

item.title: ogrelords-whip
item.description: Unlike the standard whip, this whip is capable of threatening, but only your allies. When you make an AoO against an ally, it always does 5 slashing damage and increases their speed by 20 this round. You also gain a charge, up to 3. Each charge you can spend as an free action to increase the bonus of your next attack by +2 (max +6).Charges are lost when you roll initiative.See whip in exotic weapons for more details.

item.title: orcish-hammer
item.description: This hammer is infused with the power of the wind itself by orcish shamans. It feels practically weightless while you swing it through air, despite its otherwise unwieldy size. Its wielder can innately cast storm stomp 1/day. The wielder also gains this special attack...Windfury - Attack twice in rapid succession, applying DR only once.The hammer is a 1h crush weapon with the strings attached and one-and done quality.

item.title: quaking-hammer
item.description: This hammer makes the ground shake when it strikes the ground. When a creature disarms you of this weapon, it smashes into the ground at their feet, letting you make a topple attack as an instant action.Special Attack: Fissure - Strike the ground to attack all creatures in a 30 ft line. Compare your attack to every creature's AC in the AoE. If you spend 3 mana, you can make the 30 ft line 15 ft wide.Manathirst 12 Fissure deals an additional 2d6 (7) damage and always does the enhanced version.Manathirst 22 Fissure staggers targets on hit.The hammer is a 1h crush weapon with the CM (topple) and one and done properties.

item.title: ray-gun
item.description: This pistol looks like a child's toy, made of colorful plastic with superfluous details. Pulling the trigger reveals otherwise. It blasts rays of pure energy, dealing force damage instead of a pistol's usual damage. It does not need to be reloaded, but it can only fire 5 times per day.Special Attack: Pack a Punch Creatures within 5 ft of the original target take 2d6 (7) force damage and poise damage. If this poise breaks a creature, it is knocked down.Functions as a pistol.

item.title: README
item.description: A category for things you make attacks with. Includes staves, swords and bows alike.I'm not opposed to changing some of the details of many of these weapons, like making them 2h weapons/light weapons. Or changing their qualities if you're a grapple focused build to give it CM (grapple) instead of one of its default properties.

item.title: rusty-sword
item.description: This curved iron sword looks as though the black iron exterior could peel off at any moment and is covered with patches of rust. It has a -2 penalty to damage. When used to cut down creatures that can bleed, it changes. The iron in the blood repairs the weapon and then some. Each time you successfully strike a foe, the rust fades and the blade sharpens, adding +1 damage, up to 4 times for a total of +2 bonus damage.The sword is a 2h slash weapon that has the bleed and easily repaired property.

item.title: scrappy-swordfish
item.description: This fish was subject to a magical ritual akin to taxidermy after all of the useful parts were removed. The fish is a bit small for its kind, but it is certainly as sharp. It remains rigid even when clashing with metal swords. 1/day you can say a brief prayer to Mother Earth as a swift action and the fish briefly springs back to life. It immediately readies to parry, allowing you to decide which attack to deflect during the next round of combat. If you worship Mother Earth, you can use a point of prayer to parry with this weapon.The fish is a 1h pierce weapon with the CM (disarm) and one and done properties.Despite being gutted and undersized, the fish is still rather heavy and weighs 20 lbs.

item.title: soul-eater
item.description: This black great sword has a red mana crystal in the shape of an eye affixed to its hilt. Any who hold the blade in their hands can feel its blood lust. While wielding this blade, the wielder has weakness 3 to all damage, but reduces the mana cost of all techniques by 1. This effect cannot prevent mana burn. The wielder gets a +2 bonus to attack with this weapon.The Soul Eater can be enchanted 3 times.It is a 2h slash weapon with the bleed and easy repair properties.

item.title: spirit-claws
item.description: These gauntlets have a faint blue glow to them. As a free action while your hands are free, you can clench your fists and cause a pair of glowing blue spectral claws to appear over them. The claws deal d6 slashing damage.

item.title: sticky-spear
item.description: This long, pointed piece of wood is covered in a sticky sap. The wielder cannot change weapons using the swapping gear action without first spending a standard action to attach it to another object and pulling it off. However the spear is very fickle. Whenever you disarm a creature, it leaves you behind and hops directly into your targets open hand.It is a 2h pierce weapon with the reach, CM (disarm) and attached properties.

item.title: supercharged-sword
item.description: This unassuming short sword hums with electricity. It is slightly magnetic, almost as if it wants weapons to hit it. Sunder attacks made against this weapon receive a +10 bonus. When sundered, it zaps the sundering creature for 2d6+lvl (7+lvl) zap damage.The sword comes with the elemental (zap) enchantment baked into it, and can be enchanted again.The sword can also be used as the spell focus for any spell with the [zap] tag.Manathirst 12 Sunder attacks made by enemies that threaten you always target this weapon, even if they target other creatures or pieces of equipment.It is a 1h slash weapon with the easily repaired property.

item.title: wheel-of-momentum
item.description: This strange item is a large shield-like weapon with glowing blades along its edges that constantly circle the outside of the weapon. Because of this motion, it is ill-fitted to be used for defense. Every time the user misses an attack roll with it, the blades circle faster and glow more vibrantly, giving the wielder +1 attack that stacks with each miss. Once you land an attack, the speed resets back to default, removing the attack bonus.This stacking effect cannot be used outside of combat.It is a 1h slash weapon with the one and done and attached property.

item.title: magic-weapon-properties
item.description: These properties can be attached to most weapons. Classes like fighter and magus can add these properties to their weapon temporarily.A weapon can typically only be enchanted with one of these properties. Such enchantments cost 5,000 gold.

item.title: README
item.description: Some magic items have a scaling component to them called Manathirst, growing more powerful when in the hands of someone who is more powerful.Manathirst features are unlocked when you have 12 and 22 max mana, typically kicking in at level 5 and 10.

item.title: lead-architecture
item.description: Lead structures are the most expensive, but most effective way of making sure an area is safe from scrying. This is done by lining the building materials with layers of lead during construction, or as a later add on. Scrying attempts inside of lead structures always fail. Even going near the structure causes scrying magic to be faulty, obscuring the senses.A singular room costs 25,000gAn average home costs 60,000gLarge or complex structures such as prisons, dungeons or palaces have a starting price of 150,000g, which can easily increase based off the scale of the project.

item.title: lead-container
lead-paint
item.description: Lead paint is the most convenient and cost effective way method of preventing scrying from would be spies over large areas. However it is a much more temporary solution. The high concentration of lead in the paint, as well as the additional binding agents, causes the paint to peel much more often and release a toxic gas that can cause problems over time. This requires a monthly cleaning and reapplication to maintain the anti-divination properties.A bucket of paint can cover the average sized room. Larger rooms with high roofs require many buckets.Buckets of paint are typically used for smaller private meeting rooms.

item.title: README
item.description: Lead seems like an unusual item to catalogue, but it has unique properties that make it desirable despite its drawbacks. Lead has the unique property of interfering with [scrying] effects. Lead paint is the most convenient method of preventing scrying from would be spies, but it can also be used in other clever ways.For example if you have a treasured item you don't want a spy to see, you can use a metal box lined with lead to cause it to appear invisible to any [scrying] effects. Particularly rich and paranoid creatures, like wizards an beholders hoard lead in order to cover their entire lairs in it.It only takes a very thin sheet of lead that mostly covers an area to veil it from these pesky divinations. There are various security measures available for sale.

item.title: dragon-weapon-special-attacks
item.description: Sever - This attack gains +2 attack. On-hit sever the connection a creature has to their deity. Any abilities related to prayer they cannot use until they rest. Similar abilities that rely on divine power like Smite are unaffected.

item.title: README
item.description: Dragon Metal is often referred to by what its made into rather than as a material more often than not; Something like "dragon plate armor" or "dragon greatsword." It is made by combining a rare form of jewel, called dragonstone, with steel. When in the presence of a dragon, the dragonstone absorbs bits of expended mana over time and change color to match the color of the dragon's scales. The dragon metal that is created by this often superficially resembles the dragon whom the dragonstone absorbed its power. When dragon metal is made into a weapon, the weapon has a +2 flat bonus to damage. They also get a bonus special attack, selected from the attached list.When dragon metal is made into a set of medium or heavy armor, it gives a +1 bonus to AC. It also gives resistance to an elemental damage type, based on the dragonstone used in its crafting, defaulting to fire. For light armor see dragonhide.

item.title: caltrops
item.description: Caltrops are small pointy objects designed to harm creatures that walk through areas where they are deployed. Every space a creature moves through occupied by caltrops, they take 2 piercing damage and start bleeding for 2 damage. A creature can avoid this damage by treating it as difficult terrain.500g is the price attached to the package of caltrops that can be deployed immediately as a standard action. Treat it as a thrown weapon to determine the distance you can throw it. All spaces within 5 ft of its landing point are covered in these pointy bits.If deployed beforehand carefully over 1 minute, a similar package can cover a 10 ft radius.Caltrops can be swept up in the AoE of many effects, such as aqueous orb, causing them to be rendered ineffective.

item.title: holy-water
item.description: Holy water is an item that is regularly created by churches and sold to commoners as a form of protection against the profane. Many fiends and undead have an aversion to this substance, and can often cure diseases inflicted by them and prevent some of their supernatural abilities.The most common use of holy water is as a weapon. You can throw a small bottle of it as a thrown weapon. It deals 2d6 (7) holy damage on hit.Many uses of holy water require its direct application, such as on wounds inflicted by the profane, or directly on the remains of the profane to put their spirits to rest.

item.title: property
item.description: Property is synonymous with land, and everything on it. Property can include facilities, homes or it can just look pretty. The price of property changes based on a few factors: Size, buildings, appearance, location and the overall state its in can influence its price.Small bits of land with little intrinsic value generally go pretty cheap. You can buy an acre of unworked "wild land" for 10,000gPremium land, such as places that could be good spots for attractions or farmland are a bit more expensive. You can buy an acre of premium land for 50,000gA small home that can comfortably fit a single person costs 10,000gAn average home that can comfortably fit a family costs 25,000gA luxurious home, like a mansion with many rooms for family and guests, leisure rooms for toys and sports and large outdoor yards costs 100,000gLarge or complex structures such as prisons, dungeons or palaces have a starting price of 250,000g, which can easily increase based off the contents.

item.title: README
item.description: Things that you can usually buy in many locations around the world with the correct vendor in town. Many have real life analogues.

item.title: tools
item.description: Tools typically come in sets catered to a specific task, such as fishing, lockpicking or medicine. Some tasks require the use of tools, others only give a penalty if you don't have tools.Tools also come in a masterwork variety, giving the user a +2 bonus on the skill in question. The price is increased to 800g.{% hint style="danger" %} Not all tasks have tools, and therefore are not suitable for acquiring masterwork variants to them. Skills like medicine, alchemy and profession use tools. Skills like stealth, perception and persuasion do not. Some types of tools might be able to aid you with novel types of tasks, such as using a spyglass to roll perception long distances, but should not give any types of flat bonuses. {% endhint %}Tool kits weigh 10 lbs. Some tasks, such as smithing, require even more advanced tools you can't carry around like a forge.

item.title: torch
item.description: Torches are sticks wrapped with some type of cloth, chemical or vegetable matter that is flammable. Torches give off bright light in a 20 ft radius around them, and dim light 20 ft past that. They can stay lit for up to 2 hours. Lighting and dimming a torch repeatedly can significantly decrease the amount of time they stay lit.If a torch ends up getting wet, it becomes unusable. If a torch ends up clattering to the ground from being knocked over or disarmed, roll a DC 10 luck check to see if it goes out, using the luckiest fellow benefiting from it in the vicinity if it was not wielded by anybody in specific.

item.title: README
item.description: {% hint style="warning" %} All weapons come with some of these special attacks, based on the damage type they deal, or their weapon type (ranged, melee, shield etc). {% endhint %}Special attacks by default recharge after being out of combat for 1 minute.You can swap weapons to gain more special attacks, but you cannot use special attacks with the same name more than once in the same combat. Most special attacks require a melee attack, unless the weapon is ranged.The ALL in these subcategories refer to only manufactured weapons, not natural attacks and unarmed strikes. Special Attack: Lacerate - On the hits apply d6 bleed damage for 2 turns (fort negates) Special Attack: Cleave - Attack two separate creatures you threaten from your current position. Special Attack: Concussive Strike - On hit apply clumsy 1. Special Attack: Backbreaker - Deal 10 poise damage on-hit.Special Attack: Lunge - Increase your reach by 5 ft for this attack and all others made this turn Special Attack: Pierce Defense - Ignore DR. If your opponent uses an immediate or instant action in response to this attack, gain +4 attack.Special Attack: Maim - On hit reduce the creature's speed by 15ft for one round (fort negates). Special Attack: Snipe - Ignore -2 penalty to attack for a long ranged shotSpecial Attack: Endure - Slam a target with your shield and continue to hold it up, focusing on them. Gain resistance to all damage from this target for 1 round, even if you miss. Special Attack: Shield Bash - Inflict clumsy 1 on hit.

item.title: unique-special-attacks
item.description: This section is dedicated to helping you fill in the "special attack" portion of your weapon, or for giving unique weapons special abilities. See the "special attacks" section for the special attacks weapons get by default.Special Attack: Determination - Focus your conviction. You get a +4 bonus and seeking to your next attack with this weapon. You can also choose to not attack at all with this special attack, granting your next attack with this weapon a +10 bonus instead. If you choose to delay this bonus, Determination does not consume your special attack next round.Special Attack: Stacking Strike - Make an attack. If this defeats the creature, stacking strike permanently gains 1 damage. Weapon specific, so you have to stack weapons individually. You cannot farm stacks passively and must gain them in combats you actually roll out.Special Attack: Bewildering Blow - On hit creature is confused for one round (will negates).Special Attack: Dispelling Strike - Roll an attack roll in place of a dispel check against a magical effect you can attack, including one on a creature.Special Attack: Meteor Swing - On hit your target is unable to make AoOs for 1 round.Special Attack: Ankle Slicer - On hit your target has -15 speed for 1 round.Special Attack: Lifesteal - On hit heal (2+level).Special Attack: Throat Slicer - On hit silence a creature for one round (fort negates).Special Attack: All In - On hit instead of rolling for damage, you deal maximum damage. If you graze, you instead miss entirely. When you miss, you take 20 poise damage.The above special attacks can be generalized to any type of weapon. Even the "slicer" special attacks could be achieved just as effectively if you crushed a throat or foot. In general I try to be lax with what weapons you give your character so mechanics to not interfere with flavor. However, the following weapons will specify a type of weapon you lock into, and are incompatible with each other.Special Attack: Volley - Fire many shots at once, targeting a 15 ft cone in front of you. Compare your attack roll to all creatures in AoE. This requires a bow, which is a 2h ranged weapon without the reload property.Special Attack: Rapid Fire - Fire two shots in rapid succession at the same creature. This requires a bow, which is a 2h ranged weapon without the reload property.Special Attack: Wild Strike - Swing around a flail without concern for the consequences. Deal an additional 7 damage. If you miss or graze, you instead treat the attack as if you grazed yourself. This requires a flail, which is a 1h or 2h melee crush weapon.Special Attack: Hack n Smash - Perform a free sunder attack against an opponent's armor or shield. This requires a hammer, which is a 1h or 2h melee crush weapon.Special Attack: Outmaneuver - While not being flanked, move 5 ft [elusive] and make a melee attack. This requires a polearm, which 2h melee reach weapon.Special Attack: Dig Deep - Embed your weapon into your foe punch it in further, making them clumsy 2. They can remove it as a standard action, or a swift action with medicine proficiency. You let go of the weapon as part of using this special attack. This requires a pick style weapon, which is a 1h or 2h melee pierce weapon.Special Attack: Execution - Finish them. Against a knocked down or grappled opponent, deal an additional 7 damage. This requires a heavy sword or axe style weapon, which is a 2h slashing weapon.Special Attack: Overrun - Move your opponent 5 ft in a direction that isn't towards you on hit. This requires a heavy ramming or hammer type weapon, which is a 2h crush weapon.

item.title: exotic-weapons
item.description: Inherently function differently than other weapons and require a more nuanced description to describe their functionality. These weapons get no additional weapon points to customize with.- A well crafted stick either made with wood infused with magic, or has an object affixed to its end to channel magic power. Can be used to cast spells. - Comes in a light variant (d6, 2 lbs , 120g) and a 2h battlestaff variant (2d6, 10 lbs, 200g) - When you wield 2 staves, or have a staff and some other magical focus, you get a +1 boost to your CL- A large chunk of wood or metal with handles on one side to affix to your arm. Can be used to make shield actions. - Comes with the CM (shove) quality - Gives 5 poise - Also comes in a tower shield variant, giving additional shield actions and 10 poise. (40 lbs, 100g) More details in armor/shields section.- While mounted, a lance can be wielded in one-hand while still benefiting from 2h crit damage. Special Attack: Joust - When you make this attack while mounted and during a charge, your movement is [elusive] against your target. On hit dismounts the target.- Nets deal no damage, but instead inflict the entangled condition on hit - The entangled condition can be removed by a creature succeeding on a athletics check (class dc) as a standard action, or automatically as a standard action if wielding a slash weapon. - You still benefit from the CM (Drag) feature of the net as long as the creature is entangled. - You can use nets to make drag combat maneuvers against targets within 20 ft. When you drag with a net, you forfeit entangling your target - Nets can only be used once per combat since they must be refolded again to be effective- Boomerangs return to the user when thrown automatically, allowing multiple attacks with a single thrown weapon. - Boomerangs curve, allowing you to hit opponents with total cover, so long as you aim for the correct space - Boomerangs do not return when caught with something like a goo dragon's sticky Special Attack: Wait For It... - Throw a boomerang at an unusual angle, initially missing a target. At the start of your next turn make an attack against them, but they're DD .- Harpoons come with a particularly strong 40 ft rope attached, allowing you to drag the weapon back to you in case you miss (standard action). Holding onto this rope after you toss uses a hand. - Harpoons stick into the target. The bleed from this weapon cannot be stopped until after it is removed (class DC athletics, swift action). - While embedded, you can make a drag attacks against the target without penalty from being at a range.- Bolas can be used to topple from a range. - Bolas can only be used once per combat as they need to be untangled to be used properly- Requires an even more complex reloading process than crossbows. Their reload requires a FRA -Pistols are 1h weapons, but they cannot be used to dual wield - Also comes in a 2h rifle version that has the 2h property and does 2d8 dmg (10 lbs, 800g)- Has the same rules as guns plus the following… - Simultaneously attacks every creature in a 15ft cone, comparing a single attack roll to all creature's AC - Does not provoke from shooting in melee - Not compatible with special attacks- Whips can be used to attack with 10 ft of extra reach, but do not threaten (meaning no AoOs) - You can use the whip to grab objects and pull them adjacent to you, provided you would normally have been able to lift them. - Whips can be used to dispatch creatures non-lethally instead of killing when defeating them

When called upon, your jizzle will do its best to repair your body.Functions as follows...Autumn Army - Polong

item.title: README
item.description: As a general rule, I have loosely tied the value of gold to the USD. Average laborers like farmers can be expected to make ~10-20k gold every year, with the amount increasing with more sophisticated trades such as smiths or merchants.Gold pieces are small coins and are virtually weightless due to the minting process performed by the financial wizards. Another benefit of this minting is it causes gold pieces to naturally stack into specific values (5, 10, 20, 100, 1000). Someone can easily hold 100g in their pockets, 1000g in a dedicated pouch. Anything more and they are bulging at the seams and would be better off with a bank.

item.title: Fighter
item.description:
Men-at-arms clad in steel that use various fighting styles to achieve the same goal: destroy as many enemies as possible using overwhelming martial prowess. Deadly Arsenal, HearthstoneYou have martial specialization.
You gain 1 Technique points at level 1, then another point every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used on any martial tree.
Characters with martial specialization gain points in Warfare equal to their highest tier of martial technique.Once per any turn where you're capable of taking the attack action, you can make a simple attack as a free action, or as an additional simple attack if you do take the attack action.
Gain +2 to ACC and DR 5 vs disarm.Armors requires 2 less strength to use. You ignore the stealth penalty to heavy armor.Gain athletics as a skill with a +4 bonus. You can roll athletics to aid an ally as a swift action.
+4 to saves vs fear effects. The DC to demoralize you using intimidate is 4 higher.When combat starts, if you are below full hp, heal to full HP.
When an enemy is a minion, you automatically know just by looking at them. Gain an additional superior attack that can only be used against minion enemies. You are immune to being grazed by minions
Gain combat reflexes as a bonus feat. If you already have it, gain a bonus feat. You can use an attack of opportunity to swat a ranged attack out of the air that targets either you or an ally within reach. Roll an attack roll. If your attack roll matches or exceeds theirs, the attack is negated.
You take a -4 ACC penalty to attacks opposing siege weapons, such as cannons or giant rocks.Weapon attacks gain additional damage equal to their damage dice. Gain this again at level 10 Examples: 2h weapon @1=2d6, @6=4d6, @10=6d6 Light Weapon @1=d6, @6=2d6, @10=3d6As a standard action you can enchant weapons you hold with any quality from the magic weapons section. You can enchant 2 different weapons, and give them different enchants. You can enchant new weapons, but the old ones lose their enchantments.Weapons cannot have typically more than 1 enchantment, unless they have multiple enchantment slots.

item.title: Knowledge
item.description:
INT-based Skill. You cannot roll Knowledge if you are not Trained.
Knowledge is broken up into many different skills based on subject, and each one has a subsection dedicated to Monster Lore of specific types of creatures. Monster Lore isn’t its own skill, it is instead an action that uses the individual Knowledge skills. If a subject or creature falls into multiple categories, then players can choose whichever they like more, but an individual character can't roll multiple checks with different skills - instead, they receive a +2 bonus for each overlapping Knowledge they possess.
If you want to know who an individual creature is and their relevance to the world, rather than their stats and abilities, the DC is usually dependent on how popular they are. This is typically 30-LV with additional reductions to the DC if they are famous or in a position of power, or increases in the DC if they work to keep their identity and exploits hidden.
All Knowledge Skills can be used to recall the History of the associated subject as well, such as using Humanities to learn about ancient Elf-Human relations that shaped the current world.
