item.description:
Plague alchemists use their mastery over toxic substances to melt their enemies. They have incredible damage potential in drawn out fights without healers.You gain the Elemental Adept feat, applied to poison damage. Whenever a creature fails a saving throw against one of your spells that deals damage, or on-hit, it applies a stack of Toxic. For the next minute, they take poison damage equal to the stacks of toxic they have at the start of each of their turns. Toxic damage can apply toxic stacks, but it does not extend its duration.Toxic damage cannot kill creatures, only defeating them if it drops them to 0. The toxic stacks persist while defeated, but do not accumulate further.
This can be removed with Provide First Aid or by washing a creature clean, such as by being submerged in water. Any effect that removes venom can also remove toxic stacks.
Whenever you use alchemical inspiration to create a toxin, you can apply it to a held weapon and make an attack with it as a free action.Whenever a creature fails a save against one of your toxins, they also gain a stack of ~={red}toxic=~.As a standard action, remove all toxic stacks from all creatures within 60 ft of you. Creatures take 3 true damage for each stack of ~={red}toxic=~ they possesses.
You can choose to either make it deadly or nonlethal. Nonlethal expunges can only defeat creatures, not kill them. Lethal expunges give creatures Disadvantage on luck checks to not Die.
When done out of combat, this ability has the Subtle tag.
When you successfully Hide from a creature and attack them or cast a spell on them, you can make an additional simple attack against them as a swift action.When you are defeated, you can expunge as an immediate action.

item.title: stand-united-su
item.description: In response to an ally being harmed you can immediately grant them 30 temporary hp, increasing to 50 if they are below half hp.You must continue to actively concentrate on this ability to maintain this temp hp. If you maintain concentration for 1 full round, you can teleport adjacent to this ally as an instant action.This ability can be used over any distance, however, you must still have some means of knowing when an ally is within danger, such as sending or being part of a hive mind.

item.title: covetous-aura
item.description: Whenever a creature uses a supernatural ability (Su) or spell on one of its allies within the aura, you can decide to become the target of the effect as an immediate action. For AoE effects (like channel energy), you can only steal the effect from one target.Unless you identify it with monster lore or arcana, you're gambling. Any effect that requires a saving throw that you steal (like a Blight) you automatically fail.

item.title: thrall
item.description: Worm your way deep into a creature's psyche and take control of their body. Functions as Domination, but must be cast on a willing or helpless creature. The domination lasts indefinitely. The creature does not receive new saves and must be freed through other means, magical or otherwise. If a friend, ally, respected superior, family member etc spends a standard action to sway the creature, it gets a will save against the effect with disadvantage. If at least three creatures spend their turn doing this at once, the save is not at disadvantage. Certain types of people, such as people related to the controlled creature's destiny or true love can give a creature advantage on their save.

item.title: backfire
item.description: This spell functions exactly like dispel magic, except when you successfully counterspell or dispel a [buff], the creature you target takes 4d8+CL (18+CL) fire damage.

item.title: mystery-box
item.description: You form a direct conduit with Frogg himself, allowing his magic to flow through you. Roll to select a random spell list, then cast a random spell of each spell level on that spell list (up to fifth level). Targets of these spells are chosen randomly from all legal targets. If a spell generates an area of effect then it chooses a creature randomly to center this effect on. If a spell does not have a suitable target then it fizzles, producing no effect.You are always considered a willing and available target for all effects that can affect your creature type. Frogs and frog-like creatures are fair game for this spell.A target is considered "legal" if its targeting is allowed. For example, if you roll the Frogg spell list and get lucky star, you count the number of creatures in range, then roll randomly to see who gets targeted. However, if you roll necromancy and get corpse explosion, but you don’t control any undead, there are no corpses within range and you aren't undead yourself, then that particular spell fizzles.

item.title: waves-of-ecstasy
item.description: Functions as Ecstasy, but in a 30 ft cone.A creature can only be targeted by a spell that makes them horny once every few minutes.

item.title: Fall Damage
item.description:
Fall damage increases by 3 Crush for every 10 feet you fall, capped at 60 damage. Every 50 feet you are also Drained 1, capped at 4. You take Poise damage equal to the crush damage you took. If this breaks your poise, you are Knocked Down.
When determining fall distance, subtract your Techniques/magical-techniques/wildcard/level-1/jump.

item.title: STR
item.description:
Strength (STR): Your fortitude, athleticism, and endurance. You add STR to your Fortitude Save.
You add STR to your Poise
You add +100 Carry Weight for each point of strength
Every point of strength increases your Techniques/magical-techniques/wildcard/level-1/jump distance by 5 ft. Negative STR subtracts from your Fortitude Saves. Negative STR halves your Carry Weight.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/STR.md

item.title: Concealment
item.description:
Concealment is a Circumstance that is gained when a creature's position is being obscured from another's Senses.
Usually, this means an effect like fog or darkness is partially or totally hiding a creature from another, resulting in Partial Concealment or Total Concealment, but this may take other forms against creatures that have other senses.
Concealment is a condition that's relative to the senses of other creatures. If you have Dark Vision and your opponent doesn't in a situation with Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Darkness, you have concealment against them, but they don't have concealment to you.
Attacking from concealment, even Total Concealment, does not Surprise by default. You still need to use Stealth as normal.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Cover/Concealment.md

item.title: Iron Knuckle
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Your armor is a second skin to you. Your armor is also your first skin. The iron knuckle has 2 "phases" to their battles. The first is a walking tank with multiple layers of armor, durable and stubborn until you get to the squishy single layer of plate armor underneath. The second is a nimble warrior that gets a boost of adrenaline, feeling light as a feather just after their outer shell is cracked open.Iron knuckles are practically invincible to being attacked head on while layered up, and must be ganged up. Mages will find a much easier time breaking the outer layer.
Iron Knuckle, as it appears in the LoZ seriesYou are fused with a set of standard metal plate armor. You can enhance this armor with new metals and enchantments with a more involved process. You are permanently treated as though you are wearing heavy armor. It is part of you and cannot be separated without causing permanent life-threatening damage to you.Because this armor is a part of you, it being destroyed hurts you. Whenever your armor is destroyed/degraded you take 10 damage.You add construct to your creature types. You gain proficiency in the profession (blacksmith) skill.You can choose to put on an additional layer of heavy armor over the first, providing you with the following benefits after 1 minute of preparation. +4 AC
You benefit from the quake technique constantly While~={red} layered up =~you also take a -10 penalty to your speed and cannot fly or hover. Enemies can remove layer up by dealing damage that drops you below half hp. It takes 3 rounds to remove layer up manually.It requires a set of heavy armor in order to use layer up. When an enemy removes layer up, you cannot use that particular set of heavy armor to layer up again until you repair it. Be sure to pick it up after the battle!After carrying the weight of incredibly heavy metal armor during the heat of battle, to have the burden removed suddenly fills the iron knuckle with new vigor. When an enemy removes layer up from you, you become ~={red}light as a feather=~, gaining the following benefits.
You gain (10+2xLv) temp hp (healing), potentially preventing you from dying from single instances of damage. Your speed and jump distance increases by 10 until combat ends.
You can choose to be immediately effected by the Unbreakable Advance technique. You gain access to the sudden strike special attack until combat ends.
~={green}Special Attack: Sudden Strike=~ - Advance 10 ft towards an enemy elusive and make a melee attack. On hit the target is pushed back 5 feet and knocked down. On a graze the target is only pushed back 5 ft. Deals an additional d6/odd lvl damage.
You gain the power pose feat. When you use it, it deals 15 poise damage instead of 10.If you are ~={red}layered up=~ then you can use it as an instant action 1/turn. You can use power pose against AoOs an unlimited number of times as an instant action.You can choose if you want to leave a creature at 1 poise, or poise break them with this ability. If a creature is poise broken by this ability then they are made clumsy 2, or you can sunder the equipment used to attack.While~={red} light as a feather=~, when a creature misses you with an AoO, or you successfully use acrobatics to evade AoOs, you can make a bully attack as an instant action.If you are ~={red}layered up=~, when you shove a creature, you can move with them to increase the shove distance by your remaining movement.
While~={red} light as a feather=~, you gain powerful charge.If you are ~={red}layered up=~ then you are immune to fatigue.
You gain the innate technique adrenaline burst while ~={red}light as a feather=~.
You are immune to attack rolls made by minions while ~={red}layered up=~. Any minion that attacks you is instead set to 1 poise automatically as it bounces off of your metal body.
While ~={red}light as a feather=~, you gain resistance to damage from failed saving throws.Strike at a foe, dealing an additional 6d6 (21) damage. If you are ~={red}layered up=~, gain temp hp and poise equal to the total damage dealt. If ~={red}light as a feather=~, also immediately layer up again until this temp hp is lost.This poise recovery cannot exceed your poise maximum.

item.title: Full Attacker
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Feeling nostalgic about 3e, 3.5e or PF1e? Well here's me doing my best to recreate that experience in a slightly less heavy handed way than BB fighter. The full attacker is the fightiest guy, all about gaining insane amounts of movement speed and then using that speed to gain more actions. Woe to those who dare to stand in your face.If you defeat an enemy and don't have enough speed to reach a new enemy, you can move until you threaten the next closest enemy, unless your speed is 0.Any turn you spend your standard action to make an attack, can make an additional~={orange} MELEE =~superior attack a turn by sacrificing 45 speed once per turn.~={red}You cannot use techniques or special attacks after full attacking. If you use a special attack or technique during your turn, you cannot full attack.=~During combat, your speed increases by 15 this level and another 5 every level after. You must always end your movement with an enemy in reach. If you ever end your turn without an enemy in reach for any reason, you become clumsy 1.Each one can be used in place of a superior attack and they all share a global cooldown, only able to be used 1/round. You cannot sacrifice superior attacks gained from baby slayer to use these abilities.
~={green}5 Steps Ahead (elusive) =~- Prepare for an incoming attack. While preparing you can trigger this ability as an immediate action, moving up to 30 feet to the opposite side of a creature that affects you with a harmful effect. You get a +4 bonus to AC and saves against this effect.
~={green}Random Bullshit Go =~- Throw an item that isn't a weapon. Improvised weapons can still be used. If you throw a harmful item, such as a toxin, it applies on hit (then forcing saving throws as normal). If you throw a helpful item, such as a potion, its effects function as normal, ignoring any broken vials that may get involved. If for whatever reason an effect requires multiple rounds to take effect, that is still the case for this ability.
~={green}Cunning-ish Action =~- You can disengage, Techniques/magical-techniques/wildcard/level-1/jump, aid, focus or make a +Combat Maneuver. ~={green}Brute Force =~- Roll an athletics check to move or break something.When you full attack, you can sacrifice an additional 45 speed to make an additional attack with the same restrictions.

item.title: Beast Trainer
item.description:
You form a close bond with a beast companion and mold your fighting style around fighting in tandem with it. You gain special abilities that allow you to establish a closer bond with them. Fighting individually you are fairly weak, but together you can unleash powerful combo attacks.Art by me!You have mixed specialization.
You gain 2 Technique points at level 1, then another point every 2 levels after.
These technique points can be used on the shroomlette and pupper trees.
Characters with magical specialization gain points in academy equal to their highest tier of magic technique and cantrips.
Characters with martial specialization gain points in Warfare equal to their highest tier of martial technique.
You gain the service of a specific animal to aid you on your journey. It grows more powerful as you do. More rules on beast companions in the Beast Companion section.
When you take the attack action, your beast companion can also use its attack action to attack the same creature. You both get +2 to ACC. This bonus also applies if you make an AoO against the same creature. This attack counts as one attack for the purposes of applying DR. Some forms of offensive actions that don't require an attack roll, such as maintaining a Grapple, can reasonably also grant this boon to the other member of the duo.When you use this feature and one strike is enough to defeat the creature, the other is consumed and you cannot use your companion's strike on another.All special attacks gained through this class deal an additional d6/odd LV dmg on hit if you and your beast companion both land an attack using tandem strike. You cannot combine these special attacks with other special attacks, even if your companion is the one performing the "special" part of the attack.
If one of your attacks is a Crit, then you crit this additional damage as well.Gain a teamwork feat. Your beast companion shares all of your teamwork feats.Select one of the following options that will shape your companion. ~={green}Mount=~ - Beast companion grows to size large. You can ride bareback (no saddle) without issue.
~={green}Guard=~ - Companion gains the bodyguard feat.
~={green}Watch=~ - Companion gains the Ready for Anything feat.
~={green}Lucky=~ - Companion gains +1 LUK
You learn the secret language, druidic (see Linguistics). In text form it can only be seen by other creatures that know druidic. You can essentially write secret messages by touching your finger to any natural object (typically boulders and trees) and writing. Any message written in this way can be erased by a creature that knows druidic with ease.As a standard action, you can touch your beast companion to transform it into a handheld action figure version of itself. As a standard action, you can toss it into an adjacent space to transform it back. If left in figurine form for too long, your companion will free itself when it gets hungry, thirsty or lonely.When traveling through natural terrain that restricts your movement, such as thick snow or dense jungle, you and your beast companion's speed are not affected. All allies that can see you or your beast companion also gain this benefit. After not seeing either of you for a few minutes, your allies lose this benefit.You can speak with your beast companion as though you shared a language. Other creatures cannot understand you unless they can speak with animals.
You can mana burn any amount to grant an equal number of adaptation points (from the adaptation points list) to your beast companion indefinitely. When you rest, this adaptation fades and you must reapply it.

item.title: Prey Seeker
item.description:
Classes/Beast Trainer/Beast Trainer Archetype.Prey seekers use beast companions to harass their opponents, keeping them at a distance so you can hit them from afar. Your companion can rush back to your aid when needed.
Your movement is Elusive against creatures your beast companion threaten.Your beast companion gains the following special attack. ~={green}Special Attack: To My Side=~ - The beast companion can move 30 ft closer to you and attack a creature threatening you. If its current speed is less than 30 ft, this special attack's additional movement decreases to that reduced speed.
You gain a technique point in the Marksmanship tree at this level and every two levels after.
Attach a tasty treat to your next ranged attack. On hit, apply a treat. Your beast companion gains seeking against the creature for 1 minute. Your beast companion heals (3+Lv) on hit on their first attack against this creature.
Your beast companion gets the Classes/slayer/sentinel feat.
You get a +2 bonus to ACC against creatures your beast companion threatens, as though you were flanking. Your beast companion gets the following special attack. ~={green}Special Attack: Bother=~ - Your companion taunts a creature on hit.

item.title: Main Character Status
item.description: Have you ever wanted to write an epic story for a character you made? How they survived a bloody conflict, went through incredibly rigorous training to become the best and brightest mage, was chosen by god or some other equally astonishing development. Then the game says "you die in one hit to a goblin."While not entirely unrealistic, it doesn't make for very satisfying gameplay to have your character feel like they are made out of paper and are one stray crit away from instant death. A game like DnD 5e remedies this by making KO'd a state your character falls in and out of multiple times as a result of "le nat 20," spammable low action healing and a lack of negative hit points.If you want the player characters to be invincible compared to monsters of a similar level, I say skip the pretense. Player characters are of a different breed and are hardened by their previous adventures, granting the following benefits…HP - Your hp is increased by 10. Defeat - You do not have a chance to instantly die when you fall unconscious, instead you receive a stacking debuff called doom. You also accumulate afflictions.With this change, a measure of how worn down you are can be more easily tied to how much hp you have. There are obviously other factors, but you can't ever keep adventuring without hp. Mana is the general resource system tied to using special abilities, and it naturally recharges when not used.In general healing that keeps you at full HP all the time is intended to be more scarce, and usually come at the cost of reducing your max mana until you rest.In general, only PCs will have this buff. But BBEGs, legendary creatures and other major bosses intended for use at the end of major story beats could also receive a similar version of this buff. Then you can get the juicy "phase transition" threshold to give your big boss encounters more punch.
item.guid: Classes/+Class Details/Quick Character Creation Guide/Main Character Status.md

item.description: Read main character status! It is essential for character creation. {% endhint %}There are several things for you to decide when deciding what you're writing down on your character sheet. Start with a theme, aesthetic, fighting style, or a particular character you want to mimic from popular media.There's nothing wrong with working backwards, but in general, I listed things from most important to least important when it comes to making your character sheet and starting to play. You should probably start with… Then after that… Then finally…

item.description: The ultimate being and the culmination of the Ayylmao research. This creature has the combined power (and flesh) of 100 cows! The greatest part? It's self replicating.

item.title: ayylmao
item.description: A small creature fused with a flying saucer floats overhead. It gazes upon the farmers cattle as it pulls out its probes. An electrified pulse of light reflects of of the terrified cow's eyes.

item.title: beholder
item.description: A large floating eye argues with itself as its many eye stalks twitch around and hum with magical energy. If finally decides which eye will be the one to seal your doom and it hums with black energy.

item.title: besmolder
item.description: A tiny eye shouts with glee as it chases you around. You try and hide, only for it to pop around the corner. "Found you!" It shouts as it shoots an eye beam at you, transforming you into a toy.

item.title: grandma
item.description: Level 10 Medium AberrationAC 22 HP 80 Poise 27 Fort +12, Refl +10, Will +12No Breath - A grandma does not need to breathe and can survive in the vacuum of space.Resistance - ColdBite (P) +12 (+4 vs cookie) 2d6+2 (9)2h Ritual Rolling Pin (C) +12 (+4 vs cookie) 2d6+2 (9) Innate Techniques - Wandering Stars, Unseen Form, Cosmic Cage, Hellscape, Silence 1/day - Drain SoulCookification [curse] - With a touch, turn a creature into a sweet treat version of themselves (fort negates). Creatures with bite attacks gain a +4 bonus to attack against cookie creatures. A grandma can make a bite attack as an instant action against a creature that gets cookiefied.Bite^2 - If a xenomorph starts its turn grappling a creature, it can use its second mouth to blast a hole in the creature as its maintain option. The creature takes 8d6 (28) pierce damage and is drained 1 (fort halves dmg and negates drain).Hibernation - A xenomorph can willingly enter stasis permanently. It only leaves hibernation if it smells a creature.Stabilizing Compound - A xenomorphs blood reacts explosively when exposed to open air, but an informed alchemist can negate that. With a DC 21 alchemy check, an alchemist can create a compound that can disable a xenomorphs caustic blood feature for 1 minute as a FRA. You can apply it as a thrown attack, but it only functions for 1 round if you graze, and is consumed with no effect if you miss. If you poise break the xenomorph, you can apply it instead of the usual effects.Ability Scores - Str +2, Dex +0, Lucc +0, Int +3, Wis +0, Cha +3TelepathyOne Mind - A grandma forms a family with up to 3 other grandmas. They can telepathically communicate with their family over any distance.Shape Change: Grandma [poly, true] - One humanoid grandmaFeats - Maneuver Initiate, Body Block, Maneuver Master, Combat ReflexesSkills - +10 (+8) perception, +13 acrobatics, +13 stealth, +13 athletics

item.title: illumatrix
item.description:
Level 4 Medium AberrationAC 16 HP 60 Poise 27 (DRA 3) Fort +7, Refl +8, Will +4KYS (Su) [healing] [overheal] - Kopy yourself. While a creature you are copying is defeated and within reach, you can absorb data to repair damage as a swift action, healing 20 hp.Unarmed (C) +7 (+2 real deal) d8+3 (7)Innate Techniques - Kidnap, Fake Out, Nice Catch 1/day - Toe Smasher, Feign DefeatReal Deal - While copying a creature, gain +2 attack against it.Copy: I'll have what she's having (Su) - As a swift action, a shadow can use it's copy ability to create a fully functional handheld object it can see within 30 ft. If the object is magical, it loses its magical properties. If the copied object gets more than 100 ft from the original, it disappears. Using copy in this way does not stun the shadow.Don't Tread on Me - Shadows are just that, shadows. Anything it copies is merely a projection. As such, it does not like it when objects interact with the shadow of its projection. It avoids people stepping on it, creatures walking over it etc. If the shadow's shadow is targeted directly, or included in an AoE effect, its DRA is ignored. If you target a shadow with a piercing melee weapon, you can embed it in the surface and entangle the shadow on hit or with a successful poise break, replacing all other effects and losing access to the weapon. Projectiles like arrows require 3 hits. Shadows cannot remove the entangling items on their own.Ability Scores - Str +3, Dex +2, Lucc +0, Int +0, Wis +0, Cha +0Copy (Su) [poly, true] - As a FRA, a shadow can emit a very bright flash of light while gazing upon a specific creature within 30 ft. When it does so It adds this creature to its memory. It can choose to immediately transform into this creature as part of this action. The replication process is almost perfect, giving the shadow access to the creatures memories, skill proficiencies, personality traits, current clothing, appearance, size etc. The shadow gains all of the racial features of the creature it copies (assuming a player character) or all of the natural attacks (including multi attack options)/movement abilities if it is not. A shadow can "memorize" copies of 4 different creatures/objects (see offense traits). It can transform into one as a standard action, or revert to its true form as a free action.When copying a creature, treat its disguise roll as 26.Speed - Speed(s) of copied creature. It can choose to enter a hybrid form, foiling its disguise, in order to move at a speed of 40, or climb 40.Feats - Unarmed Combatant, Bonded Mind, Feint PartnerSkills - +6 perception, +6 deception, +8 stealth
Shide, from the anime "Summertime Rendering"

item.title: mind-flayer
item.description: Masters of the psionic arts, these tentacled-lipped mages are vaguely humanoid with wet undulating orifices. They scour the universe for hosts to fuel their endless hunger for knowledge...Literally.

item.title: README
item.description: Terrors born from the unknowable and the otherworldly. They cannot be reasoned with or rationalized and are utterly insurmountable nightmare that humanity has no hope of escaping.From the darkest depths of space, the ocean and other mysterious realms, aberrations are often alien creatures uninterested in the conventions of traditional life. Others are strange mixes of the organic and inorganic in unfamiliar animalistic shapes.

item.title: shadow
item.description: A shadowy featureless imposters looks around at you from the shade curiously. You avert your eyes from a blinding flash. When you look back, you see yourself staring back at you.

item.title: shadowling-scout
item.description: A black insectoid creature skitters along a wall, a ball of glowing red energy you assume to be its eye faces you. The last thing you remember is it vanishing into a vapor and entering your lungs.

item.title: shadowling-warrior
item.description: A pool of black liquid seeps through the cracks in your door. You can feel its hunger. A black insect the size of a horse appears from the. It screeches and leans on its back legs, ready to feed.

item.title: space-crab
item.description: This alien scavenger with no eyes skitters along the ground, raising its forelegs in response to threats. Only when it is pouncing midair does its target realize the enormous mouth on its underside.

item.title: xenomorph
item.description: The horrifying screech of the creature forces you to cover your ears. When you recover and look up, the creature looms over at you, mouth agape. You never see the second mouth coming.

item.title: angry-chicken
item.description: This unassuming beast meanders about with its kin. Only when you bother it does it reveal its menacing aura and incredible power.

item.title: bee-rex
item.description: The ground thumps and you wonder if this region has earthquakes. You hear the sound of a tree snapping and look up to see an enormous mix of dinosaur and insect crush a small tree underfoot.

item.title: big-cat
item.description: A rustling in the bushes and a low growl are the last thing you hear before a giant cat pounces from the underbrush, directly onto your neck.

item.title: dragonslayer-hound
item.description: Clad in a bone-like exoskeleton armor, this dog sniffs you up and down before moving onto the next capture. It howls and the man next to your transforms into a dragon. The hound pounces on its quarry.

item.title: giant-eagle
item.description: A majestic bird flies overhead. As you appreciate its beauty it flies down with incredible speed and gouges out your friends eyes. The massive bird screeches as it continues its onslaught.

item.title: harambe
item.description: This slow paced ape walks along its knuckles before realizing your presence. It rears up on its hind legs to show off its massive size while it makes noise and swings its arms.

item.title: hippo
item.description: A pair of eyes and nostrils looks at you from inside the lake. It disappears under the water. A moment later an angry herbivore bursts from the lake and charges you down.

item.title: horse
item.description: A strange 4-legged creature with a long face trots around, its powerful legs flexing as it picks up the pace.

item.title: huffer
item.description: This aggressive boar huffs and puffs as it scrapes its hooves against the ground as you enter its territory. Its impressive speed and sharp tusks are quick to show you the error of your ways.

item.title: insect-swarm
item.description: A bug lands on your arm and you swat it. Another 2, then 5, then 10. You turn and see a tsunami of insects washing over your campsite.

item.title: love-bug
item.description: A large bug hovers in the air, a pleasant aroma washing over you as it lands on you.

item.title: macaw
item.description: This colorful bird draws your eye with its impressive plumage. Once it starts to copy the spells of your allies as it shouts the words of power gleefully, you realize its true power.

item.title: piranha-swarm
item.description: This colorful freshwater fish is an efficient carnivore that forms schools to consume prey many times larger than it. You find out just how tenacious they can be as they munch on your limbs.

item.title: shirshu
item.description: This mix between bear and mole towers over you. It grunts and rapidly inhales through its nose as it inspects the item you presented, before it darts off to hunt for the items owner.

item.title: stinger
item.description: A massive insect with an even more massive insect flies charges at you, the drone of its massive wings disorienting and frustrating you as the rest of the colony pump you with venom.

item.title: string-shot-spider
item.description: You slap the webs off of your face, only to have an agitated spider staring you in the face. As you scream, it fires a sizzling string shot from its spinneret.

item.title: wolf
item.description: An agitated canine bares its fangs at you. Before you know it, another one is to your left and to your right. The group slowly advances towards you to close off your escape.

item.title: cherub
item.description: Your date with this handsome lad is going terribly, but he suddenly perks up and things go great. You see a shimmer as a little baby with feathered wings gives you a wink, before disappearing.

item.title: copy-of-cherub
item.description: Your date with this handsome lad is going terribly, but he suddenly perks up and things go great. You see a shimmer as a little baby with feathered wings gives you a wink, before disappearing.

item.title: copy-of-cherub-1
item.description:
Level 0 Small CelestialAC 14 HP 20 Poise 20 Fort +0, Refl +3, Will +3Resistance - HolyWanderer (Su) - The cherub has a magical aura that prevents it from being seen by lesser creatures. You must have a perception bonus of at least +4 to see a cherub. This ability deactivates for 1 minute when a cherub deals damage.Shortbow (P) +3 (40/80) +charming shot d6+3 (6)Innate Techniques - SplatterCharming Arrow [charm] - On hit inflict charmed for 1 minute. The cherub can choose to not deal damage with the arrow to gain +4 attack.If the creature is DD (including if the cherub isn't visible thanks to wanderer) the cherub can choose another creature within 30 ft of its target that it isn't currently in combat with to be the subject of the charm. When the cherub charms in this way, it lasts 24 hours.Sucker for Love - Cherubs can easily be persuaded to assist creatures in facilitating romantic relationships, usually requiring no check.Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +3, Lucc +3, Int +0, Wis +1, Cha +0Speed - 20, 30 fly
Feats - Butterfly StingSkills - +5 perception, +5 stealth, +3 deception

item.title: automaton
item.description: A humanoid robot stands a few heads taller than a man with oversized arms. You see it stop the thief that rushes out of the town square by launching one of its arms as a projectile and pinning them.

item.title: boom-bot
item.description: Just a step above a hazard, this mobile mine rushes towards you with the singular purpose of ruining your day.

item.title: boom-reaver
item.description: This titan of a construct descends upon you with jet thrusters, delivering a message from its employer before bringing down the axe.

item.title: hecklebot
item.description: This robot never shuts up, constantly throwing insults at anything that it thinks can be offended.

item.title: monkey-gree-gree
item.description:
Level 3 Large Construct [boss]AC 19 HP 40 Poise 25 Fort +5, Refl +4, Will +2Resistance - Poison, Psychic, Force, Mind affecting +4Unarmed (P) +5 (+4 grapple) (20/40) d10+3 (8) +d6 zap (overcharge)Multiattack - Make 2 unarmed attacks.Innate Techniques - Mad MonkeysSpecial Attack: Rocket Punch - Make a thrown weapon attack using unarmed damage. If successful, make a drag attack with no MA penalty. If the drag is successful, the creature is pulled adjacent.Aura: Stance Change - The Monkey Gree Gree swaps between three different faces: Monkey covering eyes, monkey covering ears and monkey covering mouth. It starts covering its ears, and swaps at the start of each turn after the first in a repeating loop (cover ears, cover eyes, then mouth). Each stance has an aura that radiates 60 ft with a different effect.Cover Ears - All creatures within the aura are deafened, giving them -4 perception. Cover Eyes - All creatures within the area are blinded.\ Cover Mouth - All creatures within the aura are silenced.The Gree Gree radiates this aura while hiding in plain sight. The Gree Gree is affected by its own aura.\Yes Master - When an automaton is programmed, it is done so while listening to a voice. By mimicking this voice with a DC 20 disguise check, you can give the automaton new orders. Can only be attempted once. With a DC 13 engineering check, an inactive automaton can be reprogrammed.Hand Needed - When an automaton uses its pin down technique, it loses access to the hand and its multi-attack on subsequent turns until the creature removes it and it magnetizes back.Ability Scores - Str +3, Dex +0, Lucc +0, Int +2, Wis +0, Cha +0Speed - 25 landHide in Plain SightLanguage Processing - By listening to someone speak a language, an automaton can slowly learn how to speak a language over the course of 1 minute.
Feats - Point Blank MasterSkills - +4 perception, +7 athletics, +8 engineering

item.title: turbo-frogg
item.description: Level 5 Large Construct/BeastAC 18 HP 60 Poise 32 Fort +7, Refl +9, Will +5Graceful - Bite (C) +8 2d6+3 (10)Tongue (C) +8 (+4 drag/grapple) Has 30 ft of reach during frog's turn. d10+3 (8)Multiattack - Make a tongue and bite attackInnate Technique - Laser Pointer 1/day - Hot Potato, Plague of Froggs (U2)Special Attack: Electro Whip - Electrify a tongue attack. It deals an additional 2d8 (9) zap damage and Crash Landing - If a turbo frog uses its turbo thrusters ability to jump into a spot where it threatens a creature, it lands with a powerful shockwave. Creatures take 20 poise damage. If this breaks poise, the creature falls prone.Species - Short Circuit - Short Ability Scores - Str +3, Dex +2, Lucc +1, Int -2, Wis -1, Cha +0Turbo Thrusters [recharge] [elusive] - As a swift action, the turbo frog can boost itself, increasing its speed to 120 ft as long as it moves in a straight line. This cannot be used in consecutive rounds. Makes the frog clumsy 1.Enhanced Leap - Frogs can leap as far and as high as they can move. They can jump as a free action, and take no fall damage when falling after jumping.Feats - Skills - +7(+4) perception, +9 athleticsRocket Hopper, Hearthstone

item.title: froggalier
item.description: This frog snail hybrid slithers towards you. It screams "CHARGE" but you laugh at its speed. The power of the snail comes as a surprise to you as it slams into you.

item.title: frozen-mammoth
item.description: A mammoth covered in frost trudges through the tundra. Each step a heavy thud even through the muffled snow. An entire group of them walks by and pays you no mind, so long as you keep your distance.

item.title: minotaur
item.description: Humanoid in shape with cloven hooves and the head of a bull, this creature assesses you before mindlessly charging at your red mage.

item.title: README
item.description: Cryptid is the category that any creature that doesn't fit in elsewhere goes. They often are a mix of or resemble another creature type, but don't fit in with them neatly.

item.title: scavenger
item.description: This humanoid creature has pale skin, long claws, sharp teeth and the whites of its eyes are a strange color. If feasts upon the rancid carrion left behind by a predator ages ago.

item.title: wobbler
item.description: A strange blue creature stares at you. You try and tap it, causing it to wobble, before rebounding and smacking you backwards.

item.title: bone-beetle
item.description:
Level 2 Small Undead/BeastAC 23 HP 50 Poise 24 Fort +3, Refl +9, Will +3Immune - Poison, DiseaseResistance - NecroticReformation - Instead of being defeated, a bog creeper immediately dissipates into several bone beetles. These beetles act on the bog creepers turn. If any remain at the end of the bog creepers next turn (including any it summoned previously), the bog creeper reforms at the point closest to all that remain with (beetles*10) hp.Carrion Consumption [healing] [recharge] - Bog creepers often keep decaying and diseased creatures inside of its lair for later consumption. As a swift action, a bog creeper can consume such a creature to gain 20 temp hp and recharge its breath weapon.Bite (P) +10 d8+4 (8)Multiattack - Make 2 thorn attacks.Innate Techniques - Blight, Bone CageBoss Actions - Back and Better than Ever - After using reformation, use breath weapon. Freedom! - After taking damage, summon a bone beetle. Paralytic - Breath Weapon [recharge] - Bad Breath - For 1 round after using its breath weapon, or carrion consumption, a bog creeper emits a horrific stench. Creatures it bites during this time become sickened 2. Any creature within 20 ft of the bog creeper during this time is made sickened 1 (fort negates). Creatures with the scent ability have disadvantage on this save.Weakness - Slash 2, Fire 2Ability Scores - Str -1, Dex +4, Lucc +0, Int -, Wis +0, Cha +0Sightless Blindsense - Tremorsense (60 ft)Speed - 5Feats - Snap Shot, Point Blank Master, Combat ReflexesSkills - +5 perception, +9 stealth
No Man's Sky creature

item.title: README
item.description: A pestilent creature with creatures jittering around just underneath its scales, this dragon has bad intentions and worse breath. These creatures prefer the semi aquatic slurry of swamps to the air.

item.title: broodmother
item.description: An enormous female dragon covered in spines and (often) babies. Brood mothers are one of the most popular dragons since they provide a steady supply of eggs for poachers to sell as pets.

item.title: dragonfly
item.description: A shining insect floats through the air around its draconic ally, enchanting its scales with protective wards. It flicks its tongue at you as you fail to harm it and its allies.

item.title: shrubbagazzor
item.description: The shrubbagazzor is a creature born of magical manipulation of topiary. These creatures can also be born in response to the mistreatment of the natural world to fight against corruption.

item.title: whelp
item.description: The whelp represents an underdeveloped member of a draconic species, before it gets many of the cool features typical of adult dragons. Many are frozen at this stage in development, unable to grow.

item.title: wildfire-dragon
item.description: This long serpentine dragon looks like it's made of wood, with a raging fire boiling underneath the gaps in its scales. It's face decorated with a flaming beard, mustache and eyebrows with bony horns.

item.title: blob
item.description: Looks like living lava...

item.title: fire-bat
item.description: Some kind of bat...

item.title: flame-tender
item.description: Holy reptile...

item.title: primordial
item.description: Good doggy-lizard-thing...

item.title: README
item.description: This is going to hurt...

item.title: servants-of-jad
item.description: Mini menace.

item.title: stalagmight
item.description: I don't like the look of those spines...

item.title: cheezette
item.description: A duo of cheesy ladies rest on a slice of floating pizza. They work in tandem, encouraging and enhancing each other.

item.title: deadbeat-djinn
item.description: You pick up a bottle, disappointed that its empty only for a creature to pop out. This stinky humanoid has no legs, only a twisting tempest that hovers above the ground connected to the bottle.

item.title: snowman
item.description: A top hat rest on the snow. You go to investigate only for a snowman to emerge from the snow underneath and lob a snowball at you.

item.title: README
item.description: The once innocent looking old lady transforms before your eyes into a wicked monster with plant-like growths and magic fetishes covering its body. Her cackle makes your skin crawl.

item.title: censorship-fairy
item.description: You get a glimpse of a beautiful woman swimming naked in a lake. When you get a closer look, you can't seem to get a good look as rays of light, leaves and steam always seem to cover her naughty bits.

item.title: gnome
item.description: A pointed hat and thick white hair leading into a beard and mustache grace the head of this short creature. One of its allies tosses it across the battlefield and reveals the hat isn't for show.

item.title: high-roller
item.description: This tiny fairy carries a pack filled with dice. It regularly rolls these dice during the battle, growing more powerful the higher it rolls.

item.title: satyr
item.description: A mischievous pan flute playing creature with a humanoid torso and furry hooved legs prances about. Their magic music twists the nature of any magic affecting them with random results.

item.title: spelling-bee
item.description: This creature resembles a humanoid, but with many bee features flies through the air with a swarm of bees. It is very well spoken and gets irritated when you use incorrect grammar or vocabulary.

item.title: README
item.description: Level 10 Medium Fiend [unique] [boss] [mastermind]AC 25 HP 80 Poise 24 Fort +10, Refl +10, Will +15Resistance - +4 vs mind-affectingTouch +10 Charms indefinitely. If in combat, reduces to 1 round.Innate Techniques - Corpse Transposition, Darting Duplicate, Overstimulate, Tongue Twister 1/day - Nightmare, Domination, Order 66Power Word N (Su) [mind affecting] [language] [recharge] [subtle] - Slur'Nesh can utter a heinous word, and have it echo from the mouth of a creature within 60 feet. This word carries such vulgarity that it causes another creature within 30 ft of the original target to fly into a blind and senseless rage at the original target. They are taunted by the creature for 3 rounds, and use their deadliest most powerful abilities to kill them as quickly as possible.If the creature is a minion to Slur'Nesh, or if the secondary target has been subjugated by the race/people of the primary target, this has no save. If they are not they have disadvantage but (will negates). If the creatures have been allies for an extended amount of time, are family etc, then they do not make the save at disadvantage.Essentially, target 1 creature to taunt another with the power of racism. The two creatures relationship and races affect how difficult it is to resist.Summon Ally [companion] - 1 Living ForgeCycle of Hate - Superior Polymorph - Any successful checks to transform Slur'Nesh back into its true form instead deals 20 true damage to it.True Form - Slur'Nesh avoids its true form at all costs. If it drops to 0 hp, all remaining damage is ignored and it transforms into its true form. It cannot use its polymorph ability again until it rests. It cannot use any abilities listed in this form while in its true forms, and gets a new set of abilities and stats.Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +0, Lucc +2, Int +3, Wis +3, Cha +3Hierarchy - When Slur'Nesh is in a settlement of intelligent creatures, it can intuitively tell certain aspects of the social hierarchy. It knows which types of people are subjugated, as well as who does the subjugation, and can generally tell how extreme said subjugation is.If the settlement is generally egalitarian, then it can intuit 3 specific creatures who break this mold.Shape Change [poly, true] - Any humanoid, including any racial features. Can be used as a free action 1/turn.Rumormonger - Slur'Nesh can attempt to spread a rumor throughout a small town or larger settlement by attempting a deception check. The difficulty depends on the size, ranging from 10 for a small town to 30 for a metropolis, though this difficulty may be modified if the population as a whole tends towards skepticism or insanity.It takes a week for a rumor to spread. If it succeeds by 5 or more, the time is reduced to 3 days. If it fails by 5 or more, the rumor mutates into a competing theory.Can only have 1 rumor brewing at once.Feats - SF Deception, SS Deception, SF Insight, SS InsightSkills - +15 perception, +19 (adv) insight, +19 (adv) deception, +19 disguise, +15 local, +15 planes, +15 history, +15 linguisticsEnvy from Fullmetal Alchemist by Jinwu

The difficulty depends on the size, ranging from 10 for a small town to 30 for a metropolis, though this difficulty may be modified if the population as a whole tends towards skepticism or insanity.It takes a week for a rumor to spread. If it succeeds by 5 or more, the time is reduced to 3 days. If it fails by 5 or more, the rumor mutates into a competing theory.Can only have 1 rumor brewing at once.Feats - SF Deception, SS Deception, SF Insight, SS InsightSkills - +15 perception, +19 (adv) insight, +19 (adv) deception, +19 disguiseFrom "The Invitation" chapter 2 by Incase

item.title: blessings
item.description: This androgynous fiend wraps itself around an ally before worming its tongue into its mouth and locking lips. You see two more emerge from a pool of blood and crawl towards you, licking their lips.

item.title: dust-devil
item.description: A tempest of dust makes its way towards you, the shadowy demonic figure within commanding and riding the winds.

item.title: hell-knight
item.description: You hear a loud crashing sound coming from the church only to find two hulking fiends wrestling. When they slam into one another, they release a powerful shockwave that hurts your ears.

item.title: hellhound
item.description: A red and black dog the size of a man crunches some bones in its mouth. When it realizes you are in the room, it moves to bigger and tastier things to munch on.

item.title: imp
item.description: This ornery fiend is quick to change its mood, always looking for guidance from one of its superiors. Once they give the signal, they ready their claws and light themselves ablaze.

item.title: meathook
item.description: This fiery fiend has chains that clatter as it swings itself across the battlefield. It laughs and squeals with joy as it slaps you and your allies around and digs its spiked jaw into your face.

item.title: pamper
item.description: A pleasant creature as far as fiends go, these quadrupeds cling to their master and fulfill their every desire. Master desires your death so they rush with great speeds to tear you to pieces.

item.title: sudoku
item.description: A crazy demon laughs as it rides into battle on a unicycle, exploding out of a building every so often, blazing a trail wherever it goes.

item.title: the-flexicutioner
item.description: An enormous fiendish woman sits on her throne of bones, holding a man in her bloody claws. She crushes him into a pulp and her demonic minions cheer, then sighs and gestures for you to approach next.

item.title: the-master

If it drops to 0 hp, all remaining damage is ignored and it transforms into its true form.Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +0, Lucc +2, Int +3, Wis +3, Cha +3Hierarchy - When Slur'Nesh is in a settlement of humanoids, it can intuitively tell certain aspects of the social hierarchy. If it succeeds by 5 or more, the time is reduced to 3 days. If it fails by 5 or more, the rumor mutates into a competing theory.Can only have 1 rumor brewing at once.Feats - SF Deception, SS Deception, SF Insight, SS InsightSkills - +15 perception, +19 (adv) insight, +19 (adv) deception, +19 disguiseFrom "The Invitation" chapter 2 by Incase

item.title: tramp
item.description: You open a book and read some magic words only for a short fiend to pop out. It makes some suggestive comments and would love to spend more time with you.

item.title: twinkubus
item.description: An androgynous creature with tiny horns lies in bed with some brutish looking men. It gives the order to take care of you and they do so with great pleasure, an unnatural fervor to their compliance.

item.title: molten-giant
item.description: A large humanoid with flaming hair clad in metal arms and armor raises its weapon. this giant appears to be made of molten rock underneath. It's equipment glows red hot from the heat of battle.

item.title: ogre
item.description: This large green humanoid has curious ears that poke out of the top of its head almost like antennae. You have the displeasure of smelling its breath as it speaks to you, singing your eyebrows.

item.title: falcaptain
item.description: A bird with gold and blue feathers dashes around the battlefield back and forth, evading attacks with ease. After a flurry of blows, he stops to give a salute while saying "Show me your moves!"

item.title: loot-goblin
item.description: A silly little green creature runs around the battlefield picking pockets and slapping shiny swords out of creatures hands, quickly depositing it safely before mad dashing to safety.

item.title: murderous-chieftain
item.description: This orc has numerous battle scars and a dangerous aura that can be felt with their gaze. They don't command to fight on sight, but you can tell one wrong move can change that.

item.title: ninja-monke-initiate
item.description: A small beastfolk spins an oversized shuriken between its fingers. Once a fight breaks out, it pulls more and more from seemingly nowhere in a flurry of blades.

item.title: ninja-monke-master
item.description: The way this creature wields its weapons showcases a level of discipline and practice unlike their subordinates, that is, assuming you ever see them at all.

item.title: orc-raider
item.description: A hardened warrior with a trained battle stance makes up for its lack of armor with ferocity and reckless abandon. Swing first and ask questions later.

item.title: orc-raiding-party
item.description: A group of orcs all riled up charge into battle. Individually not a big threat, but coordinated enough to easily mow through individuals with less friends.

item.title: orc-shaman
item.description: A cheeky grin underneath sinister looking face paint or a mask give you the impression that this orc has plans. Plans that you probably won't like if they come to fruition.

item.title: the-wall
item.description: A dwarf clad entirely in a peculiar set of stony armor wields to massive shields you wonder how he can even carry. The more you swing, the more you panic as it seems impossible to harm him.

item.title: the-wall
item.description:
Level 3 Medium DwarfAC 21 (+4 vs creatures attacked) HP 60 Poise 49 (DRA 1, DR 1, DR 10 vs knockdown) Fort +8, Refl +6, Will +4Resistance - Poison, +2 vs charmCan't Go Through It - The wall gets advantage on reflex saves against acrobatics to avoid AoOs. Creatures cannot move through the wall's space through any means.Can't Knock it Down - The wall has DR 10 vs knockdown. Any other effect that would otherwise inflict knockdown, the wall has advantage against.Chip Damage - The wall is immune to being grazed.Dual Wield Tower Shield (C) +6 (+2 topple, +2 shove) d8+3 (7)Innate Techniques - Boasting Taunt, Shield Bash, Elemental Barrier, Colossal Smash,
1/day Bouncing BulwarkFreight Train - Whenever the wall makes a shove attack while charging, he can carry the creature along with him for the full distance of the charge, depositing them adjacent at the end of his charge.Jam - The wall has his own theme song that he cant help but dance to when he hears it. By rolling a DC 20 perform check as a standard action, a creature can daze the wall on his next turn.Ability Scores - Str +3, Dex +2, Lucc +0, Int +0, Wis +1, Cha +0Night VisionGear - 2x tower shields, heavy armor, stone cutting tools
Feats - Shield Focus, The WallSkills - +6 perception, +8 athletics, +6 insight, +8 Profession (stone smith)
Bull Goat Armor, Elden Ring "The Wall"

item.title: jizzle
item.description: A tiny little white puddle slides along the wall after squeezing through the crack under the door. It reaches hungrily towards the nearest creature.

item.title: living-ice
item.description: A pile of icicles on the ground springs to life, stretching all over the place to pierce you with its sharpened frosty body.

item.title: primordial-ooze
item.description: A shimmering pile of nebulous liquid contains the ingredients of countless creatures within it. It does its best to protect its creations.

item.title: mockstump
item.description: This jovial stump hops around with its mouth wide open, laughing all the way. It especially loves to crush the spirits of those around them that fail with a timely "hoo hoo."

item.title: thorn-spitter
item.description: A flower springs to life and starts rapidly spitting thorns at you and your allies coated in a dangerous looking liquid.

item.title: body-bagger
item.description: An undead beastfolk with a good nose sniffs around the graveyard. It starts to dig, throwing whatever it finds inside of its sack before it picks up your scent and smiles.

item.title: calcium-elemental
item.description: A skeleton animates before you, but not in the shape you expect. You then realize all of the remains in the room are being sucked into a tornado of bone that cackles as it takes shape.

item.title: el-stitchisimo
item.description: This unusual undead looks like many creatures stitched together were given formal training in cooking. It works with surprising dexterity with all three of its arms at once.

item.title: gloomstalker
item.description: This silent creature uses its additional limbs to load its longbow and fire shots with great precision and frequency. It climbs and clings to walls to gain the high ground at every opportunity.

item.title: life-drinker
item.description: This undead humanoid has a visible aura of necrotic energy. Hands burst from the ground around the creature and grapple foes at its command, slowly draining the life from them.

item.title: nameless-hoard
item.description: If one zombie was a problem before, dozens of them all rushing you down spells certain doom.

item.title: procrastinating-spirit
item.description: The ghost of a creature hangs its head as it whispers to itself, its words self-defeating. Grabbing its attention only seems to set it off.

item.title: river-spirit
item.description: A soft spoken young woman swims around a lake, offering you a spot amongst those having fun inside. The glamer removed once you hop in, you see a pile of corpses reaching to grab you.

item.title: skeleton
item.description: A pile of bones animates and rattles at you menacingly, wielding whatever was on hand to dispatch you.

item.title: zombie
item.description: A walking corpse shambles towards you. Its soulless gaze meets yours and you can feel its hunger.

item.title: navigating-the-bestiary
item.description: The bestiary is arranged first by the creatures type. Some creatures have multiple types and I decided to put them in the camp they felt more at home in.Some creature types inherently have qualities, other just have a general vibe. Feel free to mix and match or add more!Some monsters will have tags listed at the top of their entry. There are general tags, and some specific to creature types. One such tag is [unique]. These creatures are one of a kind. They usually have more complicated game plans to their tactics and have a very distinct identity that is separate from other creatures of the same type. Often they are intended to be a singular specific creature.

item.title: lava
item.description: Molten rock and metal. Lava is most commonly found around volcanoes, but can also be found erupting from the ocean floor and flowing through deep underground caverns.Lava typically comes in 2 variations; semisolid and liquid. Both are considered [persistent] effects.Semisolid Lava - Semisolid lava feels a bit like chunky mud if it melted your toes. Semisolid lava is difficult terrain, and every turn you move through it, you take 4d6 (14) fire damage.Liquid Lava - Liquid lava is much more dangerous since it can pool into large enough quantities for you to get completely submerged in. Each round you are submerged in lava, you take 10d6 (35) fire damage and are drained 1.If you survive that and manage to escape, lava still clings to you, burning you while it cools. This damage starts at 4d6 (14), then decreases by d6 each round until it ends. By taking cold damage, getting hit with a [water] effect or otherwise rapidly cooling or removing the clinging lava, you can avoid this damage over time. If you are only partially submerged, like if it is only waist deep, the initial damage is reduced to 6d6 (21) fire, and the cling damage starts at 3d6 (10) fire.

item.title: README
water
item.description: Water has a lot to talk about, so I'll break it up into 4 sections: Aquatic combat, underwater combat, water pressure and drowning.Aquatic Combat - This refers to combat that happens in and around water, but typically not completely submerged. As far as visibility is concerned, most of the time you can see to the bottom of lakes and rivers unless they are particularly murky. Oceans, seas and particularly wide lakes or rivers are the exception to this, where they can be deep enough that even in ideal conditions you can't see all the way down.When a creature not in water attacks another creature that is at least waist deep in water, they have cover. Creatures not in water cannot attack creatures that are completely submerged if they are more than 5 feet deep.Underwater Combat - Fighting underwater can make many fighting styles completely useless. Projectile weapons like guns can't fire at all. Thrown weapons don't function at all either. Bows and such have their range reduced to 10/20 ft. Melee combatants take a -4 penalty to attack unless they use a piercing weapon.Many of these things have workarounds. Certain types of weapons can be specifically designed for underwater use. Aquatic creatures, amphibious creatures and creatures trained in athletics figure out methods to ignore the melee attacking penalty.Water Pressure - Roughly every 30 ft you descend into water, you double the amount of pressure your body experiences. Going past 150 ft is usually impossible without being an aquatic creature, special equipment or magic. If you do not have such aid, then going deeper than 60 ft is usually a bad idea. In combat you don't have the luxury of slowly ascending to avoid the bends.If you ascend more than 5 feet a round after diving to this depth, you must make fortitude save or become drained 1 and dazed. The DC is 20+every additional 5 feet you moved (10 feet DC 21, 20 ft DC 23 etc.). Even if you pass your save, you are still drained 1.Drowning - Most creatures can pretty handily hold their breath for 30 seconds while under duress (or 5 rounds). For every point of strength you can hold it for an additional round. Every round past this limit inflicts drain. The first round you drain 1, the second drain 2 etc, causing you to rapidly die if you are unable to somehow breathe.With specific equipment, magic or training, or being aquatic/amphibious, you can increase or eliminate this limit entirely. The most common way is gillweed.

item.title: defense-traits
item.description:
AmorphousIn order to crit the creature, you must exceed its AC by a value higher than 10.ExampleAmorphous - +15Damage Reduction (DR)Damage reduction (shortened DR) is a unique defensive property that comes in two different forms. Whenever a creature takes damage that their DR applies to, reduce the damage by the corresponding amount. Denoted as follows. The x represents a numerical value.DR x Only applies to physical damage (Crush, slash, Pierce) and poise damage. Some instances of DR only apply to poise damage from specific combat maneuversDRA x Applies to all damage types (minus true damage)All forms of damage reduction stack with each other. Damage reduction applies in the most advantageous way possible for the creature (after halving from saves or resistances for example). If an attack's damage is reduced to zero, any additional effects the attack would apply do not occur.Fast HealingThe creature gains specified amount of hp the start of their turn if they are not defeated. When the creature is defeated, this ability is disabled for 10 minutes (see medicine for other means to keep those pesky healers down).If a creature with FH is bleeding, roll a luck check (DC 10) to see if the bleeding stops at the end of their turns.FerocityWhen the creature is reduced to zero hit points, they are not defeated until the end of their next turn. On said turn they are staggered. If a creature with ferocity is healed before their next turn, the creature is not defeated at the end of its next turn, and this ability is not consumed, however they are still staggered.This ability can only activate once per minute.FH does not function while in ferocity.IncorporealIncorporeal creatures have resistance to crush, slash and pierce damage. They cannot be combat maneuvered without special equipment or techniques. Incorporeal creatures universally have hover speeds.Incorporeal creatures can pass through physical objects, but cannot end their turn inside of one. This allows them to ignore cover bonuses and more easily hide.ImmunityRare defensive quality. This creature is immune to a specific type of status effect and/or damage type.A common one is mindless creatures (creatures that lack an intelligence score, denoted by a - in the ability scores section) are immune to mind-affecting effects like fear and charm.ResistanceWhen a creature has resistance to a type of status effect or damage type, the creature takes only half damage from effects that deal that damage type.When a creature has a resistance to a tag, it lists the numerical value that it gets a bonus to saves against abilities with that tag (such as [fear] [charm] etc).{% hint style="success" %} Creatures with resistance to poison also have a +4 bonus to the envenomed condition {% endhint %}RegenerationThe creature regains a specified amount of hp at the start of their turn. This healing is capable of restoring lost limbs over a few days, or instantly if the limb is reattached. At the start of this creature's turn it loses the defeated condition, restores HP, and the creature is staggered instead of dazed.All forms of regeneration have some means to stop it (typically for 1 round), usually taking a specific type of damage.
If a creature is defeated while its regeneration is disabled, it is unable to regenerate for 10 minutes (see medicine for other means to keep those pesky healers down).

item.title: fundamentals
item.description: Natural AttacksIt's very common for monsters to have sharp claws and teeth, but having more claws and more teeth doesn't necessarily lead to them having more attacks. In a typical bestiary stat block, a monster will have sets of attack actions each with their own specified stats.If a creatures stats mentions the multi-attack property, then when they take a standard action to attack, they are allowed to make multiple attacks of the specified types. Some creatures have conditional multiattacks.ExampleSting (P) +3 2d6+2 (9)Multiattack - Can only be made against creatures with a speed of 0 (entangle, stun etc). Make 2 sting attacks.Innate CastingSome techniques can be granted outside of the standard progression, such as things gained from race, class, magic items, specialized training, or some kind of boon granted by another creature. Usually quite limited in scope and much more common on monsters.Innate techniques do not take up memory slots and are always memorized.Innate techniques grant creatures the ability to use a specific set of techniques. Spells do not require the staff/seal component that other casting typically requires. If a spell has a material or focus component, that is also ignored with innate casting. By default, creatures with innate techniques can use their techniques an unlimited number of times. Number values are included next to techniques that have limited uses per day.Mana burn still applies to innately casted spells.If a spell is constant, the spell is persistently active on the creature and takes up its [buff] slot. A new buff can be cast on it, rendering the constant spell inactive. If it's constant spell is deactivated, it can reactivate it as a swift action.

item.title: groups
item.description: Packs of beasts, platoons of soldiers and swarms of insects are all groups of weaker enemies that have slightly different representation than a typical monster. Group type enemies have a few quirks

item.title: offense-traits
item.description: Aura (Su)A creature has the ability to generate an area of effect surrounding them. Some are passive some require activation. All auras are [persistent] effects, meaning creature can only be affected by a negative aura once per round.Breath Weapon (Su)The creature has the ability to use a supernatural area of effect attack. Common forms include lines and cones of elemental damage.Most breath weapons are [recharge] effects that have some condition to use them again.DeathrattleAn effect happens when the creature dies, requiring no action. This typically involves exploding or releasing toxic gases.Gaze (Su)Merely by looking at another creature nearby, they can inflict some kind of effect. The creature can use a standard action in order to gaze at a specific creature within 30 ft. Some creatures have gaze attacks that automatically happen to all creatures within a specific range.Anybody combating a creature with a gaze attack has a few options to try and negate it, made when they first are affected by the gaze attack. They can choose to close their eyes (instant action), giving themselves the blinded condition until the start of their next turn, making them immune gaze attacks. Alternatively they can choose to avert their gaze, giving them blurred vision and advantage on saves against gaze attacks. Gaze attacks can be avoided entirely by looking at the creature through a proxy, like a reflective surface.Grappling AbilitiesAttach - When the creature grapples another creature it instead gains the grappled condition, typically due to its smaller size. Creatures with the attached property typically have special abilities that can only be used while attached.Constrict - When a creature with the constrict property succeeds on a grapple check they automatically deal damage from a specified attack form. Every turn they maintain the grapple they also do this effect.Engulf - When the creature succeeds on a grapple check they can engulf the target. The target gains the entombed condition. Usually the creature can take no action other than to use athletics to escape.Allies can use athletics to pull you out or poise break the creature to set you free.Swallow - After successfully grappling a creature, the creature can choose to swallow its prey if it is at least one size category larger. The prey maintains the grapple penalties and the swallowing creature doesn't need to take any actions to maintain the grapple. The prey gains total cover and takes a specified amount of damage the turn it is swallowed immediately and at the end of the swallowed creatures turn thereafter.A creature cannot use its swallow quality while sickened 2 or higher. Becoming sickened 2 causes it to vomit any swallowed creatures.The prey escapes automatically when the swallowing creature is defeated.Powerful ChargeThe creature gets a +2 bonus to attack during any round they make a charge.RendWhenever the creature lands the listed attacks (including poise breaking the creature), they inflict an additional effect, usually damage.ExampleRend - Two claws (2d6)Summon Ally (Su) [companion]Functions like a summoning contract, but does not require a contract, usually only summoning lesser creatures. Only requires a standard action and can potentially summon multiple creature at once.Can also grant other bonuses to summoned creatures, in addition to the companion boost to attack.TrampleCreature can move around through other creatures spaces to knock them over. As a FRA a creature can move its speed, or double its speed in a straight line, and harm all creatures along its path, dealing damage and knocking them down. Creatures can choose to either AoO or make a reflex save for a reduced effect.VenomousInflicts the Envenomed status effect with one of its attacks or abilities, which functions as follows.Venom comes in 3 stages. In order to advance from one to the next, the afflicted creature must fail a fortitude save. The venom continues until they creature passes a fortitude save. Some creatures may have different effects for their venom, but this is the assumed default if no other details are listed.Stage 1 - Creature is sickened 1, which cannot be removed until the creature is no longer poisoned. 1 minute after the creature fails its first save, it must roll again or hit stage 2. Stage 2 - Creature is sickened 2, which cannot be removed until the creature is no longer poisoned. The creature also has disadvantage on skill checks. 10 minutes after the creature fails its second save, it must roll again.Stage 3 - Creature is sickened 3, which cannot be removed until the creature is no longer poisoned. The creature gains the defeated condition.In stage 3, a creature must roll a save every 10 minutes. Each failure adds a stack of drain.

item.title: other-traitss
item.description: AmphibiousAmphibious creatures can exist comfortably on land or underwater, including the ability to breathe underwater or the ability to hold their breath for long periods of time.BlindsenseThis creature has extraordinary senses that allows it to sense the presence of creatures without sight. A creature with blind sense has +4 bonus on perception against a creature to which its blindsense applies. The creature automatically receives a perception check with no penalty when a creature enters this range, even while naturally asleep, and automatically wakes up if it senses something.A successful perception check indicates the creature has "locked on" and identified the space the creature is in. They gain seeking against any creature "locked on." Once a creature with blind sense has "locked on" to a creature, it stays detected until it leaves the creature's blindsense range, or the creatures blind sense is disabled.A creature with blind sense can use the "detect hidden presence" feature of perception as a free action once per turn, but only the affecting the range of its blind sense.Blind sense relies on a specific sense (mentioned in the ability), usually hearing or scent, but can also include things like detecting life (with undead creatures), or feeling tremors in the ground/water. Blind sense can circumstantially be negated, based on the source.Echolocation - Sound based. A creature that takes sonic damage has their echolocation disabled for one round.Lifesense (Su) - Functions against living creatures. Undead, constructs (and other similar not really alive) creatures cannot be detected with life sense.Scent - Uses a creature sense of smell. Aquatic creatures can only use this underwater. Amphibious creatures can use it in water or land. If you have an item with a creatures scent on it, you get a +2 bonus on survival checks to track them. Scents can be remembered similarly to how you can recognize someone's voice. Creatures with scent automatically get a perception check (vs disguise) against someone impersonating a creature they are very close to.A creature that is sickened cannot use scent.Tremorsense - Vibration based. Aquatic creatures can use this underwater. Amphibious creatures can use it in water or land. Only functions if the creature (and any creatures it is attempting to detect) is in direct contact with a physical surface.A creature that is clumsy cannot use tremorsense.Thought Sense (Su) - Functions against intelligent creatures. Mindless creatures cannot be detected with thought sense. A creature that is shaken cannot use thought sense.Sightless Blind Sense - In the absence of sight, blindsense is enhanced. The usual methods for preventing blindsense (sickened with super scent) from functioning impose partial concealment on all creatures that their blindsense cannot negate until the condition is removed.Creatures with sightless blindsense instead get a +8 bonus to perception when blindsense applies and its range is usually higher.CompressionYou are able to move through spaces designed for creatures 1 size smaller than you without treating it as difficult terrain. You are able to move through spaces designed for creatures 2 sizes smaller than you by treating it as difficult terrainCamouflageCreature can use stealth to hide without cover or concealment. Cannot be used while being directly observed.May come with other conditions for use.Hide in Plain SightCreature has the ability to successfully hide from creatures while standing perfectly still by pretending to be an inanimate object or changing colors. If the creature is already being observed, or enemies have already been surprised by the creature using this ability recently, then it does not function.Typically creatures do not get a check to see a creature that is hiding in plain sight until they go out of their way to inspect the nearby area, or the hiding creature acts.The DC to detect them is based on their offense trait DC rather than stealth, but functions similarly when used to surprise attack. If creature has stealth, they can choose to roll it as normal to ambush.Movement TypesBurrow - A creature with a burrow speed can tunnel through dirt, but not through rock, unless the descriptive text says otherwise. Creatures leaves a temporary trail behind, unless measures are taken to maintain the hole. You cannot charge while burrowing. Starting to burrow underground requires a swift action and provokes an AoO as though moving out of a threatened space.Climb - A creature with a climb speed can easily ascend or descend trees, walls buildings etc, provided there are ample places to place hands, feet etc. Creatures with climb speeds can even climb things without ample handholds using creative methods or exceptional biology in some cases (gecko, snake wrapping around).Flight - You can use a fly speed to move directly up into the air. Any movement moving up at greater than a 45 degree angle is considered difficult terrain. Taking flight requires a swift action that provokes attacks of opportunity as though moving out of a threatened space.Whenever you take damage while flying, gain clumsy 1. You cannot ascend while clumsy.Creatures with flight automatically also have glide.While a creatures speed is reduced to zero, it cannot fly, and plummets.Glide - While not movement impaired, take no fall damage. Reduce any fall damage to minimum value. When falling, move horizontally 5 feet per 1 foot fallen at a speed of 60.Hover - A lesser form of flight, or perhaps something supernatural like telekinesis. Functions as a land speed, but you float around a foot above the ground, allows you to ignore small changes in terrain. Some creatures can use hover to fly during their turn, but they must end their movement hovering over flat-ish ground. You cannot use hover to temporarily fly while clumsy. While clumsy, your hover speed is reduced by 15.Swim - Creatures with a swim speed take no penalties to fighting underwater. Most creatures with a swim speed are either aquatic or amphibious.Polymorph (Su)[Poly]Allows a creature to turn into a different creature. The description of the ability will include the features that it gains when it does so (based off of the features of the shapeshifter class). If there are no listed features then assumes that it gains none. While polymorphed a creature is unable to use any of the abilities based on its physical form, such as its natural attacks or poison, if they originate from their original form.Descriptions typically use features from the shapeshifter class.ExPolymorph: Humanoid (Su) [poly, true] - Any medium or small humanoidPolymorph: Beast, Dog (Su) [poly, true] - Attack (bite), Manhandle (topple)Special SensesDarkvision - You can see well in complete darkness. Treat any form of darkness as bright light. Everything in darkness is grayscale.Green Sight (Su) - Can see through any form of vegetation. Creatures cannot use vegetation as a source of cover to hide against this creature.Nightvision - A lesser form of darkvision. You treat dim light as bright light. You treat darkness as dim light. These effects do not combine to allow you to treat darkness as bright light. Everything in darkness is grayscale.Telepathy (Su)The creature can speak directly into the minds of other creatures it can see. A creature must have an intelligence score of at least -2 in order to be telepathically communicated with. A creature can telepathically project its thoughts to several creatures in the nearby vicinity, even if it cannot see them. Once a creature initiates a telepathic conversation, the other creature can communicate back using telepathy. The creature that initiated the telepathic conversation can choose to end it whenever they wish.

item.title: weaknesses
item.description: Monsters often have specific and niche weaknesses, allowing characters with specific skills or abilities to exploit the monster in a specific way.There are also generic weaknesses.WeaknessMany creatures are susceptible to specific forms of attack.
