item.description: Requirements - Carefully line up a ranged attack and increase the action required to make it to a FRA. Ignore the -4 penalty for shooting in the second range increment. If your target is in the first increment, instead gain +2 attack.For effects that don't have range increments, such as spells, you can increase the action to cast to a FRA to gain the +2 bonus to attack.

item.title: butterfly-sting
item.description: Requirements - Whenever you critically strike a creature, you can turn it into a regular hit instead and choose to let the next attack another ally lands against them be an automatic crit, so long as it at least hits them.There is no bonus effect if the next attack is normally a crit.If another ally attacks the creature, they automatically consume this effect, and cannot "store it" until a later turn.

item.title: clustered-shots
item.description: Requirements - When you make multiple range attacks against the same creature, only apply their damage reduction once.

item.title: combat-step
item.description: Requirements - Dex +2Reduce your speed to 5 this turn to make your movement [elusive].

item.title: combat-vigor
item.description: Requirements - Str +3Gain FH 2.

item.title: defensive-training
item.description: Requirements - Increase your poise by 5.

item.title: diehard
item.description: Requirements - Str +1 The first time per day your hp would be reduced to 0, instead reduce it to 1. The first time per day you are actually reduced to 0, you make make a simple attack immediately before you are defeated.

item.title: distance-thrower
item.description: Requirements - Thrown weapons have no penalty to attack in the second range increment.

item.title: divine-interference
item.description: Requirements - Wis +1As an immediate action you can expend a use of prayer to reroll an attack directed against you or an ally within 30 ft.

item.title: dual-wielding-versatility
item.description: Requirements - You can dual wield with any 1h weapon, not just light weapons. When dual wielding, you can sacrifice your "off hand" attack to gain advantage with your "main hand" attack. You can also sacrifice your "off hand" attack to feint a creature. You must use your "main hand" to attack the creature you feinted.

item.title: elemental-adept
item.description: Requirements - Choose an elemental damage type (holy, force, etc). Whenever you deal damage of this type, it ignores resistance. Creatures immune to this damage type are instead treated as resistant.This is usually represented by something unusual for your element, such as a different color. Black fire, green lightning etc.

item.title: fan-club-companion
item.description: Requirements - Level 3, Cha +1You use your influence and charm to gain a group of people that appreciate you. They are often willing to perform minor tasks for you, stick their neck out for you, but not risk their life for you. They are located in one specific place at first, then they may branch as you gain more levels and influence.The size of your fan club varies based on your level. You multiply this value by your charisma bonus.One member of your fan club is your biggest fan. Your biggest fan is always a minion, other than that, there are no restrictions for what your biggest fan can be. When you gain this feat, you decide their class, race, stats etc. They count as a [companion] if they travel with you.Your biggest fan doesn't necessarily need to be a playable race, but those that aren't should be acquired through story related encounters rather than chosen.

item.title: fearsome-finisher
item.description: Requirements - When you defeat a creature, gain a +4 bonus to intimidation checks for the rest of combat. Whenever you defeat a creature, you can demoralize another creature as a free action. If they were already shaken, they instead are frightened for 1 round

item.title: fighters-lament
item.description: Requirements - When a creature teleports within your reach, it provokes an AoO.

item.title: fleet-footwork
item.description: Requirements - Increase your base speed by 5ft.Your movement is [elusive] against any target you have attacked this turn.

item.title: ghostbuster
item.description: Requirements - Religion ProficiencyYou treat incorporeal creatures as though they were corporeal.

item.title: heavy-metal
item.description: Requirements - Character level 3You gain the following special attack, usable at-will with any 2h weapon.Special Attack: Vital Strike - Add d6 damage to your attack. This improves by an addtional d6 every odd level (max ).

item.title: in-the-rhythm
item.description: Requirements - The first time you miss an attack each turn, add to 2 to a pool. As an immediate action, you can expend all of this pool to increase the bonus of an attack roll you make.Problems: Doesn't do anything if you hit, making the payoff iffy unless you have many attacks. But the attack bonus is less significant for dual wielding. Can also be used to have the juggernaut morde q effect, stack on minions, one shot enemy with big attack.

item.title: innocuous-bending
item.description: Requirements - Elemental Blast, Sleight of Hand or Deception proficiencyYou can use sleight of hand's concealed weapon feature with your elemental blast. It does not require a swift action to use, but it only works once in a particular encounter. You can also use deception's sucker punch feature with your elemental blast without taking a penalty.

item.title: mage-slayer
item.description: Requirements - Arcana ProficiencyThe first time you land a melee attack against a creature that is concentrating on a spell each round, they must roll a fortitude save (against your DC) or the spell is dismissed.You can also make a ranged attack, but the fort save is your DC-4.

item.title: matador
item.description: Requirements - When a creature grazes you or misses you with a charge attack, you can force them to continue their charge the full distance past you, potentially provoking AoOs. You can also choose to make them take a right angle turn.If they impact a solid surface, they take 10 crush damage.

item.title: parting-shot
item.description: Requirements - When you take the disengage action, you make a simple ranged attack.

item.title: power-pose
item.description: Requirements - Damage ReductionWhen you are damaged with an effect that your DR applies against, you can increase that DR by 5 as an immediate action.If the creature is within reach, it takes 10 poise damage.

item.title: README
item.description: A combat feat is only useful during combat, or is at least more skewed towards being useful during combat.

item.title: ricochet-toss
sniper
item.description: Requirements - Stealth proficiencyAfter making a ranged attack (or a ranged multiattack), you can hide as an immediate action, rolling stealth against only your target(s). If you succeed, they are unaware of your position, though can still assume your general direction.

item.title: suppressing-fire
item.description: Requirements - As a standard action, you can prepare to cover an ally's movement using a ranged weapon you can make ranged attacks with. They are treated as though they took the disengage action on their next turn.

item.title: toughness
item.description: Requirements - Increase your max hp by 5+lvl.

item.title: trick-shot
item.description: Requirements - You can make combat maneuvers with ranged attacks at a -4 penalty.You are limited to bully, shove, topple, disarm.

item.title: tumbling-charge
item.description: Requirements - When you charge, you can choose to charge through an enemy, rolling around them or running straight through them. This is [elusive] against the target of your charge. You can end your charge on the opposite side of the creature instead of ending it when you meet the creature. You must still have the movement to do so. You gain flanking against a creature you tumbling charge for the rest of your turn.

item.title: unarmed-combatant
item.description: Requirements - Even while unarmed you threatened with punches and kicks. Your unarmed strikes deal d8 dmg.Gain 2 special attacks usable with unarmed strikes.Spacial Attack: Blunt Force Trauma - On hit stagger your target for one round (fort negates). If this attack defeats the target, make a thrown weapon attack using the defeated creature as ammunition (no MA penalty).Spacial Attack: Power Fist - On hit stagger your target for one round (fort negates). If this attack defeats the target, it flies 1,000 ft into the air and gently lands on the ground one minute later. With a low roof, the creature is launched less high, but for just as long.

item.title: unconventional-mount
item.description: Requirements - You have adapted your riding style to accommodate for smaller creatures. You can mount creatures that are the same size as you.You can mount any willing creature, even those without the proper hardware to facilitate mounting.

item.title: unstoppable
item.description: Requirements - You take no penalty to speed while staggered or frosty. This can reasonably extend to other minor temporary speed debuff abilities that aren't these exact status conditions (such as the speed penalty from the icicle cantrip). If knocked down, your speed only decreases by 15. If you would be unable to move at all, such as being stunned, entangled or grappled, your speed is instead 5.

item.title: weapon-focus
README
item.description: Requirements - Choose one skill. You roll it with advantage. When you take 10 with this skill, you instead take 15. If a feature calls for you to use 10+(skill bonus) as a DC for something, instead use 15+DC.

item.title: signature-skill
item.description: Requirements - Skill Focus in chosen skillYou gain additional options in how to use a specific skill that you specialize it. For more information visit the skills page.

item.title: convenient-companion-su
item.description: Requirements - Companion creatureAs a standard action, you can touch your companion creature to turn them into a tiny action figure version of themselves, provided they are willing.As a standard action, you can toss this action figure up to 30 ft away to transform it back. If you are currently in combat.

item.title: cunning
item.description: Requirements - Gain proficiency in a skill.

item.title: demolitionist
item.description: Requirements - Gain a +4 bonus to athletics checks made to destroy or displace objects

item.title: intimidating-prowess
item.description: Requirements - You can add your charisma and strength to intimidation.

item.title: lead-by-example
item.description: Requirements - Whenever you perform a skill check you are proficient in, such as sneaking past someone or swimming across a raging river, anybody that follows your lead on their next turn gets a +10 bonus to the same check.If the task requires more than one turn for you to perform, your allies still get the bonus. If you fail the skill check, your allies do not get the bonus.

item.title: photographic-memory
item.description: Requirements - +2 IntBy spending a memory slot as a free action, you can memorize everything you are currently looking at, as though taking a photo. When looking back at this memory, you can comb it for further details, such as reading text or inspecting faces in a crowd.You can only memorize one such scene at a time.

item.title: README
item.description: General feats mostly assist with some kind of out of combat task, such as things to increase the consistency of skills.

item.title: taking-prisoners
item.description: Requirements - You know how to keep a creature down. As a standard action against a defeated creature, you can perform a series of nonlethal blows in key places to make it so they cannot lose the defeated condition until they rest or someone performs a medicine check against them (class DC).

item.title: wild-empathy
item.description: Requirements - Gain proficiency in persuasion, but only for use against beasts. If you are already proficient in persuasion, gain a +2 bonus when using it against beasts. Base DC is 10+(creatures level). Add +2 to DC for things like the following: protecting young, is only beast adjacent (magic cow), abused by humanoids, starving, unfamiliar environment, mating season etc.Succeeding on a wild empathy check makes the creature friendly to you temporarily, allowing you to make simple requests. Beasts are dumb so their help is limited (which one of these guys hurt you, lead me to x). The most obvious use case is to inquire about strange things in the nearby area that have happened recently. Interacting with the same animal over time can give you bonuses or cause you to not need to make a check anymore.

item.title: callous-casting
magic-initiate
item.description: Requirements - You gain access to 3 cantrips

item.title: matryoshkasting
item.description: Requirements - Level 3When you use a level 2 or higher spell, the next spell of a lower level that you cast costs 1 less mana. This can chain together until you spend 0 mana on casting a spell.If a spell you cast is of the same level or a higher level than the one you cast last, the effect ends.For the purposes of this feat, a spell is considered of a higher level when you upcast it.

item.title: mm-caster-minion
item.description: Requirements - Int +2While using a feature with the [scrying] tag through a companion creature, you can use your actions and the creature's actions to have them be the origin point of your spells.

item.title: mm-coax
item.description: Requirements - Int +1Your spells with the [mind affecting] tag can affect mindless creatures.

item.title: mm-elemental-shift
item.description: Requirements - Int +1When you cast the spell that deals an elemental damage type, you can choose to transform it into a different element, choosing between fire, frost, zap and force.

item.title: mm-explosion-anticipation
item.description: Requirements - Int +0You are immune to the effects of your own AoE spell, provided it does not have a listed duration.

item.title: mm-focused-blast
item.description: Requirements - Int +1When you cast a spell that deals damage and targets multiple creatures, choose a "primary target." The DC of the spell for that creature is 2 higher. If the spell allows attacks against multiple creatures (such as Gloom Bolt), you also get a +2 bonus to attack against this creature.

item.title: mm-intensify
item.description: Requirements - Int +1Increase the CL of the spell by 2.

item.title: mm-latent-curse
mm-merciful-spell
item.description: Requirements - Int +0Creatures defeated by this spell have no chance of dying when defeated by it. Any of its damaging aftereffects disappear when the creature is defeated.

item.title: mm-persistence
item.description: Requirements - Int +1When you cast a spell that has recurring saves each turn, you can choose to give it the [concentration] tag (if it doesn't already have it) in order to increase the DC of recurring saves by 2.

item.title: mm-residual-damage
item.description: Requirements - Int +2When you cast a spell that deals damage that doesn't already have a damage over time effect, add one. The creature takes your CL in damage at the end of its turn for 1 turn if it fails its save. The type of damage matches the damage of the spell.

item.title: mm-saviors-arrow
mm-sniping
item.description: Requirements - Int +1Add +4 to an attack roll made with a spell.

item.title: README
item.description: Magic - Feats that specifically apply to spells.MM - Short for meta magic. A subsection of magic feats that allow you to apply general augments to spells by increasing the mana cost by 1. Most require intelligence.

item.title: spell-ambush
item.description: Requirements - Stealth ProficiencyYour spell DC is 2 higher against creatures you successfully hide from using stealth (aka if they would normally be DD from hiding). This only applies to the spell's initial save.This does not apply to other ways to cause a target to be DD, such as blinding them or feinting.

item.title: spell-sharing
item.description: Requirements - When you cast a single target spell with the [buff] tag, you can cast it on a companion creature and yourself, or all of your companion creatures (provided they are in range and valid targets). This functions even if the spell has a target of self.If the spell does not have a listed range, its range for determining when you can buff your companions is reach.

item.title: threatening-illusion
item.description: Requirements - When you create a [figment] effect that creates a creature (such as imagination), it also threatens and provides flanking as long as creatures have not saved to disbelieve.As a standard action, or as an AoO, you can have the figment attack a creature. The creature takes d6 per spell level psychic damage (will negates and creature disbelieves illusion).

item.title: bending-initiate
item.description: Requirements - You can use the benders elemental blast feature as a character of (your level-2). It is a special attack that is usable any number of times a combat.The element you choose cannot be changed.

item.title: ex-guardian
item.description: Requirements - Perhaps you used to be a light guardian a long time ago, or you dropped out of your training early. You gain the Light Guardian's Light Binding special attack. You can only use it once per combat. You do not gain any of the other class abilities that enhance it.

item.title: flurry
item.description: Requirements - Unarmed CombatantYou can mimic a martial artists ability to weave punches and kicks into their combos. Any turn you do not make a multiattack, you can spend 1 mana to make a simple unarmed attack as a swift action.

item.title: light-steps
item.description: Requirements - Level 3Light steps requires concentration, and you can start concentrating on this ability as a free action by spending 1 mana. As long as you only move during your turn and take no other action, you can walk along any flat continuous surface. This can include things that aren't even otherwise solid such as water or lava. It can also include things such as walls or ceilings.You can use this ability for only part of your turn to get to a location, but if you attack, cast a spell etc, then you need a surface you would normally be able to stand on or you plummet.

item.title: pet-companion
README
item.description: Multiclass - This feat allows you to borrow a feature from another class. Usually such features are secondary features of the class, or are there for flavor.

item.title: speak-for-the-dead-su
item.description: Requirements - Level 31/day you can use the Medium Necromancer subclass speak with corpse feature.

item.title: unarmored-defense
item.description: Requirements - Str +0You've trained your body in such a way to allow you to effectively respond to attacks by intercepting blows and dodging projectiles.Your ac while unarmored is 14+lvl. If you have at least +1 dex, this number increases to 15+lvl. Gain 4 poise.

item.title: README
item.description: Requirements - You can communicate telepathically with any ally as long as you can see them.

item.title: take-the-hit
item.description: Requirements - Bonded MindAs an immediate action, when an ally within 30 ft of you takes damage, you can choose to reduce the damage by half and then take that damage as true damage.

item.title: artillery-team
item.description: Requirements - You can use the aid action to reload an allies weapon with the reload property (like crossbow or gun). You can aid them preemptively to allow them to shoot more than once during their turn.Also siege weapons when I get to it

item.title: cooperative-casting
item.description: Requirements - The ability to cast spellsYou can use the aid action on an ally within 30 ft to increase the CL ally by 2 for 1 round. When you do this, you can also spend 1 mana to decrease the mana cost of their next spell by 1.If your level is higher than the creature you are assisting, the CL boost increases to 3.

item.title: escape-route
item.description: Requirements - Leaving threatened squares also threatened by your allies is [elusive].

item.title: feint-partner
item.description: Requirements - If your ally feints a creature, you can make an AoO against it if it is within reach. It is DD for this attack.

item.title: gang-up
item.description: Requirements - Gain a +4 bonus to your combat maneuver if an ally has rolled an attack against the creature you target since your last turn.

item.title: harmonize
item.description: Requirements - When you roll a group skill check with the performance skill, every ally proficient in a perform skill gives a +4 bonus.

item.title: pack-tactics
item.description: Requirements - As long as you are threatening the same creature as an ally, you gain flanking regardless of position.

item.title: perfect-positioning
item.description: Requirements - You can move into an allies space. When you do, they can move into yours as an instant action [elusive].While adjacent to an ally, you cannot be flanked.

item.title: README
shield-bros
item.description: Requirements - Gain +2 ac when you are within the natural reach of an ally that wields a shield. This can increase up to +4 ac if 4 shield bros are involves.Due to how spaces work on grids, having groups of 4 adjacent to each other can be difficult. So for groups, as long as each member is adjacent to another member, that should suffice for gaining this feats benefits.

item.title: spotter
item.description: Requirements - When you give the aid action to grant a bonus to attack to a creature firing a ranged weapon or siege weapon, the bonus increases to +4, but you can no longer have multiple creatures to aid that creature to grant attack bonuses.You also give a +4 bonus when you aid a perception check.

item.title: README
item.description: Feats are features in progression typically gained at every odd level. They allow your character to get bonuses to specific actions, perform entirely new actions and occasionally get general stat increases. Some feats have prerequisites, such as stat requirements or other feats. You must meet all of the requirements of a feat to take it.Feats come in a few categories.General - General feats mostly assist with some kind of out of combat task, such as things to increase the consistency of skills.Combat - A combat feat is only useful during combat, or is at least more skewed towards being useful during combat. Multiclass - This feat allows you to borrow a feature from another class. Usually such features are secondary features of the class, or are there for flavor.Teamwork - A teamwork feat requires more than one creature to possess in order to function, usually providing some kind of synergistic effect. The wording of these feats often include "all allies," but it only applies to allies with the feat.Magic - Feats that specifically apply to spells.MM - Short for meta magic. A subsection of magic feats that allow you to apply general augments to spells by spending an additional point of mana. Most require intelligence.

item.title: emissaries
item.description: Each god has a single mortal that they choose as their most dedicated, trusted and powerful follower. This follower is known as the emissary of X god. Emissaries gain extra boons, and usually a direct line of communication to their deity.

item.title: README
item.description: Gods are beings that have purposefully not been given stat blocks, because fighting a god via conventional means, that being swords and magic, is impossible. An ancient and powerful pact is in place that prevents the gods from seizing mortals as puppets to enact their will, and forces them to figure out more subtle and indirect means of acquiring what they want.This same pact makes them immune to conventional weapons. Gods have so much mana flowing through them that no singular person is close to powerful enough to even scratch them. This same mana allows them to perform incredible feats, often referred to as miracles. Gods are free to walk amongst mortals only sparingly, as doing so requires a great deal of mana. As such they usually prefer only to appear in their Deific Aspects, which only allow them to exert a fraction of their power, and appear as a translucent spectral version of themselves. They can also appear as a mortal, unable to exert any of their usual deific powers, and usually having a hard time gathering the attention of mortals. They also use other indirect means, such as using their followers as vessels, projecting only their voice or having their messages appear in writing via ink or blood.Gods are not all-knowing, nor are they all-powerful. They have the ability to focus their attention on many places at once, with much greater detail in places where their followers exist. They hear and answer prayers while doing other things. Their ability to multi-task and process information is beyond comprehension. Certain types of things may draw their focus, such as hearing a prayer related to a matter that interests them, or a ritual in their honor conducted by one of their favorite disciples, or an enemy defacing their places of worship.Gods must carefully consider what they focus their attention on, and what they do. Their existence may seem immutable, but the countless gods lost to time suggest otherwise. They must satisfy the desires of mortals, lest they lose their source of power. As such, gods tend to only give boons to the dedicated, and only make appearances amongst mortals if it can be flashy and garner a lot of attention. A constant form of pageantry they must perform in order to maintain their power and increase their influence.

item.title: anime-jesus
item.description: Anime Jesus is the anime god of order. He primarily concerns himself with the purging of corruption and evil in the realms beyond his own. The followers of AJ call themselves The Golden Order. Many that follow him mimic his powerful offensive magic in order to destroy aberrations, demons, undead and the mortals that serve/create them. Anime Jesus is not just concerned with the evil that exists on Nack, but also that which lies beyond the stars. A radioactive and corrupting force permeates the galaxy known as ligmanium. It twists and transforms all it comes into contact with, eventually spreading between planets. Destroying this substance at its source is the prime directive of AJ and his followers.BoonsT1: TT2: tT3: You

item.title: README
item.description: There exist a great many lesser or local deities that are much less popular, and therefore do not follow the same kind of rules as the other gods. They are still more mortal than divine, and are free to exert their lesser influence directly in the mortal realm. There are even rules on how a player character can become one.These demon dukes, demigods and other lesser deities can be killed like any man. They do still have abilities similar to gods, such as the ability to grant boons, and project their deific aspect, however their ability to perform miracles is limited. Demigods must often fight tooth and nail to not fade into irrelevance once the next generation of mortals forgets them for their deeds.

item.title: daughters-of-the-cataclysm
item.description: The Cataclysm is absolutely obsessed with raw physical strength, and constantly throws herself and her followers into situations where they can test their might. This manifests in a particularly strange way, where she sees herself as the perfect being, and so therefore her offspring are the only ones that really have a chance of every topping her feats of strength. The exact circumstances of their creation are unknown, but they typically end up as large muscular demons, and are always women.Unfortunately for these ladies, mom's standards couldn't be higher: They must become stronger than their mother. Since all of them fall short of this goal, she abandons them, giving them some kind of leadership role in her demonic armies and only ever interacting with them sparingly. The only training she ever gives them is physical, so they are usually unprepared for this role.

item.title: README
item.description: The Cataclysm is the most outwardly terrifying, hostile and destructive force known to mankind. She is concerned with little more than raw physical strength, twisting this ideology to its absolute extremes and eliminating any and all unable to survive the hostility and violence so common among her and her minions. As such, she is very often held in high regard by eugenicists, anarchists and the unhinged that just want to watch the world burn.One of the few things that the followers of the Cataclysm will always hold in high regard is contests of raw physical strength. Their method of testing your might is typically an arm wrestling contest. This is often used as a last ditch effort by people to save their own skins when faced with overwhelming odds of death.On rare occasions, her followers will kidnap specimens they deem worthy enough. They will be dragged into the demon realm to have all manner of alchemical, magical and genetic experiments run on them to create a creature that is perfectly huge.Caldera herself is a massive muscular woman clad in metal armor who typically stands over 20 feet tall. Her body is covered in all manner of bony spikes, horns and scales. Along her back are dorsal plates that run down her massive tail, giving her stance a forward lean, allowing her to loom over and gaze upon lesser beings with her many eyes.BoonsT1: Huge Any thing that gives you additional carryweight in increments of 100, such as strength and racial features, gives you 1000 lbs of carryweight instead. You can throw heavy objects, dealing 2d6 base damage. You get a +2 bonus to athletics to destroy and displace objects, and to arm wrestling.T2: Huge XXL Your mastery over gravity lets you benefit from the 5G technique constantly. You can toggle this ability off or on as a free action 1/rnd.Share your training regiment as a special attack you can use at will.Special Attack: Gravity Training: Apply grounded for 1 round on hit. The grounded creature takes a -15 penalty to speed if it is not proficient in athletics, or doesn't have at least +3 strength.T3: Perfectly Huge You

item.title: fiendish-pacts
item.description: A fiendish pact requires an agreement between two parties, typically via writing, but also can be done via verbal agreements. Such pacts bind the 2 creatures to these agreements, with immediate consequences if one does not abide by the agreement.Pacts, like written contracts in real life, are methods of binding 2 parties together to persuade some time of cooperation or exchange. It usually involves exchanging goods, services, information or boons. Typically pacts are formed when someone desires something, but the other doesn't want to grant this desire for free. Both parties mediate until a satisfactory transaction is agreed upon. Then the 2 parties must decide on a punishment for the other should they not fulfill their end of the bargain. Again, the 2 parties come to an agreement on what the other desires. Finally, some type of gesture is taken to finalize the deal, such as shaking hands, returning a bow or signing a contract.Some creatures may take issue with the order in which the parties perform their end of the bargain, but it is inevitably up to the creature with the power to make the pact what order things happen in.Pacts, unlike written contracts in real life, cannot be broken without evading consequence. Pacts are made with magic that does not ask for mediation or a jury. Disobeying the contract immediately afflicts the creature with whatever the punishment is. Any kind of agreement must be within the means of the creature to perform. In the event where someone is unable to hold up their end of the bargain, or does so in a way that is not in accordance with the deal, they are afflicted with punishment immediately. You cannot also say "I will grant you anything you wish" without the ability to grant wishes. Punishments must also be within the means of both parties. You cannot just say "if you don't pet this dog 10 times then you burst into flames and die" without being able to use some type of fire magic. If you agree on a punishment that you cannot inflict, then there is no consequence for not fulfilling their end of the bargain. It us up to you to decide if the other really CAN devour your eternal soul or not.Shira, and her most dedicated, are capable of providing additional boons to those they make pacts with. Contracts without meaning, such as those made between allies to acquire more boons, will draw Shira's ire and are not recommended.Twist of Fate - The creature gains a luck dice.Lexicon - Give creature information about a subject as though asking Shira herself. The amount of information she gives typically depends on what was done in the contract. Good deeds get the bare minimum to satisfy the contract while deeds that align with Shira's interest are paid in dividends.

item.title: README
item.description:
Shira is the demon lord most known for making deals with mortals, and with subterfuge. A master of disguise, Shira always finds a way to hide amongst the crowd in parties held by those in the highest echelons of society. She will somehow simultaneously be the most beautiful and second most beautiful lady attending the party at once. She delights in the act of giving mortals exactly what they want, but then taking so much more in return. Her deals will always be carefully worded, often with a written contract. She may misrepresent things and lie to get people to sign, and if they believed her, its their fault for not reading the fine print. These devilish tendencies work to break down society by eroding trust, generating discontent and playing off of the selfish desires of mankind. You didn't honestly expect her help to be free, right dearest?Shira prefers a much more appealing and innocuous form to represent herself. She takes on the form of a voluptuous fox-like beastfolk, appearing mostly human, save for the ears and tail. The only thing that would even indicate she is a demon is vertical pupils of her eyes. When in private company, she has a casual attire she likes involving loose purple clothes, and she lets all nine of her tails out. When working, such as attending parties, she tends to dress exceptionally well and hides all but one of her tails.BoonsT1: Party Animal (Su) While at a social gathering, such as a party, festival, ball etc, you can exist in two places at once. This otherwise functions as a ninja's shadow clone, but the clone disappears once the event ends or you begin combat.So long as both clones aren't in someones line of sight at once, people do not question how you pop up so frequently.T2: Mistrust You gain a new use to deception. Sow Doubt - Roll a deception check after a few minutes of conversation (DC 10+creature's level). You can convince this creature that another creature has it out for them and seeks their downfall. They will always view what this creature does in the worst light possible, which can eventually cause great strife in the future.
This will stay the case until someone can use the Detect Intrusive Presence feature of insight (DC 10+your deception bonus). Usually someone only gets a check who is familiar that notices this unusual behavior.For creatures who are close to one another, such as family, friends or allies, the DC increases. Usually only +2 for people they see in a positive light, +5 for allies and +10 for those closest to them.T3: Devil's in the Details (Su) You gain the ability to write magically binding Fiendish Pacts.

item.title: moogen
item.description: Moogen is the demon lord most often associated with death, darkness and murder. The forces of the Cataclysm will come busting down your door. Moogen's forces will watch you for days, waiting for when your death will have the most impact in inspiring fear and chaos in your family, town or society as a whole. The more impact the death has, the flashier it is and the longer it stains the memory of mortals, the better.Moogen's unique obsession with death has created a unique set of circumstances. Moogen is not a singular entity, but rather a position that can be taken by someone capable of outwitting, outmaneuvering and killing the current Moogen. Moogen delights in the constant dance of death that happens all around her as a result of the tasty allure of this lucrative opportunity.Because Moogen is more of a title, rather than a singular creature, the appearance can vary greatly, but a handful of features are passed down. Moogen always has the same type of white eyes with many circles within that seem to spiral and hypnotize. They always have enormous mouths capable of snapping open and devouring a creature of equal size whole. When undercover, the mouth in excess is covered in skin, but usually it is only partly covered in skin, making it appear as though Moogen has multiple mouths.BoonsT1: Shadow in the Night (Su) You are constantly under the effects of Night Crawler. It grants darkvision and does not consume the buff tag.T2: Born in Darkness (Su) Absorb light around you, lowering the light level of spaces you occupy by 1 level (bright to dim, dim to dark). You can toggle this ability on or off 1/turn as a free action.T3: Shadow Blending (Su) You do not need cover or concealment to hide in any dim light or darkness, even against creatures with night vision and dark vision, though not while being directly observed.

item.title: README
item.description: The entities that have the largest degree of influence over the Demon Realm. To say they rule over it would be giving them too much credit. The demon realm is a disgusting and dangerous twisted realm that is beyond control. The demon lords tend to spend a lot more time focused on the mortal realm, always looking to spread their influence among mortals willing to eat the forbidden fruit. In particular many spend a lot of time in their mortal forms to blend in and mingle with mortals, delivering their sales pitch directly to the ears of their would-be followers.Demon lords are themselves demons, but they break the mold, bending the rules of what the typical demon can and can't do. They can transform other creatures into demons against their will, reproduce on their own, teleport long distances and create portals to other realms, among other things atypical of lesser fiends.

item.title: life-after-death
item.description: When a person dies in the world of Nack, their soul separates from their body and is quickly pulled down into the Underworld. Most people plunge into the Styx immediately, losing all sense of self and becoming an amorphous unrecognizable spirit before washing up on a line in front of Hades' desk. Depending on the type of life they lived, they are sent to different areas of the Underworld. Many are given tasks to perform, the most popular of which are record keeping and patrolling the halls for those who would steal Hades' treasure or try to escape the Underworld.Particularly strong-willed people are able to resist the pull towards the Styx for a bit longer, and are able to maintain most of their appearance, albeit a bit more ghostly. Creatures that curry favor with Hades are given access to the bodies they had in life and are still privy to many of their core memories.Any and all attempts at resurrection show up on Hades' desk after the fact, and he decides how he wants to approach them on a case by case basis. Acts performed by other gods are out of his control, but noted for future dealings. Every instance of resurrection is considered a debt that must eventually be repayed. Sometimes when creatures cheat death, Hades will instruct his followers to hunt them down.

item.title: README
item.description: Hades is the god of the dead, and the dutiful arbiter of the underworld. Hades and those who work under him attend to the souls of the dead, carefully cataloguing and maintaining records of any souls that pass through the underworld and river Styx. Hades is an entity that his job very seriously, and has strict rules that apply to any inhabitants. He is often worshiped by initiate necromancers, much to his dismay. Hades despises necromancy, as it only causes problems for him. More adept necromancers understand the ire their activities bring to him, and tread lightly when around those his worshipers.Hades is a massive humanoid with long dark hair and an exceptionally long mustache. Clad in the bones of the fallen, he wears a crimson toga and covers himself in other forms of regalia such as gold and jewels.BoonsT1: YT2: YT3: You

item.title: the-underworld
item.description: The Underworld is a physical location in the mortal realm, though its entrance is never something that stays in the same place for very long. Usually when too many people catch wind of its location, Hades will change it to another location. The entirety of the Underworld is Hades' domain, and he takes great care to make sure that he does not get unwanted guests, and that people do not escape.The underworld is split up into several parts.The River Styx in omnipresent throughout the Underworld. Wherever you stand, you can always see it snaking through the terrain. The entire Underworld is shaped around this mystical river. The liquid that flows through it changes based on the region of the Underworld. Pure in Elysium, lava in Asphodel and a crimson blood-like liquid in most other places.Exposure to the waters of the Styx has a variety of effects that depend on circumstances. Creatures who have lived exceptionally long lives are particularly resistant to the effects of the Styx while younger creatures are wiped clean very quickly. Taking a sip from the waters will not get rid of much but taking a plunge for just a minute can wipe away years of life. Typically more important memories are more resistant to the power of the Styx: Childhood memories, cherished loved ones, sense of self and important deeds.Starting from the entrance/exit is the precipice. Guarding the exit is the mighty three-headed beast Cerberus, standing as the Underworlds eternal guardian. He freely allows creatures to enter, but never allows them to leave. The precipice largely consists of twisted caves where the River Styx snakes around. Spirits of the dead often linger in the precipice as long as their will allows before inevitably passing through the Styx and washing up in front of Hades' desk. Creatures from the mortal realm wander into the Precipice quite frequently, filling its halls with beasts or mischievous creatures who like to desecrate Hades' altars and commune with lost spirits to lead them astray. This region.This region.This regio

item.title: frogg-saran
item.description:
Frogg Saran is chaos incarnate. He is known to give blessings and curses in equal measure. Frogg Saran is a very active force in the world of Nack, worming his way into many people's lives whether they like it or not. All this god seeks is to increase the amount of entropy in the universe. His followers start riots and revolutions merely to change the status quo. They reincarnate people for the lulz, just to see the reaction to their new body.Frogg Saran's odd fixation on the rubbery amphibious creature causes frogs to be revered by his followers. Special care should be taken when interacting with any frog or frog-adjacent creature, or risk unwittingly getting dragged into the machinations of this mad god. You never know when what looks like an ordinary frog could be a lunatic, or worse yet, Frogg himself in disguise.The true form of Frogg Saran is unknown, though many suspect his true form is that of a smug frog, save for its eyes are replaced with gnashing maws. It is a common way he appears before mortals, but with other common occurrences being cheese and tentacles, some depict him as an otherworldly aberration, or a rodent..{% hint style="info" %} Because it is possible to have faith in Frogg with negative wisdom, he never reliably answers prayers. But when he does answer prayers, they are typically in unexpected ways, and tend to be useful in ways other than providing advice.This could mean the place you are looking for suddenly explodes, the handsome fellow you were interested in talking to reveals they are a homosexual, or a frog will lead the way.In any such case, the advice/assistance comes in a much more dramatic and roundabout way. {% endhint %}BoonsT1: Frog Shape (Su) [poly, true] As a standard action you can assume the form of a tiny frog. You can transform back as a free action. Gain the following qualities… T2: Born Again Believer (Su) You can innately cast reincarnate 1/day. When you cast reincarnate, you gain access to a random innate technique that you can use once. While you have this technique, you lose access to reincarnation. After you expend the technique, you regain access to reincarnation. See chart below for determining what technique you gain.
Using this technique as it is intended, AKA, not using it just to cycle to a new one, gives you 100 GBP. You cannot use this to farm GBP passively during down time. Up to DM interpretation what qualifies as "intended use." Usually it involves using the technique in combat, or if a utility effect, in an apt scenario, such as using sending to communicate with a random person you met today with a cryptic message.T3: Forbidden Knowledge You can expend a use of prayer in order to find out forbidden lore concerning a creature you can see. Choose a random creature within 30 ft of you and then roll serendipity. The higher the roll, the more pertinent the information. This knowledge is always presented in a numerical format such as "2 kings killed" for important/secret high roll info or "0 dogs pet" for low impact knowledge.When you truly believe, you are rewarded. Roll on this chart to see what technique tree, then roll d6 until you get a technique level you have access to. Then roll another dice in a similar method to determine what technique in that tier (something like a d10 should usually suffice).Ex. I roll 12 and get Cataclysm. Then I roll d6 and get 6, but I'm only level 5 and don't have access to tier 6 techniques. I roll d6 again and get a 1. I roll d8 and get a 1, giving me access to the 5G technique.

item.title: mother-earth
item.description:
Mother Earth is the god of all things untamed and natural. She is the oldest of all deities. It is said that she was the entity that created the realm of mortals. A piece of her exists inside of all living things. As such, she has no true domain. But there are locations where life is at its most dense that are considered sacred, like lush rain forests, coral reefs and the valleys between forested mountains. Many see Mother Earth as a benevolent force, but she is primarily an entity that seeks balance between sentient creatures and the rest of the world. Many great tragedies have happened to people in the past when mankind overstepped its boundaries: Floods, earthquakes and storms the likes of which the world is better off never seeing again. These stories and their lessons are passed down through those studying under the druidic arts so that way such tragedies can be prevented from happening again.She is often depicted as a resting land mass, the bends of her shoulders, knees and hips creating mountains. While out and about, she is humanoid in shape, thought she appears to be entirely composed of lush green vegetation.PanoBoonsT1: Friend of the Forest (Su) You can expend a use of prayer to pacify a beast or plant creature. If used out of combat, you can usually cause it to run off or generally be okay with your presence. If used in combat, it is a standard action, and inflicts the pacified condition for 1 round automatically.Alt T1 Boon: Spirit Animal (Su) [poly, true] You can expend a use of prayer to transform into a specific terrestrial or aquatic beast that must be chosen when you gain this boon. You can only transform into this beast. The transformation lasts until you end it. You can exit this form as a swift action.T2: The Forest has Ears (Su) [scrying] You can touch a living tree as a standard action, and project your sense of hearing into another tree within 100 ft of it, even one you cannot see.T3: Nature's Vigilance (Sp)
You can innately cast Voice of the Forest once a week. As part of speaking, you can choose to manifest your spirit as visible aspect of the earth mother, allowing her to speak through you instead of the usual effects.

item.title: README
item.description: Those that reside directly in the realms of mortals. Their domains tend to be much smaller and can often be physically visited, with the potential to even meet the deity in person.

item.title: shroomlette
item.description: The Shroomlette is the shroomkin god of happiness, rest and fertility. One of the few gods that exists in the realm of mortals. Her domain is a garden filled with all kinds of oddities that rests on the clouds above a mushroom forest. There she resides, forever resting in a shiny cradle, waiting to be tucked in by a visitor. The Garden is commonly used as a place of mediation since all forms of violence are forbidden within the domain of the Shroomlette.The Shroomlette is an entity that represents the bond between gooms, a breed of squishy draconic creatures, and shroomkin, a race of people with close ties to fey creatures and mushrooms. These two entities live in tandem with each other with one main goal: increase the quantity of happiness in the world. The tactics they use to do so is to subdue creatures that decrease happiness and physically change the world around them to make it a better place to live.BoonsT1: Form of Baby (Su) [poly, true] You can transform into a tiny baby version of yourself. You are unable to attack, cast spells, speak etc. Your movement is reduced to a crawl of 10ft. You can transform into a baby or revert to your original form as a standard action.T2: Bubble Blowing Double Baby (Su) You can innately cast Bubble at will. It does not have the concentration tag. You can make the bubbles into any shape you desire.Whenever you blow any type of bubble, you can carefully shape it to make bubble art.T3: (Su) You

item.title: brazzerian-purification
item.description: The art of purification involves turning a fiend into mortal form, purging them of their inherently sinful natures. To do this requires a lot of time and effort to be successful. The bare minimum required in order to conduct the ritual is... Mana. 100*(creature's lvl)^2. (1=100, 2=400, 3=900...12=14,400) Proficiency in planes. The creature's name before it transformed. With all of the above ingredients, you can draw the magic circles required, power it, and initiate the ritual. The person in charge of performing the ritual rolls a DC 17 luck check to guess the creature's true name: A word in an ancient tongue meant to represent who a person is at the core of their soul. If successful, then it transforms into a hellion. If it fails, it is evaporated, leaving only a silhouette and any of its gear/clothing behind.Because this is such a slim chance of success, and creatures only get one shot, Brazzerian priests have done a great deal of research on how to improve the likelihood of a rituals success. Each of the below things can improve odds, adding additional bonuses to the luck check. (+1) Double the mana cost. This can stack, but it must be doubled each time. (+2) Convince the creature to be willing to transform, usually requiring appealing the the creatures ethos. (Up to +3) Have detailed information on who the creature was in life. Major things, like events they regret, cherished family/friends, major accomplishments contribute more. (Up to +3) Have items significant to what the creature was in life. Items like childhood treasures, wedding rings and signature weapons/armor contribute more. (+2) Perform ritual in sanctified area. Such areas are rare instances where Brazzeria has visited the realm of mortals to perform miracles, and are closely guarded treasures. Other things can add to the bonus that aren't listed here as appropriate.In very rare instances, creatures can be born fiends, such as when they are the child of a demon lord. Such fiends ignore most of the aforementioned rules: They can automatically succeed on the ritual if they are willing, and it always fails if they are not.Their changes tend to be less dramatic, allowing them to maintain most aspects of their fiendish form and powers, making them very rare catches for Brazzerians.

item.title: README
item.description: Her Smoliness the Goddess Brazzeria is the goddess of redemption, often revered by the Hellion her followers create. Brazzeria is unique in that she and her followers can see the good in all but the most depraved of souls. More importantly, they also believe such creatures can be saved. They often form close intimate and personal relationships with people and creatures that many find unsavory. Combine that with their tendency towards acceptance of sexual deviancy and Brazzeria has a mixed reputation.Regardless of what mortals think, the immortal fiends of the world fear Brazzerian priests and priestesses more than anything. Brazzerian missionaries will travel to the fiendish infestations in the world to capture as many as possible for conversion, even traveling into the demon realm itself to keep a steady flow of purification rituals.Brazzeria is depicted as a light-skinned, small catgirl with feathered wings. Her skin typically covered in tattoos of gold and milky yellow. She wears minimal clothing, preferring to wear the coif portion of a nun's habit, and an ill fitting one that allows her golden hair to spill out of it. Outside of that she wears stockings and sleeve warmers, leaving censorship fairies to cover up the rest.BoonsT1: Fiends are Friends (Su) You get advantage on persuasion checks made against fiends.You can expend a use of prayer to get a general sense of distance and direction of the highest concentration of fiends within 100 miles. This prayer takes 1 minute.By succeeding on a planes check, or touching a fiend, you can tell if its soul/psyche is too shattered to be redeemed. This is most common in monstrous fiends, or amalgamations of souls.T2: Introductions (Su) With physical contact, you can automatically tell what a creatures real name is, if it has one. Intimate touch, such as kissing or...wrestling...gives you a nugget of info, as though you used the Psychic Reading spell.T3: Beyond Corruption You cannot be dominated by fiends.Any types of corrupting effects, such as curses, afflictions or other DM magic have no effect on you if they originate from a fiend. Below are some methods to gaining GBP specific to Brazzeria

item.title: README
item.description: Those that typically reside in realms deemed higher than the realms of mortals. These realms have a greater degree of order and prosperity than most others, with some variety in appearance and structure depending which god calls it their domain.

item.title: invoking-deities
item.description: Deities can give their favor in specific ways, but invoking their name can give you a more general boon. Whenever you would perform a task that falls in line with the god's ethos, goals or tenets, you can choose to invoke their name as a free action. This could mean a contest of strength for The Cataclysm, a persuasion check made against a fiend for Brazzeria, or a survival check to track down a hunter exterminating wildlife for Mother Earth. The DM is the final arbiter to decide if your request is answered. When you invoke a deity, you expend a use of prayer and gain a d8 to any single d20 roll (minus something like a random chart).If you invoke and your deity disapproves, you lose that use of prayer, and you get an impression of why your request for aid failed. You can only invoke a deity that you have curried favor for in most circumstances. When you invoke, you cannot do so again for 1 minute.

item.title: README
item.description: The gods of have a vested interest in the goings on in the world of mortals, and what better way to get mortals to do your bidding then to give them your favor when they act in your interest? This system is designed to provide active incentives for characters to enact the will of the deities in the world: the more that you please a god with your actions, follow their tenets and donate to their causes, the more favor they grant to you.The amount of favor that the gods provide to you is broken up into tiers. The first tier only grants minor boons. Trying to gain the favor of multiple gods only makes all of them hate you more: pick one and stick to it.In general, you cannot earn the favor of a god by accident. In all but the most extreme cases, such as defeating the mortal enemy of a god, you must first learn about a deity to start gaining their favor. As such you cannot start accruing GBP until speaking with priests, cultists or froggs to learn more about what the gods desire.The tier a favor that you're at is determined by the amount of God Benediction Points (GBP) you earn through various tasks. Gods typically have more specific things they like, but common things to increase your GBP include:

item.title: other-skill-rules
item.description: Taking 10When not under duress, you can take 10 on skill checks. You normally cannot take 10 on opposed skill checks. Good for profession and general crafting.Taking 20When not under duress, and with a lot of time on your hands, you can automatically achieve the result of rolling a 20. It takes 20 times as long as the task would normally take. It is also assumed that during this time, you fail several times, making it ill-suited for a situations where there are consequences on a fail (such as smashing a wall or deactivating an explosive).Group Skill ChecksIn certain circumstances, creatures may want to work together perform the same task. If it is something that can tangibly benefit from group effort (pushing over a large boulder, creating a spell etc.), use the bonus of the creature with the highest modifier, then get +1 for each assisting creature and +2 for each assistant creature that is proficient in the task at hand.In other circumstances, you may want to use skills as a group when you need to, even if it less than optimal, such as group stealth with a clumsy heavy armor user. In such scenarios, you use the bonus of the weakest link as though everybody were assisting them.GambitsUsing a rule system inherently poses limitations on the actions that a player can take. The idea of gambits is to let players take their cool ideas and let them play out despite the games mechanics. If your player wants to do something that isn't necessarily covered by the rules (or only vaguely), then it counts as a gambit.The intention behind gambits is to create situations that have incredibly high risk and high reward. Before performing a gambit, the player tosses out a few ideas on how they plan to perform the action and the GM makes suggestions and/or adjustments based on circumstance. The GM should make it clear to the player what their roundabout odds are for completing a given gambit.Benefits for performing a gambit can include things like not taking fall damage with a plunging attack, gaining extra movement by swinging on things through danger or surviving otherwise deadly circumstances.Drawbacks for failing when attempting a gambit can include things like being CC'd, losing poise, losing hp or having their actions interrupted and made impossible. In extreme cases if players do something very silly, like jumping up cliffs or battling forces of nature, they may accumulate afflictions, or other long lasting debuffs.

item.title: example-dcs
item.description: Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include… >Things such as the surfaces you interact with are moving or are wet. >Surfaces you interact with are patchy or broken. Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include >Guard rails (natural or manufactured) >Appropriate equipment, such as a long object for balance

item.title: README
item.description: Used for making risky jumps, traversing difficult terrain, and avoiding AoOs. Most actions are made as part of movement. Uses dex.BalanceAcrobatics can be used to cross slippery surfaces coated in things like ice or oil. The DC is 10. Failing the check give you the knocked down condition until the start of your next turn. It can also be used to traverse or stand on incredibly small and unstable space such as a cliff side or a fallen tree branch.JumpYou can also roll acrobatics to determine your jump distance/height to see if you can jump farther than your default jump distance. The distance you jump is equal to your acrobatics roll in feet, or half that in height. This still requires a swift action to perform.IF you are proficient in acrobatics, your default jump distance is increased by points in dex or str.Jumping does not increase your speed, and is thus limited by your movement speed.Wall Kick (P)As long as there are 2 walls within 5 feet of each other, you can continually hop between them to ascend. Only the upward distance you cover counts against your movement.Avoid AoO (P)Acrobatics is rolled against all threatening creatures’ reflex saves. The DC of their reflex save is equal to your acrobatics roll. If they succeed, you provoke as normal.Soften FallWhen you take the jump action, you reduce falling damage by your acrobatics roll.Excuse meYou can move through creature spaces without provoking from said creature, but you cannot end your turn inside of a creature's space. Strafing no longer provokes AoOs.HoppingYou can jump as a free action once each turn.

item.title: breaking-objects
item.description: Should we push over the tree or just cut it down? Players may find themselves in situations where it is unclear whether it would be more effective to just hack at their problem with their swords or try to break it open with brute strength. A lot of that depends on what it is you're trying to break and what it is you're using to break it.As a general rule, if the substance that you're using is more tough, and could reasonably damage the object you'd like to destroy (hammers aren't good at cutting ropes for instance) then you can damage/break the object just by swinging at it. Some consideration should still be taken about the size and scale of the object. Adamantine might cut through stone like butter, but a 3-ft thick stick of butter would still take quite a bit of effort to cut through.Use the following chart to determine roundabout how "tough" something is.

item.title: example-dcs
item.description: Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include… >The surfaces you are interacting with are wet or moving. >You are swimming in substances other than water that are more grimy or viscous >Extra reinforcements to enhance the structural soundness and prevent breakage Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include >You are climbing at a >90 degree angle, or the surface was designed to be climbed >Flotation devices (driftwood, floaties) >Age or fundamental flaws/weaknesses in the structure How much of something you want to destroy can also influence how difficult it is. If you want to tear a brick out of a wall, that would make breaking the stone easier. If you want to break down the entire wall, that is much more difficult.

item.title: README
item.description: Used for climbing and swimming, as well as moving heavy objects and breaking things. Uses str.ClimbAssuming ideal climbing conditions, no check is required, such as when climbing an average tree. Spaces you climb through are considered difficult terrain. With athletics proficiency, you climb at full speed.SwimAssuming ideal climbing conditions, no check is required, such as when swimming in still water. Spaces you swim through are considered difficult terrain. With athletics proficiency, you swim at full speed.Brute ForceFor when there are no lockpicks or beasts of burden, you have elbow grease. The DC to break open a door is based on its material and reinforcements. You can also use athletics to represent bursts of adrenaline that allow you to surpass your normal carry weight to push over statues and punch boulders into lava.Catch Fall (P)As an immediate action, you can attempt to grab onto something to halt your falling, or to prevent an ally within reach from falling. The default DC to do this is 20. Creatures falling farther than 30 feet increase this DC even higher.Aquatic Combatant (P)With athletics proficiency, you take no penalty to fighting underwater with melee weapons.TriathleteYou gain an additional 20 speed each turn you can use to climb and swim.Power LifterIncrease carry weight by 100.

item.title: example-dcs
item.description: Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include… >The event was specifically wiped from history, or the records of it are largely destroyed/kept secret >The text/piece you are examining is missing significant chunks >The event/entity was of little significance Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include >You have a specific cultural significance to this history, or you were a local who lived through the era >The text/piece you are examining is in pristine condition, or based on a language you know >The event/entity was of great significance

item.title: README
item.description: Tell StoryYou can use your vast knowledge pool to weave together important threads in history, making for a story that is both entertaining and informative.Identify ArtifactCertain items may be tied to creatures or entities from the past. By identifying the craftsmanship and symbols on items, you can determine their origin/purpose.Interpret HieroglyphsAncient people often like to communicate without using the written word. You can interpret the meaning or significance in paintings, carvings, murals, statues and the like.Recall Past EventsMajor battles, great tragedies and turning points in civilization are all of interest to a historian. With some kind of prompting, you can recall information related to these events dating back tens, hundreds or even thousands of years.Recall Prominent FiguresThere are some names that withstand the test of time due to their accomplishments, inventions and atrocities. With some kind of prompting, you can recall details about specific people, creatures or cultures. This can include things such as their names, species, class, nicknames, organizations etc.

item.title: example-dcs
item.description: Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include… >Unable to interact with object (smell, taste, touch, as appropriate for substance)Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include >Guides, handbooks and sketches

item.title: README
item.description: Identify Natural PhenomenonYou know about natural processes like photosynthesis, the reproduction of creatures, and tectonic activity. You can do things like figuring out if a volcano is about to erupt, what could be causing plants to die or how long until an egg hatches.Identify Elements of NatureIf it doesn't have a stat block and it isn't man-made or magic, then it probably falls under natural element. Nature allows you to identify animal behavior. It also lets you identify types of plants and minerals and their uses/dangers. It also allows you to tell if something is unnatural.Identify WeatherPredict the weather, usually only for the day, but with higher checks, even farther into the future. You can also tell if these effects are naturally occurring or created by something unusual like magic.

item.title: alchemy
item.description: Identify Potion/Poison (creation DC)With a quick wiff or taste, you can determine the effects of an alchemical substance.Reverse Engineer (creation DC+5)You can take an unfamiliar substance and learn what it's made out of with the intention of creating it again in the future. A success indicates that you managed to write down the necessary ingredients and processes to create the item in the future.Create Alchemical Item (DC varies) Alchemy can make all kinds of different things: common things include healing wounds, inflicting wounds, preventing sickness, adhesives, solvents, starting fires, temporary adaptations. Uncommon things include cloning and permanent transformations.All found under the equipment tab.

item.title: arcana
item.description: Identify Spell Being Cast (DC 15+spell lvl, no action) You must be able to clearly see or hear the creature in order to identify a spell that they are casting. Useful for determining whether or not you want to dispel something, or figuring out what spell a creature cast that has no immediate visible effect.Identify Active Spell (DC 10+spell lvl, free action 1/turn)You examine the magical effect to determine what spell it is, and what the spell does.Identify Magic Properties of Item (DC=Craft DC, +10 if cursed, standard action) You learn all of the qualities of a magic item that you are adjacent to.

item.title: cryptozoology
item.description: Legendary CreaturesUsing a name or a basic description as a prompt, you can recall legends of ancient, powerful or noteworthy creatures.Such creatures usually have tales that have been written about them, or have stories that have been passed down that you can recount. Uses the "relevancy to the world" DC of (22-lvl).Identify HoaxYou can use cryptozoology in place of insight to glean if a creature is deceiving you or exaggerating details about the description of a creature they have encountered or heard about through word of mouth.What do they want?Creatures from the stars often have very strange interests in the mortal world. If you succeed on a monster lore check against such a creature, you also learn about its interests in the world, such as requiring humanoids to reproduce or a keen interest in bovines.You can also glean this information from witnessing the phenomenon itself. Using the same DC as monster lore, you can witness cattle kidnapping or host infections and glean what type of creature is doing itAstronomyGenerally, cryptozoology can be used as a substitute for any kind of scientific research with regards to space, such as astronomy and astrophysics.

item.title: engineering
item.description: Identify FunctionIdentify the purpose of particularly complex machinery. Depending on the size and scope of what you're looking at, this could only be a glance, or it could require a few minutes, and usually requires a hands-on approach.HackingWhere there exists technology, there exists a method to disable or gain control of it, even if only temporarily. Hacking always requires a hands-on approach.Structural QuirkLarge scale buildings such as castles, watchtowers, walls, factories, prisons etc. Are all built with specific purposes, facilities and defenses in mind. You can use engineering to figure out aspects of these buildings like where exhaust/waste pipes lead, how far underground you might need to take to go underneath the structure, structural weaknesses etc.

item.title: local
item.description: Recall CustomsWhen dealing with foreign cultures, you can recall information about how to conduct yourself. This can be particularly useful when trying to gain someone's favor, such as royalty. You can also recall information about holidays, festivals and ceremonies.Recognize Name/FaceYou can attach a name to a face, or vice versa. You generally understand aspects of this creatures reputation, their affiliations, their general capabilities etc. Exceptionally high rolls might even land you some secrets or gossip related to this creature.Recall Useful LocationsYou can recall the answer to a specific simple question such as "where can I buy potions?" Or "where does the royalty live?" Or "where can I hire someone to build something?" Something along those lines. These questions can be applied to the town you're in or with a higher DC, something much bigger like a country or continent.

item.title: planes
item.description: Identify Portal (DC 10)In the presence of a portal, you can tell where its destination plane is. Rolling higher can give more specific locations, more details about the portals creation and how often it gets used.Find Portal Location (DC 30)Portals are strange phenomenon that tend to come and go, but there are signs that they exist miles away from where the portal is actually located.Disable/Destroy Portal (DC 30)A task that is very difficult by one's self. Failure could mean getting stuck on the wrong side of the portal or hyper charging the portal to attract extraplanar creatures.

item.title: README
religion
item.description: It is assumed that if you are of a specific religion, you can do many of these things without rolling for your own faith.Identify Religious Symbol (DC 10)Followers of gods often wear regalia, use specific types of seals and put their gods symbol on their stuff. Sometimes just by looking at a building or a person you can tell where their religious affiliations lie.Recall Tenets (DC 15)When prompted by specific actions, you can tell whether or not these actions align with the deity in question. Good for finding fakers or guiding the faithful with poor memory.Accrue GBP (DC 15)You can figure out what kinds of things would appease a specific deity and earn you GBP.Identify Chosen (DC 20)Gods will often play favorites when it comes to specific people, peoples or items/places when deciding who will receive their blessing.

item.title: languages
item.description: Common Languages Racial languages Uncommon languages Secret languages

item.title: README
item.description: The lawyer skill that gets languages as a bonus. Uses int.Interpret TextYou peruse a book, contract or other written work to quickly summarize what it says in one minute. The DC for most works is 10, but it changes based on the size and complexity of the work at hand. Failure indicates more time is necessary to understand what the text contains. Finding oddities in a contract requires an opposed linguistics check.Polyglot (P)With proficiency in linguistics you gain a new language for every level you have, and every new level you gain.Write/Forge Official Documents (P)Make contracts, forge signatures and make (fake?) documents look official. Noticing oddities in such documents requires an opposed linguistics check.Encode/Decode (P)You can write things in ways that are difficult to interpret without a cipher, such as disguising your forbidden ritual as a cookbook. The DC to your code is 11+(linguistics bonus). Creatures that know the code can read encoded text, but creatures that don't interpret the text as something else. To read encoded text, you must first crack the code, usually requiring at least a week of research. At the end of the week, roll a linguistics check versus the writer’s DC to crack the code.Cliff's NotesYou can summarize 10 pages of written text per one minute of reading.Secret?You can select secret languages as bonus languages. Immediately gain 1 when you acquire signature skill.Read LipsWith a clear view of a creature's face, you can understand what the creature is saying as long as you understand the language they are speaking in.

item.title: dice-vs-roleplay
item.description: Persuasion is one of those skills where you can reasonably skip past lots of dialogue in order to get the desired result more quickly and efficiently. However, this is a role-playing game. So regardless of how big someones persuasion bonus is, no matter the suggestion, you must persuade something someone could conceivably be willing to do on their own, in the right circumstances.On the opposite end, even if you do not possess the persuasion skill, you might still be able to convince an NPC of something if you present the right information in the right circumstances. A gruff pirate might not be interested in a -1 cha fighter, but if he says he knows where treasure is the pirate has been hunting for decades, that can change his mind.Tl;dr Role-play and dice are 2 different tools to acquire the same result, each with their own benefits and drawbacks. Neither should be dismissed as nonviable and one should not be required in order to succeed at the other.

item.title: example-dcs
item.description: Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include… >Racism >Your questions/requests are offensive or closely guarded secrets >You are not well liked by the person/people you are persuading Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include >You are well liked by the person/people you are persuading >You hold a position of authority over the person/people you are persuading >The information you are looking for is well known or noteworthy

item.title: README
item.description: Convincing others to do things with your words. Uses cha.PersuadeWhen you ask something of someone, such as information or aid, they may be on the fence about whether or not they should answer and persuasion gets them to your side. The difficulty of the check is based on how well you know the person, how difficult the request is and what the consequences of telling you might be.Even if you do persuade someone to do something, it may come with caveats such as favors or payment.Gather information (P)When in a settlement, you can roll persuasion to find the answer to a simple question by speaking to people in town. The time it takes and the difficulty scales with the size of the settlement, people's general attitude toward you and how knowledgeable they are on the subject. Asking about where someone lives in a village could take minutes, but asking in a large city could take hours.Mercy Breeds CooperationWhen you defeat a foe, you can instead choose to give it the time out condition for 1 hour.ContactYou always know at least a few places in town drifters are welcome. The time to gather information is always less than 10 minutes.

item.title: README
item.description: The day to day things that need to be done when out and about adventuring far from home in the wilderness. Uses wis.NavigationYou can attempt to not travel in circles when moving through unfamiliar territory. Failure indicates that a lesser amount of progress is made towards reaching your destination, or arriving at an unintended destination.Extract ResourcesYou can skin creatures, extract organs/fluids and other resources from recently killed creatures. This usually takes 1 minute. You get an amount of value equal to (10+the creature's lvl). Particularly dangerous or delicate operations require proficiency and a survival check (usually 10+creature's level), with higher value multipliers. A failed attempt represents the resources being destroyed.Live off the Land (P)Characters proficient in survival can sustain themselves and 4 other creatures in environments with suitable sources of food and water.Tracking (P)You can attempt to follow footprints, broken branches, scent trails and other disturbed natural elements to figure out where a creature has been and where it’s going. With ideal conditions you can follow trails made days or even weeks ago (if you don't believe me, look at dino footprint fossils :^). The longer it's been since the creature has been there and the less ideal the conditions, the higher the DC.Sniff Them OutYou gain blindsense (scent 5 ft). If you already have scent, increase its range by 5 ft.Advanced TrackingYou can use survival to track creatures that fly and swim using scent, even if you aren't aquatic. It's harder to determine "ideal conditions" in these types of environments, so the DC is mostly based off of how long ago the creature was present.

item.title: deception
