item.description: Simply put, lying. This skill is almost always opposed to insight. Uses cha.Convince TruthSpeak falsehoods to cover your ass or to soften the truth.Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include… >The person you are deceiving witnessed events you are lying about firsthand >The claims you are making are incredibly outlandish or outright impossible (angels and demons are the same, the sky is green) >The person you are deceiving is knowledgeable on the subject matter.Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include >The person you are deceiving is inattentive. They are sleepy, drunk or in a hurry >The person you are deceiving is a friend or close allyFeintIn place of an attack, roll deception against a creature within reach. DC (10+lvl) or (10+creatures insight bonus) whichever is higher. If successful, your opponent is DD. They are unable to make AoOs against you or take immediate or instant actions in response to your actions. These benefits last until the end of your turn.Create DiversionAs a standard action, you can shout something at your enemies to briefly get them to look the other way so you can give them the slip. Out of all creatures currently attending you, roll deception against the creature with the highest insight. If you succeed, you are able to roll stealth and people don't know where you went. This does not prevent people from being unable to find you again using perception.Convey Secret Message (P)By speaking in roundabout terms and making subtle gestures, you can communicate a simple idea (we need to leave, time to strike) while in company that might scrutinize. The DC to convey this message is 15. The intended recipient automatically understands the message. For anybody else listening, its insight DC to read between the lines is (10+your deception bonus).Sucker Punch (P)If you are in some kind of standoff where you aren't quite fighting your enemy yet, you can use this skill as a replacement for stealth to surprise your enemy with a melee attack. The enemy must be aware of you in order sucker punch, otherwise it is stealth. If you don't use an unarmed strike then you have disadvantage on this check.Certain situations where you are not able to get close to your aggressors, such as having bows pointed at you on from a garrison above you, make sucker punching impossible.EnigmaYou have advantage on saving throws against effects that would read your thoughts or otherwise pry into your mind. InceptionConvince a creature that one of your ideas is their own idea. By speaking with a creature over the course of a few minutes you can plant an idea in their mind that they then act on as if it was their own. You take a -10 penalty to your deception check vs their insight.

item.title: disguise
item.description: Pretend to be someone you’re not. Rolled against perception. Uses cha.Craft DisguiseSpend 10 minutes perfecting your makeup, outfit and wig to appear as a playable race you're not. Disguise checks are usually unnecessary unless you fall under scrutiny, the person knows you/what you're pretending to be or you're trying to enter an exclusive club. Creatures get bonuses to their perception if they know you or what you're disguised as particularly well.You take a -2 penalty to disguise checks when you try to change your race and when you change your apparent gender. When you initiate a disguise, you tell your DM your bonus, they apply any appropriate modifiers and roll it in secret.Crafting a disguise without a disguise kit or magic imposes a -5 penalty.Impressionist (P)Creatures proficient in the disguise skill have the ability to alter their voice significantly. If a creature can’t see you (or while you are disguised), you can pretend to sound like someone else whose voice you have heard, or something more exotic like an animal. If a creature sees you and the voice is a mismatch, then they will quickly see through obvious facades, but can potentially be used to misdirect.Zero to HeroYou can change your disguise into something completely different as a FRA. If someone was looking for you, they automatically get a check to see through your disguise if they see you again.Costume ExpertYou no longer take a penalty to disguise when changing your race or gender.You can now use disguise to pretend to be a monstrous creature (skeleton, phoenix, giant). These disguises tend to be very bulky and impractical. You cannot do anything physically intensive while in such a disguise, such as acrobatics, athletics or combat without the disguise falling apart.

item.title: insight
item.description: When interacting with creatures, pick up on nonverbal cues and tone of voice to glean more information. Uses wis.Detect TruthWhenever a creature makes a statement, you can roll insight (opposed by deception) to see if what they say aligns with what they think. If you succeed, you determine that something is fishy. Prying further about the deception may cause the creature to reveal the truth or become hostile depending on context.If you roll this too often, your DM can silence you. No using insight multiple times on the same thing. Don’t be silly.Detect Intrusive Presence (P)You can use insight to determine when a creature is under duress from a spell or some other kind of effect that has a lasting impact on their mind, such as domination or possession. You must actively search for this by speaking with a creature for 1 minute. Roll insight vs the DC of the effect. If the effect has no DC, assume basic DC with cha as the modifier.Intrusive ThoughtsBy having a conversation with a creature for one minute, you can glean into their surface thoughts as you continue this conversation. Make an insight check with a -10 penalty, if you succeed you can read their surface thoughts for the remainder of the conversation.5 Steps AheadWhen a creature fails to feint you, they are feinted by you.

item.title: intimidation
item.description: Be spooky and coerce creatures. Uses the higher value of either your str, or your cha.DemoralizeAs a standard action, inflict shaken 1 on an enemy that can see or hear you within 30 feet. Must have line of sight. They roll a will save vs (10+your intimidation bonus). They are shaken as long as you are nearby, and for 1 minute after. You can demoralize a creature repeatedly to increase the penalty. If they pass their save, their shaken value decreases by 1.Coercion (P)By having a conversation with a creature that lasts at least one minute, or by defeating a creature in combat, you can shape how they respond to you or anybody asking about you in the future. The strength of this creature's conviction is dependent on your intimidation roll against it. You can make the creature keep their mouth shut about something you did to them. Any checks to gather information from this creature about you or your party change to this roll if it would be higher than the usual DC.You can greatly exaggerate what you did to further spread fear and grand tales of your strength. Any knowledge checks that creatures make on you when hearing about information that spreads from this creature changes to your intimidation roll if it would be higher than the usual DC, or else they learn false info.PTSD (P)You can permanently scar a creature so that your mere presence is enough to fill it with dread. Creatures you defeat in combat are automatically shaken 1 in your presence permanently. If you successfully demoralize a creature afflicted with PTSD, you can choose to increase their shaken penalty or make them frightened.Big ShotAny minion creature (a creature that is 1/3 your level or lower) is automatically shaken 1 while in combat with you.BooYou can demoralize a creature as a swift action.

item.title: medicine
item.description: Be a doctor in a world filled with people whose touch brings people back to life. Uses wis.Assess the WoundedA creature that is wounded can be examined to determine how they were injured, how long ago it happened and whether they are in grave danger of dying. This also functions on corpses. The more complex the ailment and the longer the duration since it happened, the higher the DC. Duration may reverse in scaling in the case of diseases, where more time passing makes the symptoms more obvious.Provide First Aid (P)As a standard action you can cure creatures of status ailments to a creature within reach. You can remove sickened stacks, bleed and blurred vision. The DC of removing any of these conditions is the DC of the ability that inflicted them. If they have no DC, then assume the class/offense trait DC. When you succeed in providing first aid to heal a condition, the creature heals 1 HP.Performing first aid without a first aid kit imposes a -5 penalty.Long Term Care (P)Resting under the care of a creature that is proficient in medicine lets you recover 1 drain every 3 days instead of every week. You also qualify for removing many types of afflictions, both physical and mental.Prevent Recovery (P)If you have defeated creatures in your custody that you don't want to be waking up at inconvenient times, you can choose to treat them so that way they do not naturally recover hp (including regen and FH). This requires a few minutes to perform, and lasts 24 hours.Identify Affliction or Curse (P)By spending a minute examining someone who suffers from an affliction or curse, you can determine its exact effects. You also know the exact method on how to cure the affliction or remove the curse.T1 afflictions have a DC of 5. +5 to DC for each tier.Curses have a DC of 10+spell lvl. If the effect was not a spell, then DC 10+(1/2 lvl of entity who inflicted curse).Improvised ImplementsYou take no penalty to medicine checks when you do not have a first aid kit. When you provide first aid, you heal 3 hp.Frankenstein's SecretsPermanent devastating effects to a creature's body, such as having a limb severed or an eye gouged out can now be healed with a DC 30 check. Provided the wound is fresh and the body part is intact. Failure inflicts drained 2 and destroys the body part.Band-Aid FixYou can provide first aid as a swift action.

item.title: perception
item.description: {% hint style="info" %} All creatures are considered proficient in perception, unless they are mindless. Uses wis. {% endhint %}Perception is the mechanism through which players can notice the unnoticed in the imagination game. Traps, hidden loot, secret entrances, unusual stimuli are a handful of the many things this skill is used for. Conditions such as bad weather and listening through walls can make perception difficult, or even impossible. Sleeping gives a -5 penalty.Detect Hidden PresenceOnce a round, by spending 15ft of movement, or a swift action, you can make a perception check to find hidden creatures/objects, or their general direction if they have total cover.One Eye Open You take no penalty to perception from sleeping. You perceive and remember things that happened around you while sleeping when you wake. You can choose to automatically wake up for any reason. You are not DD by default when asleep. Quick ScanYou can Detect Hidden Presence as a free action, but still only once per turn.

item.title: profession
item.description: The skill for the working class fellas. Defaults to wisdom, but see the experienced feature.RecallIf you are ever quizzed on particular aspects of a profession and you are not proficient, you must roll an intelligence check to answer correctly (DC 10 for most professions). Proficient creatures automatically know most aspects of their profession.Hard WorkEvery day you work, you earn money. See economics for more details. Your talent could be anything from music, to craftsmanship to working as an innkeeper.Experienced (P)You can select what ability score to use to determine your profession bonus for all your professions. Your given ability score colors the approach you have to your professions.??

item.title: sleight-of-hand
item.description: Pocket things while staying undetected. Quietly open locks and turn off dangerous devices. Uses dex.ThieveryIf a target is unaware of you or otherwise distracted, you can attempt to steal items loosely attached to their person or in their pockets. Rolled versus the perception of the individual. Anybody else vigilantly standing guard also gets a check with a penalty based on circumstance. You can also pilfer unattended objects, with anybody nearby or standing watch getting a check to notice your misdeeds. Objects that are in some way affixed to a creature, such as a sword in its hilt, take a -5 penalty to SoH when you try to steal them.Conceal Weapon (P)You can store light weapons in all kinds of places. As a swift action you can draw a concealed weapon to attack a creature with. If they fail a perception check vs your sleight of hand, they are DD this turn. If you're in a crowded area, or in some kind of standoff where you aren't quite fighting your enemy yet, you can even use this skill as a replacement for stealth to surprise your enemy. The enemy must be aware of you in order use a concealed weapon, otherwise it is stealth.Pick Lock (P)Open locked objects with a DC dependent on the complexity of the lock. Mages and very skilled locksmiths might have nearly impossible locks while common doors are child's play. The more difficult the DC, the longer it takes to open a lock, with an upper limit of 30 seconds. Failing a check has no consequences unless time is short or there are other security measures in place.Picking locks without thieves' tools imposes a -5 penalty.Disable DevicePressure plates and dangerous magic crystals are at your mercy if you’re able to get your hands on them if you notice them before you get roasted. You can temporarily or permanently disabled the dangerous dungeon decorations with a DC based on the complexity of the device. Simple tripwires are easy enough but a soul gem firing arcane bolts could be tricky. If you pass the DC by 5 or more, you can repurpose the trap to suit your needs. The more difficult the DC, the longer it takes to disable, with an upper limit of 30 seconds.Disabling devices without thieves' tools imposes a -5 penalty.Fast HandsYou can pick any lock and disable any devices as a FRA.Is....this your sword?You can steal sheathed and stored weapons at no penalty, and replace them with other items of similar size/shape.

item.title: stealth
item.description: Moving around while remaining unseen. If someone is looking for you in your immediate vicinity and you don't want to be seen, you roll stealth. Uses dex.Special: Stealth and sizeSize provides no numerical benefit or penalty. The only thing that size effects relative to stealth is your ability to gain cover: Larger creatures have a harder time figuring out places to hide, while smaller creatures find it very easy. Hide (immediate)As long as you have total cover, partial concealment or total concealment, you can attempt to hide from your enemies as an immediate action. You remain hidden until no longer have total cover/concealment, you cast a spell, use a special ability, attack or someone spots you with perception. When you attack a creature after successfully hiding from them, they are DD until the end of your turn.Pass Without Trace (P)Characters with stealth proficiency can travel without leaving an obvious trail behind. Attempts to track them suffer a -5 penalty.Dampen PresenceBlind sense does not function against you.StalkerUse stealth to trail someone without them noticing you. It is assumed that you keep your distance, only observing broad strokes what they do, but not things they say, write down etc. If you want to get a closer look to find such details, you take a -5 penalty to stealth.Using stealth to stalk people can potentially become impossible without first circumventing protections against spying.How often you roll stealth checks is determined by the situation, opposed by the creature you stalk. Some general examples…

item.title: README
item.description: {% hint style="info" %} All creatures are proficient in perception, unless they are mindless {% endhint %}Skill rolls are how players interact with the world without hitting it with their sword. Even if certain actions have a skill associated with them, you don't necessarily need to roll a skill check (no need to roll deception if they already believe you, no need to roll athletics in still water, etc). When one is required, it is prompted by the DM. D20 can be very swingy, creating dramatically unexpected results. That is its strong suite. As such using a skill roll as a barrier for entry can create all or nothing scenarios. There's nothing wrong with saying "the lock is too complex for you to pick," but you can't be upset when immediately after the martials of the party start smashing into the door. Just like with attack rolls and saving throws, there should be lesser versions of success. If you barely fail the DC to scale a wall, it lowers your speed instead of falling. If you barely fail a stealth check while trailing someone, they can tell someone is in the bushes, but not who. Skill bonuses by default only use the relevant ability modifier. Proficiency in a skill grants you a 2+(lvl) bonus to the skill. Certain aspects of a skill might only be available to characters that are proficient in the skill and are denoted with a (P) When you have multiple spells and/or items that give bonuses to skills, only take the highest bonus.Standard skill DCs are what should be used in the absence of a set or opposed DC. They are as follows… Some skills are opposed to other skills, while other skills will include examples comparable this chart.

README
item.description: Certain monster abilities, as well as the defeated condition, give permanent debuffs to characters. These debuffs represent physical/mental wear and tear beyond the catch-all of hp. The longer you are away from home, the more debuffs you are likely going to accrue.Debuffs universally MUST have some finite method of curing them. Many of them can be cured just by taking a day off: Spend a night at the local bar or brothel, spend time with family, visit a theme park etc. Others require something more specific. Debuffs come in tiers, the higher the tier, the greater the debuff.In the heat of combat, you do not gain the afflictions. Afflictions are accumulated after combat. Roll separately for each time you were defeated in combat.How do you decide what tier you get?Roll a luck check. If you roll below 1, you get a Tier 3 affliction. If you roll below 6, you get a Tier 2 affliction. Anything 6 or above and you get a T1 afflictionThe luck check gets a penalty to the roll equal to afflictions all added up. Tier 1 give a -1 penalty, Tier 2 gives -2 and T3 gives a -3 penalty.

item.title: abnormalities
item.description: Another feature that can help you decide if your character is a weirdo or not. If you want a relatively average character, don’t roll this.Roll a d20, then roll a d3. The d20 represents what feature is in question and the d3 represents whether the abnormality tends towards being positive (1) unusual (2) or negative (3). You can roll a few times to decide a few unusual features, decide you want a specific number of each feature, then roll a few d20s, or not roll at all.Depending on the race, some of the features described as weird or negative may actually be positive or completely normal. Some features may be completely absent from your race. An easy way to create a new negative feature is to completely remove or damage certain features (one eye).Feel free to go down the whole list if you're a mad lad (though the ladies might not appreciate some of the hair options)

item.title: age
item.description: Roll a d100. The result you get is the percentage of the way through your life essentially. Multiply this value by the average lifespan of your chosen race.Example - Human with a roll of 7570*.75=52 years oldMost races tend to be children for the first 20% or so of their life, so you can opt to be older if you don’t feel like being a kid.

item.title: height-weight
item.description: Roll a d20 and then flip a coin. The d20 represents the variance as a percentage and the coin flip decides up (heads) or down (tails).Example - Human are average 5'6 and weigh 150. I roll a 10 and get heads.66*1.1=72 in or 6 ft, 150*1.1=165 lbsIf you roll a 1 or a 20, you can choose to be ludicrously tall or smol.

item.title: README
item.description: For when you want to let fate decide what kind of character you are playing.

item.title: README
item.description: For every point of luck you possess, roll on this chart. Permanent increases to luck also include a bonus boon. You can roll multiple of the same result (for most results), but you can reroll if you aren't feeling like +15 hp is your thing.

item.title: resurrection-chart
item.description: When a character is resurrected, roll a d4. After that roll your respective chart. Characters with positive luck can decide to reroll their result. Characters with negative luck roll twice and have the DM decide what effect happens. Bad stuff Neutral Good Stuff

item.title: acid-splash
item.description: Your hand, or your staff/seal turn a sickly green color and start bubbling. You flick it towards a creature, making a ranged attack roll, and a sticky glob of caustic goo flies at them. Deals d4+CL (2+CL) poison damage. This damage happens again at the end of the creatures turn unless they are wet, or otherwise remove the acid through some kind of washing.

item.title: arcane-mark
item.description: You touch a surface and inscribe a symbol or a single word. The mark can be no larger than 4x4 inches.In order to use the spell on a creature, it must be willing, you must land an attack roll or you must make a successful sleight of hand check.Dispel magic automatically succeeds on an arcane mark.

item.title: audio-book
item.description: You touch a book, scroll or other form of writing and give the text a faint glow. As long as you could read the text normally and you concentrate, the text is automatically read out loud. It is in your voice in a language that you can speak.After casting the spell, you can leave and go about your business and the spell continues to work its magic. You can dictate a starting point, and the pages flip all on their own, highlighting the text as it is read.

item.title: catch-flame
item.description: A mote of flame manifests in an empty hand, or attached to a staff/seal. As part of casting the spell, you can blow this flame onto a creature within reach by making an attack roll. Does d10+CL (5+CL) fire damage. You can continue making more attacks by blowing on it again as a standard action each turn as long as the flame persists.You can also use this mote of flame to gently warm things, start fires and provide light (10 ft bright light).

item.title: dancing-light
item.description: You conjure a tiny being of light. It gently floats around the target and gives off bright light and a 20-foot radius, and dim light in a 20 foot radius after that. Casting this spell again causes any other instances of it to end.

item.title: death-ward
item.description: A rune appears on each willing creature inside of the area. All creatures that posses a death ward cannot kill creatures that were subject to the same casting of death ward by defeating them. This spell is used for organized duels and tournaments to prevent contestants from dying.

item.title: detect-pregnancy
item.description: By holding your hand close to the creature, you can tell whether or not it's pregnant and how far along in it's pregnancy it is.

item.title: ghost-sound
item.description: You create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place. You choose what type of sound is created when casting it and cannot change the sound.The sound mimics whatever you want. It can sound like a cafeteria, crowd, waterfall, lion roaring etc, but cannot produce intelligible speech, or sound like a specific person. It can be very loud, but cannot be loud enough to cause harm or otherwise affect anything physically.When exposed to this sound, a creature can roll a will save to realize it is fake.

item.title: grasp-of-the-undying
item.description: Make a ranged attack against a creature with a bony spectral hand. Deals d6+CL (3+CL) necrotic damage and applies bone chill for 1 round.Special: If the target creature is within your natural reach, you can make this attack as a melee attack.

item.title: icicle
item.description: You fire an icy projectile that deals d6+CL (3+CL) frost damage and decreases the creatures speed by 15 for 1 round on hit.

item.title: innervate
item.description: You call upon the energy of all living things to empower you or an ally. You cast this spell in response to a spell being cast and it increases the spells CL by 1. A creature cannot be the target of this spell more than 1/day.

item.title: living-roots
item.description: Choose a creature that is standing on some form of dirt/earth/sand. Roots burst up from the ground and entangle the creature (reflex negates). They can remove this condition automatically as a standard action, or a swift action with an athletics check (spell DC).

item.title: mage-hand
item.description: You create a ghostly ethereal hand that can pick up items and perform a simple task such as opening doors, pulling up pants or tipping over buckets. It can carry up to 10 lbs and has a +0 bonus to athletics. The hand cannot do anything that takes longer than one turn to perform unless you add the [concentration] tag and focus on its actions with yours each turn.You can use the hand to perform a bully or shove combat maneuver with a bonus of +1.

item.title: magic-missile
item.description: Launch a dart of magic that unerringly strikes an enemy to deal (CL) force damage.

item.title: mana-ramping
metronome
item.description: Wiggle your staff and cause a random effect from the following list. Roll a D6.1 - Bury yourself underground until the start of your next turn, effectively putting you in stasis against anything that isn't an earth-based attack. If you attack a foe on follow up turn, they are DD. 2 - Confuse yourself. Immediately roll on confusion chart, then end the confusion. 3 - Cause a banana peel to appear under a creature within 30 ft of you. They are knocked down, (reflex negates). 4 - Your tongue becomes long, powerful and elastic, allowing you to make a free drag attempt with a range of 30 ft.\ 5 - Move 60 ft in a straight line of your choosing [elusive], stopping when you hit a solid surface. Creatures along the way take d6 (3) crush damage\ 6 - You and an enemy within 30 ft of you are set ablaze (reflex negates for you both).

item.title: prestidigitation
item.description: With a flick of your wrist and some magic sparkles, you can create a variety of effects.

item.title: README
item.description: The magic basics. Cantrips don't cost mana and essentially count as level 0 spells.

item.title: scribe
item.description: You touch a book, scroll or other form of writing and give the text a faint glow. The utensil moves on its own to copy down the content you targeted onto the paper, parchment etc. you provided as a focus. It copies down the text at a rate of about 1 page of an average book per minute in your handwriting. If you are trained in the linguistics skill, you can duplicate the handwriting.

item.title: shocking-grasp
item.description: Your staff transforms into electricity and coats your hand. Make a melee attack against a creature that deals d8+CL (4+CL) damage. The creature cannot make AoOs for 1 round on hit.If the creature is wearing metal armor or is sufficiently metallic, get a +4 bonus to attack.

item.title: spirit-animal
item.description: You create a small spectral animal of significance to you. This animal follows basic commands and can roll survival ONLY to guide people through wilderness using your bonus. It cannot interact with the physical world and disappears if it takes damage. Casting this spell again causes any other instances of it to end.Upcast - Increase duration by 8 hours per mana spent

item.title: stubbed-toe
item.description: You cause the ground underneath a creature to react unfavorably to their movement. If the targeted creature moves at all on their next turn, they must roll a reflex save or a piece of the ground intercepts their movement. They take d6 (3) bludgeoning damage and they have their speed reduced by 15 ft until they spend a standard action bitching and moaning about it.

item.title: umbrella
item.description: You create a visible barrier above your head that shields you from the elements. You are protected from things such as rain and sunlight. Gain cover from attacks that originate above you. Creatures that huddle next to you can also share this benefit.Certain effects that mimic weather can potentially be mitigated by this spell such as call cheese storm and solar eclipse.Average doorways are considered difficult terrain while this spell is active.

item.title: catapult
item.description: The end of your staff manifests into a sling or catapult like device. You can load it with any handheld item weighing up to 10 lbs and launch it at a creature. The creature takes d8+CL (4+CL) damage and is also affected by the item catapulted (reflex halves and negates effect of item). The type of damage varies depending on the object thrown.The creature must also make any appropriate save against catapulted items. Even if a creature passes its save, the item is assumed to land in the creatures space, so if the item activates on impact, the creature may still have to deal with an explosion, grease or whatever other fun stuff gets tossed.

item.title: endothermic-touch
item.description: You are temporarily much better at conducting heat in a controlled manner. In general you can exist in hot environments comfortably. One of your limbs glows like heated metal and can be used to touch solid objects that are sources of large heat. Up to a 1 ft cube can be affected at a time. By maintaining contact with an object (one FRA) you can store its heat. Later you can choose to diffuse this heat into the air around you, or transfer it to another object. The effects of which depend on the object. Many things simply burn, but others like stone and metals can be softened.If used as a melee attack, it deals 2d6+CL (7+CL) fire damage.If you desire, you can immediately diffuse the heat as you touch the hot object continuously. You can affect a 1ft cube per round of contact. Prolonged exposure to heat bothers you less during this spell, but in enclosed spaces, your allies, and eventually even you, can be overwhelmed by heat.

item.title: fools-gold
item.description: You touch metal and give it a shiny new coat of paint, making it shimmer like gold. This changes nothing about the metals physical properties, only its appearance.You can affect a 1ft cube of metal.A DC 10 nature check reveals the gold is fake.Upcast - Per additional mana you spend, you can add 2 ft to the dimension of the cube you affect. (3 ft cube, 5 ft cube etc).

item.title: lab-rat
item.description: Prepare a creature for transport, or prevent them from being a continued nuisance thanks to healing. The creature transforms into tiny white rodent that can fit in the palm of your hand.The creature is automatically transformed back into its original form when a creature says "ratatouille."

item.title: long-arms
item.description: Your arms lengthen, more closely resembling prehensile tentacles. Your natural reach increases by 5 ft.

item.title: rubbery
item.description: Your entire body becomes incredibly bouncy and flexible. You only take 1 damage per 10 ft you fall and cannot be drained from falling. You can take the jump action as a free action whenever you take fall damage. You gain compression.

item.title: venom-transfer
euphoric-cloud
item.description: You take a deep hit from your pipe. When you exhale a cloud of colorful fragrant smoke fills the area. The smoke does not obscure vision significantly enough to give concealment.Any creature within the area is fascinated by its incredible colors and tantalizing aroma (will negates).

item.title: liquefy
item.description: Transform target creature into a puddle of water. This prevents them from interacting with objects, unless they are buoyant enough to move as a puddle. As a liquid, they can slip into places they otherwise might not be able to. The spell ends if the liquefied creature takes fire damage, or if they form back into their previous shape as a standard action.

item.title: nauseating-trail
item.description: Immediately dash and disengage, leaving behind a toxic trail in your wake. For the rest of your turn, spaces you move through are filled with a toxic gas that lingers. The gas spreads slightly up into the air, causing the spaces 5 feet above you to also be affected. Any creature that moves through one of these spaces experiences its stench and caustic properties. They take 3d8+CL (13+CL) poison damage and are sickened 1 (fort halves damage and negates sicken).

item.title: third-leg
item.description: You cause a creature to grow an additional oversized and unwieldy limb. The creature is clumsy 2 (fort negates).The additional limb does not disappear over time and must be removed manually. When the creature takes at least 5 slashing damage, the limb quickly withers away.

item.title: alchemize
blood-to-ichor
item.description: Summon an ooze inside of a creature. The ooze immediately tries to melt its way out. The affected creature takes 3d8+CL (13+CL) poison damage (fort halves).

item.title: chimp-out
item.description: Transform a creature so they become a more ape-like version of themselves (fort negates). They gain a climb speed of 30, have their land speed reduced by 15 and are effectively silenced, only capable of making animal noises.They gain the following special attack Special Attack: Poop Toss - Make a thrown weapon attack. On hit the creature takes 2d6 (7) poison damage and becomes sickened 2.Curse can be removed by eating a banana or using poop toss.

item.title: caustic-blood
item.description: When a creature deals slash or pierce damage to you, spray them with a nasty surprise. They take 4d8+CL (18+CL) poison damage (reflex halves)

item.title: caustic-suprise
item.description: While this contingency is active, your skin seems to bubble and pop, with the frequency and intensity increasing as your hp depletes.When you die or are defeated, this contingency triggers and you briefly live on, ignoring these conditions. You are unable to take any actions, including dashing, other than movement while in this state, and you ignore all movement impairing effects. At the end of your next turn, your skin explodes in a caustic brine, dealing 5d8+CL (21+CL) poison damage to all creatures (reflex halves)

item.title: iron-man
item.description: Your body undergoes a rapid and temporary transformation to be completely made of metal. You gain the following benefits… You do not possess biology, and therefore cannot be envenomed, bleed, suffocated etc. Any non-permanent instance of these effects immediately end on cast. Resistance to all physical damage unless it originates from a weapon of adamantine or greater toughness Resistance to all poise damage And the following drawbacks… You are silenced You speed is 30, but cannot be decreased or increased You cannot swim, fly or hover. You automatically sink when submerged in water. Your weight increases to be 100x heavier. If you have the anime theme song racial feature, it changes during this transformation.

item.title: README
item.description: Effects that transform you, allies, objects or enemies. Also includes poison effects and things related to chemistry.

item.title: disc-of-light
item.description: You throw a disc of light that boomerangs back to you at the start of your next turn. Make a ranged attack and compare the result to every creature within a 30 foot line. Each creature takes (6+CL) holy damage.The disc persists at the end of its range, automatically dealing its damage to creatures that move through that space. At the start of your next turn, the disc returns very quickly in a line directly back to you dealing half the damage again automatically, requiring no roll.If you spend an immediate action, you can catch the disc, allowing you to throw it again at no cost. If you do not throw it again on your next turn, it disappears.If the disc impacts solid terrain (such as a wall) on either the way out or the way back, it halts in place.The discs give off light in a 20 ft radius.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by 4.

item.title: enhance-water
item.description: Transform water into a mediocre alcoholic beverage such a wine, whiskey or mead.

item.title: epitaph-of-finality
item.description: You sing out to the dead, inflicting drained 1. If it is defeated while this spell is active and it does not have regeneration, it is instantly and utterly consumed in holy flames, leaving behind only ashes. If it has regeneration, this spell will cause them to become dazed for one turn upon revival.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase drained stacks by 1.

item.title: rejection
item.description: You cross your arms and then enter a powerful stance as you release stored energy. Creatures in range are knocked back 10 feet and knocked down (fort negates).If you increase the cast time to a FRA, its DC increases by 2.

item.title: oath-to-order
item.description: You recite an oath with your target, bolstering their courage in the face of darkness. The target sheds light out to 20 feet, granting them a +4 bonus to intimidate vs undead and fiends within this light and a +4 bonus to saves against fear, darkness, and blinding effects.

item.title: radiant-burst
item.description: You manifest a shining light and cause it to flash brightly before extinguishing. Creatures are blinded for two rounds (reflex negates). A creature can make a new save against this effect at the end of its turn.Undead, fiends and creatures with light sensitivity take 10 holy damage (no save).

item.title: repelling-light
item.description: You create a globe of bright light. Undead and light-sensitive creatures that start their turns inside or attempt to enter this zone immediately recoil, using their movement to escape the zone if possible (will negates), or suffering -2 attack if they do not.

item.title: rings-of-light
item.description: You throw many light rings that deal 4d8+CL (18+CL) holy damage (reflex halves).The rings persist at the end of the cone, forming a line that automatically deals their damage to creatures that move through their spaces. At the end of your next turn, the rings return very quickly directly back to you in a straight line, dealing half the damage again automatically (no save).If any of the rings impact solid terrain (such as a wall) on either the way out or the way back, they halt in place. Any that don’t continue on their usual path.The discs give off light in a 20 ft radius.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: wrath-of-gold
item.description: You cross your arms and then enter a powerful stance as you release stored energy. Creatures in range are knocked back 10 feet, knocked down and take 4d8+CL (18+CL) holy damage (fort halves dmg and negates knock down/knockback).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: deific-presence
item.description: You assume a position akin to prayer before you throw your arms to the side and assume the pose of deific power. You radiate intense waves of holy energy that ramp up over time, damaging all enemies within 20 ft. You move at -15 speed while casting this spell. You must spend a standard action each round to continue concentrating.Round 1 - 5d6+CL (17+CL) holy damage (reflex halves).Round 2 - 5d8+CL (22+CL) and increases the DC by 4.Round 3 - 5d10+CL (27+CL) and no longer has a save.Any creature that fails its save (or automatically on round 3) versus this spell is staggered for 1 round.

item.title: threnody-of-vengeance
elden-memes
item.description: You create a condensed ball of divine energy and release it into the world. Every round on your turn, the ball of light gently floats towards a target you designate at the time of casting at a speed of 30 feet. If the ball gets within 30 feet of the original target, it starts to gently circle around them clockwise instead of moving towards them. All enemies within 30 feet of the ball at the end of its movement each turn automatically take (CL) holy damage from projectiles that rapidly fire in all directions around it.If the original target is ever defeated, then a new target can be selected as an instant action.On the 5th round, the ball advances rapidly towards the original target and explodes in their space. If the original target is dead, unconscious or has managed to get more than 300 feet away, it instead explodes immediately. The explosion deals 7d8+CL (31+CL) holy damage (reflex halves) in a 20 ft radius to all enemies.

item.title: README
item.description: AJ spells are focused around unleashing divine power in the form of holy spells and punishing the wicked.

item.title: magic-dart
item.description: Make a ranged attack with a dart that deals 2d8+CL (9+CL) force dmg. The dart sticks inside of them, magnetizing other force effects to it. item.title: scholars-shield
item.description: A shield made of vibrant magical force rotates around your body. You can take shield actions, but only against spell attacks. item.title: spell-blade
item.description: Coat a melee weapon into pure magic force and make a melee attack, dealing d6+CL (3+CL) bonus force damage. It counts as a spell attack.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d6 (3).

item.title: arcane-arc
item.description: Fire a wide projectile that affects an area in front of you, dealing 3d8+CL (13+CL) force damage (reflex halves)Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: crystalline-explosion
item.description: Make a ranged attack by firing a magical crystal at a creature, dealing 3d8+CL (13+CL) force dmg. item.title: exasperating-evocation

item.title: floating-spell-blade

item.title: great-gavel

item.title: arcane-cannon
item.description: You form a literal cannon made out of shimmering magical force that is immobile and automatically comes loaded with mana from casting this spell. As part of casting the spell, you can fire the cannon, dealing 5d8+CL (22+CL) force damage in a 10 ft radius at the point of impact (reflex halves).You or any ally can spend 4 mana as a standard action to again fire the cannon at a new point (still using your CL). But the cannon can only fire once each turn.You [mana burn] 4 mana while this spell is active. When the spell ends, the mana burn reduces to 1.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: wall-of-force
item.description: You create a wall of shimmering force. It is transparent, giving you line of sight, but blocks line of effect and deflects all attacks. It has 50 hp and dissipates if this hp is lost. A creature can attempt to pass through the wall by making a reflex save as a free action. Failure deals 2d8+CL (9+CL) force damage to them.

item.title: README
item.description: The magic-y magic that has no real life analogue. Primarily focused around dealing force damage using projectiles and conjured weapons.

item.title: black-light
item.description: Your staff emits light, but it is a dim violet color. The radius of the spell turns darkness into dim light.More importantly, certain substances are highlighted while within this light. Bodily fluids and chemical spills are the most common substances, but savvy alchemists can create ink that also shows up under black light.

item.title: bookake
item.description: You apply the mark of Brazzeria and close the book. Between its pages ooze an incredibly effective gooey adhesive that keeps it closed. No matter how strong the individual, the book's adhesive may stretch slightly, but it cannot be broken open. You can also choose to seal off only a specific section of a book, such as a chapter or a singular page. The caster must apply a password to the book that dispels the goo when spoken. A caster may roll arcana to determine the password (15+CL). An application of universal solvent automatically dispels this effect.

item.title: cure-wounds
item.description: Magically close wounds and replace lost blood. The creature gains 5+CL hp and is cured of fatigue.By adding [mana burn] equal to spell level you give it the [overheal] tag.Upcast - For every additional mana you spend, increase healing by 3 and you can target an additional creature. You can move in between delivering the spell to reach more than one creature.

item.title: fasting
item.description: You lock the creature out from all kinds of physical intimacy. The target is physically unable to engage in intimate touch as a divine force repels all attempts to initiate such acts, as well as all attempts made against the target to initiate such acts. No other bodily functions are impaired by this spell.Any effects that have a saving throw and can be obviously considered lewd are rolled with advantage.When the spell is cast, a magical key is generated. Inserting this key into the chest of the corresponding creature is the only reliable way to end this spell (don’t lose it!). If the key is destroyed, they spell ends.

item.title: hand-holding
item.description: The ally you are bonded to is treated as though they are within reach for the purposes of targeting them with spells and other effects as long as they are within 30 ft and you have line of sight. This functions both ways.This spell creates a visible spectral golden hand that wraps around the bonded creature's hand.

item.title: path-of-glory
item.description: You bless the ground that you walk on. Your movement this turn leaves behind a glowing golden radiance for 1 minute. Allies that exist in or move through one of these spaces restore 2 hp. This effect cannot happen more than once per turn.Upcast - Heal 1 more per mana spent

item.title: unnatural-lust
item.description: When you cast the spell, you choose two targets. The initial target you inflict the horny upon. The second target doesn't get affected by anything, but rather determines where this horniness is directed towards. The initial target must spend the entirety of its next turn moving towards the secondary target and then caressing, hugging, or kissing them (will negates).A creature gets a +4 to its save if it would not normally be sexually attracted to the secondary target. By succeeding on a monster lore check against a creature, you can determine what an appropriate secondary target for this spell would be.After failing its save and satisfying it's carnal desires, a creature becomes more resistant to the spell and always receives the +4 bonus on subsequent casts against it for one minute.A creature can only be targeted by a spell that makes them horny once every few minutes.

item.title: circle-of-sealing
item.description: You move around to inscribe a circle on the ground, then infuse it with mana to cause a tangible but transparent barrier to appear, sealing the fiend inside of it. The fiend is unable to pass through this barrier, or go under/over it. It is anchored and siphoned while inside. Otherwise the fiend may act as they wish. If the barrier is ever damaged from the outside, it automatically breaks, and so care must be taken to protect trapped demons. Brazzerians usually use this spell to interact with the fiend to get to know them better to prepare for purification.This spell functions only on level 4 or lower fiends.Upcast - Each additional mana spent increases the level of the fiend you can trap by 2 (max 12).

item.title: detect-thots
item.description: You detect thots. For the purposes of this spell, a thot is someone who (breathes) has had more than one sexual partner. Every turn as a standard action you can scan a creature you can see, automatically telling you their propensity for horniness on a scale of 1 to 5.You can also pry further to find out a rough approximation of the number of sexual partners the target has had (will negates).Rough estimation: Zero, one, several, dozens, countless

item.title: exhibition
item.description: This spell functions differently if you target an ally or an enemy.Enemy You cause all of the creatures equipment to visually disappear, making them appear naked (will negates). For the duration of the spell the creature treats it as though they have no equipment, and cannot use anything dependent on equipment, such as shield actions, spell casting and weapon special attacks. At the end of each turn, the creature gets a new save to end the effect.They still get any passive bonuses to their equipment, such as armor or poise from shields.Ally You can cast this spell on yourself or an ally as a swift action, and its duration increases to 1 hour. It instead only makes your ally appear as though they are naked or scantily clad, but still armed. They can still use any activated equipment.

item.title: head-pat
item.description: You roll a caster level check to immediately end a harmful effect. The DC is (10+CL of the effect). For non-spell effects its (10+creature's lvl). If the status is removed, the creature heals 5 hp.This spell cannot be used in order to remove permanent status effects, like curses or afflictions.

item.title: simp
item.description: You inflict the curse of the simp on a defeated or willing creature. The creature is permanently charmed. All interactions between you and the creature are inherently positive to the creature. Stepping on them is a massage, insulting them is advice etc. When the creature is asked about you, they have nothing but positive things to say and you can do no wrong.While they are not compelled to do anything that you ask necessarily, they do go out of their way to help in ways that don’t require much effort on their part, and they are very easy to convince. You get advantage on any skill check versus this creature.If you affect the creature with an effect that deals damage or otherwise harms them, then they get a will save against the curse (also applies if they see/find out you told someone else to do so).Doing an advanced ritual that involves going outside and touching grass, the curse ends.

item.title: true-form
item.description: You roll a caster level check to immediately end a polymorph effect. The DC is (11+CL of the effect) or for non-spell effects (11+creature's lvl). If you are successful, the creature is staggered for one round and cannot use polymorph effects for 24 hours.If you cast this on a creature that is not currently hiding its true form, the spell rebounds and you stagger yourself for 1 round. If you cast this on a helpless or willing creature, it automatically succeeds.When used against a fiendish creature, increase your effective caster level by 5.

item.title: bondage
item.description: A golden chain is launched from your staff and wraps around a creature (reflex negates). While chained the creature cannot easily move beyond the spell's range and is clumsy 2.As a swift action, the creature can attempt an opposed athletics check to drag you along with them. If you are untrained in athletics, use your CL as your bonus. If they succeed, you are pulled towards them the distance they move beyond the spells range (max 30 ft) and take 10 poise damage. If this poise breaks you, you are knocked down.You can also attempt this athletics check to yank the creature back.

item.title: ecstasy
item.description: You fill a creatures mind with horny thoughts, causing them to shiver and writhe with pleasure. The creature is dazed for 1 round and staggered the round after (will reduces to stagger 1 round).If the target creature could reasonably be sexually attracted to the caster (aka, not gay) then the DC is increased by 1. If the caster is naked, or basically naked, the DC is increased by 1. These DC increases stack.A creature can only be targeted by a spell that makes them horny once every few minutes.

item.title: hell-and-back
item.description: You generate a portal that leads to the demon realm for 1 minute. A maximum of a dozen creatures can go through the portal. At any point within the next 24 hours, you can spend another minute to recreate this portal to bring you back to your original position. The portal’s destination is always on stable ground in an area without any immediate natural hazards (you don’t spawn in lava pits).You must have an idea of where you would like to go in order to use this spell. Roll a planes check and subtract your result from 40. That is how many miles you appear off course from your desired location. The minimum distance is 1 mile off course.If you are interrupted during the cast time when attempting to recreate the portal or you stay for longer than 24 hours, you cannot use this spell to return back to the material plane and must find other means.This spell does not require line of sight.

item.title: regenerate
item.description: You infuse a creature with incredible healing powers. They instantly regenerate damaged organs/limbs. Severed limbs in the creature's possession are automatically reattached. Destroyed or misplaced limbs are instead regenerated over 1 minute, during which the creature is stunned.The creature is drained 1 after casting.

item.title: golden-shower
item.description: A fluffy yellow cloud appears 30 ft overhead and soothing droplets of gold rain wash over nearby allies, and burn nearby enemies. All allied creatures recover 4 hp each turn and all enemies take 4 holy damage each turn for 1 minute (totaling 40 healing or damage over the full duration).This healing/dmg occurs at the end of each of your turns. If an enemy is defeated, they cannot die from this damage, and they no longer take holy damage from the rain.

item.title: grace-of-champions
item.description: You conjure a golden spectral champion of Brazzeria that mirrors your movements and enhances your actions. Whenever you target allies with a beneficial effect, you can choose to also heal them (or one of them for AoE effects) for d4+CL (2+CL), or 2d6+CL (7+CL) if they are within your natural reach. Whenever you target an enemy with a harmful effect, you can choose to also strike them with holy energy (or one of them for AoE effects), dealing d4+CL (2+CL) holy dmg, or 2d6+CL (7+CL) holy damage if they are within your natural reach.Either effect requires a swift action, and can be performed as part of casting this spell.The spirit will also protect you in your hour of need. If you fail a will save, you can choose to instead pass. If you are defeated, you can instead choose to drop to 1 hp. Either effect requires an immediate action and ends the spell.

item.title: holy-nova
item.description: Unleash a quick burst of radiance to heal your allies and damage your foes. Allies heal (CL) hp and enemies take (CL) holy damage.

item.title: power-word-cum
item.description: You fill a creatures mind with horny thoughts, causing them to shiver and writhe with pleasure. The extent of which this affects them is determined by whether or not the creature is attracted to you.If the target creature could reasonably be sexually attracted to the caster (aka, different gender and not gay) then the creature is stunned for 1 round, then staggered the round after.If the creature isn't compatible (same gender and not gay etc) or doesn't experience horny (like mindless creatures and constructs) then it is staggered for 1 round.A creature can only be targeted by a spell that makes them horny once every few minutes.

item.title: README
item.description: Brazzeria embodies the struggle people face when their beliefs clash with reality and their desires clash with their duties. She has a reputation for normalizing what would otherwise be considered taboo in most other types of relationships. In the eyes of her followers, almost no evil is too great to be beyond redemption. As such, it isn’t uncommon to find her followers frequenting the same place as fiends on the material plane. It is a constant battle of wills; satisfying your deepest desires while avoiding the descent into deepest depths of profanity.Brazzeria spells are a mix between useful spells for battling fiends, healing and horny spells.

item.title: fog-cloud
item.description: Cause a fog cloud to roll into the area and linger for a bit. Creatures outside of the fog cloud can only see 5 ft into it. Creatures inside of the fog cloud can only see 5 ft in front of them. Even still, such creatures have partial concealment.Creatures beyond 5 ft of fog have total concealment.Upcast 4 - The fog becomes much thicker. Creatures treat it as difficult terrain. It can also soften falls.

item.title: lightning-rod
item.description: As an immediate action, you can choose to direct any effects with the [zap] tag to yourself, provided you are within range 30 ft the effect's origin or destination.You can use yourself as a target for any effects that require multiple creatures to chain [zap] effects and are immune to allied [zap] effects without reducing the number of creatures it effects.

item.title: lightning-strike
item.description: Electrify a melee weapon, natural attack or unarmed strike. Concentrate until you land an attack with it. On hit the electricity arcs to another target within 15 ft. All secondary targets take the entirety of the attacks damage as lightning damage (reflex halves). They do not suffer any of its on-hit or additional effects. You choose the targets.If you are disarmed of the weapon you cast this spell on, you cease concentration and the spell ends.Upcast - Every additional mana spent allows you to increase the number of additional targets.

item.title: storm-stomp
item.description: You take a step forward and whip up winds around you knocking any creatures within range back 5 feet (fort negates).

item.title: achoo
item.description: Your nose twitches before you unleash a mighty sneeze. You knock yourself and a creature back 10 feet in opposite directions. They are staggered for one round and take 2d8+CL (9+CL) crush damage, or two rounds with 3d8+CL (13+CL) crush damage if they impact a solid surface (fort halves dmg and negates stagger).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: finger-gun
item.description: You point your finger at someone and then snap your fingers with your thumb pointing towards the sky. You unleash a powerful concentrated stream of air at a creature, requiring a ranged attack. The attack deals 3d8+CL (13+CL) crush damage. The creature is staggered for 1 round (fort negates).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: heavens-vengeance
item.description: A dark cloud spawns above your head that crackles with electricity. It is angered whenever you take damage, and deals 3 zap damage to the creature that inflicted the damage if it is within 30 ft.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by 1.

item.title: static-field
item.description: While this spell is active, you crackle with electricity. Your melee attacks deal an additional 2 zap damage and apply a mark to enemies on hit. As a standard action while this persists, you can end the spell with one big stream of electric current. Marked creatures you have line of effect to automatically take 3d8+CL (13+CL) zap damage, even if you can't see them.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage of the standard action blast by d8 (4).

item.title: wind-wall
item.description: All ranged attacks passing through the wall take a -4 penalty to attack unless they originate from a siege weapon. Exceptionally small creatures such as insects cannot pass through the wall. The wall can also reasonably protect against things like harmful gases.Moving through the wall costs 15 ft of movement. Creatures that opt to stand inside of a wind wall are clumsy 2 until they exit.You can choose to make the wall in 2 shapes. Wall - 20x40 rectangle Castle - 10ft cube

item.title: call-lightning-storm
item.description: As part of casting the spell, and as a standard action every turn after, you call down a lightning bolt to strike a specific creature. The creature takes 2d8+CL (9+CL) zap damage (fort halves).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, target an additional creature with each lightning strike.

item.title: eye-of-the-storm
lightning-bolt
item.description: Lightning erupts from your fingertips and bounces around the battlefield from enemy to enemy. You initially target a single creature, then the lightning bounces from that target to another target of your choosing (that you can see) within 30 ft. You affect a total of three creatures. Each creature affected takes 4d8+CL (18+CL) zap damage and is staggered for one round (fort halves damage and negates stagger).Upcast - For each additional mana spent the lightning bolt bounces to an additional target and deals and additional d8 (4) damage.

item.title: storm-step
item.description: The direction of the wind changes to briefly haste you. As part of casting the spell, dash. Creatures within reach of you at the end of your turn take 3d8+CL (13+CL) crush dmg (fort halves).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: succ
item.description: You take a breath so deep that you can use it to inhale enormous quantities of air in a 40 ft radius around you. This is best used against clouds of smoke, fog or poison. As long as you concentrate, you can hold this air in your massive cheeks without any harm to yourself. When you cease concentration, you can exhale these gases as a 30 ft cone attack if they were harmful, inflicting whatever negative effect they had using your save DC. Regardless of what you exhale, the gas dissipates immediately after the attack.

item.title: temperamental-tempest
item.description: You create a tornado about the height of a man that rapidly moves around the battlefield tossing around foes. Immediately after casting and for an additional 2 rounds at the start of your turns, it barrels in a line of your choosing 30 feet. Enemies within its path are tossed in a random direction 10 ft, take 2d6+CL (7+CL) crush damage and are knocked down (fort negates dmg, knockback and knocked down).

item.title: rushing-winds
item.description: Fly rapidly in a direction 60 feet. Any creatures within 10 feet of you during this journey are blown in the direction of your movement 20 ft, take 6d8+CL (27+CL) crush damage and are knocked down (fort halves damage and negates push back/knockdown).

item.title: tempest
item.description: You bend the wind to your will, and you will it to destroy. Over the course of the cast time, the weather worsens, giving creatures the opportunity to run and hide. Wind speeds increase to the extent where even heavy objects get picked up and tossed around. All but the most sound structures are damaged and weak structures are outright destroyed within minutes.You gain a fly speed (60) while within the area of the spell. Other flying creatures are automatically clumsy 4 and all ranged attacks have a -4 penalty to attack.Creatures without proper protection, that don't take shelter and lack proficiency in the athletics skill are whipped up by the winds and tossed 30 feet in a random direction every turn, taking 2d6+CL (7+CL) crush damage. Creatures that take shelter are generally safe, while those that have protection and/or have athletics can roll checks (spell DC) each turn they move through an open area affected by this spell or they are tossed.In areas where numerous loose objects are plentiful, you can use a standard action to command the winds to blow them at your enemies. The objects deal 4d6 (14+CL) physical damage (reflex halves), with the AoE being determined by the size of the object (max huge).You are immune to the effects of the wind and any objects that might get tossed your way.All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

item.title: thunderlords-decree
item.description: Your shout echoes like thunder across the battlefield as you call down lightning bolts to strike all enemies you can see within range. Creatures takes 6d8+CL (27+CL) zap damage and are staggered for 1 minute (fort halves and negates stagger). Creatures get a new save to end the stagger at the end of their turn.

item.title: README
item.description: Clairvoyance is leader and mother to all cloud giants. She and her children dominate the mountainous northern region of the world plagued by all manner of windstorms and blizzards. She covets wealth in all of its forms and regularly uses her power and influence to steal from those that think they can live in her cold and desolate corner of the world.Clairvoyance’s spells are centered around the manipulation of wind, storms and lightning.

item.title: embiggen
item.description: The touched creature increases to large size.If the creature is already large or larger, the spell has no effect.

item.title: README
item.description: The magic-y magic that has no real life analogue. Primarily focused around dealing force damage using projectiles and conjured weapons.

item.title: crimson-confession
item.description: You touch an object and infuse it with a curse to help you keep track of creatures who mess with it. When you lay this curse you can name creatures that circumvent the curse out loud.Afterwords, if any creature touches or directly moves the object, including through gloves, telekinesis or a long stick, their skin turns a bright crimson color (will negates). If their skin was already crimson, they turn blue. Once a creature has passed their save against this effect, they are immune to further touches against the same cast.If you cast this spell on an object while you already have a crimson confession active, the previous one disappears.The creature must either admit to touching the object to the caster , or they must manually cover their body in paint of their previous skin color to remove the curse.

item.title: feast-and-famine
fish-out-of-water
life-drinker
item.description: You emanate an aura that absorbs energy from creatures attempting to heal. This aura follows you as you move. Creatures other than you are bone chilled while within this aura, and for 1 round after they leave it.Upcast - By spending 4 mana, you also gain any healing you negate from the bone chill you inflict with this aura.

item.title: never-lucky
item.description: Cause a creature to be unlucky. They next time they roll an attack or saving throw, they roll it at disadvantage.Outside of combat, this has the [subtle] tag, but only affects skill checks, ability checks and luck checks.Upcast - By spending 3 mana, the creatures next 2 rolls are at disadvantage. By spending 5, the creatures next 3 rolls are at disadvantage.

item.title: poison-the-well
item.description: You stand at the edge of a well and fill a coin with malefic energy. By dropping the coin into the well, it subtly causes it to become poisonous. Creatures that drink from it become drained 1 (fort negates).This curse can be removed by removing the coin from the well.Upcast - You can affect larger water sources by spending more mana. At 2 mana you can effect larger bodies of water, such as lakes and creeks. At 3 mana you can effect large lakes and 1 mile of river. At 6 mana you can effect an entire river, regardless of its length.

item.title: prisoners-brand
item.description: You touch the creature and apply the brand used as the focus component. It is slightly uncomfortable when applied, but does not cause damage. You are constantly aware of the direction of this creature. You can brand multiple creatures, but you cannot tell which creature is which.Petting an eagle removes this curse and its associated brand. Other types of freedom-related creatures can potentially suffice.

item.title: enfeeble
item.description: With heavy arms, the creature struggles to bring the full force of their attacks and spells. Whenever the creature deals damage, that damage is decreased by 2 (unless it is true damage).While a non-minion creature within 60 ft is afflicted with this curse (and you are its caster), you get advantage on fortitude saves.In order to remove this curse, a creature must sheathe and unsheathe a sword 3 times without doing anything else. In combat this requires a FRA.

item.title: harvester
item.description: The curse of the harvester is a tool used by creatures to remotely collect mana. Because of the cast time, the creature must either be willing or defeated to be the target of this spell. You link a creature to the inert mana crystal used as a focus. You also specify a time of day. Every day at the specified time, the target is mana burned until they only have 1 mana left, as though they had donated mana. The harvester receives (this mana value-1), which they can use as they see fit.This curse can only be removed by destroying the inert mana crystal used as the focus for the initial casting. The harvestee can innately tell if a crystal is bound to them by looking at it, feeling it etc.

item.title: retributive-reparations
item.description: Curse an object to reject its owner, unless that owner is you. The first time a creature picks up this item it is inflicted with a curse (will negates). The curse causes them to be unable to separate from the item, unless it gives it back to you, and fatigues them until it does. If the creature tries to use the item, like unlocking a door with a cursed key or swinging a cursed weapon, they become drained 1.The creature doesn't need to hold the item per se, but it does need to be on their person. If they try something clever like putting the key in a backpack, then taking the backpack off, the backpack defies logic and stays put, just like the key would. The creature can return the cursed item to you as a swift action, removing the curse. Alternatively, if you spend 1 week more than 1 mile away from this creature, the curse naturally fades.

item.title: violent-accident
wither
item.description: Cause a creature to atrophy over 3 rounds. This has no immediate effect, but at the start of the creatures turn it withers (fort negates). The first failure fatigues the creature and reduces their speed by 15. The second and third failure reduce their speed by an additional 15.This effect continues for three turns, regardless if the creature passes its save (unless it has stalwart).

item.title: caught-red-handed
item.description: Drawing upon the spiritual link between a corpse and its killer, you reach out across space to brand the killer of the corpse you used as a focus for this spell, creating a physical manifestation of the killer’s guilt.The killer’s right hand is stained a crimson red, and this stain can’t be removed (though it can be hidden by mundane means such as by wearing gloves). If the killer doesn’t have a right hand for some reason, the spell instead causes a red stain in the shape of a hand to appear elsewhere on the creature’s body (typically on the arm).This spell affects only the creature that directly killed the targeted corpse. Other individuals that contributed to the target’s death are unaffected. If the victim did not die from violence or died indirectly (for instance, if the creature died from suffocating after someone trapped it in a room filling with water), then the spell fizzles. Once a corpse has acted as the focus for red hand of the killer, it can never act as the focus for another casting of red hand of the killer.

item.title: corrupting-mist
item.description: You cause a purple or green mist to spread over and area. Creatures inside cough and wheeze, becoming sickened 1 (fort negates). If the creature is already sickened, then they instead take 3d8+CL (13+CL) poison damage (fort halves).You are immune to your own cast of corrupting mist.Upcast 5 - You can increase the duration of the spell to 1 hour. Every round it persists, it spreads an additional 10 ft. It only spreads in one direction 180 degrees.

item.title: vulnerability
item.description: The curse softens hide, weakens bones and lowers the creatures pain threshold. While afflicted with this curse, a creature has weakness 2 to all damage.To remove this curse, a creature has to give themselves a paper cut or break a glass window.

item.title: curse-of-blindness
item.description: The target's vision wanes permanently as the world disappears around it. It is blinded (fort reduces effect to blurred vision for one round).Removed by consuming the raw eyes of a freshly killed creature.

item.title: rotting-alliance
item.description: You curse up to 4 creatures with a rot that accelerates their demise when they exist near one another. When a creature with this curse exists within 15 feet of an ally that is also cursed during its turn, it takes 4d6 (14) necrotic damage and is drained 1. This is a [persistent] effect.Each cast of this spell is not mutually exclusive. Multiple castings of this spell have the potential to include more creatures in this effect. This curse is removed by the cursed creatures all signing their name on something like paper or parchment without damaging each other in the process, and then burning it.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, affect an additional creature.

item.title: README
blanket-of-snow
item.description: A shadow appears beneath the target, and a blanket of snow falls upon them immediately after. The creature takes 2d8+CL (9+CL) crush damage and has to spend 30 ft of movement to dig themselves out of the snow (reflex halves dmg and getting buried).While buried, the creature cannot move, has resistance to fire damage and has cover.

item.title: frost-armor
item.description: You cover yourself in a thin protective ice barrier. You gain resistance to the next instance of HP damage that is not crush, slash or pierce.Once you take damage from any source, minus damage over time effects like bleed or self inflicted damage, the ice barrier shatters and frost armor ends.If you are ablaze when you cast this spell, instead of the usual benefits, put out the flames.Upcast 4 - This spell becomes an immediate action.

item.title: frost-breath
item.description: You exhale and fill the area with ice cold air. Creatures inside take 2d8+CL (9+CL) frost dmg and are made frosty (fort halves dmg and negates frosty).

item.title: ice-skating
item.description: You coat the bottoms of your feet/footwear etc with ice, allowing you to slide along cold terrain with ease. While in an arctic environment, or while moving across ice or snow, your gain a "skating speed" of 50.

item.title: snow-fort
item.description: You cause a snowy barrier to appear to protect a creature. The barrier appears all around the creature, protecting them from all sides, but not from attacks from above. They gain cover as long as they do not move from their space. If you stop concentrating or if the fort is hit with fire damage, it crumbles.Upcast 2 - You can target large creatures, or 2 medium or smaller creatures. The barrier improves to shield from airborne attacks.Upcast 3 - You can target huge creatures, 2 large creatures, or 3 medium or smaller creatures. The barrier now grants improved cover.Upcast 4 - You can target up to 4 creatures of any size.

item.title: snow-man
item.description: You sculpt snow into a more friendly shape, and your new friend does his best to aid you. A snow man is an elemental that shares all of your ability scores, poise, AC and saves. He has half of your max hp. He shares your level, but is always treated as a minion.He cannot wield weapons, and his only form of attack is a single snowball every turn that deals d8+dex/str crush dmg. If there is no snow present, he must take 3 true damage to throw this snowball. He has a 30 land speed. When not moving along snowy or icey surfaces, his speed is 15.When the snow man is destroyed, or when the spell ends, the mana burn is removed.

item.title: snowball
item.description: You toss a snowball at a creature, aiming for their weak points. Make a ranged attack that does 2d8+CL (9+CL) frost damage. They also suffer one of the following effects (fort negates).Eyes - Creature has blurred vision for 1 round.Mouth - Creature is staggered for 1 round.

item.title: chill-metal
item.description: Rapidly chill a metallic object. If it is not currently attended, it automatically happens. Creatures that touch this item for whatever reason are entangled by rapidly spreading frost.If the object is attended, then the creature can choose to drop the object as an instant action to negate the effects of the spell and it functions as written above. If they do not drop the object or cannot, such as with metal armor, the creature takes (CL) cold damage at the start of each of their turns and the item cannot be separated from them until heat is applied or you cease concentration.You can also use this spell to target a creature that is made of metal, functioning as though they cannot drop the object.Sometimes creatures have features that rely on heated metal. Such features are disabled while they are affected by this spell.

item.title: creeping-ice
item.description: You drain the heat from the air, coating an area in frost. The radius of the AoE increases by 10 feet each round on your turn. Creatures in the AoE at the time of casting or that enter/end their turn in the AoE take 2d8+CL (9+CL) cold damage and are staggered for 1 round (fort negates stagger).

item.title: frostbite
item.description: You subject to creature to a cold winter's night over the course of a few seconds. On a successful attack roll, the creature takes 3d8+CL (13+CL) frost dmg. It gains weakness 5 frost for the spells duration.

item.title: ice-lance
item.description: Turn your staff into a deadly ice spike, and stab a creature with it for 3d8+CL (13+CL) pierce damage.If the target is entangled by a [frost] effect, you make the attack with advantage and it does 3d10+CL (16+CL) pierce damage.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, the spell deals an additional d8 (or d10 if entangled) damage.

item.title: powder-snow
item.description: Snowflakes permeate the air, chilling creatures to the bone. The spell leaves behind a cloud that persistently inflicts weakness 5 to frost damage to all creatures without frost resistance in the cloud.Your allies gain frost resistance while within the area of powder snow.Upcast - Per each additional mana spent, increase the weakness the spell inflicts by 2, and increase its radius by 5 ft.

item.title: glacial-advance
item.description: Rapidly advance forward in a straight line riding along a tiny glacier, dealing 4d8+CL (18+CL) frost damage and an equal amount of poise damage (reflex halves). If a creature drops to 0 poise from this, they are shoved 15 ft away from the line in a direction of your choosing.The area of the spell becomes icy, causing creatures that move through it to fall prone unless they treat it as difficult terrain or roll acrobatics (vs class DC).

item.title: ice-beam
item.description: Fire a ray of ice at a foe. Make a ranged attack. It deals 4d8+CL (18+CL) cold damage and makes them frosty and entangled on hit. If they are already frosty or entangled, they are instead entombed. Athletics as a swift action to escape entangle (vs DC), or standard if entombed.

item.title: icy-spears
item.description: You jam your staff into the ground and thin streams of ice advance towards your foes. Choose three creatures within 15 ft of each other.
