A series of pointed ice spears erupt from the ground directly beneath them, dealing 4d8+CL (18+CL) frost damage, as well as entangling them (reflex halves damage and negates entangle). Athletics as a swift action to escape.Pass or fail, the spaces occupied by the spears are considered impassible terrain until they are destroyed or melted. A successful reflex save also means the creature can choose any space within 5 ft of the spell effect to move to [elusive]. Larger creatures create more impassible terrain and dodge farther.If there are multiple creatures in the same space, you can target the larger creature and hit all creatures in the space, but you cannot target both the creatures to double up on damage.

item.title: snowscape
item.description: A bunch of clouds roll in and start to deposit large amounts of snow. Temperatures decrease and the area of the spell becomes difficult terrain after 1 minute. Certain gear can allow you to traverse snow unimpeded. Creatures cannot see beyond 100 ft.If you cast this spell in an area where snow normally is impossible, incredibly unlikely or out of season, the spells duration decreases to 1 minute.All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

item.title: blizzard
item.description: Pelt your foes with a wave a frigid air in a wide area. Creatures take 5d8+CL (22+CL) cold damage and makes them frosty and entangled (fort halves dmg and negates entangle). If they are already frosty or entangled, they are instead entombed. Athletics as a swift action to escape entangle (vs DC), or standard if entombed.

item.title: cold-feet
item.description: Call forth icicles underneath all of your foes. Each one is entangled and takes 6d6+CL (21+CL) cold damage (reflex removes entangle and halves dmg).Athletics as a standard action to escape.

item.title: README
item.description: Ice magic! Frequently slows and restricts movement.

item.title: fraudgg
item.description: You enchant a friendly frog to give off an aura of excellence, as though it were rich, famous or well renowned. People treat this frog as though it were a person of high importance, accommodating for its small stature whenever they can.You can give this frog a set of simplistic orders such as "enter that restaurant and buy a steak" or "pretend to be a lifeguard at the beach." It will dutifully perform these tasks to the best of its ability.Only creatures that directly interact with the frog get a save against the enchantment (ie the waiter or someone the lifeguard saves). Creatures who are level 0, or who are minions to you do not get a save.If you cast the spell again, the frog harms anyone or someone kisses the frog, the spell ends.

item.title: lucky-star
item.description: You point at your foe and a star-shaped projectile unerringly falls upon them, dealing d20 force damage.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, the star bounces, affecting an additional creature within 10 ft of the previous.

item.title: oh-my-frogg
item.description: Before you would normally be affected by a hostile (non cantrip) spell, you change the nature of the magic into something completely different (will negates). The spell changes to another spell of the same level with you as the primary target or origin point of the spell, regardless of its typical range/targeting. Make saves as appropriate.Some spells may have other restrictions like material components. Ignore them.Upcast spells count as spells of a higher level.Level 1 (d4) 1 - Time Shudder (Frogg 1) 2 - Charming Gaze (Shira 1) 3 - Bloodbath (Necromancy 1) [caster immediately takes bleed damage] 4 - Cure Wounds (Brazzeria 1)Level 2 (d4) 1 - Hysteria (Frogg 2) 2 - Silence (Moogen 2) 3 - Detect Thoughts (Larella 2) 4 - Mirror Images (Wildcard 2)Level 3 (d4) 1 - Enfroggen (Frogg 3) 2 - Ice Beam (Cryomancy 3) 3 - Cosmic Cage (Lunar 3) 4 - Afterimage (Moogen 3) [afterimage always cosplays a frogg]Level 4 (d4) 1 - Call Cheese Storm (Frogg 4) 2 - Curse of Blindness (Necromancy 4) 3 - That's All Folks (Shroomlette 4) 4 - Sacrificial Heal (Lunar 4) [transfers CL hp]Level 5 (d4) 1 - Doom (Frogg 5) 2 - Rainbow Beam (Pyromancy 5) 3 - Telekinetic Thrust (Larella 5) 4 - Inferno Sphere (Pyromancy 5)Level 6 (d4) 1 - Rod of Roasting (Frogg 6) 2 - Elden Memes (Anime Jesus 6) 3 - Possession (Necromancy 6) 4 - Invisibility (Moogen 6)

item.title: plague-of-frogs
item.description: You conjure a spectral frog that slowly jumps towards an enemy. Each round it moves 20 feet closer to the target. Once it moves into the targets space, it explodes in a cloud of toxic gas, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) poison damage (fort halves). If it survives its first turn without hitting its target, it deals an additional 10 damage when it explodes.The frog does not take into consideration difficult terrain, and will hop directly into the air towards a foe. It cannot pass through walls and will move around them if the target moves out of sight.If a creature enters the space of a frog, willingly or unwillingly, then it immediately explodes.Upcast - For each additional mana spent (max 2 additional mana) increase the damage d8 (4) and add another frog that targets a different creature.

item.title: power-overwhelming
item.description: Cause the creature to surge with unbelievable power as their body rapidly deteriorates. They get a +4 bonus to all d20 rolls, damage rolls and CL. After the buff ends, they take 50% of their max hp in true damage.

item.title: spontaneous-combustion
tentacles-for-arms
item.description: One of your arms transforms into several muscular writhing tentacles, reaching for nearby creatures autonomously. At the end of each turn, they roll a grapple attack with a +4 bonus against a random creature within your natural reach, even if you are unable to act. If you do not threaten a creature, then they grapple you.You cannot willingly end a grapple made by the tentacles.

item.title: time-shudder
item.description: You emit waves of entropy, hindering or helping ALL creatures nearby (including you). Immediately upon casting and at the start of your turn unleash a pulse to determine the effects of the spell for one round. There is a 50% chance to Hinder and there is a 50% chance to help.Hinder - Creatures are staggeredHelp - Creatures gain an additional 30 speed and their movement is [elusive]

item.title: hysteria
item.description: You laugh maniacally and revel in the chaos. All creatures in the radius of the spell MUST make a simple attack with a melee weapon against the nearest creature. If they do not have a means to attack, then the spell does not affect them. The order that creatures make the attacks is as follows: The caster, his allies, neutral parties, his enemies.The caster is allowed to use a special attack instead of a simple attack.

item.title: laser-pointer
item.description: You use your finger to point at something and a little red light appears on the surface in the space of a creature. The creature is entranced by this tiny red light (will negates, mindless creatures and animal intelligence get a -2 penalty to this save). If the creature is not in combat then it follows the light with a playful curiosity, trying to catch it. The creature will not go anywhere it is incapable or that is inherently dangerous.You must spend a standard action each turn to maintain the light. When you do, you can move the light up to 30 feet a round to guide the creature's movement.If the creature is currently engaged in combat, they spend their move action following the light, but still have any other actions.

item.title: mind-maze
item.description: You alter a target's perception to make it think it needs to move in specific directions around invisible walls in order to reach it's intended location. At the start of the creatures turn, it moves 15 ft in a random direction, even if that brings them to a very dangerous position, such as off a cliff.Aside from this movement, the creature is unable to move further. If something prevents the creature from moving, such as being snared, then it does not move.

item.title: reincarnate
item.description: You transform a humanoid into a random race. They are (usually) reborn as a completely different race. They replace all of their previous racial traits with the racial traits of the new race, making the same choices they had during character creation for things such as alternate racial features.Use the following chart determine what race the spell transforms the creature into. Campaigns where more races are present, feel free to add more options to the chart. If the race is incompatible with your campaign, then reroll until you find an appropriate race.Special: A lunatic that casts reincarnate gains a luck dice 1/day.

item.title: wonkas
item.description: You open up a portal underneath yourself and a random enemy within range you can see. The portal violently sucks the creature into it forcing it to swap places with you.

item.title: confuse-ray
item.description: A ray of light shines down on a point, and mysterious motes of light fly around and distort creatures' perception of the world around them. Any creature that starts its turn inside of, or moves into the ray of light becomes confused (will adds 4 to confusion rolls).You can direct this light as a standard action on subsequent turns, moving it 20 feet in a straight line. All creatures along its path are subject to its effect.

item.title: enfroggen
item.description: You transform a creature into a frog. Permanently. The caster is unable to attack, cast any spells that affect this frog or otherwise harm it in any way, even when magically compelled to do so. The creature gains the following qualities.Another creature must spend their standard action to kiss the frog to transform it back. The un-frogged creature is dazed on its next turn and charmed by the creature who kissed it for 8 hours. This secondary effect is a [charm] effect.

item.title: eye-of-sneko
item.description: You change the pupils of your eyes to match that of the mysterious serpent Sneko, afflicting you with its curse. Whenever you spend mana, roll a d4.1 - The mana cost is decreased by 2 2 - The mana cost is decreased by 1 3 - The mana cost is increased by 1 4 - The mana cost is increased by 2You can choose to spend mana in excess to your current mana as long as you could potentially reduce the mana cost to your remaining mana or less. If the mana cost exceeds your remaining mana, you mana burn the excess. If the mana reduction exceeds the mana cost, you regain mana.To remove the curse, you must T-pose and perform no actions for 1 full round.

item.title: hot-potato
item.description: You cause a smoldering potato to appear in a creatures free hands, in their pocket, or otherwise lodged on their person. It is uncomfortable to the touch, but does not deal damage. It vibrates and pulses with greater intensity as time passes, culminating into a powerful condensed explosion on the 3rd round, dealing 6d12+CL (33+CL) fire damage to whoever is holding it.The potato must be possessed by someone, and can only be removed by the creature who currently has it giving it to someone else as a standard action, requiring a successful attack roll or poise break.For clarity...Turn 1 - Cast Spell Turn 2 - nothin' Turn 3 - Explodes violently at the end of your turn

item.title: taste-the-rainbow
item.description: You launch a beam of energy at a creature that rapidly changes between the seven colors of the rainbow. Make an attack against a creature that deals 4d8+CL (18+CL) force damage, then roll to see which effect happens on a successful hit.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: call-cheese-storm
item.description: You make a cheesy sacrifice to the god of madness. He blesses you by generating a storm of cheesy goodness. Cheese wheels fall from the sky, damaging friend, foe and terrain alike. Any creature without some kind of cover from the harsh weather takes (CL) crush damage at the start of each of their turns.The effect on the surrounding terrain varies based on how durable it is. Many settlements will experience broken windows and plenty of casualties. But with great sacrifice comes great reward: This spell generates a mountain of edible cheese.

item.title: chimpanzee-bolt
item.description: You summon a chimpanzee, functioning as a medium sized harambe, and it immediately flies at high speeds towards the target of this spell. Make a ranged attack that deals 5d8+CL (22+CL) crush damage. Hit or miss, the chimp lands adjacent to the target. During the first turn you summon it, you can command it to better strategize. Every turn after it attacks creatures randomly until it is defeated, focusing on whatever creature is closest.

item.title: self-destruct
item.description: You explode violently, setting yourself to 0 hp. All creatures within 20 ft of you take 30+CL force damage and are knocked back 20 feet (reflex halves).Caster gains a T2 affliction.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by 7.

item.title: doom
item.description: Drain the life from the world around you in a massive burst that has a rebound effect proportional to the number of creatures you hit with it.Deal 7d8+CL (31+CL) necrotic damage to creatures other than you in the spells radius. For every creature you hit, you take d6 (3) true damage and gain 1 mana reserve.

item.title: rain-of-frogs
item.description: A bunch of storm clouds roll in, even while indoors, and rain hundreds of frogs upon the area. The situation grows more dire with each passing round at the start of your turn.Round 1 - A mere frog drizzle. The area is considered difficult terrain to any non frog creatures.Round 2 - A frog downpour. The area is considered impassable terrain for any non frog creatures. Any non frog creatures still in the area are entangled, unable to effectively move through the lake of frogs.Round 3 - A frognado. The frogs, and any creature in the area of the spell is lifted into the air and thrown 60 feet in a random direction. The frogs quickly dissipate afterwords. Any other creatures and objects are staggered for 3 rounds and take 6d10+CL (33+CL) crush damage.

item.title: tastier-rainbow
item.description: You launch a wave of rainbow of energy. All creatures in the area take 6d8+CL (27+CL) force damage, then roll a bonus effect for each individual creature (reflex halves the damage and negates the additional effect).The rainbow persists for three rounds, creatures that enter the area of the rainbow or end of their turn inside of it must make additional saves. You can walk on the rainbow as though it were a solid object without issue.

item.title: madness-consumes-you
item.description: All creatures in the radius of the spell become confused.

item.title: rod-of-roasting
item.description: You plant your staff into the ground and it ignites in flames. The flames take the shape of a frog and start laughing maniacally, telling a joke or saying proverbs unfit for the current situation.At the end of each of your turns, the frog launches an intense fireblast at a creature within 60 ft, chosen randomly between all creatures. Creatures takes 10d8+CL (45+CL) fire damage (reflex halves). Touching or trying to physically move the stick also triggers this effect. If you are the last one standing within a 60 ft radius of the rod when the spell ends, you refund the the mana cost of this spell, you gain a luck dice, your staff returns to you and you gain 40 temp hp.

item.title: README
item.description: Ever since his rebranding from the god of death back in the old days, Frogg has grown a lot more popular.Frogg Saran is chaos incarnate. He is known to give blessings and curses in equal measure. Frogg Saron is a very active force in the world of Nack, worming his way into many peoples lives whether they like it or not. All this god seeks is to increase the amount of entropy in the universe. His followers start riots and revolutions merely to change the status quo. They reincarnate people for funsies just to see the reaction to their new body.Frogg spells are categorized by their randomness and propensity to inflict madness or strange behavior, generally favoring the caster.

item.title: snap-back
item.description: Reverse time ever so slightly, only doing so for 1 particular creature. They move back to the position they were in at the start of their last turn. If used on an enemy (will negates).Has no effect on a creature that has not acted in combat.

item.title: steal-years
item.description: You cause a creature to age rapidly and then you use that energy to bolster yourself. The target looks superficially old and you appear superficially in your prime.The target is fatigued (will negates). As long as they are fatigued from this spell, you can spend an immediate action to reroll a d20 roll.

item.title: tardiness
item.description: Delay a creature so that way their spot in initiative is moved to be dead last (will negates). If the creature has already acted in this round, it does not get an additional turn.

item.title: time-bomb
item.description: You cause a rapidly ticking down unstable looking clock to appear above a creatures head. At the end of that creature's turn, it explodes, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) force damage to all enemies within 10 ft (reflex halves dmg).You can place this time bomb on an ally or an enemy. The time bomb never damages allies.

item.title: blink
item.description: You sporadically blink out of the mortal plane into a private demiplane. At the end of your turn, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, you blink out of existence, putting you in stasis until the start of your turn.

item.title: on-the-clock
item.description: Cause magic circle that resembles the face of a clock to appear on a surface. As long as you concentrate, enemies treat this area as difficult terrain, even if they attempt to jump/fly over it. Allied movement through this area is elusive.

item.title: portal-jump
item.description: A portal opens up beneath you, bringing you to the target location. You cannot move, but you may take your turn from your new position. At the end of your turn, you fall back into the portal and return to the initial position.Other creatures cannot pass through your portal, even with prepared actions.

item.title: spacial-rend
item.description: Tear apart time in space surrounding a creature, causing the creature to temporarily split into two different versions of itself. One is clearly insubstantial, almost like a ghost, and gets yanked into a space of your choosing within range.Targeting this severed spirit, in all ways, is treated as though you were affecting the original creature, using all of its statistics. [Persistent] effects can still only effect once per turn, and AoE effects that target both still only do one instance of damage, but it gives the creature disadvantage on its save.The spirit cannot be moved. It cannot be affected by anything other than HP damage, which is redirected to the original target of this spell. It cannot use any abilities and the original creature cannot activate its own abilities through its spirit. The target of the spell is tethered, and cannot ever be more than 120 ft from its spirit.

item.title: borrowed-time
item.description: Borrow some time from your future self. Gain an additional swift action, but you lose your swift action next turn. You can choose to [mana burn] 3 to not consume your swift action next turn.Can only be used once a turn.

item.title: fast-forward
item.description: The creature you target moves at incredible speed, allowing them to immediately take an additional turn. This does not affect their position in initiative.On the creatures next turn they are dazed.A creature cannot be the target of this spell for 1 minute after being affected by it.The magic of this spell is a bit unstable and can sometimes go overboard. After the daze ends, an affected creature must make a DC 8 luck check or age 1 year.

item.title: multiverse-theory
item.description: You call out into the multiverse your own name, and you answer the call. A version of yourself from an alternate timeline appears before you to speak to you or aid you with tasks. This alternate version of you does not have access to its mana pool, cannot attack and has 5 hp. The primary use of this spell is to give you a different perspective on things. It can give you a +2 bonus to skill checks, as though using the aid action, and it can do simple item interactions, such as pulling levers or lifting things. Because of how different your dimension is from theirs, they cannot perform tasks on their own. If this alternate version of yourself ever takes damage, you also take that damage, ignoring any temp hp you have. If the alternate you is out of your sight for longer than a minute, it disappears.If you cast this spell again, the previous alternate you disappears.

item.title: switcheroo
item.description: You can target any combination of 2 enemies, allies and unattended objects of up to roughly humanoid size/weight. You target allies and objects freely. If you target an enemy (will negates).

item.title: dimension-door
item.description: Touch a mostly flat solid surface and cause a incomplete portal to appear on it. At any point after as a standard action, you can touch another solid surface within 120 feet of the original and turn the portal on. For as long as you concentrate, creatures can walk into one portal and appear out of the other.You can see through the portal as though it were a window leading to its destination.

item.title: retro-visions
item.description: You gaze into the past of the location you stand. You can make weeks, months, or even years pass by within minutes, but you always intuitively have a sense of how far back into the past are. You can see and hear events as they occurred. Things that are visually striking or loud are blips on your radar that give pause and allow you to watch in real time. Otherwise you need to have a roundabout idea of when the event happened.The radius of the spell represents how far you can move around while observing.You can freely travel (CL*5) years back into the past looking for anomalies. If you have the exact date of an event, you can go twice as far back.

item.title: slow-time
item.description: Cause time to stop almost completely for all creatures other than you. Everything else in the universe is essentially in stasis until this effect ends. You can spend a standard action to move an unattended object you would normally be able to manipulate (with great difficulty), but other than that, your options are limited for what to do with your extra turn.

item.title: hostile-teleportation
item.description: Choose an creature and teleport it anywhere within the spells range. If the creature is an enemy (will reduces effect to stagger).

item.title: inner-sanctum
item.description: Create a portal that brings you to your own private dimension (aka demiplane). The first time you go to this dimension, it is empty, and the tuning fork used as the focus attunes to this plane. Every time you cast this spell after the first, you come back to this dimension.The range, concentration and teleportation aspects of this spell refer to the portal you create to get to your inner sanctum. The portal acts as a window between the 2 dimensions, and stays open as long as you concentrate. Whenever you exit your inner sanctum, you always appear from where you entered it.The sanctum itself is a large empty void filled with a dark clay-like substance. Using your mind alone, you can form this clay into the shape of anything you like, such as furniture, statues, trees etc. This substance always has a texture of sturdy but malleable clay. It cannot create living things or complex objects like clocks, only facsimiles of such things. The substance always has a dark, almost space-like color to it. You cannot bring this substance out of your sanctum, but you can freely bring real objects in and out of it.The sanctum's dimensions are 100x100x100 ft.

item.title: chronobreak
README
item.description: God mode magic involves manipulating things people generally perceive as constants, such as time and distance.

item.title: blessing-of-goom
item.description: You exude an aura that allows creatures to exist in worlds they are no used to. Every creature that can see you (or sense you) gains the amphibious quality, allowing them to comfortably adapt to either land or sea, no matter which they normally prefer. Sea creatures gain a 30 ft land speed and land creatures gain a 30 ft swim speed.This quality persists for as long as they stay near you, but it does not immediately disappear. The boon persists for (CL*10) minutes after the creature cannot see you.Most churches dedicated to The Shroomlette are persistently affected by this aura.

item.title: bubble
item.description: Blow a bubble large enough to carry the target(s) of the spell. The bubble can carry any amount of weight, and can even hold sharp objects without popping. The bubble trails behind you, matching your speed, automatically avoiding obstacles and bouncing against surfaces. You can toggle whether the bubble follows you on and off as a free action.The only way the bubble can be popped is ceasing concentration, dispel magic or a creature spending a standard action to poke the bubble.Upcast 3 - The bubble carries up to 10x10x10 of spaceUpcast 5 - The bubble carries up to 15x15x15 of space

item.title: bubble-break
item.description: You blow a big bubbles. Affected creature is trapped inside of a bubble for 3 rounds (reflex negates). The bubble is completely indestructible and cannot be popped, moved or altered in any way from the inside. Trapped creatures are free to take any actions they please, the only restriction being that they cannot affect creatures outside of the bubble. They can use teleportation to escape or use the reprieve to heal and buff. The reverse is also true: Creatures outside of the bubble cannot affect creatures inside of the bubble without first popping it. Bubbles can only be popped by taking 1 pierce damage.Because of the defensive properties of the bubble, hitting allies with it to protect them is a viable strategy. Allies do not need to roll a reflex save. They can choose to be affected by the spell or not, even while defeated.

item.title: copy-of-bubble-buddy
item.description: You blow a bubble in the shape of a friend. It floats gently in the air or water behind you at a static distance of 10 ft. It cannot be popped unless it takes piercing damage from a direct attack.Gives all nearby allies +2 happiness.Bubble buddy has nothing but the best intentions but often somehow finds a way to sour the mood. At any point while bubble buddy exists, you can send it into a social situation. People will generally treat bubble buddy as a real person, but it does not speak much back, only communicating vaguely through subtle item interactions. Over the course of a minute, bubble buddy will quickly inconvenience people to show what a bad possible outcome is for interacting with this specific person or type of person. Such as spilling a dwarf's drink, or poking someone very sensitive to touch.If you allow it, bubbly buddy will continue interacting with people all around a social setting, such as a party, a tavern etc and ruin the mood. After which, people will turn on the buddy (and the caster if they saw you cast it, see you concentrating etc).

item.title: gang-up
item.description: You create 3 slimy copies of yourself that relentlessly follow a creature of your choosing (even into areas you couldn’t go, such as into the air). While they persist, they each take up a single space adjacent to the creature most optimal to provide flanking. If they are targeted with a hostile attack, spell or take any damage, they disappear. Their movement is [elusive].These duplicates are treated as though they have all teamwork feats.

item.title: gooball
item.description: Your throat swells as your mouth fills with bile. You spit a glob of goo at a creature as a ranged attack roll. Their speed is reduced by 15 for 1 minute. A creature can remove this goo automatically as a standard action, or a swift action with athletics.

item.title: message-in-a-bottle
item.description: You take a bottle and you think of somebody that you know at least by name and have met as you place it into a source of water: A bucket, a lake, a toilet, as long as the bottle can be submerged, it counts. This bottle disappears and then appears near the creature you thought of and floats towards them in a bubble. If the creature is near no suitable water sources then it only appears when the creature gets nearby one. After (presumably) reading the message, the creature can write their own message and send the bottle back to you.Anything that can reasonably fit into a tiny bottle can also be included. This spell does not function across planes.This spell does not require line of sight.

item.title: splatter
item.description: Spit a slimy ball at the ground that splatters on impact. Creatures in the spells area at the time of casting, or that walk into the spells area are affected by it. Choose one: Greasy - Creatures are knocked down (reflex/acrobatics negates). Treating the grease as difficult terrain while moving through it prevents the creature from being knocked down.Gooey - Creatures are entangled (fort negates). Athletics as a swift action to remove snare.

item.title: stick-together
item.description: Your skin oozes a gooey substance. Whenever you touch a willing creature (free action), your initiative now matches theirs. This does not give you an additional turn, but you can use any movement you have left to ride into battle with the touched creature. Simply by touching them, you can allow a creature of any size to mount you as though you were appropriately sized. You ignore their weight as though it were your own. Any effects that create forced movement automatically moves all attached creatures if you are affected, and have no effect on mounted creatures if you aren't affected.If you attach to multiple creatures, you all must choose one creature's initiative to attach to.You can also use the carry action without making allies clumsy.By applying a solvent or making an athletics check (spell dc) as a standard action you can be forcefully separated. The caster can choose to release stuck creatures at any time as a free action.

item.title: mud-buddy
item.description: You sculpt mud into a more friendly shape, and your new buddy does his best to aid you. Mud buddy is an elemental that shares all of your ability scores, poise, AC and saves. He has half of your max hp. He shares your level, but is always treated as a minion.Mud buddy cannot wield weapons, and his only form of attack is a single topple every turn. He has a 20 land speed and a 60 swim speed. He can burrow through moist earth using his land speed.Outside of combat he can do simple tasks, such as physical labor. He is intelligent, but he lacks the ability to speak and has no skills. He can carry 300 lbs.

item.title: mushroom-dance
item.description: Choose an adjacent creature to start dancing around. If you remain adjacent to the creature for the entire cast time, you learn about their lifestyle by gleaning one of three general categories.Sin - They kill, lie, cheat, steal or deal with demons/undeadNeutral - They have no strong tendencies towards sin or virtue, or roughly equal measures of bothVirtuous - They are honest. They save the lives of innocents and lend aid to the weak and downtrodden"Mushroom dance. Mushroom dance. What could it mean?"

item.title: nap-time
item.description: You inflict a wave of drowsiness on a creature, causing it to fall asleep (will reduces to clumsy 1). If the creature stays asleep until the end up the spells duration, it gains 20 temp hp.

item.title: osmosis
item.description: As long as you maintain concentration and contact with a body of written text, you can continue to absorb information from it. You can effectively summarize a book without even opening it at a rate of 10 standard pages a minute, even if you don't understand it's language.If the text is encoded, you only interpret its literal meaning. This spell allows you to get the gist of anything written in a secret language.

item.title: overflow
item.description: You cause a hemisphere of water to suddenly form in an area. This water has no inherently negative effects, but aquatic terrain can be a problem for some and a boon for others.Upcast - By spending 4 mana, the diameter of the sphere increases to 25ft.

item.title: to-the-rescue
item.description: Your hands ooze with a soothing and sticky goo. Take the carry action and increase your speed by 20 this turn. You ignore their weight as though it were your own. Any creature touched recovers (5+CL) hp. You can rescue up to 2 allies. At the end of your turn, they detach in an adjacent space of your choosing, or in your possession.If a creature is directly preventing an ally from moving, such as when being grappled, then you cannot rescue them. For situations like being stuck in a web, a suitable check (like athletics) can be rolled to rescue.

item.title: aqueous-orb
item.description: You open a portal to the elemental planes to generate a large size (10x10 ft) orb of water. Immediately upon casting the spell, and as a swift action each turn, you can move the orb up to 30 ft in a straight line. If the orb moves through a creature's space, then it is carried along for the ride and made wet (reflex negates).When picked up or at the end of each turn it is carried, creatures take 2d8+CL (9+CL) poise damage and are made clumsy 2. Spell DC athletics as a swift action to escape.

item.title: bubble-breath
item.description: You blow a bunch of bubbles. Affected creatures are trapped inside of a bubble for 3 rounds (reflex negates). The bubble is completely indestructible and cannot be popped, moved or altered in any way from the inside. Trapped creatures are free to take any actions they please, the only restriction being that they cannot affect creatures outside of the bubble. They can use teleportation to escape or use the reprieve to heal and buff. The reverse is also true: Creatures outside of the bubble cannot affect creatures inside of the bubble without first popping it. Bubbles can only be popped by taking 1 pierce damage.Because of the defensive properties of the bubble, hitting allies with it to protect them is a viable strategy. Allies do not need to roll a reflex save. They can choose to be affected by the spell or not, even while defeated.

item.title: dog-pile
item.description: Cover the ground underneath your foe in sticky goo, entangling them for 1 round (reflex reduces to -15 speed).Your allies are magnetized to this enemy. Any allies can move 30 ft closer to a creature entangled by this spell as a free action once.

item.title: rain-dance
item.description: You dance a jig. After you complete your dance, clouds roll in and it starts to lightly rain. After the spell ends, the weather returns back to what it was before casting.All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

item.title: serenity
item.description: You compel the enemies around you to cease fighting. Enemies are pacified (will negates). They get a new save against this effect each round.If an ally harms a pacified enemy, they get an additional save to end the effect.

item.title: fairy-ring-retreat
item.description: You conjure up an extra-dimensional meadow that can be accessed from a single entrance on the plane from which the spell was cast. The entry point looks like a circle of toadstools enclosing a 10ft circle. The meadow itself is a one mile radius. Only those you designate can enter through the portal. You can designate a creature by carving its name into a special tree inside of the meadow. As a standard action you can banish a creature from your dimension.Once a visitor has passed through the entry point, they find themselves in an idyllic twilight meadow decorated with mushrooms surrounded by an impassable grove. The atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm.The caster can configure the meadow into any shape desires with rolling hills and flowing rivers. The place is comfortable and temperate. The trees can provide enough food to sustain 20 people a day. A staff of 10 spectral animal or fey-like servants wait upon all who enter. They can perform simple tasks and can go anywhere in the meadow.Since the place can be entered only through its special portal, outside conditions do not affect the meadow, nor do conditions inside it pass to the plane beyond.A caster can only have one instance of this spell active at once. If they cast the spell again, it only moves the portal. Because this is a physical tangible location, things can be brought in and out of the portal. Like all extra-dimensional spaces, creatures can use plane shift (wild card 4) to teleport directly into the plane.

item.title: README
item.description: The Shoomlette is an entity that represents the bond between gooms, a breed of squishy draconic creatures, and shroomkin, a race of people with close ties to fey and mushrooms. These two entities live in tandem with each other with one main goal: increase the quantity of happiness in the world. The tactics they use to do so is to subdue creatures that decrease happiness and physically change the world around them to make it a better place to live.Shroomlette spells either inspire teamwork or incapacitate creatures in some way, often through the manipulation of water. Includes many oddities mimicking the special abilities of gooms and shrooms.

item.title: dream
levitate
item.description: You decide gravity isn't your thing today. You gain a hover speed equal to your speed.

item.title: mind-crush
item.description: You overload a creatures brain with information, giving them a hell of a headache. They take 2d8+CL (9+CL) psychic damage (will halves).Upcast - The target takes d6+CL (3+CL) damage again at the end of its next turn (will halves). Each mana spent adds an additional turn. A creature cannot suffer from multiple mind crushes at the same time.

item.title: mind-link
item.description: With a touch, communicate a vast quantity of information by showing the target brief memories and psychic impressions. You can communicate the broad strokes of an experience you had, including important locations, people, events and feelings. The experience must be shorter than 1 hour.Casting on an unwilling creature requires an attack roll.

item.title: psychic-reading
item.description: You focus on a creature's aura to learn more information about them. Roll a CL check, DC 10+(creature's lvl). If you succeed, you can learn information from their aura, and even more by concentrating. Every round you learn a piece of information about it from the following list (caster's choice). Sexual Orientation Race/Species Gender Level Native Language Place of Origin (usually only general, like country) Age You can only cast this spell on a given creature once per day.

item.title: sending
item.description: You deliver a message to a creature over any distance. In order to communicate with a creature, you must have met them, and you must know their name.When you cast the spell, you telepathically communicate simple ideas that require no more than two sentences to convey (Monsters are attacking the north gate. How do we respond?). Your target can reply with the same restrictions.If your message is too complex or too long, the creature is dead, or the creature is on another plane then it gets lost in the ether and the caster takes 1 psychic damage.You can only cast sending on a particular creature once each day unless you [mana burn] 1.Upcast 3 - By adding [mana burn] you can instead have a conversation with this creature that either of you can cut off at any moment. The spells duration is instead 10 minutes.

item.title: concentrated-blast
item.description: {% hint style="info" %} This spell can only be cast when concentrating on a spell. {% endhint %}Release your mind from the strain of concentration, channeling this raw mental energy at a target within range. Make an attack that deals 3d10+CL (16+CL) psychic damage. This spell immediately ends the spell you were concentrating on, immediately restoring the ended spells mana cost.If you are concentrating on multiple spells at once, you can end both spells to restore more mana.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase dmg by d10 (5).

item.title: cull-the-weak
item.description: You sense weakness in your enemies. Whenever a creature falls below (CL) hp, you know. You can spend 1 mana and an immediate action to pounce on this weakness, dealing CL psychic damage to them.If they currently under the effect on one of your spells, this can be done as an instant action.

item.title: detect-thoughts
item.description: Every turn as a standard action you can scan a creature you can see. You can read the surface thoughts of the creature for as long as you desire (will negates), requiring no additional action. The spell gives you the mental capacity to have a conversation with the creature and hear its thoughts at the same time.

item.title: memory-lapse
item.description: You cause a target to forget the events that have transpired in the past 2 rounds of combat (12 seconds). Certain details may cause them to recall what you did during that time, such as seeing you in a restricted area, or an ally reminding them.

item.title: share-memory
item.description: With a touch, you can tap into your targets memories (will negates) or your own, decided when you initiate mental contact. In any case, both parties see what is being viewed. The memory is limited to one minute duration. If gazing into another creatures memories, you must specify the type of memory or specific memory you want to look at.

item.title: dream-council
item.description: You enter a trance like state as you try to intercept the thoughts of up to 10 specific named sleeping creatures. You can remain in this trance as long as you'd like, waiting for the target creature(s) to fall asleep. When they do, you and any creatures you specify enter a shared dream space where you can make conversation with them. The creatures are under no compulsion to speak with you and can leave the dream space at any time.Using the spell typically requires coordination beforehand in order to get everybody to attend the council. The duration of the spell starts when you contact at least one creature.While interacting with a creature in a dream, you get a +2 bonus to skill checks.

item.title: mirror-realm
item.description: This spell has two functions, trapping for combat and hosteling for shenanigans. In either case, you must target a mirror. When you do so, the contents of the mirror are set in stone and cease to reflect reality, instead creating its own little world that resembles what it reflected.You cast this version on a mirror in order to create an extradimensional space with some interesting quirks. The space itself is a copy of everything within a 30ft distance from the mirror. This means the mirror realm can capture entire rooms, including things that are hidden from line of sight (such as behind furniture) This allows your extradimensional space to contain furniture for instance.No effects can come in or out of the mirror realm, but both sides can see what is on the other side of the mirror, barring any kind of physical obstructions that would prevent sight (such as drapery). By tapping on the mirror from either side you can cause the noise to carry over.On casting the spell you can include a password that needs to be spoken in order to walk into the mirror (no action). This password can be changed with 1 minute of concentration from the caster. You can also update the mirror's appearance to keep it inconspicuous should the environment change drastically. The caster can go blind and deaf temporarily to project their senses into the mirror realm at will indefinitely.Objects cannot be brought out, nor can objects be brought in aside from what the average humanoid can reasonably carry on their person. Any such objects left behind are shunted out, along with any creatures, if the mirror is destroyed or the spell ends.Can be made permanent using 2,000g worth of powdered rare metals as an addition material component during castingWhen casting the trapping form, you must target a creature AND an appropriately sized mirror (both of which need to be in range of you, but not each other). If the creature fails its save, it is immediately sucked into the mirror (with a similar setting as the aforementioned hosteling effect). No other creature can enter the mirror realm without another casting of this spell.This does not prevent it from taking actions, but it can no longer interact with anything outside of the mirror realm, nor can any creature interact with the trapped individual. The target is stranded. They can see out of the mirror by standing next to it. The only way they can escape is by having an ally destroy the mirror, or by waiting for 1 minute. In either case, the creature appears in a random space within 15 feet of the mirror's line of sight.

item.title: telekinetic-lift
item.description: You exert your psychic power to manipulate heavy unattended objects within the spells range. You can lift objects weighing up to (100*CL) pounds, having them float in the air around you. Lifting objects with this spell has the [concentration] tag, but otherwise does not restrict your movement, occupy your hands etc.Upcast - Increase carrying capacity to (1000*CL) lbs.

item.title: telekinetic-maneuver
item.description: As part of casting the spell and as a standard action for the spells duration, you can perform a combat maneuver using (CL+3) as your bonus. Some maneuvers work slightly differently as noted below.Drag - Move the creature to another position within the spells range, up to 30 ft.Grapple - While grappling, this spell also has the [concentration] tag. Instead of dealing the damage of a held weapon, you instead deal 2d6+CL (7+CL) crush dmg each turn. You must spend your standard action to do this each turn or the grapple ends.You are not entangled while grappling. You do not need to pull the target adjacent to you. Any damage you take while concentrating also deals poise damage. If poise broken or moved out of range, this effect ends.

item.title: malleable-memory
item.description: You root around in the targets head, removing things and adding things to their memories. This spell has 2 functions.Alter Memories - You can change details about memories, or add entirely new ones.Remove Memories - You can completely remove memories of events.In either case, you have to have at least a basic idea of what you're looking for (when they saw me break into that house, watching their spouse die in front of them). The spell can get very precise in its ability to alter memories, allowing you to remove specific items or creatures, but otherwise maintain everything else. The cast time of the spell is equal to the amount of memory that you want to change. 2 minutes of fighting you want to erase? 2 minutes of concentration.For alterations that total longer than 5 minutes (including multiple strings of casts around the same time), the creature will fight to remember things that were altered or removed. When presented with contradictory evidence or otherwise prompted to think about these heavily modified memories, they get an additional save against the effect to restore their original memories.When you take damage or if the target moves out of reach, the spell ends.

item.title: memory-movie
item.description: Tap into a creature’s memories and display them on a small screen so nearby creatures can also see what you experience. Memories are viewed from the target’s perspective, so if they have impaired or inferior senses, so do you when you view the memory.You must decide what specific memory or type of memory to view (ie. first kiss, 20th birthday party). After you start viewing the memory in real time, you have the ability to skip ahead and rewind minutes at a time to better pinpoint important moments.When cast on yourself or a willing creature, the duration increases to 1 hour and you can freely change what memories you look at on a whim, allowing for improved curation.When you take damage or if the target moves more than 30 feet away from you, the spell ends. Cannot view magically altered memories.

item.title: glimpse-of-truth
item.description: You see everything as it truly is.>You automatically disbelieve all illusions, such as figments, patterns and glamers >You can see a polymorphed creatures true form >You can see invisible creatures >You gain darkvision

item.title: telekinetic-thrust
item.description: You can perform one of the following actions, manipulating matter with your mind.

item.title: telekinesis
item.description: You exert your psychic power to such an extent that you are able to manipulate heavy objects and toss creatures around against their will. Your eyes glow and you emit a constant repulsive force pushing away loose objects nearby.For the duration of the spell, you gain a hover speed equal to your land speed. You can use this speed to fly during your turn.Immediately upon casting the spell, and every turn after as a standard action, you can perform one of the following actions.

item.title: README
item.description: Colene Larella is an elven spell caster whose spells use psychic powers to gather information and out maneuver foes before the battles even begin. If it does come down to a fight, you can crush foes' minds or toss them around with telekinesis. Long distance communication is easy with spells like dream and sending. Creatures won't be able to keep secrets from you with access to spells like detect thoughts and memory movie.

item.title: astrology
enchant-sapphire
item.description: You cast a spell on a Sapphire jewel or jewelry, turning it into a consumable magic item. The effects vary based on where the item goes on the body.

item.title: in-orbit
item.description: 3 small pale white orbs emerge from your staff and float around you. At the end of each of your turns, an orb bumps into to a creature within your natural reach. A single creature can only be hit by 1 orb a turn, but can be affected by multiple over several turns.When an orb bumps into a creature, it deals (3+CL) force damage and disappears. If multiple creatures are within your reach, multiple orbs bump. If more than 3 are within reach, choose 3 to affect. When all 3 orbs have bumped into a creature, gain (3+CL) temp hp.Only the orb part of the spell is a buff, not the temp hp.

item.title: natural-geomancy
item.description: For the duration of this spell, you get a mental ping whenever anything happens to the targeted plant or plot of terrain. You are informed what kind of interaction happened, such as whether it was trampled, touched, clipped, watered, etc. no matter how insignificant the interaction. You're also aware of the environmental conditions they are experiencing, such as approximate temperature, humidity, and even noise level.For animate plants, you gain a +2 bonus to nature checks to determine their health and needs, and can identify such mentally and remotely.This spell does not grant visual stimuli.

item.title: providers-station
star-fall
item.description: The skies darken above you and tiny motes of light pepper the heavens.You can call down stars on your foes. You automatically deal (CL) force damage to all enemies within 15 ft of you. Each time you hit an enemy with this spell, the damage increases by 3 for the next 2 rounds. Additional casts extend the duration of the increased damage, allowing it to ramp up in damage infinitely.Damage resets when you roll initiative.

item.title: star-sight
item.description: By spending a standard action to concentrate each round, you gain a completely unobstructed view of the sky as though it was a clear night. You ignore things like environmental conditions, being indoors and underground, light pollution etc.You get +2 bonus to astronomy or survival checks made to navigate.

item.title: wandering-stars
item.description: You unleash the beauty of the cosmos upon a creature as a group of stars swirl around them. They are fascinated for one round (will negates). When their fascination ends (including if they pass their save), you can spend an immediate action to make the stars move, provided you can see the target. You can direct the stars at another enemy within 30 ft.This can repeat indefinitely, but cannot effect the same creature more than once. If you do not spend an immediate action to redirect the spell, it ends.

item.title: astral-infusion
item.description: A mote of energy resembling a shining star lands on this spot, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) force damage to all enemies (reflex halves). Some of the affected creatures' energy is absorbed and you may divert that energy to an ally within range.They gain restore hp equal to the (3*number of creatures damaged by the spell).

item.title: lunar-dream
nebula
item.description: Conjure a cloud of stardust that illuminates in a 20 ft radius. It obscures vision beyond 5 feet, granting partial concealment. Anything beyond 5 feet grants total concealment. At the end of the spell's duration, it ignites dealing 3d8+CL (13+CL) force damage to all creatures in the area automatically.

item.title: unseen-blade
item.description: While in the presence of moonlight, your held weapons become invisible, allowing you to feint a creature as a free action when you attack them with it once per turn, resolved before your attack.

item.title: unseen-form
item.description: While in the presence of moonlight, you become partially invisible, granting you total concealment from creatures beyond 30 feet and partial concealment from any creatures closer.Taking any actions besides simple interactions or movement reduces the effect to partial concealment.

item.title: center-of-the-universe
item.description: Many glowing orbs immediately move away from you and start rotating at a fixed distance of 15 ft. At the start and end of your turns, deal (CL) force damage to creatures that are exactly 15 ft away from you.

item.title: cosmic-cage
item.description: You create a cage like structure at the edge of the radius of this spell. Creatures can still see in and out of the cage, and still have line of effect. The cage provides no cover.If a creature moves in or out of the cage, willingly or unwillingly, it is stunned for 1 round (fort reduces effect to dazed) and its movement is halted. A creature can only be affected by the spell once.

item.title: dark-matter
item.description: You mark a position on the ground and a dark shadow forms over it, indicating great danger to those nearby. At the start of your next turn, a chunk of condensed cosmic energy lands on this spot, dealing 4d12+CL (26+CL) force damage (reflex halves).If a creature's speed is zero (such as from being stunned or entangled) it has disadvantage on its save.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d12 (6).

item.title: the-stars-align
item.description: You can foresee the alignment of the heavens, but you do not know when it will occur. Next time you roll serendipity or a luck check of some kind, you add +4 to this check.

item.title: vengeance
item.description: You may cast this spell in response to an attack or spell targeting you, but before its result is known. You may also cast it at any point on your turn. Remind your DM to announce attacks before making them to make casting this spell less awkward.You reflect 75% of the next instance of damage you take as true damage.This spell is particularly easy to identify due to its distinct visual effect of a skull appearing over your head, making the DC 10 points lower.This spell has a 1 minute cooldown.

item.title: meteor-shower
item.description: Call down ray(s) of light from the heavens onto your foes. The spell’s CL increases by 2 at night with a direct view of the night sky. 40 ft around the area the spell impact becomes bright light for one minute.Shower - Target a 30 ft line in the spells area. Creatures in the area take 5d8+CL (22+CL) force damage (reflex halves).Strike - Target a single creature. The creature takes 5d10+CL (27+CL) force damage and is blinded for 1 round. (reflex halves and negates the blinded condition)Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase shower damage by d8 (4), or strike by d10 (5).

item.title: night-comet
item.description: Make a ranged attack roll as you fire a large dart of magic. The target takes 5d10+CL (27+CL) force damage. While in the presence of moonlight, this dart is invisible, making it DD against creatures that cannot see it.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d10 (5).

item.title: sacrificial-heal
item.description: Sacrifice any amount of your hp and transfer it to another creature. Also transfers this spell's mana cost to the target. If you choose to [mana burn], you can even heal mana burn from the creature an equal amount.

item.title: singularity
item.description: Choose a point in space to manifest a dark sphere with a selective gravitational pull. Immediately upon casting, and as a swift action each subsequent turn, 3 creatures (or objects weighing less than a ton) of your choosing within 100 feet of the singularity are pulled 30 feet closer (fort reduces to 10ft). Any creature in an adjacent space is considered touching it, dealing 2d6+CL (7+CL) force damage.

item.title: lunar-eclipse
item.description: You alter the composition of the heavens in such a way to mimic the effect of a lunar eclipse. The radius of the spell is coated in darkness. All non-magical light sources are immediately extinguished and cease to function while in the spells area. Magical light sources that existed in the area previously, that are cast in the radius or are brought into its radius after the fact must succeed on a caster level check (DC 11+CL) or they fizzle.Lunar eclipse ends automatically if solar eclipse is cast in its range, cancelling each other out.All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

item.title: moonblast
item.description: You gently float into the air and the cradle yourself with energy that takes the shape of a full moon. You enter stasis until the start of your next turn.As a free action at the start of your next turn, launch the moon at an enemy within range. Roll a ranged attack to deal 7d6+CL (24+CL) force damage. The creature also gains weakness 10 to force damage for 1 minute.

item.title: the-skies-descend
item.description: You mark a position on the ground and a dark shadow forms over a 20 ft radius, and an bright and shining object hurtling towards it is visible from the sky. At the start of your next turn, a small star lands on this spot, dealing 7d10+CL (33+CL) force damage and stuns for 1 round (reflex halves dmg and turns stun into stagger).The star then sends a shockwave out to affect all enemies within a 100ft radius. They are automatically treated as though they pass their save.

item.title: README
item.description: Surrounding the magic of the moon are many Lunar Realms, ruled over by a single Lunar Kingdom. The magic of the realms themselves bestowed the royalty of the ruling class, with the Queen and King at the top being given unique wisdom and strength with which to lead their people.The secrets to their magic were closely guarded by the royal family until the last King was murdered in a foreign adversary's coup attempt, and the princess at the time mysteriously disappeared for months. When she returned to take the throne back, she made the secrets of the Moon Queen's Wisdom public knowledge, but the secrets to the Moon King's Strength was forever lost when the Moon Princess died without providing the Lunar Realms a new heir.These spells are based upon the Moon Queen's Wisdom. They focus on abilities passed down from the stars themselves that grant foresight, prosperity, retribution, and access to the ebb and flow of magic from heavenly bodies. Many lunar spells deal force damage and have delayed benefits.Some Lunar spells require access to the night sky.

item.title: dark-lure
item.description: A nearly invisible whip of shadows emerges from your staff and wraps around a target. The target is pulled towards you in a subtle way that makes it feel like it is of their own volition. On their next turn, they spend all of their movement to move closer to you and cannot move away.

item.title: imagination
item.description: You create an illusory object or creature that to all senses appears real. The size of what you create is limited to a 5x5x5 ft cube, but other than that, there are few limitations. You can create a fire, and it (seems to) gives off heat. You can create a dog and it bounces around in its space and barks. You can create a door that creaks as it swings on its broken hinges.When you initially cast the spell, you decide a type of behavior that your imaginary creation exhibits. Maybe you want your person that you made to dance, but then the party you're at the music stops. You can spend a standard action concentrating on the spell (as long as you have line of sight to your imagination) to have it change behaviors to instead bow before a king. You cannot change what you imagine, but you can change what your imagination does.Your imagination isn't limited to the laws of physics, so you can have it do incredibly unusual things, like having a person swim through air or a rock doing flips. However, when creatures see unusual stimuli like that, they get a save to disbelieve it. If someone points out it’s a fake, other creatures automatically see through it and it appears translucent to them.When used in combat, creatures may waste their time attacking the imaginary creature, but instead of rolling attacks or the imagination rolling saves, the attacking creature rolls a save. Failed saves indicate they miss or the creature resists the attack. Passed saves indicate they see through the ruse, and they can communicate this to their allies, making them automatically disbelieve it, causing the illusion appear translucent to all.The "concentration" part of the duration allows you to indefinitely maintain this imagination as long as you concentrate each turn as a standard action. You must have line of sight to the imagination to concentrate on it. If you do not concentrate on the spell for 1 minute, it disappears.Upcast - Each additional mana you spend increases the dimensions by 5 ft on all sides, to a max of 4 mana and 20x20x20 dimensions. By spending 5 mana, the duration also changes to permanent, no longer requiring concentration. Dispel magic automatically succeeds against permanent imaginations.

item.title: living-shadow
item.description: Your shadow detaches and forms a copy of you in your current space. It looks like you, but made of a shadowy mist with your eyes. It is stationary and mimics your attacks/gestures. You can use this shadow as the origin point for your spells and attacks. It can also make AoOs.You still must be able to see the target of your attacks/spells.As a swift action, you can teleport to this shadow if it is within 30 ft of you, ending the spell.

item.title: night-crawler
item.description: You gain night vision. While in an area of dim light or darkness, you turn into a dark silhouette version of yourself, with only your eyes remaining the same. If you are exposed to bright light, your form slowly returns back to normal over 3 rounds (~20 seconds). Returning back to darkness turns you back into a silhouette. You can toggle this shadow form off/on if you want yourself to be seen.While a silhouette, you get a +2 bonus on disguise and stealth.

item.title: vanish
item.description: Functions as invisibility (Moogen 6) but only lasts until the end of turn.

item.title: ventriloquism
item.description: You can cause your voice to sound as though it is originating from a location you can see within 30 ft of you whenever you speak.

item.title: wave-of-darkness
item.description: You slash at the air with your staff and a dark cloud washes over the area in front of you. The area is total darkness while the spell persists.You can increase the cast time of this ability to a standard action to have it deal 2d6+CL (7+CL) cold dmg when you initially create it (fort halves). This also gives the spell the [cold] tag.

item.title: alone
item.description: You cause the target creature to be alone. All of the creatures allies and neutral parties disappear to all the senses for the target. They are unable to interact with allies directly or target them with specific effects. They can't use anything that requires teamwork like flanking, casting buffs, teamwork feats etc. They might be able to infer the position of their allies based off of how their enemies are acting.When a creature that possesses companions is targeted by this spell, they are unable to effectively coordinate with them. Their companions temporarily lose the teamwork feats and their commander's charisma bonus to attack while this spell persists. This also applies to individual companions targeted by this spell.

item.title: darkness
item.description: A cloud of black mist emerges from your fingertips. This mist absorbs all natural light and leaves the area where it covers in complete darkness.You can use the spell effectively as dispel magic against a spell with the [light] tag. If you succeed, the darkness spell consumes the light and takes hold.

item.title: hellscape
item.description: You alter a target's perception, causing it to perceive the world around it as though it were made entirely out of flesh, blood and viscera (will negates). It is shaken 2. If it interacts with the environment, such as opening a door or climbing a tree, the shaken penalty increases by 1.To remove the curse you must hug a child.

item.title: nearsighted
item.description: You cause a shadowy mist to cover a creatures eyes and reduce their vision range to 15 ft (will negates). All attacks made against the creature from beyond this range are made as though the target was DD.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, target an additional creature.

item.title: shadow-puppets
shadow-weapon
item.description: You transform a held weapon such that it appears to be made out of complete darkness, absorbing the light around it. You can also choose to transform your staff into another weapon to dual wield, making you unable to cast further spells. You can transform it back as a free action.If the weapon leaves your hands for longer than 3 rounds, it reverts back to its original state.Shadow weapons deal frost damage instead of their standard damage type. When you feint a creature while wielding them, it takes (CL) frost damage.

item.title: silence
item.description: Sound cannot be created in or enter the area of this spell. Creatures are unable to speak, cry for help etc. Certain abilities dependent on sound like bardic performance, spell casting and abilities that deal sonic damage are all completely disabled.If you cast the spell on yourself, then it stays anchored to you, but it changes to a 10-foot radius and gains the [buff] tag.

item.title: afterimage
item.description: Functions as invisibility (Moogen 6) but only lasts until the end of turn. In addition, you leave behind an illusory copy of yourself in your current position that repeats a simple type of movement you perform right before vanishing. This can be something like shadowboxing or crouching while looking around. This figment lasts for 1 round before disappearing.If a creature sees you use this technique, they know something is up. If they don’t see you use it, they treat it as the real you (will negates). A creature can identify your afterimages if they have seen one on another occasion.

item.title: encroaching-darkness
item.description: A cloud of black mist emerges from your fingertips. This mist absorbs all natural light and leaves the area where it covers in complete darkness. At the end of each of your turns, the darkness spreads an additional 10 ft.You can use the spell effectively as dispel magic against a spell with the [light] tag. If you succeed, the darkness spell consumes the light and takes hold.

item.title: eyes-everywhere
item.description: You pluck one of your eyes from your head and seal the empty eyelid. After, you place the plucked eye onto a surface. It melds into that surface and closes. By placing your hand over your other eye(s), you can open the plucked eye and gaze/hear through it instead of where your body is.By forcefully opening the sealed eye, you end this spell. If a creature pokes the eye, whether its open or closed, the spell ends. Otherwise, it lasts indefinitely. They eye appears as Moogen's eye instead of yours.Whenever the eye is open, creatures present can roll perception to notice it each day. The DC is either your spell DC, or 15+(your stealth bonus).

item.title: gutwrench
item.description: Inflict a creature with a staggering pain in their stomach. When they look down, they see a blade inflicting a horrible wound upon them, either emerging from their stomach, or grazing their waist. What they see is what they believe, and what they believe manifests into reality. The creature takes 4d8+CL (18+CL) pierce damage and causes them to bleed d6 damage for 2 rounds (will halves damage and negates bleed).While a creature is bleeding from this spell, they are also effectively silenced as they cough up blood.

item.title: illusory-wall
item.description: You create a wall, floor or ceiling of any type that can appear to be made of anything. It blends seamlessly with the nearby terrain to appear as natural as possible. The wall can be no larger than 10x10 feet. You cannot chain cast invisible walls to make a bigger wall. If the wall would take any damage then it immediately disappears. If a creature attempts to move through the wall or otherwise interact with it meaningfully, then it disappears.

item.title: death-mark
item.description: A red mark appears along the creatures neck(s) resembling a bloody wound (will negates). They gain weakness 2. As an immediate action over any distance, you can "pop" the mark, removing the curse and dealing 5d6+CL (17+CL) true damage.This curse is removed by killing another creature.

item.title: nightmare
item.description: When you cast this spell, you fall into a catatonic state until your target falls asleep. You can choose to leave this state if you feel they are taking too long. When it falls asleep, it's dreams are plagued by horrific imagery of your choosing. When the creature wakes up from this dream, it is drained 1 (will negates). This spell has no mechanical effect against a creature that is already drained, but you can still haunt their dreams if you want.If you know the creature well enough to know about some deep-seated fear that they have, the creature has disadvantage on their saving throw.

item.title: piercing-gaze
item.description: Close one of your eyes and cause a much larger illusory copy of it to open on the ground. It swells before bursting in a cloud of sharp fragments, dealing 5d6+CL (17+CL) pierce damage and applying a curse (reflex halves dmg and negates curse).While a creature is cursed with your piercing gaze, a tattoo of your eye appears on their back. You see their aura as a glowing outline around their person, even through total cover. You get a +8 bonus to perception and survival checks to track them.At any point in the future, you can close it again (standard action) in the future to open an obvious illusory copy of your eye above a creature cursed with your piercing gaze. You can watch them through this eye indefinitely. If they attempt to move or cover the eye, it evades barriers attacks etc in order to keep line of sight on the cursed creature.This curse is removed by spending an hour to write your own eulogy, then burying it that night.

item.title: umbral-trespass
item.description: Fade away into shadowy mist and flow into the target of the spell. You disappear and enter stasis while you observe the world from the creature's PoV. On your next turn, you must spend another standard action to leave the creature's body in a violent slash, dealing 5d8+CL (22+CL) slash or pierce damage (fort halves) and dashing 15 ft away from the creature.This spell cannot be cast again for 1 minute.

item.title: darkvault
mirage
item.description: You affect a wide area to completely change its appearance into something else. You can create an oasis in a desert, a house on a hill or make your house look like a flat piece of land. Creatures typically don't get a save to disbelieve the illusion unless something tips them off: bumping into a wall that shouldn't be there or drinking from a pool of water that holds only sand. The less suspicious and out of place the mirage is, the less likely creatures get a will save to see through it.Casting mirage a second time removes the previous one.

item.title: shadow-projection
item.description: You create an illusory duplicate that is shaped like you but it's almost entirely black, save for its eyes. You project this shadow to a location within the spells range that you can see. While occupying this shadow, you can speak and move around freely in this new illusory body. You can cast spells, but you cannot physically interact with objects otherwise.If the shadow is ever exposed to bright light, then it disappears. If it ever takes damage, then you also take the damage and it disappears. It uses all of your statistics to determine its defenses.Upcast 6 - You no longer need to be able to see the position you initially project your shadow to, though you have to at least seen the place before. The spells range changes to unlimited.

item.title: invisibility
item.description: You appear to vanish from thin air. You gain total concealment, automatically take the hide action and get a +4 bonus on stealth checks while invisible. Objects that you carry turn invisible. This spell ends when you attack or otherwise take some form of aggressive action, like casting a spell or using an item on a creature.Certain environmental conditions can aid in seeing where this creature is. The presence of water or snow can give a better idea of their position. Inflicting a bleed effect can give you a trail of where they have been. Air that is dense from some kind of particle like dust, or actively throwing something like a bag of flour at the creature can also give you an idea of the creature's position.Regardless of whether or not you know what space the creature is, they still maintain their total concealment.

item.title: README
item.description: Moogen isn’t so much a creature as she is an idea. She is handily replaced by anyone who can outwit her, kill her, then take her place. She is a demon that exists in the shadows, content to play with the affairs of others (usually mortals). She regularly invites mortals into her loving arms as pawns in some kind of scheme, always ready with a knife to their back if they don’t play along.Moogen spells assist in manipulating light sources, stealth and misdirection.

item.title: bush
item.description: You cause a bunch of tall grass to spring up. This space is overgrown and is considered difficult terrain. It also provides cover to any attacks made into or through it.You can take the hide action in this bush as a free action the turn you cast this spell.The bush withers and fades after 1 minute, or 3 rounds if the environment couldn't otherwise sustain it.

item.title: hibernate
item.description: You cause a creature to enter a catatonic state akin to a deep sleep. Nothing short of taking damage can awaken the creature from its slumber. The creature gains the benefit of resting and is staggered for 1 minute after waking up if it slept the full duration.

item.title: pet
item.description: You reach over to a creature and pat its head. If it resembles an animal, even superficially, it is dazed on hit for 1 turn.If it is a defeated creature that matches this description, it gets the time out condition for 1 hour.Tamed animals (such as beast companions) can be brought back from pet heaven with a counter pet as a swift action.

item.title: pollinate
item.description: Shower a foe with a thick cloud of toxic plant dust. Creature takes d6+CL (3+CL) poison damage. The powder also has an additional effect (fort negates).Choose One: Poison Powder - Creature takes an additional (3+CL) poison damage at the end of its turns (fort ends effect). Rage Powder - Creature is taunted by you for one round.The spell instead deals 2d6+CL (7+CL) poison damage. You gain new options.Choose One: Sleep Powder - Creature is put to sleep. Stun Spore - Creature is dazed for 1 turn. Deadly Poison Powder - Creature takes an additional 2d6+CL (7+CL) poison damage at the end of its turns (fort ends effect).

item.title: speak-with-animals
item.description: You can speak with beasts and magical beasts as though you share a common language. They are able to much better articulate their feelings as though they possessed the intellect of a simple humanoid, but their instincts, desires and attitude toward you remain largely the same.

item.title: tree-shape
item.description: Transform into a young living tree, a large shrub or dead tree. The type of tree, as well as its appearance, is under your control. While in tree form, you can observe the world around you just as if you were in your normal form. You can dismiss tree shape as a free action.You get a +10 bonus to stealth/disguise while in tree form and can use either skill to evade detection, otherwise people will think something is fishy about this tree. You cannot move or take any actions while in tree form, but you can speak.

item.title: vine-whip
item.description: Two long and supple green vines grow from your body. You can use these vines to hold and manipulate objects within 15 ft, but not wield equipment, such as weapons, shields or staves. These function as whips, but they are considered natural attacks and deal d6 crush damage.

item.title: wild-growth
item.description: Enemies within the spell's area have plants suddenly grow in the chinks of their armor and around their feet, tangling their joints. They have their speed reduced by 15. The plants can be destroyed by dealing slashing or fire damage to them, or 10 damage of any other type.

item.title: ants-in-your-pants
item.description: You launch a stream of ants that get your opponent MOVING (reflex reduces effect to 1 round). They take a (3+CL) pierce damage at the start of their turn. They must start each of their turns by moving 10 ft in a random direction. Being immersed or drenched in water, taking any AoE damage or something else suitable can reduce the duration of this spell or remove the ants completely. The ants automatically disperse if the foe is defeated.

item.title: arboreal-army
item.description: All the nearby plants snap to attention, ready to receive orders. As a swift action each turn, you can command a nearby inanimate plant to bully a nearby creature by bending its trunk or swinging its branches. Its bonus is your CL. It gets advantage if the creature is currently inside of the attacking tree, bush etc.

item.title: fairy-dust
item.description: You borrow some fairy dust from the fey wilds and toss it at your enemy, with a variety of effects.Choose One: Sparkles - Coat creatures in brilliant sparkly particles. Attacks made against a creature covered in sparkles have seeking. Sparkly creatures have a -10 stealth penalty.
