Flashy - The dust sparkles so brightly that it blinds creatures for 1 minute (reflex reduces to blurred vision). At the end of a creature's turn, they can make an additional save to reduce the condition. Blind>blurred vision>normal. Rainbow [pattern] [mind-affecting] - Targets are fascinated for 1 minute (will negates).

item.title: fetch
item.description: You wiggle an object at a creature in range and toss it to a space within 30 feet of you. The creature must spend all of its actions to retrieve this object and bring it back to you (will negates). If you ever get more than 30 feet away from the object, you are no longer visible to the target or the creature successfully brings it back to you, the spell ends. If there is something that impedes the creature's movement, it can reasonably spend its actions dealing with this obstacle (a wall of sheep, creature is grappled etc). If the creature does not retrieve the item after the first turn, then it gets an additional save at the end of each of its turn to shake off the compulsion to fetch.This spell’s DC is 2 higher when targeting beasts.

item.title: nourish
item.description: You infuse plants with life, with a variety of effects. Choose one: Cultivate [recharge] - You cause a single dying plant to become vibrant, putting it on the correct path for future growth. If you [mana burn], you can even accelerate its growth one stage. Seed>sprout>seedling>sapling>adult.Fertilize [recharge] - Tracts of land become more habitable for plants, enriching soil and removing contaminants, assuring future growth. You target 1 square mile. Contaminators might not be too happy…Constrict - An enemy within 30 ft must roll a reflex save or be entangled. They can make an athletics check to escape (standard, spell DC).

item.title: power-of-the-sun
item.description: You temporarily instill great fear of the sun to a creature. Every turn the creature starts its turn in an area lit with sunlight or moves into a sun-lit area, it takes 2d6 (7) psychic damage and is shaken 1.

item.title: queen-bee
item.description: You summon a swarm of bees that intuitively follow your orders without need for speech. The bees won’t enter water. You must maintain a tether to them using the swarm almost like an additional limb that if separated, immediately disappears. You take a -5 penalty to stealth checks and you have a hover speed of 30.The bees hover around you and can perform a few sets of tasks... Interact (action varies) - The bees can perform tasks with a high degree of precision such as picking up objects and opening doors. They can perform any task you could perform with your hands (including skills like SoH) at a range of 20 feet Sting [envenom] (standard) - Automatically deal (2+CL) pierce damage to a single creature within 10 feet. They are also staggered for 1 round (fort negates).Protect (immediate) - The bees move to block an attack, giving you a +4 bonus to ac or +4 bonus to a reflex save. This subtracts 5 rounds from the duration of the spell

item.title: wall-of-sheep
item.description: You summon a flock of sheep that quickly pile up on top of each other to form a fluffy impassable barrier. The sheep are completely impervious to all forms of attack unless it is a combat maneuver. The wall has 20 poise. When poise broken, a 5x5 section of the wall falls apart and the sheep disappear. If the creature who broke through the wall was larger, the hole is also large enough for them to fit (10x10 large, 15x15 huge etc).In order to interact with the wall, it required maneuvering through the unruly sheep. To climb on the wall, it requires an athletics roll, to balance on it requires acrobatics etc (skill DC=caster's DC).

item.title: floristry
item.description: You cause a vibrant thorny flower to sprout from the ground. It mindlessly shoots your enemies for the spells duration, focusing a target you choose when you cast, or the nearest creature if the first target leaves the flowers range. It loses 5 hp each turn. When it is defeated, it wilts and crumbles to dust.If the flower is summoned in an area that otherwise wouldn’t sustain it, such as underground or in stone, it loses 10 hp each turn.

item.title: forests-curse
item.description: You curse a foe to wander aimlessly and suffer while in forested terrain. They take a -10 penalty to survival checks made to navigate in forest/jungle type terrain. They also lose poison resistance if they have it.In order to remove this curse, the creature must plant 3 new trees.

item.title: mad-monkeys
item.description: You channel your inner tree to summon one to your aid. Gain (3*CL) temp hp when you cast this spell. Summon a treant that understands druidic and does its best to aid you.When you lose this temp hp, the treant disappears.

item.title: oaken-summons
item.description: You grow bark on the exterior of your skin and to summon a treant to your aid. Gain (3*CL) temp hp when you cast this spell. The treant that understands druidic and does its best to aid you.When you lose this temp hp, the treant disappears.

item.title: persistent-pranksters
item.description: You summon a group of playful fairies that fly around the battlefield and bother your enemies. They do not have any hp, but they do have 25+CL poise. If they are ever poise broken, they disappear.On your turn they can fly up to 30 feet and make a combat maneuver against a creature. The result of the combat maneuver is always 20+CL. You can direct them to focus on specific creatures.

item.title: sunny-day
item.description: The clouds part and the sun shines brightly. All plant creatures in the area gain +2 attack and FH 1.You cannot cast this spell at night.All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

item.title: leech-seed
item.description: Shower a foe with seeds that take root inside of their skin (reflex negates). At the end of your turn, they take (CL+5) necrotic damage and you recover hp equal to the damage if you are within 30 ft. As an immediate action, you can divert the flow of energy to bestow this healing upon another creature within 30 ft of you.If neither you nor an ally is within 30 ft of the seeded creature, the damage does not occur.

item.title: solar-power
string-shot
item.description: Shoot a precise string of webbing at a creature. They are entangled and you may slam them against the ground into any position within the spells range to deal 5d6+CL (17+CL) crush damage (fort negates damage). Athletics as a standard action to remove entangled.

item.title: voice-of-the-forest
rebirth
item.description: This spell can be used by creatures hoping to change themselves.After the cast time completes, the creature falls unconscious to dream about its new self as a cocoon forms around them. 24 hours pass and they awaken in their new form. The creature can change its race, its gender and its physical appearance to its liking. The creature has complete control over all features such as racial traits, height, age, skin color etc as long as it falls within reasonable parameters for the race.If the cocoon is destroyed, the spell fails and the creature inside is killed..

item.title: savage-roar
item.description: Let out a powerful roar to inspire savagery and anger in your allies. All allied creatures make a melee attack against a creature within reach. Beasts and any creature that can understand druidic get a +4 bonus to this attack.

item.title: solar-eclipse
item.description: You alter the composition of the heavens in such a way to mimic the effect of a solar eclipse. All creatures caught in the radius of the spell when it is first cast without proper eye protection are blinded for the duration of the spell (reflex reduces to 1 round). Creatures in the spells radius take a -4 penalty on perception even if they aren't blinded.What constitutes protection either covers the eyes completely, or are glasses specifically designed to block the powerful light of the eclipse. The caster can create a pair of these glasses for 100g.Solar eclipse ends automatically if lunar eclipse is cast in its range, cancelling each other out.All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

item.title: README
item.description: The oldest of all the deities and the creator goddess. Mother Earth is interested in the constant struggle between nature and those who would seek its destruction or exploitation. The proliferation of life and balance between all living things are what her followers preach.Mother Earth spells primarily manipulate plants, animals and other aspects of nature to aid those who seek to protect it.

item.title: foxdie
item.description: You summon a relatively average looking fox at a point you can see. At your command, you can cause it to make noises typical fox. After which, it explodes violently in a tiny fiery mushroom cloud.This does not cause damage to anybody or anything, nor does it dirty anything.If you do not cause it to make noise, it disappears within 1 minute.

item.title: pants
item.description: You undo belts, buttons and zippers on a creature's pants as they are forcefully removed and folded into a pile next to them.This spell does not work when used against heavily armored targets.

item.title: x-ray
item.description: While this spell is active your eyes gain and unusual swirly quality to them that overlaps over your usual features. The spell allows you to see through clothing/armor while it is worn by a creature.

item.title: big-head-mode
item.description: You increase a creatures head to be double its original size, doing little more than inconveniencing and embarrassing them (fort negates). A creature cannot be the target of this effect more than once each day.

item.title: form-of-waifu-husbando
item.description: You transform into a cute anime girl/boy. You have exceptionally large eyes, wacky hair and abnormal colors. Your voice also changes accordingly.You can speak and understand manganese while transformed.

item.title: pornportions
item.description: You cause a creature to have incredibly exaggerated proportions, focusing primarily on the sex characteristics. Women get incredibly curvy or impossibly thin, men get enormous members, or you can mix and match features of the creature to match a particular taste. This spell cannot give creatures parts they do not have, only alter the ones they do.Get advantage on sex checks...If you roll that kind of thing.

item.title: kaijumorph
item.description: You grow to be 100 ft tall, proportions changing as appropriate. This does not give you extra carry weight, strength, or destructive capabilities. It does not even increase your reach. You still possess the same exact weight.If you are targeted with a harmful effect, take damage or cease concentration, you immediately shrink back to your normal size.

item.title: power-word-fun
awaken
item.description: You give a plant or animal sentience. Its intelligence increases to +0. If it is a plant, it gains a 30ft speed and the ability to uproot without killing itself. If it is a beast, their type changes to magical beast. Creatures gain big goofy eyes and a mouth to speak with. They learn common.What happens after that is largely based up to it. Certain types of creatures may have certain mannerisms. Predators tend to be more aggressive, for instance. Beavers are more industrious. They can look upon their past and present with great clarity, recognizing mistreatment and caring.This spell has a 1 week cooldown.

item.title: README
blight
item.description: You briefly allow a creature to experience the joy of decomposition. They take 2d8+CL (9+CL) necrotic damage and are sickened 2 for one minute (fort halves dmg and negates sickened).Upcast - For each additional mana you spend, deal an additional d6 damage. If you cast at 3rd lvl or higher, increases the sickened duration to 1 hour.

item.title: bloodbath
item.description: As part of casting the spell, you cut yourself with a held object taking d6 (3) bleed damage immediately and every turn after at the start of your turn. Creatures you target bleed for the same damage you took (fort negates). As long as you continue to bleed, the targets also continue to bleed for the same damage you take each turn.You can choose to stop bleeding as an instant action, ending the spell.

item.title: bone-shaker
item.description: {% hint style="info" %} The spell cannot target creatures that are BONELESS. A successful monster lore check against a creature reveals if it has bones. {% endhint %}The spell's effect varies depending on what you target.Living Creature - The creature takes 2d6+CL (7+CL) necrotic damage and is staggered for one round (fort haves damage and negates stagger).Willing Undead - The creature spends an immediate action to make an attack against a creature within reach or move 30 feetUnwilling Undead - Functions as willing undead (fort negates)

item.title: call-of-the-grave
item.description: Cause several arms to erupt from the ground and grab onto a creature. The creature is entangled (reflex negates).The hands share your AC, and have poise equal to their AC. On hit, when the hands are poise broken, or with a successful athletics check (DC=their AC) they retreat back into the ground.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, target an additional creature in range.

item.title: decomposition
item.description: You cause a group of corpses to rapidly experience decomposition, turning in them into skeletons almost instantly. Perfect for cleanly storing in your closet.If cast on an undead creature, they instead take 2d6+CL (7+CL) true dmg. This can happen accidentally if you happen to target an undead buried amongst corpses.

item.title: grave-robber
item.description: While this technique is prepared, you gain an innate sense for when corpses are nearby. You can sense them buried up to 30 feet underground. You can read the text written on tombstones and similar things, even if the text has long since faded. If you can see a corpse, you know what its name was in life.As a standard action, you can reach into the ground and pull out an entire corpse if it is not inside of a container of some sort.Undead creatures have a visible aura around them unless they are your level or higher.

item.title: halt-undead
item.description: You command an undead creature to bend to your will, and you will it to stand still. It is entangled (will negates). An intelligent undead creature gets a new save at the end of each of its turns.

item.title: life-transfer
item.description: You transfer fundamental life energy between yourself and the target. Choose one.Heal You can inflict drained upon yourself in order to heal the target. You become drained 1 and you heal 10 hp, or remove 1 drain stack from the target.Harm Alternatively, you can [mana burn] to inflict drained stacks you possess onto another creature. This requires an attack roll and removes 1 drained stack from yourself to inflict it on your target on hit. If you miss, you do not mana burn. You must be drained to use this variant of the spell.Upcast - When you heal, you can increase the number of drained stacks you accumulate by 1 for each additional mana spent. For each stack of additional drain you accumulate, you can remove an additional stack of drain from the target or heal an additional 7 hp.When you harm, each additional mana spent allows you to increase the stacks of drain you pass on to your enemy by 1. You must possess drained stacks equal to the amount you are inflicting.

item.title: mr-skeltal
item.description: Raise a skeleton from a corpse whose only calling is to jam. Give it the instrument used as the focus of this spell and it will play it with a bonus of (CL+2) whenever you ask. When not playing, it follows you around.If you give the skeleton a trumpet, its bonus increases to (CL+4).Doot.

item.title: animate-dead
bone-cage
item.description: {% hint style="info" %} The spell cannot target creatures that are BONELESS. A successful monster lore check against a creature reveals if it has bones. {% endhint %}You tear the bones out of a corpse and use them to shield yourself. You get +2 AC. This bone armor can be destroyed with a successful sunder.

item.title: gloom-bolt
item.description: You shoot a ray of necrotic energy that interferes with the creature's vision. Make a ranged attack that deals 3d8+CL (13+CL) necrotic damage and blinds on hit for 1 round.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, fire an additional ray at a different creature.

item.title: spectral-hand
item.description: You summon an ghostly bloodied hand that you can used to deliver reach spells from a range. Spells with a range of reach gain a range of 30 ft. You can make these attacks as melee attacks or ranged attacks. Defaults to melee.The hand ambiently floats around you when not in use, but you can choose to pocket it if you don't want creatures to see it.

item.title: vampiric-blood
item.description: You drain the blood from a recently deceased creature and use its life force to bolster yourself and a chosen ally within range. You restore 2d6+CL (7+CL) hp and grant the same amount to the chosen ally.The same corpse cannot be targeted multiple times with this spell. Upcast - For every additional mana spent, increase healing by d6.

item.title: asphyxiate
corpse-explosion
item.description: The effect and cast time of this varies depending on what you target.Allied Undead (Immediate) - You can cast this freely on any undead you control, even in response to one being destroyed. The creature bloats and cracks before bursting, dealing 3d8+CL (13+CL) necrotic damage (reflex halves). This kills the undead.A Corpse (Standard) - You can cast this spell on a corpse. Its range increases to 60 ft, its AoE increases to 10 ft but its cast time increases to a standard action.Upcast - By spending 5 mana, you can cause the the initial explosion to deal 5d8+CL (22+CL) necrotic damage. In addition, you set off a chain reaction, causing all corpses in the spell's area to also explode, and the corpses they effect and so on. A creature can still only be damaged by a single explosion.

item.title: corpse-transposition
item.description: Briefly vanish in a pool of blood before exploding violently out of the target corpse/minion. If you targeted an allied undead, this kills the undead.

item.title: drain-soul
item.description: You borrow a piece of creature's soul. They are drained 2 (fort reduces effect to 10 necrotic damage). You regain 10 hp.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase drain by 1 and healing by 5 (with passed saves dealing the would be drained value*5 necrotic damage).

item.title: going-ghost
item.description: Turn incorporeal until the end of your turn.Upcast 5 - Until the end of your next turn.

item.title: unholy-frenzy
item.description: Give undead you control within the spells area a +4 bonus to attack this turn.Choose one specific creature within range of the spell. All undead under your control rush this target down, moving up to it and making a simple attack. If the undead can make ranged attacks, it need not move.

item.title: corpse-possession
item.description: This spell spell functions as animate dead, but changes as follows. It raises the creature as a zombie version of itself. Upon completion, your spirit leaves your body and inhabits the zombified corpse. You can inhabit this corpse indefinitely, and speak through it in the creatures voice, your own, or a raspy mixture of the two.You can choose to no longer inhabit the corpse at any time, returning back to your body and causing the magic animating it to leave. This kills the zombie.While you animate this corpse, any other undead you have animated enter a coma, and reanimate once you return.Upcast 5 - You can choose to animate the corpses of 3 similar creatures at once, such as members of a town guard.

item.title: haunted
item.description: Take a creature or an object for a ride. Detach your spirit from your body, causing it to look like you are napping or have your head in the clouds. Attach your freed spirit to a creature or object within range (will negates against creatures). If the object is possessed by a creature (ha), then you are effectively targeting the creature and it still gets a save.If you are successful, you can swap between using your own senses and the senses of what you are attached to. The creature remains unaware of your presence unless you make it known. You can telekinetically move objects within 30 ft around while haunting. Objects weighing less than 5 pounds can be tossed and objects under 100 lbs can be slowly dragged. You can also telepathically speak to the creature, making your voice sound vague and ghost-like or your own voice.A creature with arcana or religion recognizes the moving objects or voices as a possession with a DC 14 check. By uttering a prayer or drinking holy water, the spell immediately ends. You can also choose to end it willingly at any time.

item.title: vile-vigor
item.description: You can remove practically any status ailment at the cost of your own magic. Mana burn to remove it, increasing in amount based on the status ailment.1 - Minor Status - Asleep, bleed, blurred vision, charmed, entangled, fatigued, fascinated, grounded, knocked down, shaken/sicken/clumsy stacks, frosty, wet.2 - Major Status - Bone chilled, ablaze, blinded, confused, envenomed, frightened, staggered, silenced, taunt.3 - Extreme Status - Dazed, pacified, stun, stasis.You can change the mana burn into drain to cast this spell as a swift action.

item.title: final-hour
item.description: A surge of necrotic energy imbues an undead creature, giving it a very noticeable aura. It takes a -5 penalty to stealth and becomes immune to hp damage. It is afflicted with a curse that destroys it at the end of its second turn.

item.title: shackles-of-pain
item.description: You share your pain with another creature, represented by an ethereal shackle that connects you two (will negates). While within 60 ft of this creature, you take half damage, and the other half of the damage is transferred to it as true damage. If the creature leaves this range, the shackle breaks.

item.title: beyond-death
item.description: When you are defeated or killed, you can choose to spend 6 mana to enter a ghost state. While in this state, you can freely speak, use supernatural abilities and cast spells, but your speed is 0 and you cannot make weapon, natural or unarmed attacks.At the end of your next turn, your spirit reunites with your body and this effect ends.Your ghost remains tethered to your body. You cannot move on your own without the aid of magic, but other creatures can physically move your body to adjust the position of your ghost.

item.title: possession
item.description: You turn incorporeal and siphon into a creatures mouth to take control of their body (will reduces effect to stagger for 1 round). On each of your subsequent turns, you can play as that creature using all of its abilities and statistics except hp. In order to use activated the abilities, you must have seen the creature use them, or succeed on a local check (DC 15+lvl of creature). If you do not, then you must spend 1 week to accommodate yourself to the new body. Creatures under your control like summons or undead still recognize you as their master.When you are defeated, dispelled etc, you appear in a space adjacent to the possessed creature and are staggered for 1 round and the creature is drained 3.If cast on a defeated creature, there is no save. Because the spell uses your vitality to sustain the creature, you can immediately stand up and start fighting.You get a plus +5 bonus to disguise checks to pretend to be this creature. You can swap between your voice and the creatures voice at will.The spell cannot be cast again until you rest. When you rest while possessing a creature, you regain your hp, but no other benefits from resting.

item.title: skelepathy
item.description: Speak directly to a creature's skeleton, setting it free from the tyranny of its fleshy host.The spell cannot target creatures that are BONELESS. A successful monster lore check against a creature reveals if it has bones. This spell functions as animate dead, but with a few bonuses… You can target creatures that aren't dead (including undead, but not undead that are only bones) Its level is set to the level of the creature the spell is cast on Its max HP is the current HP of the creature at time of casting It has the perform (dance, trumpet) skill (bonus=CL+4)

item.title: README
item.description: Necromancy spells are about manipulating the dead and inflicting dead, often via necrotic damage.

item.title: blazing-palm
item.description: You fire a ray of immolation that sets targets ablaze. Roll a ranged attack that deals 2d8+CL (9+CL) fire damage. On a hit applies glowing.

item.title: sacred-flames
item.description: While this technique is prepared, your heat is infused with holy light. Whenever you cast a spell that does fire damage, its damage counts as fire and holy. The spell's tags change as appropriate.

item.title: flame-of-destiny
item.description: You create a stationary bonfire whose flames move in slow motion, and illuminate an area of 100ft. It can be put out like any other fire.By resting next to the fire and gazing into its flames for at least 10 minutes, your deity shows you visions of a prominent creature that it wants you to defeat or apprehend. This creature is always a similar level to you, and is a leader of some sort at the forefront of operations in opposition to your deity: a necromancer, bandit chief, cult leader etc. This creature is also somewhat close by in terms of proximity, only targeting creatures you can realistically find within a week of travel using your current means of transportation.

item.title: solar-flare
item.description: Close your eyes and unleash a blast of solar energy that deals (CL) fire damage to all creatures and blinds them for 1 round (reflex negates).

item.title: blazing-beam
item.description: Fire a beam that magnetizes to burning creatures and feeds the flames. The target takes 4d8+CL (18+CL) fire damage. If they are ablaze, the DC to save against the condition is increased by 4, and the penalty to AC is increased to -4. Only standard actions grant a new save against being ablaze. If an effect would normally automatically remove ablaze, it instead only grants a save without the -4 penalty.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, the spell deals an additional d8 dmg.

item.title: radiance
item.description: You cause the target of the spell to emanate an exceptionally bright light. The area within 60 ft of the target is bathed in bright light.You can use the spell effectively as dispel magic against a spell with the [darkness] tag. If you succeed, the light spell consumes the dark. This happens automatically when the area of the spell overlaps with a [darkness] effect and radiance is disabled for 1 minute.

item.title: plasma-blade
item.description: Imbue a melee slashing weapon in hand with searing light, changing its base damage to d8+CL (4+CL) Fire damage. It becomes weightless. It gives off bright light within 20 feet.As part of casting this spell, and as a swift action every turn for its duration, you may make a simple attack with this weapon. If it leaves your possession, this spell ends after one round.

item.title: prismatic-body
item.description: You become a being of pure light, allowing you to move through glass and obstacles that do not block light (such as wire fences) freely.You shed light in a 20-foot area. This form can be suppressed while in areas of magical darkness, but you automatically attempt to dispel any such area at the start of your turns.Sighted creatures that attack you are considered to have blurred vision against you, and creatures that successfully attack you in melee or are grappling with you are set ablaze (reflex negates). No matter how many attacks a creature makes, they cannot be forced to make multiple saves a turn.

item.title: rainbow-beam
item.description: Line attack deals 6d8+CL (27+CL) fire damage to enemies, but instead of harming allies, it grants them a Lucky Rainbow - visible as an aura around them. They may consume this rainbow to reroll any one attack, save, or skill check within a minute, after which it disappears.A creature may only have one Lucky Rainbow on them at a time. It lasts one minute.Also creates bright light in its area for a round.

item.title: README
item.description: The luminosity tree is all about inflicting a unique status effect called "glowing." This status effect can be consumed by spells in this tree to trigger bonus effects. Prismancy spells deal fire damage and light up the battlefield.

item.title: blazing-bulwark
item.description: {% hint style="info" %} Special: Must be wielding a shield to cast If you have shield focus, you can cast this spell as an instant action. {% endhint %}As part of casting the spell, take the block action. If the foe attacked with a melee weapon, they are set ablaze (reflex negates).

item.title: bouncing-blast
item.description: You toss a mote of flame that hungers for more if it successfully consumes its target. Roll an attack against a creature that deals 2d8+CL (9+CL) fire damage. If it defeats the creature, you can target a new one within 30 ft with an additional attack. This can continue indefinitely.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8.

item.title: forbidden-flame
item.description: Convert all of your mana into heat with a spark. Cause the air to explode in a creatures face, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) fire damage. You automatically spend all of your mana, including any reserves, when you use this technique. For each mana spent beyond the first, increase the spells CL by 1.

item.title: pillar-of-flame
item.description: Ignite a circle on the ground and cause a pillar of flame to erupt from it. Creatures in the area of the pillar take 2d8+CL (9+CL) fire damage.Upcast - Increase damage by d8 (4) and create an additional pillar.

item.title: self-immolation
item.description: You light yourself on fire and the fire hungers for things to burn. At the end of your turn, you take 4 fire damage. Whenever a creature is within 5ft of you, they take 4 fire damage. Your speed increases by 5 ft.Upcast - The damage increases by 2 and your speed increases by 5 per additional mana spent. If you spend at least 3 mana, your movement is [elusive].

item.title: soulfire
boiling-blood
item.description: Ignite a creatures insides, making them convulse in pain. They are staggered and take (CL) fire damage each round at the start of its turn (fort negates). At the end of each turn, save again.Creatures that are already ablaze take a -4 penalty to their save.

item.title: flame-cleanse-me
item.description: You hold a flame to your chest that burns away your ailments. Poisons, bleed, and magical damage-over-time or status conditions are removed at the cost of 5 hp.

item.title: hot-streak
item.description: Supercharge your staves, decreasing the mana cost of all abilities with the [fire] tag by 1, but increasing the mana cost of all other mana expenditure by 2.

item.title: fire-and-brimstone
item.description: The flames of hell are unleashed through a portal you open up. A line of hellfire that continues until it hits a solid object deals 3d8+CL (13+CL) fire damage to creatures within. The portal remains open for 3 rounds, continuing to damage creatures that move through it.Fire created by this spell ignores fire resistance.This spell has great potential for destruction considering its immense AoE and the fact it persists for several rounds, potentially burning holes through creatures and structures alike.

item.title: fire-blast
item.description: You throw an enormous ball of fire that attaches to something, then explodes forcefully, dealing 4d8+CL (18+CL) fire damage and knocking down creatures struck (reflex halves dmg and negates knock down).You can target one specific creature with an attack roll. If you land it, the creature's space is the center of the explosion, and it takes a -2 penalty to its save. If you miss, the fire falls directly down and then explodes when it first impacts a surface.This also destroys flammable undergrowth, sends small objects flying, starts fires, disperses atmospheric conditions, and otherwise causes the effects one would expect from a fiery explosion.Upcast - Every additional mana spent adds d8 damage, 10 range, and 5 radius.

item.title: hellfire
item.description: Temporarily borrow some fire from the demon realm, burning yourself in the process. You explode violently dealing 4d8+CL (18+CL) fire damage and setting creatures ablaze (reflex halves dmg and negates ablaze). This spell and the fires it causes ignore fire resistance.The area of the spell is scorched for 1 minute, causing the movement of any fiends inside of it to increase by 20 for 1 round.You yourself take (CL) fire damage from the burst, and ignore being set ablaze.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, the spell deals an additional d8 (4) dmg.

item.title: fire-snake
item.description: Cause a flaming serpent to erupt from your staff. It moves along the ground 30 feet, capable of bending around obstacles and terrain. It continues to occupy that 30 feet of space, burning any that it passes through, or that pass through it. Creatures engulfed by the fiery serpent take 5d8+CL (23+CL) fire damage (reflex negates).As a swift action on subsequent turns, you can move the snake another 30 feet.

item.title: inferno-sphere
item.description: The area around you is pelted with a whirling storm of flame. All creatures (except you) within 15 feet are instantly and persistently set ablaze. Creatures that start their turns in range or move into range take (CL) fire damage.Your speed is reduced to 10 while buffed by this spell.

item.title: purge
item.description: You fire a beam of purifying light, dealing 7d8+CL (31+CL) fire damage and blinding everything it hits for one round (reflex halves dmg and negates blind). This automatically destroys objects of solid or lesser toughness, and if it's enough to break them, it continues past them. This damage area is persistent, and creatures that enter it must save against the damage.Fiends and undead creatures that fail their saves are set ablaze.You may not move while concentrating on this spell.At the start of your next two turns, the damage occurs again, and you may sweep the beam up to 45 degrees to target a new line and everything between the two lines that gets caught in the sweep. The sweep area is not persistent, but the new line is.Turn 1: line Turn 2: sweep, new line Turn 3: sweep, new line Turn 4: spell ends at the start of your turn

item.title: README
item.description: The magic-y magic that has no real life analogue. Primarily focused around dealing force damage using projectiles and conjured weapons.

item.title: charming-gaze
item.description: You lock your eyes onto a target and charm them (will negates). If you're currently engaged in combat with the creature, the spells duration is 1 minute. If you are not, the spell's duration is 8 hours. Entering combat against them shortens the remaining duration to 1 minute.

item.title: dance-with-me
darting-duplicate
item.description: An illusory duplicate of yourself leaves your square, which moves at up to your speed per round and takes a path of your choosing. It can go around corners if you know where to turn to not hit terrain or creatures. It cannot replicate any actions besides moving and smiling.Creatures that are threatening you when you cast this spell must make an AoO on the duplicate (will negates).If the duplicate enters a creature's space or impassable terrain, any creature that witnesses it instantly disbelieves it. A creature that identifies your spell when you cast it instantly disbelieves it.

item.title: lip-service
item.description: You can make a creature think you said something you didn’t. You can implant simple ideas that require no more than two sentences to convey (I think your hat looks lovely. Where did you get it?) into their head that they think that you said in the middle of a conversation, while masking what you actually said during the few seconds it would take to speak.In essence you can speak to two different people at the same time and tell them two different things.

item.title: role-playing
item.description: You instantly apply a disguise to the target creature. Disguises typically include things like makeup, clothing, accessories and occasionally something more odd like stilts.

item.title: tongues
item.description: Creature can speak and understand all spoken non-secret languages. Has no effect on written text.

item.title: unspoken-name
item.description: When you cast this spell, designate a word, phrase, or name. If a creature within 1 mile of you uses that word, phrase, or name to refer to you, you immediately learn that creature’s name, appearance, and location. This discharges the spell.

item.title: command
item.description: You give the subject a single command, which it obeys to the best of its ability at its earliest opportunity (will negates). You may select from the following options. The spell specifies whether the creature can take other actions, or if their actions provoke AoOs.Approach - On its turn, the subject moves directly towards you 30 ft, provoking AoOsDrop It - On its turn, the subject drops whatever it is holding. It can’t pick up any dropped item on the same turn it drops it.Kneel - The subject is knocked down. It may act normally but takes any appropriate penalties.Begone - On its turn, the subject moves 30 ft directly away from you, provoking AoOs.Praise Me - The subject babbles on about your greatness, effectively silencing them for 1 round. If the subject can’t carry out your command on its next turn, it defaults to kneel.

item.title: sense-motives
item.description: While this technique is prepared, you gain a +4 bonus to insight checks. Whenever you glean something using insight, you can transfer the knowledge you gain to any creature you can see as vague impressions, effectively treating it as though they had succeeded in using insight to detect falsehoods.

item.title: stage-fright
item.description: The fear of failure looms over the target creature (will negates). They take a -2 penalty to attack and opposed skill checks. Whenever they graze, miss or fail an opposed skill check they initiated, they take d6+CL (3+CL) psychic damage. Outside of combat this gains the [subtle] tag and gives creatures disadvantage on their next skill check made in front of a crowd. Its duration changes to 24 hours. Once they roll the check, the spell ends.

item.title: stunt-double
item.description: You instantly apply a disguise to the target creature that causes them to appear identical to you.While standing adjacent to a creature that looks identical to you, attacks and targeted spells roll to randomly target among everyone (will save per attempt negates, passing this save causes an attacker to be immune to the same cast of the spell).

item.title: tongue-twister
item.description: You add an extra load to all mental actions related to a creature’s speaking, causing their speech to be slowed and slurred (will negates). In order to speak at all, the creature must spend a swift action instead of a free action (ex sharing information with monster lore). In order to cast a spell that normally requires a swift action, the creature must spend a standard action. In order to cast a spell that normally requires a standard action, the creature must spend a FRA.This increase in action cost can reasonably apply to any other actions based on speech as well.

item.title: overstimulate
item.description: You flood the creatures senses with stimuli, overloading them (will negates). They have -15 speed, blurred vision and any blindsense they have is disabled. They have weakness 2 to all damage. This weakness can only be applied once per effect (ie multiple damage types on something like a fire sword don’t deal +4 dmg per strike).An affected creature can make an additional save at the end of each of their turns. If wet, this additional save has advantage.

item.title: the-hand-that-feeds
item.description: You bring forth all of the negative memories and feelings a companion has for its leader. The target companion is taunted by its leader for 1 round (will negates). It does not use any recharge abilities while taunted in this way. This ability cleanses all other taunt effects currently affecting the companion creature if the spell is successful.Upcast 5 - You can target 2 companion creatures.

item.title: venomous-promise
item.description: Your words are poison, but they don't know that. Whenever you share information and get a creature to promise not to tell anybody (or something to that effect), you can infect the creature with a venomous promise.From that point after, if they share any information related to what they promised about, they succumb to the effects of the spell. They are immediately envenomed. You are aware of when this happens, who triggered it and what they said and can immediately begin scrying, sensing through the creature that broke the agreement.You can do this for up to 10 minutes. At any point during the scrying, including when it ends, you can deal 40 poison damage to the creature. This damage is nonlethal and does not immediately kill them (though the venom might).

item.title: domination
item.description: You link your mind with a creature and enforce your will upon it. For the duration of the spell the creature is charmed and you can telepathically give orders to the dominated creature. They must follow these orders unless they are very obviously self-harming (ex. KYS NOW). For all intents and purposes, this creature is considered your ally as long as they are dominated. If you know of the creature's abilities, you can command it to use them, otherwise they use their normal tactics, but to aid you.At the end of each turn, the creature gets a new save against the effect.The spell ends if any of your allies harm the target (including you). This spell can only be cast 1/minute.

item.title: order-66
item.description: You plant subconscious cues into a helpless or willing target. After completing the cast time, you cause the target to forget you casting this spell. At any point thereafter, you can trigger the true effects of this spell by speaking a passphrase in a manner where the target can clearly hear you as a standard action. For 1 minute the creature aids you in combat, attacking your enemies as you direct them. Once this effect is triggered, the contingency ends.The contingent aspect of this spell applies to the caster, not the target creature.The spell leaves behind subtle cues, allowing those trained in insight to realize the creature is affected by this spell (caster's DC+4). Creatures only ever get 1 check to realize this enchantment is in place.Upcast 6 - The duration of the subconscious order is permanent.

item.title: authority
item.description: You link the minds of all creatures with intelligence higher than -2 that can hear the sound of your voice and see you. For the duration of the cast time, you must speak and stand relatively still. What you talk about during the minute cast time is of little importance, all that matters is that you speak. You automatically catch the attention of every creature if nobody is under duress for the duration of the cast time.At the end of the cast time, all minion creatures are automatically charmed by you. For non minions (will negates). A creature of your level or higher needs not make a save at all. After the minute, you can move around, ensnaring more people in your speech as long as you continue speaking.While charmed, creatures will follow you around and agree with basically everything you have to say. You can parade them around, have them protest, have them clap at your performances etc. They will avoid actively engaging in obviously dangerous activities, like jumping off cliffs, attacking people or walking into a war zone. Stopping the spell or playing beautiful music can break this spell's effect. The profession DC to do so is the spell's DC+5.

item.title: README
item.description: When you try and figure out who the most attractive lady is at a party, it's often a question of who is second best, for whenever you get a closer look at #1, it's Shira. People submit to the Cataclysm for strength, and Moogen for stealth, but this demon lord prefers subterfuge. She often exists among mortals, playing along with the politics and wars for fun. Being the least abrasive and the most approachable, Shira is the demon lord the most mortals find intertwined in their life, often not knowing that they deal with a demon.Shira spells focus on deceit as well as mental domination of both overt and subtle varieties.

item.title: embiggen
item.description: The touched creature increases to large size.If the creature is already large or larger, the spell has no effect.

item.title: README
item.description: The magic-y magic that has no real life analogue. Primarily focused around dealing force damage using projectiles and conjured weapons.

item.title: alarming-sigil
item.description: You inscribe a magic rune on the surface of an object. Whenever a creature of at least tiny or larger size enters this area, the sigil triggers, creating one of 2 effects you decided on casting. In either case, you are mentally alerted and awakened if sleeping.Silent Alarm - Only you are mentally alerted Loud Alarm - A loud sound starts to play and repeat, like beeping. Creatures within 300ft can hear it in ideal conditions.

item.title: amplify
item.description: The touched creature gains the ability to increase their volume much higher than what is normal. Good for getting the attention of crowds, shouting for lost friends and announcing for sports.Upcast 5 - The spell doesn't increase your volume further, but rather allows your voice to carry extreme distances. You are capable of speaking to entire towns, large battlefields and small islands miles wide.

item.title: arcane-lock
item.description: The spell can only be cast on medium (or smaller) sized objects, like a chest, an average door or a dresser.A visible padlock appears on the object decorated with magic sigils, usually near the point where it needs to be opened. While the lock persists, the object cannot be opened.As a standard action, a character can get rid of the lock and pop open the object with an athletics or sleight of hand check (DC 23).Any previous instance of this spell disappears if cast again.

item.title: arcane-pocket
item.description: You create an extradimensional space that can store numerous small items. When you gaze inside you see nothing but a starry sky. It creates a 5x5x5 ft space that can hold 100 lbs of items. The item need not fit into the entrance of the pocket/pouch, only the extra dimensional space. Any excess you attempt to put in spills back out immediately. As long as you know what you're looking for, you can effortlessly pull it out of the space without looking inside. If you turn the pouch/pocket inside out or this spell ends, all of the items spill out.This spell can be made permanent by sewing phase spider web into the fabric (3k gold). You no longer need to prepare a permanent arcane pocket.Any previous instance of this spell disappears if cast again.

item.title: embiggen
item.description: The touched creature increases to large size.If the creature is already large or larger, the spell has no effect.Upcast - By spending 2 mana, this effect can target allies with a range of reach.

item.title: feather-fall
item.description: Used to save people from deadly falls. The target gently falls 60 ft per round and safely lands on the ground. The spell ends early if the target lands.Upcast 2 - Target up to 4 creatures within 30 ft of each other with the spell.

item.title: free-swim
item.description: You gain a swim speed equal to your land speed and the amphibious quality, allowing you to fight underwater without a penalty.

item.title: gear-up
item.description: You create a magical copy of a non-magical shield or weapon that you think of that doesn't require ammunition, such as a dagger or greatsword. It deals force damage instead of its usual damage.If you have an open hand, you can cause the weapon to appear in your hand and you can make a simple attack with it as part of casting the spell.If you cast this spell while you have already conjured gear, the previous gear disappears.Upcast - For each additional spell level, create an additional piece of gear

item.title: hidden-power
item.description: Unleash a wave of elemental energy that homes in on a creature, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) damage (reflex halves). The damage type can be any elemental damage type and is chosen when cast. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, deal an additional d8 (4) damage.

item.title: jump
item.description: Casting this spell allows the caster to jump as high and far as their movement speed. When you jump, you ignore fall damage from a fall of 30 ft or less. If you attack an enemy that is in midair during this time, your movement is [elusive] when landing after jumping up to them.As part of casting the spell, you can take the jump action.Upcast 2 - You can increase the duration of the spell to 10 minutes, and it gains the [buff] tag.

item.title: dimensional-anchor
item.description: You fire an anchor-shaped projectile a creature. Make a ranged attack; if it hits, the target is dimensionally anchored, preventing them from using [teleportation] effects, either on themselves or others.The DC to dispel this effect is 13+CL.

item.title: dispel-magic
item.description: The spell can be used in two different ways.Dispel - You roll a caster level check to immediately end a magical effect. The DC is (11+CL of the effect).Counter Spell - You roll a caster level check to prevent a spell from being cast. This must be done as a prepared action in response to a spell being cast. The DC is (11+CL of the spell). If the spell the creature is casting has a higher caster level than your to dispel magic, you have disadvantage on your caster level check.You can use dispel magic on supernatural features, labeled (Su). The creature's CL is treated as (lvl+2). Passive supernatural effects or constant innate spells can be reactivated as a standard action.

item.title: mirror-images
item.description: 4 illusory copies appear within your space and mirror your actions. Increase your AC by 1 for every clone you still have. If a creature grazes you, they destroy a clone.You can only cast this spell once every minute.

item.title: shrink-ray
item.description: This spell has a different effect depending on what you target.Ally - Creature shrinks down to the size of an action figure, only a few inches tall. It is unable to effectively damage creatures of small or larger size due to its diminutive nature. Their speed is reduced by 15. They can say "big mode" to increase back to their normal size as a standard action.Enemy - The creature shrinks to small size on-hit. If already small or smaller, no effect.Object - Targeting an unattended object shrinks it down to 1/10th of its original size. Divide its weight by 100.

item.title: backstab
item.description: Move to the direct opposite side of a creature you threaten and make an attack.

item.title: elemental-shield
item.description: While this spell is active, you are wreathed in an elemental damage type of your choosing. You gain resistance to this damage type. 1/turn when you take damage, the spell rebounds and deals (CL) of your chosen damage type to the creature that did the damage (instant action).

item.title: plane-shift
item.description: You concentrate for a minute on your destination, then appear in a location on another plane. The recipients of this spell must be in physical contact with each other.You must have an idea of where you would like to go in order to use this spell. Roll a planes check and subtract your result from 40. That is how many miles you appear off course from your desired location. The minimum distance is 1 mile off course.Tuning forks are made out of material native to the plane. They are difficult to obtain without first visiting that plane or purchasing them from specialized vendors. This spell does not require line of sight.

item.title: README
item.description: The generic magic techniques available to all mages.

item.title: amnesia
item.description: You hit a creature in the head hard enough to cause it to forget its own training. On hit the creature forgets a technique of your choosing. In order to remove a specific technique, you must have seen the technique get used, hear about a specific creature's technique from someone who has seen it or succeed on a monster lore check against the creature to reveal its offense traits.For creatures with class levels that prepare techniques this can be a bit awkward since they can swap techniques so you're gonna have to play it by ear.If you don't have a specific technique in mind, the creature forgets one of its highest tier techniques known if it prepares them, or a 1/day innate technique (that it hasn't used yet) if it doesn't. Move down the list until you get something that fits, with the idea being remove most important and powerful tech first.A creature with Amnesia can spend a standard action to try and remember the technique. Martial techniques require a DC 5 intelligence check while magical techniques require a DC 20 intelligence check.

item.title: dismantle-su
item.description: You create a transparent but clearly visible wall that partially unweaves magic that passes through it. Any spell or supernatural (Su) effect that passes through the wall has its attack bonus and DC decreased by 2.You can also choose to form the barrier into a hemisphere centered on you with a radius equal to half the walls dimensions.Upcast - Per each additional mana spent, increase the dimensions of the wall by 10 ft (20x20, 30x30 etc)

item.title: down-to-earth-su
item.description: You infuse your weapon with the ability to tangle a creatures wings or the magic that holds it afloat in the air. Make a weapon attack that applies grounded for 1 round.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4). At 3 mana, the grounded duration increases to 3 rounds. At 5 mana, this debuff gains the [curse] effect. The curse only ends when the creature consumes a creature known to fly, even if only sparingly, such as a chicken, or its egg.

item.title: mana-drain
item.description: You radiate a 10 ft aura that drains the mana from living things. Every time a creature spends mana within this aura, it spends an additional mana. If the ability costs no mana, such as an innate spell, its CL is reduced by 2.Upcast 4 - Double the penalties of the aura (+2 mana expenditure, -4 CL for innate spells).

item.title: pressure
item.description: Move 10 ft in response to an enemy casting a spell. You must end this movement in a space adjacent to said enemy.Because this action happens before the casting completes, you can benefit from effects like Mana Drain or Fighter's Lament.

item.title: silencing-strike
item.description: Strike at a creatures throat in order to silence them for 1 round (fort negates).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: crumble-magic-minion-su
item.description: If you land this attack against a magically created minion, such as an undead or a summoned creature, you automatically deal the attack's damage to the creature that created the effect too if they are within 100 ft of you.In the case of summoning contracts, it still damages whoever summoned them, not the real body of the creature being summoned.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4). If you spend at least 3 mana, the attack damages all the companion creatures, in addition to their creator/summoner.

item.title: dispelling-strike-su
item.description: Roll an attack roll in place of a dispel check against a magical effect you can attack. If it is attached to a creature, the attack only effects the spell, not the creature. If you successfully dispel the effect, the caster takes 2d8+lvl (9+lvl) force damage.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: mana-burn-su
item.description: You weaken the creatures connection to the source of their magic power. They mana burn 2 (will negates) decreasing their current and max mana by the burn value. Mana burn curses can stack.By not casting a spell for a full day, the curse ends.Upcast - Increase mana burn by 1 per mana spent.

item.title: psionic-backlash
item.description: When you hear magic words or see magic at play, you can respond by making the creature's mana manipulation unstable. They take d6 (3) psychic damage for each point of mana they spend (or would spend with innate casting).

item.title: superstitious-su
item.description: You see magical auras around mages constantly. You learn the highest level spell a creature can cast by focusing on them as a standard action.You automatically get a check to see a creature’s true form (will save vs their class/offense trait DC). If you strike a creature disguising their true form, they revert back to it (will negates).

item.title: arcana-theft-su
item.description: Make an attack against a creature and steal their magic away from them. If they are currently affected by a buff spell, you take it away from them on hit. You remove the buff from them and grant it to yourself or an ally within 30 ft.

item.title: blood-price-su
item.description: Inflict a curse that is particularly annoying to mages (will negates). Whenever the cursed creature casts a spell, it starts bleeding. The creature immediately takes the bleed damage after the spell is cast. The bleed damage is equal to (the spells level+2). The bleed effect happens after the effects of the spell (so using a healing spell has no effect on the subsequent bleed).By not casting a spell for a full day, the curse ends.

item.title: teleblock-su
item.description: When a creature attempts to teleport and you successfully identify the effect (via monster lore or arcana to identify the spell), you can block it automatically. The creature is also anchored (will negates).

item.title: teleportation-trap-su
item.description: When you place this sigil, you must designate a location within its AoE on a surface visible from where it is placed. Unlike most other sigils, a teleportation trap is not triggered by moving within a certain radius of it. A creature that teleports within 120 feet of the sigil, even without direct line of effect, is immediately affected by the trap and teleported to this predesignated location instead of their intended destination (will reduces effect to clumsy 1).If you place a Teleportation Trap while you already have one active, the previous one disappears.Upcast 6 - The sigil becomes permanent and its AoE increases to 300 ft.

item.title: trace-teleportation
item.description: You gain a 6th sense allowing you to detect when a teleportation effect has happened in the area recently. Such spots appear as silhouettes of portals. While adjacent to such a space, you can inspect it more closely to glean further details.You can automatically tell the distance and direction of the teleportation effect. If the effect teleported the creature to another plane, you know what plane instead of the distance. You can roll an arcana check (DC 10+CL of the effect, or 10+the creatures level for non spell effects) to gaze into this pseudo portal to see exactly where the creature teleported to, as though looking through a window to their destination. You see it as it currently is, not as it looked when they went, using all of your senses.If you are capable of getting to this destination while the same use of this ability persists, you need not make further checks to see any chain of teleportation that may have occurred from the same caster.

item.title: siphoning-sigil-su
item.description: You inscribe a anti-magic rune on the surface of an object. Whenever a creature of at least small or larger size enters this area, the sigil triggers. All creatures within 20 ft of the sigil are siphoned (will negates). At the end of each round, creatures get a new save against this effect.

item.title: trigger-word
item.description: You have trained your body to react to magic words with violence. When an enemy you threaten casts a spell, attack them. On hit the spell fizzles (fort negates).

item.title: highway-patrol
item.description: You are a master at negating teleportation, but why not play along a little? Every time a creature within 60 ft of you teleports, you can redirect them to another position within 60 ft of you as an instant action and cause them to become clumsy 2 (will negates redirection).

item.title: README
item.description: The techniques designed to combat and negate magic.

item.title: blood-for-blood
item.description: When you provoke an AoO, you can retaliate after the attack is resolved with a simple attack.

item.title: bloodletting
item.description: Shed your own blood, taking 5 true damage and offering it to the gods. They repay you by granting you 1 mana,You can only use bloodletting once a turn.

item.title: carnage
fore
put-me-in
item.description: Deal 20 poise damage to an ally and throw them into combat. You can throw them up to 20 ft, including into the air.Upcast - For each additional mana you spend, you can throw your ally an additional 10 ft.

item.title: war-paint
item.description: Wipe the blood, sludge or ectoplasm off of a creature and apply it to yourself to get yourself in the mood for battle. You must initially target a defeated creature or yourself if you are below 10 hp.After you apply the blood to yourself, gain +15 speed, a +4 bonus to intimidation checks. When you critically strike, you deal an additional 50% damage. Most weapons now do 2x damage on a crit, and 2h weapons deal 2.5x damage on a crit.

item.title: wide-open
item.description: Call out to your foes to hit you where it hurts. Provoke an attack of opportunity from all creatures currently threatening you. Wary creatures who do not want to make an AoO must make a will save. Failure means they do it anyway.You may make an additional simple melee attack against any creature that AoO's you as a result of this technique.

item.title: foe-toss
item.description: Make a grapple attack. Instead of grappling them, you make a bonus thrown weapon attack using the poise broken creature as ammunition.The attack always deals full damage to the poise broken creature. If you graze the secondary target, it does not change the damage against the initial target. If you crit, they are both crit. All creatures affected take an additional d8 (4) damage. If you are already grappling the creature when you initiate the attack, you don't need to grapple them again.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: spartan-kick
item.description: A swift kick in the abdomen sends your opponent reeling backwards. The attack automatically pushes them back 10 ft on hit and deals an additional d8 (4) damage. If the opponent was clumsy, they take double fall damage (6 damage per 10 ft).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: technology
item.description: While this technique is prepared, you can activate things using the athletics skill that normally require another skill. This could mean twisting the doorknob off of a door to open it, forcing open a book that requires a password gleaned through arcana or activating a portal that normally required planes.This usually involves damaging or breaking the object."We aren't cavemen. We have technology!"

item.title: ups-and-downs
item.description: On hit deal an additional d8 (4) damage and smash a creature into the ground, or throw them directly up into a low roof within 10 ft. In either case, the creature is entangled until they use athletics to escape as a swift action. If you throw the creature into a roof, they are also unable to see and interact with the floor below until they escape.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: blood-armor
cart-su
item.description: You manifest a cart of your own design. Every time you manifest this cart, it is the same cart. The cart is capable of holding a dozen or so people and has an extra dimensional cargo space (5-ft cube). You can cause this cart to vanish back to the cart realm as a FRA.While attached to and dragging your cart, your land speed doubles. To you, the contents within the cart are completely weightless. To anybody else, it weighs 10k lbs.The cart lasts indefinitely, but disappears while you don’t have this technique memorized.

item.title: exist
item.description: As part of the initiative roll you can choose a creature within range. That creature is taunted (will negates). To that creature, your very existence infuriates them and you must be stopped at all cost. At the end of each of their turns, they get a new save to end the effect.If you are at or below 50% hp when this ability triggers, increase the DC by 2. If on subsequent turns, you take no actions on your turn other than movement, the DC increases by 2.If this creature is defeated, then you may choose a new creature to affect with this ability (no action required, happens immediately).

item.title: flash-attack-su
item.description: You can teleport 30 ft, as long as you appear in a threatened space. Any creatures you threaten take 2d8 (9) force damage and an equal amount of poise damage.After you activate this ability, your turn immediately ends.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: forget-me-stick
item.description: You need to defeat the creature on the same turn that you land this attack for it to have its effect. The creature is never killed by your attacks this turn.You deal an additional 2d8 (9) damage. The target forgets anything that happened while defeated, and anything that happened a minute before being defeated.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: revenge
item.description: Make a simple melee attack against a creature that did hp damage to you. If they are not within reach, you can move your speed to get within reach of them.

item.title: firmly-grasp-it
item.description: Make a disarm attack with a +4 bonus. Instead of knocking the weapon out of the creatures hand, you violently stab it into the creature's hand, dealing 3d8 (13) additional damage. The creature cannot use that hand or weapon until the weapon is removed as a standard action with athletics (class DC).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: most-annoying-sound
item.description: Make a grapple attack. Gain constrict 3d8 (13) sonic while it persists. While grappled, the creature is confused.

item.title: walk-around
item.description: You can walk around. You spend all of your actions moving and doing nothing else, ending your movement at some point within 30 feet of where you started walking around. Naturally this behavior befuddles the creatures around you. All enemies within 60 feet of this initial starting point are confused (will adds 2 to d10 roll). The effect ends when creature gets the result "act normally."Creatures that make an AoO against you when you move take a -2 penalty to their save.You may continue spending your turns walking around to maintain this confusion effect as long as you want, the same creature cannot be confused more than once.This has no effect on creatures not engaged in combat with you.

item.title: armed-robbery
item.description: Make a grapple or disarm attack. If successful, instead of grappling or disarming, tear off your opponents arm causing them to be drained 1 (fort removes drain and reduces to broken arm, which renders it useless until medicine check to provide first aid, DC=class/offense trait DC).Make an attack against them with their own arm that deals an additional 4d8 (18) dmg.

item.title: man-drop
item.description: Leap with incredible strength 300 ft into the air and crash down onto an area. Creatures within 30 ft of your landing position take 6d8+lvl (27+lvl) crush damage and are staggered for 1 minute (fort halves damage and reduces stagger to 1 round). Creatures get a new save against the stagger effect at the end of each of their turns.Usable 1/combat.

item.title: undying-rage
item.description: While you have this technique applied to you, your eyes glow a dark red and your resting emotional state is angry.The first time you are defeated and the effect is not negated by another feature, such as ferocity or the Diehard feat, this contingency activates.You become completely immune to death. Every time you take damage that would defeat you, you can instead decide to become drained 1. This drain does not cause you to fall unconscious. When you become drained 20, you instantly die.

item.title: README
item.description: Techniques that use raw strength to perform ridiculous and unorthodox feats. Barbarism also rewards you for putting yourself in danger and hurting yourself.

item.title: bear-arms
item.description: While this technique is prepared, your arms get coated in a thick fur and your fingers get claws at their ends. The claw attacks deal d8 slash damage, or d10 if your hands are empty. They have the CM (disarm) and CM (grapple) properties. If you already had claws, these qualities are only in addition to what you already had. Cannot decrease your claw dmg.While wielding a gun, you get DR 20 vs disarm attacks.You can make grapples and disarms as AoOs with your bear arms.You gain a multi-attack option: Bear Rights - Make 2 attacks with your bear claws.

item.title: bestial-claw
item.description: Dig your claws into the ground and unleash a cone of sharp claw shaped shockwaves dealing 2d8+lvl (9+lvl) slashing damage (reflex halves). Creatures take an equal amount of poise damage.Upcast - Every point of additional mana spent on this ability increases the damage by d8 (4).

item.title: frenzied-leap
item.description: Take the jump action and crash upon your foes with a shockwave. Creatures within 10 ft of your landing position (or your natural reach) are clumsy 1.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase your jump distance by 5.

item.title: lick
item.description: Your tongue grows in size and strength to attack a creature. You can use it to make melee attacks with an additional 15 ft of reach for the remainder of your turn.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase the reach by an additional 15 ft.

item.title: pack-attack
item.description: Keep up the pressure on an opponent by making it appear like many copies of you are attacking it at once. If the attack lands, an ally (other than yourself) has advantage on their next attack against the target in the next round.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: pouch
item.description: While you have this technique prepared you have a single large pouch in your skin, or other methods of storage on the exterior of your body. You gain an extra 100 carry weight and natural pockets to place things in.You can use the patches to hide objects using sleight of hand.

item.title: shells-up
item.description: While this technique is prepared, you have a large shell on your back. You cannot be flanked.By spending 1 mana when you take the total defense action, you can slip into your shell completely. This prevents you from taking any instant or immediate actions, but increases the the defense granted by the action to DRA 4.

item.title: venomous-sting
item.description: Grow a large stinger, or long fangs to sink into an enemy. On hit they are envenomed (fort negates).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, deal an additional d8 (4) poison damage.

item.title: jaws-of-the-beast
item.description: Grow massive powerful jaws and take a chomp your opponent. dealing an additional d8 (4) damage and latching onto them on hit. Until the start of your next turn, you stay adjacent to this target as it now needs to drag you along for the ride. You can decide which space you end adjacent to them after the creature moves.Anything that prevents you from moving prevents the other creature from moving as well (such as being entangled). If you are poise broken you detach.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: kindred
item.description: Transform into a beast creature you can see. You do not copy their appearance exactly, only their species. You gain the creature's senses, movement types and natural attacks, but nothing else. A pattern appears in your fur/scales etc that matches the symbol of Mother Earth.How others of the species react to you depends on the species. Some creatures are territorial, others are social and others don't care.If you [mana burn] you can increase the duration to 10 minutes.

item.title: make-or-break
item.description: You can cause pieces of your body to detach, such as your hands or legs. Basically anything that isn't your head or your torso. When you do so, you are drained 1.These pieces of your body grow back slowly over time, making a full recovery when you recover from the drain. If you are able to retrieve your detached limbs, this recovery time decreases to 1 hour, during which constant contact is required between the detached limb and where it was detached from.This technique does not allow you to recover limbs you didn't have before using the technique.

item.title: predatory-instincts
item.description: You can instinctively tell when a creature is a lower level than you just by looking at them. You get a +2 bonus to melee damage rolls against said creatures. If the creature is a minion, you can tell, and this damage bonus increases to +4.

item.title: rapid-recovery
item.description: While this technique is memorized, you regenerate lost limbs and organs, and in general recover much faster. You recover 1 stack of drained every 3 days instead of every week, as though receiving medical attention (doesn't stack). A lost limb/organ regrows within 3 days.When you are defeated, you automatically regain 1 hit point after 10 minutes.As a swift action, you can heal 10 hp, regrow a limb instantly and make yourself drained 1.

item.title: rend-vision
item.description: Grow a beak and poke at a creature's eyes. On hit the creature takes an additional d8 (4) dmg and is blinded for 1 round (reflex reduces to blurred vision).Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: sniffer
item.description: You enhance your sense of smell, giving you blindsense (scent, 10 ft).

item.title: blood-spurt
item.description: While you are bleeding, or whenever a creature within your natural reach deals slashing or piercing damage, you can respond by squirting some of your blood at them. You take 2 true damage and the target is blinded for 1 round (reflex reduces to blurred vision).

item.title: chameleon
item.description: While this technique is prepared, you gain the camouflage monster quality. You can turn this quality on or off as a free action 1/turn.

item.title: feast
item.description: Grow rows of jagged teeth, unhinge your jaw and take a meaty bite out of a creature, dealing an additional 2d8 (9) dmg. If after the attack is resolved, the creature is defeated or dead, gain (2*lvl) temp hp.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

item.title: octolock
item.description: Grow several tentacles and make a grapple attack with a +4 bonus. While grappled in this way, the target has -4 AC, you have resistance to poise damage and you constrict them for 3d6 (10) damage each turn, including the turn you initiate it.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase attack bonus by 2.

item.title: return-to-monke
item.description: Assume the form of a tiny monkey indefinitely with the following qualities (see shapeshifter). You can exit this transformation as a standard action.While in this form, you gain 2 abilities. Both usable as a standard action.One of Us [poly, true] - While in monkey form, you reach over and touch a creature with your tiny monkey hands. The creature also turns into a tiny monkey (fort reduces to stagger 1 round).Ohhh Banana [mind-affecting] - You procure a shiny golden banana that hovers in the air for 1 minute. All creatures you turned into a monkey are automatically fascinated. Other monkey/ape-like creatures are fascinated (will negates).

item.title: unseen-predator
item.description: While hiding, leap 30 ft, requiring a jump action. You appear suddenly next to the creature and make a melee attack against them that deals an additional 2d8 (9) dmg. If the target fails its perception against your stealth, instead deal 4d8 (18) additional dmg.

item.title: death-roll
peacocking
item.description: You grow an elaborate and colorful set of feathers, patterned wings or a wide hood like that of a snake to temporarily entrance your enemy. The creature you direct this display towards becomes fascinated for 1 round (will negates).You cannot use this technique against a creature you have attacked this round.

item.title: devour
item.description: This move functions differently based on whether you target an ally or an enemy.Enemy Against a creature you are grappling, this attack automatically works. If not already grappling, roll a grapple attack with a +4 bonus. If successful, you swallow the creature whole. While devoured, the creature inside is in stasis.You gain access to the following special attack. Spit Up - Spit out a devoured creature, hurling them up to 30 feet. The creature takes 6d8+lvl (27+lvl) crush damage and is knocked down. Creatures within 5 ft of the impact location are also knocked down (reflex negates).If you do not use spit up on the following turn, the target is disgorged with no negative effects at the end of that turn.Ally Devour a willing ally, they can hang out inside your stomach indefinitely, hearing muffled versions of things happening outside. As a free action, they can exit your stomach.While inside, your ally cannot be targeted as though they had total cover. If you take damage or become sickened, you automatically vomit them out.

item.title: hive-mind
item.description: You establish a connection to your allies with 1 minute of intimate contact, adding them to your hive mind. While part of the hive mind, you are able to speak telepathically with them. You can choose to telepathically communicate with one, some or all members. All members of the hive also get an intuitive sense of each member's direction and distance.You can form a hive mind with a number of creatures equal to your level.If you ever stop preparing this technique, your hive mind disappears.

item.title: blood-hunt
item.description: While this technique is prepared, you can smell everything as long as it bleeds. You gain the Shirshu's Elite Tracker and Sightless Blindsense. These only function against wounded creatures, or against creatures whose blood you have smelled before.You see a faint misty red trail leading directly to whatever you track, automatically succeeding on survival checks to track creatures whose blood you have smelled before.

item.title: wallop
item.description: Grow long bestial arms to scoop up your foes and toss them in a specific direction.
