If the attack ends the combat, future finale attacks gain +1 damage permanently. If it does not end the combat, lose 1 damage (minimum 0). A savvy foe can tell how many stacks you have.{% hint style="danger" %} Finale only stacks in actual combat, not training. You can never passively gain stacks. {% endhint %}As a free action, move 10 feet, even directly into the air. Can be used multiple times to cover great distances.Augment an unarmed strike that staggers the creature on hit (fort negates). If the attack is successful, enemies within 10 feet of the original target automatically take the attacks damage.This ability can be used in tandem with techniques.This ability functions as Old Friend, but instead of a shotgun you manifest a rifle with the following stats… DMG - 2d8 P Properties - 2h Range - 30 ft (no second increment) Zoom - As a FRA, make a single shot with 100 ft range and +2 attack.When you fall at least 20 ft, you release a shockwave in a 10 ft radius around you. If you fell at least 50 ft, the shockwave is a 20 ft radius. The effect this has depends on the target and their HP threshold.Against enemy minions, it sets them to your glory kill threshold. If they are already within the glory kill threshold, they are defeated.Against anything else (including allies), it deals 10 poise damage.As a free action during movement, spend 2 energy to throw a supercharged ball of energy that explodes on impact on the ground, affecting all creatures within 10 ft of the space it lands in. You have 3 types of grenades [Fire] - Set creatures ablaze (reflex negates). Frag - Deal (3d6+lvl) crush damage and poise damage. If this breaks poise, the creature is knocked down (reflex halves damage). [Frost] - Put creatures in stasis for 1 round (reflex reduces to frosty for 1 round).This ability functions as Old Friend, but instead of a shotgun you manifest a hammer with the following stats… DMG - 2d8 C Properties - 2h, CM (Sunder) Horny Jail - As a standard action, automatically bonk a creature within reach to make them not horny for 1 hour. Hammer Down [recharge] - 1/combat, strike the ground as a standard action to deal your (d6+d6/odd level) crush dmg and make creatures clumsy 2 within 20 ft (fort halves dmg). Plunging Attack - If you start your turn above a creature and are not flying/pseudo-flying, you can make a plunging attack. Plunging attack adds 1 damage per 10 feet you fall (max +20 dmg). Plunging attack can also apply to Hammer Down.Weapon attacks gain additional damage equal to their damage dice. Gain this again at level 10 Examples: 2h weapon @1=2d6, @6=4d6, @11=6d6 Light Weapon @1=d6, @6=2d6, @11=3d6This ability functions as Old Friend, but instead of a shotgun you manifest a hand held ballista with the following stats… DMG - 2d8 P Properties - 2h, Siege Weapon Range - 60 ft (no second increment) Special Attack: GET OVER HERE! - On hit make a drag attack with a +4 bonus. If successful they are pulled adjacent to you Siege Mode [recharge] - 1/combat as a FRA charge and release a horizontal slashing energy projectile. Creatures in a 100ft line that is 15 ft wide take (5d8+lvl) slashing damage and start bleeding for 2d8 damage (reflex halves damage and negates bleed). You can reduce the charge time, making this only require a standard action, but the line is only 5 ft wide.This ability functions as Old Friend, but instead of a shotgun you manifest a sword with the following stats… DMG - 2d8 S Properties - 2h, Special Attack: Determination Melt - As a standard action, cut a hole in a surface of solid or lesser toughness large enough for you to fit through with ease. Special Attack: Sever - On hit sever an limb from a creature (fort negates). Arm - Creature is unable to use arm Leg - Creatures speed is reduced by 15. Clumsy 1 permanently. Wing - Creature is unable to fly.Other limbs can be selected, disabling natural attacks like tentacles and such. These are just the most common examples.You gain combat reflexes as a bonus feat.You can use glory kill an instant action by consuming an AoO (essentially 3 times round unless you can AoO more somehow).

item.title: sentinel
item.description: The Sentinel Slayer trades many of the abilities granted by the original slayer class to pivot the class from an unrelenting aggressor to a more defensive play style. Instead of killing everything that moves, a sentinel focuses more on disruption and setting up combos. The class primarily revolves around parrying enemy attacks.Removes: Glory Kill, Dash, Shredder, Feats, Blood PunchYou no longer have glory kill, so that method of regaining energy is removed.Instead you regain 2 energy when you successfully parry an attack.You start play with and can craft a circular shield with spinning blades inside of it with 8 hours of work and 100g. This is treated as a tower shield and a 1h weapon that can deal slash or crush damage and has the CM (shove) and CM (bully) properties. If this shield is sundered or destroyed, it repairs itself after 1 round. In the hands of a Sentinel, the shield also additional properties. It has the thrown property and 2 enchantment slots, one of which is the returning enchantment, but the returning can be used as an instant action.You can reasonably augment existing shields to also make them better suit your tastes, giving them the above properties.Any offensive ability that deals damage to you, you can parry. Roll an attack roll as an immediate action. Against opposing attack rolls, if you match their roll, you negate it. Against anything else if you match the DC of the ability, you negate it entirely (at least for you in the case of AoE effects).When you successfully parry any ability, you rupture your attacker and any other enemies within 10 ft of them, making them clumsy 2 and setting them to 1 poise.{% hint style="danger" %} But how do I determine my attack bonus for parrying?You use what your melee attack bonus would be against the target. If you are currently flanking the target, add flanking. If your shield has the bane enchantment against their creature type, add bane. {% endhint %}As a free action, spend 2 energy to dash directly adjacent to a creature within 30 ft and crash into them, releasing a powerful shockwave. The target creature and all enemies within 10 ft are staggered (fort negates).Instead of a shockwave, you can instead choose to shove the target.When you make a thrown attack with your shield, it embeds itself into a creature on hit, entangling them. If at the end of the creatures turn it is still entangled by this, it takes your shield attack damage again. If you choose to use the returning property of your shield to parry, shield action etc, this entangle ends.When a creature is a minion, you know. You do not need to make attack rolls with your shield against minions. They are automatically crit by your shield attacks. If you defeat a minion with a shield attack, it can bounce to another minion within 20 ft.You gain the shield focus, sentinel and point blank master feats.Inscribe a rune upon your shield to give it additional powers that activate when you successfully parry. You can only activate 1 rune when you parry. Choose one at this level and another at level 6 and 10,Quaking Rune - All ruptured creatures are also staggered. Vengeful Rune - Your next onslaught against a ruptured creature costs no energy. If you are within range, you can use onslaught as an instant action. Celestial Rune - All ruptured creatures are smited by divine power, taking 2d6+lvl (7+lvl) holy damage. Cursed Rune - All ruptured creatures gain weakness 2 to all damage. Ligma Rune - All ruptured creatures contract ligma.

item.title: chronomancer
item.description: Destruction wizards look to win battles by unleashing enormous amounts of damage, usually to large groups of foes.While wielding a spell focus in each hand, you increase your CL by an additional 1 for spells that deal damage. This increases to 2 for spells of your school specialization.Unless otherwise stated, arcane discoveries for destruction wizards only function on spells that deal damage.T

item.title: controller
item.description: Destruction wizards look to win battles by unleashing enormous amounts of damage, usually to large groups of foes.While wielding a spell focus in each hand, you increase your CL by an additional 1 for spells that deal damage. This increases to 2 for spells of your school specialization.Unless otherwise stated, arcane discoveries for destruction wizards only function on spells that deal damage.T

item.title: destruction
item.description: Destruction wizards look to win battles by unleashing enormous amounts of damage, usually to large groups of foes.While wielding a spell focus in each hand, you increase your CL by an additional 1 for spells that deal damage. This increases to 2 for spells of your school specialization.Unless otherwise stated, arcane discoveries for destruction wizards only function on spells that deal damage.You can spend mana to increase the range of a spell you cast. For each point of mana you spend, you can increase the spells range by 10. Spells with a range of reach gain (reach+10*mana spent) range. If the spell is an attack, it turns into a ranged attack.Does not function for spells without a listed range.Whenever you cast a spell that has a listed AoE, your allies within that AoE are not targeted by the negative effects of the spell.Woe to the destruction wizard who believes himself he has outwitted Frogg Saran by evading the many aspects of his spells that backfire. You can still use the techniques, but casting a Frogg spell demands unforeseen consequences. If you do not play along, you will make him your enemy.

item.title: financial
item.description: Financial wizards look to win battles far before they are ever fought using an enormous amount of preparationYou have an additional contact in the financial wizard's guild. This could be a teacher, banker or parent with connections or that works for it. You start play with an additional 1,000g worth of mundane items. Whenever you sell items, you automatically get 60% of the items value instead of 50%.The more decorated you are in your wealth, the more powerful you become. As long as you are covered in jewelry, fine clothing and other fancy mundane items worth at least (your level*1,000g), your CL is increased by 1.Whenever you take damage, you can choose to destroy (your level*1000g) worth of items in order to negate it as an immediate action. Gold pieces themselves cannot be destroyed using this.Unless otherwise stated, arcane discoveries for destruction wizards only function on spells that deal damage.Whenever you would gain any kind of bonus to arcana checks outside of this class, such as from the aid action, or a bonus from the facilities at your disposal, you increase that bonus by +2 for each unique source. A unique source means something that is different from the previous ones. For example, your two financial wizard brothers would not be different sources. Those same two brothers and a dragon are 2 sources. 2 brothers, a dragon and a laboratory are 3 sources.Basically there needs to be a variety of sources of inspiration for arcane synergy to function. Each individual can still lend aid, giving a bonus depending on their proficiency. In that same example, your two brothers would collectively give a +6 bonus (2 proficient+2 proficient+2 synergy). The dragon, less versed in magic, lacks the arcana skill and gives a +3 bonus. The lab you are doing research in normally gives +2, but with synergy gives +4. So your bonus changes from +7 to +13 thanks to arcane synergy with this setup.

item.title: README
item.description:
If there are any mortals that can be considered masters of magic, it can be wizards. Each one a prodigy in their own right, pushing the boundaries of what is possible with mana. Wizards are on the cutting edge of new magical items, rituals and spells, creating new ones and enhancing old classics to fit their particular approach to magic.{% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %} Art by {% endtab %}{% tab title="Basic Stats" %} Requires Archetype{% endtab %} {% endtabs %}You gain 2 technique points at level 1, then another 2 points every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used on any magical technique tree.Characters with magical specialization gain points in wild card equal to their highest tier of magic technique and cantrips.Choose a magical technique tree. This tree is the field of magic you specialize in. You get a +8 bonus to arcana when dealing with spells of this school. You gain a technique point in this tree, and an additional technique point each odd level, all must be dedicated to this specific technique tree.Every time you gain a technique point in this tree, you can make some magic happen. You can choose one of 3 paths, depending on how much effort you are willing to put forth... You can create your own completely original spell for this spell school. This can be a bit of a daunting task, requiring a degree of trust between game master and player. Once a spell is created, the balancing does not stop there, and should be adjusted as needed to not disrupt the game too much. Alter an existing spell. Have you ever looked at a spell and wished it was just a little bit different? Perhaps you wanted a boneless boneshaker spell, or a snow woman instead of a snow man. These changes are encouraged to alter not only the flavor text, but also the mechanics. Perhaps our boneless-shaker allows you to create the boneless world you desire, tearing out a creatures skeleton leaving them a clumsy blob person. Perhaps a snow woman is more affectionate preferring to get up close and personal, grabbing creatures and keeping them frosty. In any case, the power of the altered spell should be pretty close to the original, and should serve a similar type of purpose.
You could also choose to upgrade a lower level spell. Say you thought fireblast wasn't explosive enough. Make a 5th level version that explodes again at the end of your next turn, forcing creatures who failed the initial save to eat another one without some extra speed or aid from allies. If you aren't confident in your ability, or just don't have the time. Gain +1 memory. You are proficient in the arcana skill with a +4 bonus.You can choose to leave up to 3 of your memory slots unused. By spending 1 minute, you can choose to prepare a spell in that unused memory slot.If you [mana burn] 1, you can fill an empty slot as a free action.Choose a level 0 fiend, celestial or fey, or create a beast that is automatically tiny using the Beast Trainer's Beast Companion feature. It's level is always 0. If it aids you in combat, it gains the [companion] tag. You can also use your familiar to do a handful of other useful things.
Spying [scrying] - You can sense through your companion at will. See the scrying tag for more details. Assistant - Your companion can use the aid action to assist you for any skill checks. To My Side [teleportation] - You can concentrate for 3 rounds to teleport your companion to your side.Your mana pool is deeper than most. Add 1 to your mana pool at this level, and levels 4, 6, 8 and 10.The remainder of this class is full of arcane discoveries. These features are customizable abilities that you gain at level 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10. Each archetype comes with its own.

item.title: README
blood-hunter
hunter
item.description: Hunters are marksman trained to hunt down a specific type of creature with impunity. They specialize in using weapons that are otherwise inconvenient for most creatures to use as their main weapon, such as crossbows and firearms.{% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %}{% endtab %}{% tab title="Basic Stats" %} | HP (martial) | 20(+10 per level) | | ------------ | ----------------- | | Poise | 8 | | Skills | 2 | | Save | Reflex | | Memory | 3+lvl | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %}You gain 2 technique points at level 1, then another point every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used on the marksman and pupper trees.Characters with martial specialization gain points in warfare equal to their highest tier of martial technique.Make two attacks, one of which must be a ranged attack.You are trained to hunt a specific type of creature. Choose a type of creature in the bestiary. You get a +4 bonus to attack against them. You also gain the associated knowledge skill to identify this creature type with monster lore, and a +4 bonus to the skill.Whenever land an attack against one of these creatures, you get a single point of mana reserve. You can only ever have 1 point accumulated in such a way.You gain rapid reload and lightning reload as bonus feats.You gain survival as a bonus skill, with a +4 bonus.Make a carefully aimed ranged attack at a creature, granting it seeking. On hit, you mark them. You can only have 1 creature marked at a time. You get a +4 bonus to survival checks against a marked creature. Choose one additional effect your hunters mark has while the mark persists.Reveal - Creature glows slightly, giving it a visible colorful aura. Creature cannot hide and and all attacks against it have seeking. Taunt - The creature you strike is taunted by you until it damages you, upon which the mark is removed.As an immediate action when a creature makes an attack against a marked creature, you can transform that attack into a crit. Using this function of Hunter's Mark causes the ability to be unusable until you rest. Otherwise this special attack can be used at will.

item.title: light-guardian
maligner
item.description: Maligners are master manipulators that worm their way into positions of power through deceit and cunning. They use enchantments to force cooperation, illusions to misdirect, lies to spread rumors, and polymorphs to imitate. While there are Maligners that start off benevolent, they most often find themselves engaging in morally abhorrent behavior while impersonating enemies just to keep their stories straight.{% hint style="info" %} This class is a pretty odd fit for this game, mostly because it has basically zero combat related abilities as part of the class. The role a Maligner will play in a party will probably be akin to that of a rogue. They are much more impressive out of combat than in combat. {% endhint %}{% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %}Maestra, Mask Merchant, Hearthstone {% endtab %}{% tab title="Basic Stats" %} | HP (specialist) | 20(+6 per level) | | --------------- | ---------------- | | Poise | 5 | | Skills | 4 | | Save | Will | | Memory | 2+(2*lvl) | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %}You gain 3 technique points at level 1, then another 2 points every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used on the Shira, Moogen and one other tree, chosen at character creation.Characters with magical specialization gain points in wild card equal to their highest tier of magic technique and cantrips.As a standard action, you can assume an alternate persona of your creation. You fabricate a backstory, connections, race, appearance, clothes, voice, the works - this alternate form is completely unique. When you have an alternate persona, you have no "true" form.Your alternate persona has all of your abilities and statistics, but you can decide to swap up to 2 of your skills for any others, and your race may be different. If these changes cause you to no longer qualify for a feat or class feature upon assuming the other form, then you lose access as normal.It takes a week of work to fabricate a new form, and a week to "kill off" an old form. These personas consume your Companion slots, and you may have more than one if you have enough slots. You start off with one alternate persona.Gain deception and disguise as bonus skills.Upon engaging in conversation with a creature for at least one minute, you can call out one detail of its appearance, recent activities (within a day), or mannerisms as a free action. You instantly learn its mental state and intentions as they relate to the detail, within the scope of the totality of information you have on the creature (will negates).Essentially, you correctly guess why a creature did or is doing something. Part of this ability is speaking your guess to the creature, and judging your accuracy off of its response; if it passes its save, you guess wrong, may look silly, and can no longer use this ability on the same creature until you rest. You may substitute the DC with Insight, and the target may substitute its Will save with Deception.As a free action, name a rumor. You gain a sixth sense for who has heard or spread this rumor. If you see the people they told or heard it from, they appear to glow white or red to you, respectively. If you interact with the creature, you can see a literal trail of ethereal energy to the people they either heard the rumor from, or who they told the rumor.Using this ability again negates the previous use.You can amputate a helpless, willing, or recently deceased (within an hour) playable race's face, and spend 500g and 8 hours of labor to convert it into a Maligner's Mask attuned to that specific creature. Most creatures will die or go blind upon having their face amputated without immediate medical attention.When you wear this mask, you partially transform into that creature, which counts as a disguise and grants a +4 bonus skill checks to appear as that specific creature. Putting it on is a full round action, but removing it is a Swapping Gear action. It does not change your clothes or equipment. Other creatures may wear these masks.While you possess a mask, you can use Faceless Monster to create a persona of a person whose mask you possess. If the persona you steal still lives, or is absent for long periods of time, it can cause problems.You can attempt to spread a rumor throughout a small town or larger settlement by attempting a deception check. The difficulty depends on the size, ranging from 10 for a small town to 30 for a metropolis, though this difficulty may be modified if the population as a whole tends towards skepticism or insanity.It takes a week for a rumor to spread. If you succeed by 5 or more, the time is reduced to 3 days. If you fail by 5 or more, the rumor mutates into a competing theory.Each of your personas may only have one rumor brewing at a time.After a minute of concentration, you can enter a state of calm where you deepen your connection with your collection of masks. You can communicate with the fragments of the persons soul left behind within. The masks appear to speak to you, and you can inquire things about these people as though you were a neutral party. As such, they are usually willing to tell you some things, but hesitant for others, usually requiring skill checks. Once you try and pry into something secret and fail, the information is lost forever. The masks are unable to form new memories, and therefore always treat you as they would a stranger, no matter what you ask.

item.title: mana-addict
item.description:
A mana addict is an antimage who is well and truly addicted to the power of mana flowing through them. They get various abilities that function differently depending on how much mana they have.{% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %}{% endtab %}{% tab title="Basic Stats" %} | HP (Mixed) | 20(+8 per level) | | ---------- | ---------------- | | Poise | 6 | | Skills | 4 | | Save | Will | | Memory | 3+lvl | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %}You gain 2 technique points at level 1, then another 2 points every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used on the Arc and Pupper trees.Characters with martial specialization gain points in warfare equal to their highest tier of martial technique.You have a mana pool vaster than even that of most practiced mages. You gain an additional point of mana this level and every even level after.All your points of mana reserves are instead converted into maximum mana, unless they are tied to specific items.You can manifest a shimmering barrier of volatile energy that protects you and snaps at those who disturb it.As a standard action, you can grant yourself temp hp equal to your current mana. Keep note of this value. Whenever a creature deals HP damage to you, they also take this value as force damage, regardless of how much of the temp hp you actually have left.Mana barrier lasts indefinitely. Anything that decreases the temp hp you gain when you initially use this ability, like bone chill, also reduces the counterattack damage.Whenever you take damage, you can spend mana as an immediate action to reduce the damage. You can spend 1 mana to reduce the damage of an effect on you by 3. If you decrease the damage of an effect to zero, it still activates the force damage counterattack from Mana Barrier.Upcast - For each additional mana spent, reduce the damage you take from an effect by 3.You can innately cast the Mana Ramping cantrip.Whenever you inflict mana burn, you restore 1 mana.You can also use the mana burn you inflict on another creature to cure your own, but you are drained 1 for every 2 mana burn you cure.As a standard action, you can cause an adjacent defeated, asleep or otherwise helpless creature to mana burn 2.Gain arcana as a bonus skill with a +4 bonus.
You can spend 1 mana to speak the magic words of similar spells while another creature casts a spell to confuse them while they cast (will negates). This functions as the Tongue Twister technique with a few key differences: You can only use this as an immediate action to a creature casting a spell. If the creature fails its save, it only suffers the effects of tongue twister for the spell it is casting. If it has already spent any actions that tongue twister would normally consume, they are instead staggered until the end of their next turn.While at or above half mana, you have a +10 bonus to your speed, advantage on perception checks and immunity to fatigue.While below half mana, but not out of mana, you gain the following special attack usable an unlimited number of times per combat. Special Attack: Mana Leech - On hit, steal (½ lvl) mana from the target. If the creature does not prepare techniques, also expend the use of a random 1/day innate technique they have.When you are completely out of mana, you become fatigued, but you gain resistance to damage that originates from an effect than can be dispelled (ie Su/Sp effects). You recover 1 mana at the start of your turn.
You gain Psionic Backlash as an at-will innate technique. When you use it, the creature is mana burned 2 (will halves). If the creature does not prepare techniques, they also expend the use of a random 1/day innate technique they have.Y

item.title: summoner
virtuoso
item.description:
Death should never be quick. It should be an opera. The virtuoso is a creature of cadence and cruelty. All of their abilities are as flashy as they are deadly. They primarily focus on dealing damage from range using a special type of firearm. Anybody familiar with a virtuoso fears the power behind the fourth shot of this gun.{% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %}By Oreski {% endtab %}{% tab title="Basic Stats" %} | HP (mixed) | 20(+8 per level) | | ---------- | ---------------- | | Poise | 6 | | Skills | 4 | | Save | Reflex | | Memory | 3+lvl | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %}You gain 2 technique points at level 1, then another 2 point every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used on the scoundrel, moogen and marksman trees.Characters with martial specialization gain points in warfare equal to their highest tier of martial technique. Characters with magical specialization gain points in wild card equal to their highest tier of magic technique and cantrips.You can transform a single standard pistol into a special weapon just by holding it in your hands. You need to reload it after making 4 shots instead of 1
You can only fire once per round, making you incompatible with some multi-shot abilities (such as snap shot), but you get +2 to attack when you attack using this gun. Bullets fired out of combat do not consume ammo. The 4th shot gets +10 to attack and deals 2x damage on a crit instead of 1.5x. Reloading always requires a standard action. When you crit, gain +2 ac, 20 speed and [elusive] movement until the end of your next turn.As a swift action, place a trap in an unoccupied space that quickly camouflages with the surrounding terrain and blends into the terrain (DC 20+lvl perception to notice). If an enemy steps on a trapped space, it blossoms. Blossomed traps create an area of brightly lit difficult terrain in a 5 ft radius around its space until the end of the triggering creatures turn. At the end of the turn of the triggering creature, it explodes, dealing (2d6+d6/odd lvl) pierce damage to the area made into difficult terrain.You can have 2 traps out at once at any given time. If you place another while 2 are out, one of your choosing disappears. You are mentally alerted when a trap is triggered, and which one. You gain +4 perception against any creature that has triggered a trap since you last rested.Whenever you defeat a creature, it automatically triggers a flowering trap beneath them that explodes at the start of your next turn.By spending 1 mana as swift action, you can target a creature within 60 ft to have a spotlight focus on for 1 minute. The light around the spotlight artificially dims for dramatic effect (but no mechanical effect). That creature takes a -10 penalty on stealth and is brightly illuminated. The creature also has advantage on perform checks.While a spotlight is active, you can increase the volume of your voice to echo over even large crowds.You have an alternate ego that forms while masked, with its own name. Magical means to detect things treat you as two different creatures (such as red hand of the killer). If a creature takes off your mask, you can spend 1 mana as an instant action to cause the mask they remove to be a temporary copy that lasts 1 minute, revealing another mask underneath.+2 to disguise while masked. While your face is obscured, such as with a mask or in darkness, you can make your voice sound like anyone you have heard.You gain a unique special attack. Finale - Deal an additional 1 damage with a pistol attack. If this ends the combat, permanently increase the damage of finale by 1. If it does not end the combat, decrease the damage of finale by 1 (minimum 1).You cannot stack finale in mock combats, training, or passively during down time hunting wolves etc.By spending 2 mana as swift action, you can target a 60 ft line. The very first enemy within this line is entangled for 1 round (reflex negates). If a flowering trap you can see is triggered, you can activate this as an immediate action against a creature within the radius of the blossoming trap.
You can innately cast the Ghost Sound cantrip as a free action, but only to make the sounds typical of an audience, such as clapping, laughter, gasping etc.You can cast this as an instant action when you successfully end a combat with finale.You can perform sunder maneuvers through your pistol without penalty, but only to break armor and shields. 4th shots require no roll and automatically succeed.When you kill a creature with your pistol, you can choreograph how their blood splatters. You can cause it to form a pool of a specific shape, with enough precision to write in text, but usually no more than 2 sentences. You can also cause it to make patterns on the deceased's skin.When you defeat a creature, you can spend 2 mana as an instant action to cause a pair of curtains to appear and close in between you and your victim directly adjacent to you. These curtains are 20 ft tall and 20 ft wide. It lasts for 1 minute, or until they are opened.You can open the curtains as a free action from any distance, and an enemy can open the curtains as a standard action if they are adjacent. It is not difficult for any creature to simply move past the curtains by going through or under without opening them.When you kill someone, you can write a eulogy for them, provided you have the means to physically write one. You can drop this eulogy off on the corpse, the creature's previous home or simply a nearby settlement. This eulogy naturally multiplies, finding itself in newspaper stands, cafes, waiting rooms etc. The less important the creature, the less it spreads. This results in the eulogy being pretty common knowledge for well known people, and the talk of the town for beloved or reviled creatures.You can choose to write or draw anything on this eulogy, but cannot attach any kind of magical spells/traps to it. It must be concise enough to fit on a single standard page.By spending 1 mana as a free action, you can roll out the red carpet for 1 minute. This carpet is 10 ft wide and 60 ft long. It must be placed on a mostly flat, though not necessarily solid, surface. It can also be placed on any surface where carpet is commonly found (such as a staircase). It can be placed on the surface of still(ish) water. It can be used as a bridge to cross a chasm, provided the gap is mostly level.While walking on this carpet, creatures ignore difficult terrain. If you make another carpet, the previous one disappears.You can extend your hand towards a creature and offer to show them the world (or something to that effect). If they willingly take your hand, they are automatically fascinated for up to 5 minutes. During this time you completely obscure their senses from the outside world and take them on a magical journey of your imagining with catchy songs and pretty visuals straight out of a Disney movie.To the outside world it merely looks like you are holding hands with the creature. You can even decide to move the creature around as though you were going for a walk, or dancing at a party. If you move more than 60 ft away from the creatures location, then the fascination ends.By spending 2 mana as a swift action, drop a peculiar grenade on a creature within 30 ft of you that deals 4d6 (14) crush damage to it and then bounces up to 10 ft to a target of your choosing, dealing this damage again. If it defeats the enemy, you can choose another creature within 30 ft for it to bounce to and its damage increases by 2d6 (7). The grenade can hit a maximum of 4 creatures.When you kill a creature, you see their life flash before your eyes, learning one piece of information. Greatest regret Deepest secret Closest companion Choose a direction and reduce your speed to 0 at the start of your turn. Until you move or are poise broken you can only shoot in that direction (180 degrees), but you can increase your range to 200. Once you shoot a 4th shot, this effect ends.

item.title: witch
demigod
item.description: You are well known and beloved/feared throughout the land through your deeds and people worship the ground you walk on. You defeated a demigod previously and absorbed their power. Through some means you have literally ascended to godhood.Gain the following benefits… Deific Boons - Take a T1 boon from another god, or make one up. You and creatures that choose you as their god gain this benefit. By achieving even greater (story/world related) feats, you can acquire greater boons.Emissary - Form a summoning contract with your chosen one. The creature must be level 10 or lower. You can telepathically communicate with this creature over any distance.Prayers Answered - You can innately cast sending (Larella 1) upcast to 3rd level so long as it is to communicate with to any of your followers.Deific Aspect - You can project yourself anywhere you have seen, as though you had been summoned via summoning contract. This requires a 1 minute cast time with a very obvious physical phenomenon occurring to indicate your imminent arrival, such as storm clouds, whirlpool, magic circle (something appropriate for you) during the cast time. You do not need to know the location if your followers pray for your assistance. You are not drained if you gain summoning sickness. Otherwise this has a cooldown of 1 day.

item.title: immortal
item.description: You have harnessed the power of a powerful artifact. You have received the blessing of a god. You have unlocked forbidden magics. Through some means, you have managed to figure out how to prevent aging for yourself.Gain the following benefits… Timeless - You cannot die of old age, nor can you be forced to magically age. You can alter your age to appear as a younger or older version of yourself, going anything from your prime to an elderly form. Changing requires a standard action.Optional - You no longer need to drink, eat, sleep, breathe or anything else tied to your biology that requires your continued operation. You must still must only do light physical/mental activity in order to rest. You can still do any of these things if you so choose.Ex Machina - Whenever you are slain, you automatically resurrect 1 day later at a pre-designated significant location, such as your hometown or primary place of worship. This ability goes on cool down for 1 month. If you die during this time, you stay dead.

item.title: legendary-weapon
item.description: You have a special weapon that you use to vanquish your enemies. It's name, legendary. It's purpose, divine. This indestructible weapon will be passed down from champion to champion for all of eternity.(if dual wielding is your thing, no issue in making it twinned weapons)Gain the following benefits… Bonus Feat - Gain the bonded weapon feat, applying only to your legendary weapon(s).Indestructible - This weapon cannot be sundered. It's destruction can only be brought about through a series of complex rituals, requiring the intervention of deities or some other incredibly powerful force of destruction, determined upon ascension.Intelligent - It may or may not be able to communicate, but it can at least understand language and perceive the world around it. Its bonded wielder can receive knowledge from it through language or psychic impressions conveying the information. It has a +20 knowledge bonus concerning monsters of a specific type (plants, fiends etc.). Gain bane against this creature type.Unique Property - Each legendary weapon is unique and has something that aids and defeating its favored foe. Some examples below.

item.title: master
item.description: Through dumb luck, large quantities of practical experience or intensive research, you have reached a level of mastery demanding of respect from all mortals, and perhaps even those greater than mortal.Gain the following benefits… TECHNIQUE - Create your own school of techniques and make 6 techniques, one for each level. You automatically have all of them memorized without spending memory.Mana Cheating - You restore mana at the start of each turn regardless of if you spend it or notSignature Technique - You can innately cast a level 3 or lower technique you could normally cast. Its DC increases by 2.If you aren't up to the task of making a bunch of content, instead gain this boon TECHNIQUE - Immediately gain 3 technique points and 3 memory slots.

item.title: README
item.description: Most classes stop gaining features at level 11, but every class universally has access to ascendance, which is granted at level 12. After which the content train stops. Ascendances are meant to cater to a fantasy where after a character's journey has gone on long enough, they not only acquire power, but also often prestige. Ascendances can often be summed up in a single title like "immortal" or "archmage" or "demigod."

item.title: achievements
item.description: Achievements are archetypal tasks that provide some kind of tangible benefit after completion. You do not need to opt into an achievement, instead they can be claimed retroactively after accomplishing a task.Battle ScarsRequirement - Get defeated by a critical hit and survive in 3 different encounters. Or get crit 3 times in the same combat and survive.Reward - The scars you get from battle are deeply entrenched in your memory. Your memories of combats you have encountered cannot be magically removed. By touching them, you can perfectly recall past events, as long as they happened in the thick of combat. Other creatures can touch your scars to share in the experience of the memoryBackstabberRequirement - Murder 3 people you once considered allies, or who at thought you were an ally (before you turned on them). If you murder someone in a position of great power, like a powerful guild leader or king, it counts as 3.Reward - You have a 6th sense for when people trust you. By observing how they react to your presence in a brief interaction (such as an introduction), you can tell whether they trust you, are indifferent towards you or if they distrust you.Critical PetRequirement - Use stealth to initiate combat on a creature by patting its head 3 times. This pat can have no mechanical effect such as delivering a spell or attacking.Reward - You unlock the "Pet" skill, usable for memes. It uses your stealth bonus. If you sneak up on a creature and pet their head (again, no additional mechanical effect), you establish dominance, giving you a +2 bonus to skills for the subsequent social or combat encounter. If a creature within reach is smaller than you, you can pet them as a free action 1/turn for no mechanical benefit (no save).

item.title: progression-outside-of-class
item.description: Just so its all in one place.Boons/Banes - Gained at level one as a result of having positive or negative luck.Feats - Gained at level 1, and every odd level after.Technique Points - Gain one that can be used on any school of techniques at level 2, and every even level after.Ascendance - Unique template applied at level 12.Achievements - Can be gained at any time, even retroactively, when certain conditions are met, varying based on the achievement

item.title: class-descriptions-completion-status
item.description: This section primarily exists to give you a starting point to see what you're interested in.Because this is early access, not all the classes are done (C) denotes that the class is complete, often with a variety of options (P) denotes the class is playable, but lacking in variety or later levels are sparse (ND) denotes the class is still in not done, and is largely unplayable

item.title: distributing-ability-scores
item.description: Read the core mechanics section in order to get a better understanding of the function of each ability score. Every character gets starting 6 points to invest in their ability scores as they wish/ Every point you increase in ability score counts against this total. You can decrease an ability score to -1 in order to gain an additional point. The maximum points you can invest is 3. The minimum is -1.

item.title: main-character-status
item.description: Have you ever wanted to write an epic story for a character you made? How they survived a bloody conflict, went through incredibly rigorous training to become the best and brightest mage, was chosen by god or some other equally astonishing development. Then the game says "you die in one hit to a goblin."While not entirely unrealistic, it doesn't make for very satisfying gameplay to have your character feel like they are made out of paper and are one stray crit away from instant death. A game like DnD 5e remedies this by making KO'd a state your character falls in and out of multiple times as a result of "le nat 20," spammable low action healing and a lack of negative hit points.If you want the player characters to be invincible compared to monsters of a similar level, I say skip the pretense. Player characters are of a different breed and are hardened by their previous adventures, granting the following benefits…HP - Your hp is increased by 10. Defeat - You do not have a chance to instantly die when you fall unconscious, instead you receive a stacking debuff called doom. You also accumulate afflictions.With this change, a measure of how worn down you are can be more easily tied to how much hp you have. There are obviously other factors, but you can't ever keep adventuring without hp. Mana is the general resource system tied to using special abilities, and it naturally recharges when not used.In general healing that keeps you at full HP all the time is intended to be more scarce, and usually come at the cost of reducing your max mana until you rest.In general, only PCs will have this buff. But BBEGs, legendary creatures and other major bosses intended for use at the end of major story beats could also receive a similar version of this buff. Then you can get the juicy "phase transition" threshold to give your big boss encounters more punch.

item.title: Bleeding
item.description:
Bleeding creatures take a specified amount of Damage at the start of each of their turns for a specified duration. If no duration is specified, it lasts indefinitely. The DC to stop the bleeding (with the Medicine skill, or magic healing with a CL check) is the attacker's Lv+12.
Instead of taking damage, bleed prevents a creature from losing the Defeated condition when healed (unless the healing removes the bleed).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Bleeding.md

item.title: Focus
item.description:
Choose a creature you can see. For 1 round you gain the following benefits... Your movement is elusive to them You can take an immediate action as an instant action 1/turn in response to their actions. You cannot be denied instant actions and immediate actions against the focused creature, even while DD.
While you focus on a creature, you pay less attention to all other creatures, and are automatically DD to them. You can choose to continue or end focus on a creature on subsequent turns as a free action.Special - In organized duels, it is assumed both characters start the combat in this state. In such circumstances, they ignore the DD portion of this action (for companions and such).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Focus.md

item.title: Crit
item.description: Critical hits occur when you roll 10 higher than a creature's AC. Crits deal 1.5x damage.Its also worth noting here that all damage multipliers are additive.For example, group type enemies like swarms takes 1.5x damage from AoE. If you Cleave and crit, you deal 2x damage.

item.title: Divine Shield
item.description: A shimmering barrier forms around a creature. They are immune to Poise damage and cannot be Grazed while it persists. The next instance of hitpoint damage they suffer is negated in its entirety, also preventing any additional effects that damage would inflict (such as On-hit effects).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Divine Shield.md

item.title: True Damage
item.description: True damage cannot be reduced by anything. Resistance, DR you name it. The most common source of true damage is Bleeding
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/True Damage.md

item.title: On-hit
item.description: On-hit effects only happen when you successfully match or exceed a creature's AC and deal damage to a creature (AKA it is not negated by DR/Resistance). The effect does not occur on a graze.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/On-hit.md

item.title: Recharge
item.description: Recharge abilities have a specific criteria or time required until they can be used again.If no such criteria or duration is listed, then it is assumed that the recharge is resting, making it a 1/day ability.

item.title: Sp
item.description: Spell abilities encompass any ability that is magical that is a Spell.Sometimes used in notation for abilities that mimic or function like spells.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Sp.md

item.title: Index
item.description: Nick Nacks is my very own fantasy tabletop role-playing game (TTRPG). My biggest sources of inspiration are Pathfinder 1e and Divinity Original Sin 2.Most of the rules in Nick Nacks are centered around combat. I expect you to be traveling through dangerous wilderness, delving into dungeons and stealing treasure from dragons. Some rules, such as skills and mini games, allow you to resolve actions outside of combat, like chases and drinking contests.Where I think Nick Nacks shines is its customization options for players and DMs alike. Instead of having traditional spell lists, I made techniques for both martials and mages, each with their own group loosely centered around a theme such as pyromancy, unarmed fighting or necromancy.I have plans to make far, far more classes, subclasses, bestiary creatures, feats and more!

item.title: Bloody Finger
Basic Bitch Fighter
item.description: Fighter Archetype.For when you really don't want to think about complicated class features.You gain a bonus feat every level. Every time you gain a technique point, you can choose to instead turn it into a feat.You get access to the following feats, each of which can be taken any number of times.Ability Increase - Increase an ability score by +1 (up to +3)Super Strength - Increase strength by +1 (up to +5).Super Armor - Gain +1 AC (up to +3).Power Stance - Gain +3 poise.Paladin Cosplay - Get a +1 bonus to saving throws (up to +3).Superior Genetics - Get an additional major feature from your race

item.title: deadly arsenal
Magical Beasts
item.description:
Classes/Beast Trainer/Beast Trainer Archetype.Magical Beasts use their casting to enhance their beast companions. They are able to combo their spells with their beast.This archetype replaces Tandem Strike.
Your beast companion benefits from any technique you have prepared with the prepared tag.
Whenever you use a technique with the Buff tag, you can also affect your beast companion with it.The DC for your spells is 2 higher against any creature your beast companion has attacked this turn. You get advantage on attacks with spells against any creature your beast companion has attacked this turn.
You automatically exclude your beast companion from any damage or CC that your techniques inflict.Choose a magical technique tree. You gain a technique point in this tree at level 1 and every two levels after.
Whenever a creature fails a save against one of your techniques, it Provokes from your beast companion.

item.title: +Achievement
item.description: Achievements are archetypal tasks that provide some kind of tangible benefit after completion. You do not need to opt into an achievement, instead they can be claimed retroactively after accomplishing a task.

item.title: ankylotortoise
Ability Scores
item.description:
These are representations of a creature's innate or cultivated affinities. These represent the mind, body, and spirit. The ability scores are Strength, Dexterity, Luck, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.
Every Player Character gets 6 points to increase their ability scores as they wish, starting from 0 in each.You can decrease a ability scores to -1 in order to gain an additional point. The maximum points you can invest in a given ability score is 3.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/Ability Scores.md

item.title: Ability Scores
Prepared
item.description: This technique does not require any form of activation to use. It provides its benefit constantly.

item.title: Attack
item.description:
Attack rolls are any type of harmful effect targeting a creature that does not require a saving throw. This can be spells, swords or trying to push your foe off a cliff.Most attacks assume you use a weapon, a Natural Weapon or an unarmed strike.Default:d20+ (lvl) +(ability score) +/- (circumstances)
In general AC is not a zero sum endeavor. If you successfully meet the AC number, you deal full damage. if you roll 10 higher than the AC number, you Crit. If you roll under the AC number, but not by more than 5, you get a partial hit as you graze your opponent with your attack.
Generally speaking, you can only make a single attack with your standard action, but creatures with multiattack, and special cases like Classes/Fighter/Fighter or Martial Artist, can make multiple on their turn.

item.title: Dazed
item.description:
A more severe version of Staggered. Creature cannot take a Standard Action and cannot make
AoOs.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Dazed.md

item.title: Confused
item.description: You consider all creatures enemies. Every turn, roll a d10 to determine how you act. Many effects allow you to increase the dice roll with a will save. For confusion effects that last more than 1 round, each subsequent d10 roll gets 2 added to the result.The confusion result is the only thing the creature does on their turn, ie if you roll a 5 you wander and then end turn.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Confused.md

item.title: Frosty
item.description: Creature is covered in ice. Creature has Resistance to Fire Damage and -15 Speed. Attacks against a frosty creature get +2 ACC. This status ends when they take physical or fire damage.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Frosty.md

item.title: Charmed
item.description: Creature cannot attack the entity that inflicted this condition. The entity that inflicted this condition has a +4 bonus on Charisma Skills against this creature.This ends if the creature that inflicted the condition harms the charmed creature.Charmed creatures always interpret what the creature that charmed them is doing in the most positive light: Punches and sword swings are massages and surgeries. Charmed creatures are often willing to do things asked of them provided they don't put the creature in danger or clash with their ethos. After the charm ends, acts are seen for what they truly are.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Charmed.md

item.title: Asleep
item.description: Asleep: This creature is Knocked Down, can take no actions, and cannot be awakened unless it takes damage, is subject to an offensive ability or an ally uses the Aid action to awaken them. The creature is also DD and suffers -10 Perception.If the creature is asleep through natural means, it can use perception to wake up by noticing something amiss.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Asleep.md

item.title: Anchored
item.description: Creature cannot use Teleportation effects. Either on themselves or on others. If they attempt to do so, the effect fizzles.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Anchored.md

item.title: Ablaze
item.description: When a creature is set Ablaze, it takes 2d8 Fire Damage at the start of each turn. Attacking creatures get a +2 bonus to ACC. On every turn after the first, it gets a Reflex save before it takes damage to end the effect. A creature can choose to inflict Knockdown on itself at the end of its turn for a +4 bonus to this save.Being submerged in water, getting entombed or taking cold damage also removes this condition. Other things that snuff out flames can reasonably remove ablaze.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Ablaze.md

item.title: Stacking Damage and Defense
item.description: When you stack a source of flat damage reduction and multiplicative reduction, add them together in the way that reduces the damage the most.When you have multiple sources of increasing damage by a percentage, add the percentages together, do not multiply (ie 1.5x dmg and 1.5x dmg adds together to 2x dmg).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/More Rules/Stacking Damage and Defense.md

item.title: +Death and Resurrection
item.description:
Let's be honest, the purpose of resurrection in TTRPGs is primarily for the benefit of the players. If a DM makes frequent use of the resurrection spells for entities that the players went to great lengths to kill, it heavily undermines their effort and feels terrible, even if plausible. If all it takes is a bunch of money and a cleric, then rich high level players live in a world without death as a consequence for anybody.Now that we all agree about that, why does resurrection have an expensive material component cost? To punish the players for being unlucky? Why is it locked behind high-level magic? To make playing cleric mandatory? If we only consider the players, then these things become very obvious problems. Players shouldn't be shoehorned into playing specific classes, nor should the money that they worked hard to obtain be required to continue playing the game.The powers that be should instead be very particular about the who gets a second chance. If the players are the main character of the story, then the game's resurrection mechanics should treat them as such. As a replacement for most resurrection effects, use these rules instead. Or don't use resurrection at all. It's your game. Whatever.IMPORTANT NOTE: Please make sure your players are on board with whatever you decide. Nobody likes surprise mechanics.Isn't this just plot armor? The basic premise of this system of resurrection is that you want player death to have immediate consequences: Not being able to complete a mission or delaying the players long enough so that way the villain can complete the ritual. But you don't want them to have long-term consequences: Not being able to play your character. Having to go on lengthy multi-session quests to find someone willing and able to cast the correct spell to bring you back can be fun, but after a few times, it can get old.So in order to achieve the former and avoid the latter, it's recommended that you bake the reason for the players coming back from the dead into the story. Death still matters or course, after all the players will have allies (:<If your players aren't too attached to their characters, then who needs plot armor? Let 'em die. If they are, consider some of the options in this section.See: Ashen One
Cloning Device
Limited Resurrection
Tombstone
Withers
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Death and Resurrection/+Death and Resurrection.md

item.title: Rest
item.description:
8 consecutive hours of sleep. If you sleep in undesirable conditions, you can still rest, but you are exhausted the following day.Some conditions, such as a bumpy ride, a bed of rocks or an incredibly loud house can prevent you from resting at all.
When you rest, you restore your HP and mana burn. You also can use abilities with limited uses per day.

item.title: Natural Healing
item.description: In the absence of danger, a defeated creature will regain 1 hp after 1 hour. They are staggered until they are healed or they rest.With a proper 8 hours rest, a character restores all their HP, all of their daily use abilities and recover mana burn. You can only rest once each day.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Hitpoints/Natural Healing.md

item.title: +HP
item.description: How much hp a player has is largely determined by their class. Creatures have a base hp value of 20, and then a value that they add each Lv, including level one. Classes and creatures all fall under one of the following categories based on their play style.

item.title: Ranged Attack
item.description:
A Ranged Attack is an Attack made with ranged targeting. This means you can make the attack up to the listed range, not limited by the space you Threaten. These attacks can also be penalized due to Cover. Physical Ranged Attacks have three listed ranges: thrown, short and long.
Making a Ranged Attack Provokes.
Abilities that function from a distance but do not use an Attack Roll are not Ranged Attacks.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Ranged Attack.md

item.title: Special Attack
item.description:
Special attacks allow for more versatility in play style. Weapons, class abilities, techniques and
Feats can grant these special attacks. Special attacks can usually only be performed once per turn.
Special attacks universally have the martial tag.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Special Attack.md

item.title: Attack Progression
item.description: Creatures that aren't dual-wielding have only 1 attack by default. When you use your standard action to make multiple attacks, it's called a multiattack. You can distribute the attacks to creatures as you see fit, move in between them, before and after them (for certain AoE attacks like cleave, you usually need to stand still). By default a standard attack is considered a simple attack.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Attack Progression.md

item.title: Weapon
item.description:
Weapons are the most basic method of increasing one's offensive power. Just having a weapon and attacking an enemy is often enough to make you a substantial threat, regardless of your expertise or abilities.Weapons fall into Weapon Groups for the purpose of identifying what Special Attacks, Abilities, and Techniques they're compatible with. The categories describe how they are used to attack, rather than how they look. If a weapon has more than one main category, then that means its category changes based on the way it is used, such as throwing a dagger instead of swinging it.There are ten main categories:And 4 subtypes:
Exotic Weapons do not neatly fit into these categories, and will list how they differ.Weapons come with damage values, attack speed values, and damage types as their core stats, in addition to the categories listed above.
All standard weapons deal a physical Damage type. If a weapon has more than one damage type, you can decide which to use before you make a given attack with it.
Damage values and Attack Speed correlate such that the damage tends to be very similar without any additional abilities or STR. The typical offense-oriented damage values and AS are as follows:
Weapons with ranged capabilities (thrown or otherwise) will also have a listed range. Ranges come in an X/Y format, with the X range being the accurate range, and the Y taking a -4 penalty, referred to as the Range.
Some weapons come with Techniques and Special Attacks. These temporarily grant you a technique as long as you wield them. As per the Mana rules, you cannot sacrifice your own Mana to get another use of a Limited Technique unless otherwise stated. Special Attacks specifically are also tied to the weapon - If you use the Special Attack, you cannot pass the weapon off to another creature to use it again, and the weapon has its own Recharge timer.
Many weapons come with Weapon Qualities. These describe what a weapon does beyond its classification, Damage, and AS.Unless otherwise stated, Weapons weights default to the following:

item.title: Weapon Group
item.description:
A Weapon Group is a categorization of Weapons that describes the way it is used in combat, and is used to identify what Special Attacks, Abilities, and Techniques they're compatible with. The categories describe how they are used to attack, rather than how they look. If a weapon has more than one main category, then that means its category changes based on the way it is used, such as throwing a dagger instead of swinging it.
There are 10 main groups: Axe, Blade, Bludgeon, Bow, Close, Dagger, Polearm, Thrown/Caster, Thrust, and Trigger,
and 4 sub-groups: Ammunition, Natural, Shield, and Staff.

item.title: Simple Attack
item.description: Simple attacks are only rolling attack and damage, typically with no special effects tied to them. Special attacks allow for more versatility in play style. Unique weapons, class abilities, techniques and feats can grant these special attacks. Special attacks can usually only be performed once per turn.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Simple Attack.md

item.title: Poison
item.description: Poison is a Damage type Tag, representing an toxic or caustic substance that melts away the body as well as objects.

item.title: Nebula
item.description:
Tier 2 Lunar Spell
Action-Attack, Recharge
Force, Light
Evocation
Conjure a cloud of stardust that illuminates in a 20 ft radius beyond its borders. It obscures vision through it beyond 5 feet, granting Partial Concealment. Anything beyond 5 feet grants Total Concealment. At the end of the spell's duration, it erupts, dealing 2 SP+CL Force Damage to all creatures in the area.
Upcast 1 - +1 SP Damage

item.title: Vengeance Other
item.description:
Tier 4 Lunar Spell
Standard Action, Limited
Buff
Evocation
Functions as Vengeance, but on a creature other than yourself. It cannot be cast reactively.
You reflect 75% of the next instance of damage you take as Force Damage back at the attacker.
This spell is particularly easy to identify due to its distinct visual effect of a skull appearing over your head, making the DC to Identify Spell 10 points lower.

Tier 3 Lunar Spell
Immediate Action, Recharge
